module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AttributePayload

-- | The attribute payload.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttributePayload</a> smart constructor.
data AttributePayload
AttributePayload' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Bool -> AttributePayload

-- | A JSON string containing up to three key-value pair in JSON format.
--   For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"attributes\":{\"string1\":\"string2\"}}
--   </pre>
[$sel:attributes:AttributePayload'] :: AttributePayload -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Specifies whether the list of attributes provided in the
--   <tt>AttributePayload</tt> is merged with the attributes stored in the
--   registry, instead of overwriting them.
--   
--   To remove an attribute, call <tt>UpdateThing</tt> with an empty
--   attribute value.
--   
--   The <tt>merge</tt> attribute is only valid when calling
--   <tt>UpdateThing</tt> or <tt>UpdateThingGroup</tt>.
[$sel:merge:AttributePayload'] :: AttributePayload -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>AttributePayload</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:AttributePayload'</a>,
--   <a>attributePayload_attributes</a> - A JSON string containing up to
--   three key-value pair in JSON format. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"attributes\":{\"string1\":\"string2\"}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:merge:AttributePayload'</a>, <a>attributePayload_merge</a> -
--   Specifies whether the list of attributes provided in the
--   <tt>AttributePayload</tt> is merged with the attributes stored in the
--   registry, instead of overwriting them.
--   
--   To remove an attribute, call <tt>UpdateThing</tt> with an empty
--   attribute value.
--   
--   The <tt>merge</tt> attribute is only valid when calling
--   <tt>UpdateThing</tt> or <tt>UpdateThingGroup</tt>.
newAttributePayload :: AttributePayload

-- | A JSON string containing up to three key-value pair in JSON format.
--   For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"attributes\":{\"string1\":\"string2\"}}
--   </pre>
attributePayload_attributes :: Lens' AttributePayload (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Specifies whether the list of attributes provided in the
--   <tt>AttributePayload</tt> is merged with the attributes stored in the
--   registry, instead of overwriting them.
--   
--   To remove an attribute, call <tt>UpdateThing</tt> with an empty
--   attribute value.
--   
--   The <tt>merge</tt> attribute is only valid when calling
--   <tt>UpdateThing</tt> or <tt>UpdateThingGroup</tt>.
attributePayload_merge :: Lens' AttributePayload (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AttributePayload.AttributePayload
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AttributePayload.AttributePayload
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AttributePayload.AttributePayload
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AttributePayload.AttributePayload
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AttributePayload.AttributePayload
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AttributePayload.AttributePayload
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AttributePayload.AttributePayload
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AttributePayload.AttributePayload

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditCheckDetails

-- | Information about the audit check.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditCheckDetails</a> smart constructor.
data AuditCheckDetails
AuditCheckDetails' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuditCheckRunStatus -> AuditCheckDetails

-- | Describes how many of the non-compliant resources created during the
--   evaluation of an audit check were marked as suppressed.
[$sel:suppressedNonCompliantResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of resources on which the check was performed.
[$sel:totalResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Integer

-- | True if the check is complete and found all resources compliant.
[$sel:checkCompliant:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of resources that were found noncompliant during the check.
[$sel:nonCompliantResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Integer

-- | The code of any error encountered when this check is performed during
--   this audit. One of "INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS" or
--   "AUDIT_CHECK_DISABLED".
[$sel:errorCode:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The message associated with any error encountered when this check is
--   performed during this audit.
[$sel:message:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The completion status of this check. One of "IN_PROGRESS",
--   "WAITING_FOR_DATA_COLLECTION", "CANCELED", "COMPLETED_COMPLIANT",
--   "COMPLETED_NON_COMPLIANT", or "FAILED".
[$sel:checkRunStatus:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe AuditCheckRunStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditCheckDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressedNonCompliantResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_suppressedNonCompliantResourcesCount</a> -
--   Describes how many of the non-compliant resources created during the
--   evaluation of an audit check were marked as suppressed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_totalResourcesCount</a> - The number of resources
--   on which the check was performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkCompliant:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_checkCompliant</a> - True if the check is
--   complete and found all resources compliant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nonCompliantResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_nonCompliantResourcesCount</a> - The number of
--   resources that were found noncompliant during the check.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_errorCode</a> - The code of any error encountered
--   when this check is performed during this audit. One of
--   "INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS" or "AUDIT_CHECK_DISABLED".
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_message</a> - The message associated with any
--   error encountered when this check is performed during this audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkRunStatus:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_checkRunStatus</a> - The completion status of
--   this check. One of "IN_PROGRESS", "WAITING_FOR_DATA_COLLECTION",
--   "CANCELED", "COMPLETED_COMPLIANT", "COMPLETED_NON_COMPLIANT", or
--   "FAILED".
newAuditCheckDetails :: AuditCheckDetails

-- | Describes how many of the non-compliant resources created during the
--   evaluation of an audit check were marked as suppressed.
auditCheckDetails_suppressedNonCompliantResourcesCount :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of resources on which the check was performed.
auditCheckDetails_totalResourcesCount :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Integer)

-- | True if the check is complete and found all resources compliant.
auditCheckDetails_checkCompliant :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of resources that were found noncompliant during the check.
auditCheckDetails_nonCompliantResourcesCount :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Integer)

-- | The code of any error encountered when this check is performed during
--   this audit. One of "INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS" or
--   "AUDIT_CHECK_DISABLED".
auditCheckDetails_errorCode :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The message associated with any error encountered when this check is
--   performed during this audit.
auditCheckDetails_message :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The completion status of this check. One of "IN_PROGRESS",
--   "WAITING_FOR_DATA_COLLECTION", "CANCELED", "COMPLETED_COMPLIANT",
--   "COMPLETED_NON_COMPLIANT", or "FAILED".
auditCheckDetails_checkRunStatus :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe AuditCheckRunStatus)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditCheckDetails.AuditCheckDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditCheckDetails.AuditCheckDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditCheckDetails.AuditCheckDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditCheckDetails.AuditCheckDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditCheckDetails.AuditCheckDetails

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata

-- | Returned by ListAuditMitigationActionsTask, this object contains
--   information that describes a mitigation action that has been started.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata
AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata' :: Maybe AuditMitigationActionsExecutionStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata

-- | The current status of the task being executed.
[$sel:status:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe AuditMitigationActionsExecutionStatus

-- | The date and time when the task was started.
[$sel:startTime:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the task that applies the mitigation action.
[$sel:taskId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the mitigation action being applied by the
--   task.
[$sel:actionId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The friendly name of the mitigation action being applied by the task.
[$sel:actionName:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the task was completed or canceled. Blank if
--   the task is still running.
[$sel:endTime:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If an error occurred, the code that indicates which type of error
--   occurred.
[$sel:errorCode:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the findings to which the task and
--   associated mitigation action are applied.
[$sel:findingId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | If an error occurred, a message that describes the error.
[$sel:message:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_status</a> - The current
--   status of the task being executed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_startTime</a> - The date and
--   time when the task was started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_taskId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the task that applies the mitigation action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_actionId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the mitigation action being applied by the task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionName:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_actionName</a> - The
--   friendly name of the mitigation action being applied by the task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_endTime</a> - The date and
--   time when the task was completed or canceled. Blank if the task is
--   still running.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_errorCode</a> - If an error
--   occurred, the code that indicates which type of error occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_findingId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the findings to which the task and associated
--   mitigation action are applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_message</a> - If an error
--   occurred, a message that describes the error.
newAuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata

-- | The current status of the task being executed.
auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_status :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata (Maybe AuditMitigationActionsExecutionStatus)

-- | The date and time when the task was started.
auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_startTime :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique identifier for the task that applies the mitigation action.
auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_taskId :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the mitigation action being applied by the
--   task.
auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_actionId :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of the mitigation action being applied by the task.
auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_actionName :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the task was completed or canceled. Blank if
--   the task is still running.
auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_endTime :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If an error occurred, the code that indicates which type of error
--   occurred.
auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_errorCode :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the findings to which the task and
--   associated mitigation action are applied.
auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_findingId :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | If an error occurred, a message that describes the error.
auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_message :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata (Maybe Text)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata.AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata.AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditMitigationActionsTaskStatus
newtype AuditMitigationActionsTaskStatus
AuditMitigationActionsTaskStatus' :: Text -> AuditMitigationActionsTaskStatus

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata

-- | Information about an audit mitigation actions task that is returned by
--   <tt>ListAuditMitigationActionsTasks</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata
AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuditMitigationActionsTaskStatus -> AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata

-- | The time at which the audit mitigation actions task was started.
[$sel:startTime:AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the task.
[$sel:taskId:AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of the audit mitigation actions task.
[$sel:taskStatus:AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata -> Maybe AuditMitigationActionsTaskStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>auditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata_startTime</a> - The time at
--   which the audit mitigation actions task was started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskId:AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata_taskId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStatus:AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata_taskStatus</a> - The current
--   state of the audit mitigation actions task.

-- | The unique identifier for the task.

-- | The current state of the audit mitigation actions task.
auditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata_taskStatus :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionsTaskMetadata (Maybe AuditMitigationActionsTaskStatus)

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget

-- | Used in MitigationActionParams, this information identifies the target
--   findings to which the mitigation actions are applied. Only one entry
--   appears.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget
AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text (NonEmpty Text)) -> AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget

-- | If the task will apply a mitigation action to findings from a specific
--   audit, this value uniquely identifies the audit.
[$sel:auditTaskId:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'] :: AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | If the task will apply a mitigation action to one or more listed
--   findings, this value uniquely identifies those findings.
[$sel:findingIds:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'] :: AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Specifies a filter in the form of an audit check and set of reason
--   codes that identify the findings from the audit to which the audit
--   mitigation actions task apply.
[$sel:auditCheckToReasonCodeFilter:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'] :: AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget -> Maybe (HashMap Text (NonEmpty Text))

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:auditTaskId:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_auditTaskId</a> - If the task will
--   apply a mitigation action to findings from a specific audit, this
--   value uniquely identifies the audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingIds:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_findingIds</a> - If the task will
--   apply a mitigation action to one or more listed findings, this value
--   uniquely identifies those findings.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:auditCheckToReasonCodeFilter:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_auditCheckToReasonCodeFilter</a> -
--   Specifies a filter in the form of an audit check and set of reason
--   codes that identify the findings from the audit to which the audit
--   mitigation actions task apply.
newAuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget :: AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget

-- | If the task will apply a mitigation action to findings from a specific
--   audit, this value uniquely identifies the audit.
auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_auditTaskId :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | If the task will apply a mitigation action to one or more listed
--   findings, this value uniquely identifies those findings.
auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_findingIds :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | Specifies a filter in the form of an audit check and set of reason
--   codes that identify the findings from the audit to which the audit
--   mitigation actions task apply.
auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_auditCheckToReasonCodeFilter :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget (Maybe (HashMap Text (NonEmpty Text)))

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget.AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget.AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget

--   sent.
[$sel:targetArn:AuditNotificationTarget'] :: AuditNotificationTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | True if notifications to the target are enabled.
[$sel:enabled:AuditNotificationTarget'] :: AuditNotificationTarget -> Maybe Bool

--   the target.
[$sel:roleArn:AuditNotificationTarget'] :: AuditNotificationTarget -> Maybe Text

--   fields omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   topic) to which audit notifications are sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:AuditNotificationTarget'</a>,
--   <a>auditNotificationTarget_enabled</a> - True if notifications to the
--   target are enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:AuditNotificationTarget'</a>,
--   <a>auditNotificationTarget_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the role that
--   grants permission to send notifications to the target.

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditTaskMetadata

-- | The audits that were performed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditTaskMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data AuditTaskMetadata
AuditTaskMetadata' :: Maybe AuditTaskType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuditTaskStatus -> AuditTaskMetadata

-- | The type of this audit. One of "ON_DEMAND_AUDIT_TASK" or
--   "SCHEDULED_AUDIT_TASK".
[$sel:taskType:AuditTaskMetadata'] :: AuditTaskMetadata -> Maybe AuditTaskType

-- | The ID of this audit.
[$sel:taskId:AuditTaskMetadata'] :: AuditTaskMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of this audit. One of "IN_PROGRESS", "COMPLETED", "FAILED",
--   or "CANCELED".
[$sel:taskStatus:AuditTaskMetadata'] :: AuditTaskMetadata -> Maybe AuditTaskStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditTaskMetadata</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskType:AuditTaskMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditTaskMetadata_taskType</a> - The type of this audit. One of
--   "ON_DEMAND_AUDIT_TASK" or "SCHEDULED_AUDIT_TASK".
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskId:AuditTaskMetadata'</a>, <a>auditTaskMetadata_taskId</a>
--   - The ID of this audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStatus:AuditTaskMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditTaskMetadata_taskStatus</a> - The status of this audit. One of
--   "IN_PROGRESS", "COMPLETED", "FAILED", or "CANCELED".
newAuditTaskMetadata :: AuditTaskMetadata

-- | The type of this audit. One of "ON_DEMAND_AUDIT_TASK" or
--   "SCHEDULED_AUDIT_TASK".
auditTaskMetadata_taskType :: Lens' AuditTaskMetadata (Maybe AuditTaskType)

-- | The ID of this audit.
auditTaskMetadata_taskId :: Lens' AuditTaskMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of this audit. One of "IN_PROGRESS", "COMPLETED", "FAILED",
--   or "CANCELED".
auditTaskMetadata_taskStatus :: Lens' AuditTaskMetadata (Maybe AuditTaskStatus)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditTaskMetadata.AuditTaskMetadata

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthInfo

-- | A collection of authorization information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthInfo</a> smart constructor.
data AuthInfo
AuthInfo' :: Maybe ActionType -> [Text] -> AuthInfo

-- | The type of action for which the principal is being authorized.
[$sel:actionType:AuthInfo'] :: AuthInfo -> Maybe ActionType

-- | The resources for which the principal is being authorized to perform
--   the specified action.
[$sel:resources:AuthInfo'] :: AuthInfo -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionType:AuthInfo'</a>, <a>authInfo_actionType</a> - The
--   type of action for which the principal is being authorized.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:AuthInfo'</a>, <a>authInfo_resources</a> - The
--   resources for which the principal is being authorized to perform the
--   specified action.
newAuthInfo :: AuthInfo

-- | The type of action for which the principal is being authorized.
authInfo_actionType :: Lens' AuthInfo (Maybe ActionType)

-- | The resources for which the principal is being authorized to perform
--   the specified action.
authInfo_resources :: Lens' AuthInfo [Text]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthInfo.AuthInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthInfo.AuthInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthInfo.AuthInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthInfo.AuthInfo

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthorizerDescription

-- | The authorizer description.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthorizerDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AuthorizerDescription
AuthorizerDescription' :: Maybe AuthorizerStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> AuthorizerDescription

-- | The status of the authorizer.
[$sel:status:AuthorizerDescription'] :: AuthorizerDescription -> Maybe AuthorizerStatus

-- | The UNIX timestamp of when the authorizer was last updated.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:AuthorizerDescription'] :: AuthorizerDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies whether IoT validates the token signature in an
--   authorization request.
[$sel:signingDisabled:AuthorizerDescription'] :: AuthorizerDescription -> Maybe Bool

-- | The authorizer name.
[$sel:authorizerName:AuthorizerDescription'] :: AuthorizerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The authorizer's Lambda function ARN.
[$sel:authorizerFunctionArn:AuthorizerDescription'] :: AuthorizerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The authorizer ARN.
[$sel:authorizerArn:AuthorizerDescription'] :: AuthorizerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The UNIX timestamp of when the authorizer was created.
[$sel:creationDate:AuthorizerDescription'] :: AuthorizerDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The public keys used to validate the token signature returned by your
--   custom authentication service.
[$sel:tokenSigningPublicKeys:AuthorizerDescription'] :: AuthorizerDescription -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The key used to extract the token from the HTTP headers.
[$sel:tokenKeyName:AuthorizerDescription'] :: AuthorizerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthorizerDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_status</a> - The status of the authorizer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_lastModifiedDate</a> - The UNIX timestamp of
--   when the authorizer was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingDisabled:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_signingDisabled</a> - Specifies whether IoT
--   validates the token signature in an authorization request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authorizerName:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_authorizerName</a> - The authorizer name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authorizerFunctionArn:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_authorizerFunctionArn</a> - The authorizer's
--   Lambda function ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authorizerArn:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_authorizerArn</a> - The authorizer ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_creationDate</a> - The UNIX timestamp of when
--   the authorizer was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenSigningPublicKeys:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_tokenSigningPublicKeys</a> - The public keys
--   used to validate the token signature returned by your custom
--   authentication service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenKeyName:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_tokenKeyName</a> - The key used to extract
--   the token from the HTTP headers.
newAuthorizerDescription :: AuthorizerDescription

-- | The status of the authorizer.
authorizerDescription_status :: Lens' AuthorizerDescription (Maybe AuthorizerStatus)

-- | The UNIX timestamp of when the authorizer was last updated.
authorizerDescription_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' AuthorizerDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether IoT validates the token signature in an
--   authorization request.
authorizerDescription_signingDisabled :: Lens' AuthorizerDescription (Maybe Bool)

-- | The authorizer name.
authorizerDescription_authorizerName :: Lens' AuthorizerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The authorizer's Lambda function ARN.
authorizerDescription_authorizerFunctionArn :: Lens' AuthorizerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The authorizer ARN.
authorizerDescription_authorizerArn :: Lens' AuthorizerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The UNIX timestamp of when the authorizer was created.
authorizerDescription_creationDate :: Lens' AuthorizerDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The public keys used to validate the token signature returned by your
--   custom authentication service.
authorizerDescription_tokenSigningPublicKeys :: Lens' AuthorizerDescription (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The key used to extract the token from the HTTP headers.
authorizerDescription_tokenKeyName :: Lens' AuthorizerDescription (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthorizerDescription.AuthorizerDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthorizerDescription.AuthorizerDescription

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobAbortCriteria

-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobAbortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobAbortCriteria
AwsJobAbortCriteria' :: AwsJobAbortCriteriaFailureType -> AwsJobAbortCriteriaAbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AwsJobAbortCriteria

-- | The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.
[$sel:failureType:AwsJobAbortCriteria'] :: AwsJobAbortCriteria -> AwsJobAbortCriteriaFailureType

-- | The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
[$sel:action:AwsJobAbortCriteria'] :: AwsJobAbortCriteria -> AwsJobAbortCriteriaAbortAction

-- | The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
[$sel:thresholdPercentage:AwsJobAbortCriteria'] :: AwsJobAbortCriteria -> Double

-- | The minimum number of things which must receive job execution
--   notifications before the job can be aborted.
[$sel:minNumberOfExecutedThings:AwsJobAbortCriteria'] :: AwsJobAbortCriteria -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobAbortCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureType:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_failureType</a> - The type of job execution
--   failures that can initiate a job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_action</a> - The type of job action to take to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thresholdPercentage:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_thresholdPercentage</a> - The minimum
--   percentage of job execution failures that must occur to initiate the
--   job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
--   
--   <a>$sel:minNumberOfExecutedThings:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings</a> - The minimum
--   number of things which must receive job execution notifications before
--   the job can be aborted.
newAwsJobAbortCriteria :: AwsJobAbortCriteriaFailureType -> AwsJobAbortCriteriaAbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AwsJobAbortCriteria

-- | The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.
awsJobAbortCriteria_failureType :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria AwsJobAbortCriteriaFailureType

-- | The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
awsJobAbortCriteria_action :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria AwsJobAbortCriteriaAbortAction

-- | The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
awsJobAbortCriteria_thresholdPercentage :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria Double

-- | The minimum number of things which must receive job execution
--   notifications before the job can be aborted.
awsJobAbortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobAbortCriteria.AwsJobAbortCriteria
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobAbortCriteria.AwsJobAbortCriteria
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobAbortCriteria.AwsJobAbortCriteria
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobAbortCriteria.AwsJobAbortCriteria
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobAbortCriteria.AwsJobAbortCriteria
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobAbortCriteria.AwsJobAbortCriteria
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobAbortCriteria.AwsJobAbortCriteria

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobAbortConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobAbortConfig

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig

-- | Configuration information for pre-signed URLs. Valid when
--   <tt>protocols</tt> contains HTTP.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobPresignedUrlConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig
AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig' :: Maybe Integer -> AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig

-- | How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 -
--   3600, the default value is 1800 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated
--   when a request for the job document is received.
[$sel:expiresInSec:AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig'] :: AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiresInSec:AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobPresignedUrlConfig_expiresInSec</a> - How long (in seconds)
--   pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 - 3600, the default
--   value is 1800 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated when a request
--   for the job document is received.
newAwsJobPresignedUrlConfig :: AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig

-- | How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 -
--   3600, the default value is 1800 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated
--   when a request for the job document is received.
awsJobPresignedUrlConfig_expiresInSec :: Lens' AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig.AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig.AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria
AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

-- | When this number of things have been notified, it will initiate an
--   increase in the rollout rate.
[$sel:numberOfNotifiedThings:AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria'] :: AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria -> Maybe Natural

-- | When this number of things have succeeded in their job execution, it
--   will initiate an increase in the rollout rate.
[$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria'] :: AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfNotifiedThings:AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfNotifiedThings</a> - When this
--   number of things have been notified, it will initiate an increase in
--   the rollout rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfSucceededThings</a> - When this
--   number of things have succeeded in their job execution, it will
--   initiate an increase in the rollout rate.
newAwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria :: AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

-- | When this number of things have been notified, it will initiate an
--   increase in the rollout rate.
awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfNotifiedThings :: Lens' AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria (Maybe Natural)

-- | When this number of things have succeeded in their job execution, it
--   will initiate an increase in the rollout rate.
awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfSucceededThings :: Lens' AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria.AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria.AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria.AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define an exponential rate increase for a job rollout.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobExponentialRolloutRate</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate
AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate' :: Natural -> Double -> AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria -> AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate

-- | The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute, at the start of the job rollout. This is the initial rate
--   of the rollout.
[$sel:baseRatePerMinute:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'] :: AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate -> Natural

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. The number of things notified
--   is multiplied by this factor.
[$sel:incrementFactor:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'] :: AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate -> Double

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
[$sel:rateIncreaseCriteria:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'] :: AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate -> AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseRatePerMinute:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_baseRatePerMinute</a> - The minimum
--   number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute,
--   at the start of the job rollout. This is the initial rate of the
--   rollout.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incrementFactor:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_incrementFactor</a> - The rate of
--   increase for a job rollout. The number of things notified is
--   multiplied by this factor.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateIncreaseCriteria:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_rateIncreaseCriteria</a> - The
--   criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
newAwsJobExponentialRolloutRate :: Natural -> Double -> AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria -> AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate

-- | The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute, at the start of the job rollout. This is the initial rate
--   of the rollout.
awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_baseRatePerMinute :: Lens' AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate Natural

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. The number of things notified
--   is multiplied by this factor.
awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_incrementFactor :: Lens' AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate Double

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_rateIncreaseCriteria :: Lens' AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate.AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobTimeoutConfig

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobTimeoutConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobTimeoutConfig
AwsJobTimeoutConfig' :: Maybe Integer -> AwsJobTimeoutConfig

-- | Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish
--   execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1
--   minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be
--   updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a
--   job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this
--   interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal
--   <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt> status.
[$sel:inProgressTimeoutInMinutes:AwsJobTimeoutConfig'] :: AwsJobTimeoutConfig -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobTimeoutConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inProgressTimeoutInMinutes:AwsJobTimeoutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobTimeoutConfig_inProgressTimeoutInMinutes</a> - Specifies the
--   amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish execution of
--   this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1 minute and 7
--   days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be updated and
--   will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a job execution
--   remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this interval, the
--   job execution will fail and switch to the terminal <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>
--   status.
newAwsJobTimeoutConfig :: AwsJobTimeoutConfig

-- | Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish
--   execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1
--   minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be
--   updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a
--   job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this
--   interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal
--   <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt> status.
awsJobTimeoutConfig_inProgressTimeoutInMinutes :: Lens' AwsJobTimeoutConfig (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobTimeoutConfig.AwsJobTimeoutConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobTimeoutConfig.AwsJobTimeoutConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobTimeoutConfig.AwsJobTimeoutConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobTimeoutConfig.AwsJobTimeoutConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobTimeoutConfig.AwsJobTimeoutConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobTimeoutConfig.AwsJobTimeoutConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AwsJobTimeoutConfig.AwsJobTimeoutConfig

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Bucket

--

--   bucket.

--   counted for the particular bucket.
--

--   documents that have the value counted for the particular bucket.
newBucket :: Bucket

--   bucket.
bucket_count :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Int)

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CACertificate

-- | A CA certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCACertificate</a> smart constructor.
data CACertificate
CACertificate' :: Maybe CACertificateStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> CACertificate

-- | The status of the CA certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
[$sel:status:CACertificate'] :: CACertificate -> Maybe CACertificateStatus

-- | The ARN of the CA certificate.
[$sel:certificateArn:CACertificate'] :: CACertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the CA certificate.
[$sel:certificateId:CACertificate'] :: CACertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The date the CA certificate was created.
[$sel:creationDate:CACertificate'] :: CACertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>CACertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CACertificate'</a>, <a>cACertificate_status</a> - The
--   status of the CA certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:CACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificate_certificateArn</a> - The ARN of the CA certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:CACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificate_certificateId</a> - The ID of the CA certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:CACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificate_creationDate</a> - The date the CA certificate was
--   created.
newCACertificate :: CACertificate

-- | The status of the CA certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
cACertificate_status :: Lens' CACertificate (Maybe CACertificateStatus)

-- | The ARN of the CA certificate.
cACertificate_certificateArn :: Lens' CACertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the CA certificate.
cACertificate_certificateId :: Lens' CACertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the CA certificate was created.
cACertificate_creationDate :: Lens' CACertificate (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CACertificate.CACertificate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CACertificate.CACertificate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CACertificate.CACertificate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CACertificate.CACertificate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CACertificate.CACertificate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CACertificate.CACertificate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CACertificate.CACertificate

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Certificate

-- | Information about a certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data Certificate
Certificate' :: Maybe CertificateStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CertificateMode -> Maybe POSIX -> Certificate

-- | The status of the certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
[$sel:status:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe CertificateStatus

-- | The ARN of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateArn:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
[$sel:certificateId:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The mode of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateMode:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe CertificateMode

-- | The date and time the certificate was created.
[$sel:creationDate:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>Certificate</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_status</a> - The
--   status of the certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateArn</a> - The ARN of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateId</a> - The ID of the certificate. (The
--   last part of the certificate ARN contains the certificate ID.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateMode:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateMode</a> - The mode of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_creationDate</a>
--   - The date and time the certificate was created.
newCertificate :: Certificate

-- | The status of the certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
certificate_status :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe CertificateStatus)

-- | The ARN of the certificate.
certificate_certificateArn :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
certificate_certificateId :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The mode of the certificate.
certificate_certificateMode :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe CertificateMode)

-- | The date and time the certificate was created.
certificate_creationDate :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Certificate.Certificate


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CertificateValidity

-- | When the certificate is valid.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificateValidity</a> smart constructor.
data CertificateValidity
CertificateValidity' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> CertificateValidity

-- | The certificate is not valid before this date.
[$sel:notBefore:CertificateValidity'] :: CertificateValidity -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The certificate is not valid after this date.
[$sel:notAfter:CertificateValidity'] :: CertificateValidity -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>CertificateValidity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:notBefore:CertificateValidity'</a>,
--   <a>certificateValidity_notBefore</a> - The certificate is not valid
--   before this date.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notAfter:CertificateValidity'</a>,
--   <a>certificateValidity_notAfter</a> - The certificate is not valid
--   after this date.
newCertificateValidity :: CertificateValidity

-- | The certificate is not valid before this date.
certificateValidity_notBefore :: Lens' CertificateValidity (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The certificate is not valid after this date.
certificateValidity_notAfter :: Lens' CertificateValidity (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CertificateValidity.CertificateValidity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CertificateValidity.CertificateValidity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CertificateValidity.CertificateValidity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CertificateValidity.CertificateValidity

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CACertificateDescription

-- | Describes a CA certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCACertificateDescription</a> smart constructor.
data CACertificateDescription
CACertificateDescription' :: Maybe CACertificateStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CertificateValidity -> Maybe AutoRegistrationStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> CACertificateDescription

-- | The status of a CA certificate.
[$sel:status:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe CACertificateStatus

-- | The owner of the CA certificate.
[$sel:ownedBy:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The date the CA certificate was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The CA certificate data, in PEM format.
[$sel:certificatePem:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The CA certificate ARN.
[$sel:certificateArn:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The CA certificate ID.
[$sel:certificateId:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | When the CA certificate is valid.
[$sel:validity:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe CertificateValidity

-- | Whether the CA certificate configured for auto registration of device
--   certificates. Valid values are "ENABLE" and "DISABLE"
[$sel:autoRegistrationStatus:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe AutoRegistrationStatus

-- | The date the CA certificate was created.
[$sel:creationDate:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The generation ID of the CA certificate.
[$sel:generationId:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The customer version of the CA certificate.
[$sel:customerVersion:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>CACertificateDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_status</a> - The status of a CA
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ownedBy:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_ownedBy</a> - The owner of the CA
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date the CA
--   certificate was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificatePem:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_certificatePem</a> - The CA certificate
--   data, in PEM format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_certificateArn</a> - The CA certificate
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_certificateId</a> - The CA certificate ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validity:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_validity</a> - When the CA certificate is
--   valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoRegistrationStatus:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_autoRegistrationStatus</a> - Whether the
--   CA certificate configured for auto registration of device
--   certificates. Valid values are "ENABLE" and "DISABLE"
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_creationDate</a> - The date the CA
--   certificate was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:generationId:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_generationId</a> - The generation ID of
--   the CA certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customerVersion:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_customerVersion</a> - The customer version
--   of the CA certificate.
newCACertificateDescription :: CACertificateDescription

-- | The status of a CA certificate.
cACertificateDescription_status :: Lens' CACertificateDescription (Maybe CACertificateStatus)

-- | The owner of the CA certificate.
cACertificateDescription_ownedBy :: Lens' CACertificateDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the CA certificate was last modified.
cACertificateDescription_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' CACertificateDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The CA certificate data, in PEM format.
cACertificateDescription_certificatePem :: Lens' CACertificateDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The CA certificate ARN.
cACertificateDescription_certificateArn :: Lens' CACertificateDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The CA certificate ID.
cACertificateDescription_certificateId :: Lens' CACertificateDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | When the CA certificate is valid.
cACertificateDescription_validity :: Lens' CACertificateDescription (Maybe CertificateValidity)

-- | Whether the CA certificate configured for auto registration of device
--   certificates. Valid values are "ENABLE" and "DISABLE"
cACertificateDescription_autoRegistrationStatus :: Lens' CACertificateDescription (Maybe AutoRegistrationStatus)

-- | The date the CA certificate was created.
cACertificateDescription_creationDate :: Lens' CACertificateDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The generation ID of the CA certificate.
cACertificateDescription_generationId :: Lens' CACertificateDescription (Maybe Text)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CACertificateDescription.CACertificateDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CACertificateDescription.CACertificateDescription

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchAlarmAction

-- | Describes an action that updates a CloudWatch alarm.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudwatchAlarmAction</a> smart constructor.
data CloudwatchAlarmAction
CloudwatchAlarmAction' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CloudwatchAlarmAction

-- | The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch alarm.
[$sel:roleArn:CloudwatchAlarmAction'] :: CloudwatchAlarmAction -> Text

-- | The CloudWatch alarm name.
[$sel:alarmName:CloudwatchAlarmAction'] :: CloudwatchAlarmAction -> Text

-- | The reason for the alarm change.
[$sel:stateReason:CloudwatchAlarmAction'] :: CloudwatchAlarmAction -> Text

-- | The value of the alarm state. Acceptable values are: OK, ALARM,
--   INSUFFICIENT_DATA.
[$sel:stateValue:CloudwatchAlarmAction'] :: CloudwatchAlarmAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudwatchAlarmAction</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:CloudwatchAlarmAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchAlarmAction_roleArn</a> - The IAM role that allows access
--   to the CloudWatch alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alarmName:CloudwatchAlarmAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchAlarmAction_alarmName</a> - The CloudWatch alarm name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateReason:CloudwatchAlarmAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchAlarmAction_stateReason</a> - The reason for the alarm
--   change.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateValue:CloudwatchAlarmAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchAlarmAction_stateValue</a> - The value of the alarm
--   state. Acceptable values are: OK, ALARM, INSUFFICIENT_DATA.
newCloudwatchAlarmAction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CloudwatchAlarmAction

-- | The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch alarm.
cloudwatchAlarmAction_roleArn :: Lens' CloudwatchAlarmAction Text

-- | The CloudWatch alarm name.
cloudwatchAlarmAction_alarmName :: Lens' CloudwatchAlarmAction Text

-- | The reason for the alarm change.
cloudwatchAlarmAction_stateReason :: Lens' CloudwatchAlarmAction Text

-- | The value of the alarm state. Acceptable values are: OK, ALARM,
--   INSUFFICIENT_DATA.
cloudwatchAlarmAction_stateValue :: Lens' CloudwatchAlarmAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchAlarmAction.CloudwatchAlarmAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchAlarmAction.CloudwatchAlarmAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchAlarmAction.CloudwatchAlarmAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchAlarmAction.CloudwatchAlarmAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchAlarmAction.CloudwatchAlarmAction

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchLogsAction

-- | Describes an action that sends data to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudwatchLogsAction</a> smart constructor.
data CloudwatchLogsAction
CloudwatchLogsAction' :: Text -> Text -> CloudwatchLogsAction

-- | The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch log.
[$sel:roleArn:CloudwatchLogsAction'] :: CloudwatchLogsAction -> Text

-- | The CloudWatch log group to which the action sends data.
[$sel:logGroupName:CloudwatchLogsAction'] :: CloudwatchLogsAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudwatchLogsAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:CloudwatchLogsAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchLogsAction_roleArn</a> - The IAM role that allows access
--   to the CloudWatch log.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logGroupName:CloudwatchLogsAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchLogsAction_logGroupName</a> - The CloudWatch log group to
--   which the action sends data.
newCloudwatchLogsAction :: Text -> Text -> CloudwatchLogsAction

-- | The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch log.
cloudwatchLogsAction_roleArn :: Lens' CloudwatchLogsAction Text

-- | The CloudWatch log group to which the action sends data.
cloudwatchLogsAction_logGroupName :: Lens' CloudwatchLogsAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchLogsAction.CloudwatchLogsAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchLogsAction.CloudwatchLogsAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchLogsAction.CloudwatchLogsAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchLogsAction.CloudwatchLogsAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchLogsAction.CloudwatchLogsAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchLogsAction.CloudwatchLogsAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchLogsAction.CloudwatchLogsAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchLogsAction.CloudwatchLogsAction


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CloudwatchMetricAction

-- | Describes an action that captures a CloudWatch metric.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudwatchMetricAction</a> smart constructor.
data CloudwatchMetricAction
CloudwatchMetricAction' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CloudwatchMetricAction

-- | An optional <a>Unix timestamp</a>.
[$sel:metricTimestamp:CloudwatchMetricAction'] :: CloudwatchMetricAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch metric.
[$sel:roleArn:CloudwatchMetricAction'] :: CloudwatchMetricAction -> Text

-- | The CloudWatch metric namespace name.
[$sel:metricNamespace:CloudwatchMetricAction'] :: CloudwatchMetricAction -> Text

-- | The CloudWatch metric name.
[$sel:metricName:CloudwatchMetricAction'] :: CloudwatchMetricAction -> Text

-- | The CloudWatch metric value.
[$sel:metricValue:CloudwatchMetricAction'] :: CloudwatchMetricAction -> Text

-- | The <a>metric unit</a> supported by CloudWatch.
[$sel:metricUnit:CloudwatchMetricAction'] :: CloudwatchMetricAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudwatchMetricAction</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   timestamp</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:CloudwatchMetricAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchMetricAction_roleArn</a> - The IAM role that allows
--   access to the CloudWatch metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricNamespace:CloudwatchMetricAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchMetricAction_metricNamespace</a> - The CloudWatch metric
--   namespace name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:CloudwatchMetricAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchMetricAction_metricName</a> - The CloudWatch metric name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricValue:CloudwatchMetricAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchMetricAction_metricValue</a> - The CloudWatch metric
--   value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricUnit:CloudwatchMetricAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchMetricAction_metricUnit</a> - The <a>metric unit</a>
--   supported by CloudWatch.
newCloudwatchMetricAction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CloudwatchMetricAction

-- | An optional <a>Unix timestamp</a>.
cloudwatchMetricAction_metricTimestamp :: Lens' CloudwatchMetricAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch metric.

-- | The CloudWatch metric namespace name.
cloudwatchMetricAction_metricNamespace :: Lens' CloudwatchMetricAction Text

-- | The CloudWatch metric name.
cloudwatchMetricAction_metricName :: Lens' CloudwatchMetricAction Text

-- | The CloudWatch metric value.

-- | The <a>metric unit</a> supported by CloudWatch.
cloudwatchMetricAction_metricUnit :: Lens' CloudwatchMetricAction Text

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CodeSigningSignature

-- | Describes the signature for a file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCodeSigningSignature</a> smart constructor.
data CodeSigningSignature
CodeSigningSignature' :: Maybe Base64 -> CodeSigningSignature

-- | A base64 encoded binary representation of the code signing signature.
[$sel:inlineDocument:CodeSigningSignature'] :: CodeSigningSignature -> Maybe Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>CodeSigningSignature</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inlineDocument:CodeSigningSignature'</a>,
--   <a>codeSigningSignature_inlineDocument</a> - A base64 encoded binary
--   representation of the code signing signature.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This
--   <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The
--   underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
newCodeSigningSignature :: CodeSigningSignature

-- | A base64 encoded binary representation of the code signing
--   signature.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes
--   and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to
--   Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
codeSigningSignature_inlineDocument :: Lens' CodeSigningSignature (Maybe ByteString)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CodeSigningSignature.CodeSigningSignature
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CodeSigningSignature.CodeSigningSignature
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CodeSigningSignature.CodeSigningSignature
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CodeSigningSignature.CodeSigningSignature

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CustomCodeSigning

-- | Describes a custom method used to code sign a file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomCodeSigning</a> smart constructor.
data CustomCodeSigning
CustomCodeSigning' :: Maybe CodeSigningSignature -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CodeSigningCertificateChain -> Maybe Text -> CustomCodeSigning

-- | The signature for the file.
[$sel:signature:CustomCodeSigning'] :: CustomCodeSigning -> Maybe CodeSigningSignature

-- | The hash algorithm used to code sign the file.
[$sel:hashAlgorithm:CustomCodeSigning'] :: CustomCodeSigning -> Maybe Text

-- | The certificate chain.
[$sel:certificateChain:CustomCodeSigning'] :: CustomCodeSigning -> Maybe CodeSigningCertificateChain

-- | The signature algorithm used to code sign the file.
[$sel:signatureAlgorithm:CustomCodeSigning'] :: CustomCodeSigning -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomCodeSigning</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>customCodeSigning_signature</a> - The signature for the file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hashAlgorithm:CustomCodeSigning'</a>,
--   <a>customCodeSigning_hashAlgorithm</a> - The hash algorithm used to
--   code sign the file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateChain:CustomCodeSigning'</a>,
--   <a>customCodeSigning_certificateChain</a> - The certificate chain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signatureAlgorithm:CustomCodeSigning'</a>,
--   <a>customCodeSigning_signatureAlgorithm</a> - The signature algorithm
--   used to code sign the file.
newCustomCodeSigning :: CustomCodeSigning

-- | The signature for the file.

-- | The hash algorithm used to code sign the file.
customCodeSigning_hashAlgorithm :: Lens' CustomCodeSigning (Maybe Text)

-- | The certificate chain.

-- | The signature algorithm used to code sign the file.

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DetectMitigationActionExecution

-- | Describes which mitigation actions should be executed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDetectMitigationActionExecution</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DetectMitigationActionExecution
DetectMitigationActionExecution' :: Maybe DetectMitigationActionExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> DetectMitigationActionExecution

-- | The status of a mitigation action.
[$sel:status:DetectMitigationActionExecution'] :: DetectMitigationActionExecution -> Maybe DetectMitigationActionExecutionStatus

-- | The unique identifier of the task.
