instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoKeyType.DynamoKeyType


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBAction

-- | Describes an action to write to a DynamoDB table.
--   
--   The <tt>tableName</tt>, <tt>hashKeyField</tt>, and
--   <tt>rangeKeyField</tt> values must match the values used when you
--   created the table.
--   
--   The <tt>hashKeyValue</tt> and <tt>rangeKeyvalue</tt> fields use a
--   substitution template syntax. These templates provide data at runtime.
--   The syntax is as follows: ${<i>sql-expression</i>}.
--   
--   You can specify any valid expression in a WHERE or SELECT clause,
--   including JSON properties, comparisons, calculations, and functions.
--   For example, the following field uses the third level of the topic:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "hashKeyValue": "${topic(3)}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following field uses the timestamp:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "rangeKeyValue": "${timestamp()}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDynamoDBAction</a> smart constructor.
data DynamoDBAction
DynamoDBAction' :: Maybe DynamoKeyType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DynamoKeyType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DynamoDBAction

-- | The hash key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
[$sel:hashKeyType:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe DynamoKeyType

-- | The type of operation to be performed. This follows the substitution
--   template, so it can be <tt>${operation}</tt>, but the substitution
--   must result in one of the following: <tt>INSERT</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>,
--   or <tt>DELETE</tt>.
[$sel:operation:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The range key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
[$sel:rangeKeyType:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe DynamoKeyType

-- | The action payload. This name can be customized.
[$sel:payloadField:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The range key name.
[$sel:rangeKeyField:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The range key value.
[$sel:rangeKeyValue:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the DynamoDB table.
[$sel:tableName:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
[$sel:roleArn:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Text

-- | The hash key name.
[$sel:hashKeyField:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Text

-- | The hash key value.
[$sel:hashKeyValue:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DynamoDBAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hashKeyType:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_hashKeyType</a> - The hash key type. Valid values
--   are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
--   
--   <a>$sel:operation:DynamoDBAction'</a>, <a>dynamoDBAction_operation</a>
--   - The type of operation to be performed. This follows the substitution
--   template, so it can be <tt>${operation}</tt>, but the substitution
--   must result in one of the following: <tt>INSERT</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>,
--   or <tt>DELETE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeKeyType:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyType</a> - The range key type. Valid values
--   are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
--   
--   <a>$sel:payloadField:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_payloadField</a> - The action payload. This name can
--   be customized.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeKeyField:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyField</a> - The range key name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeKeyValue:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyValue</a> - The range key value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableName:DynamoDBAction'</a>, <a>dynamoDBAction_tableName</a>
--   - The name of the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:DynamoDBAction'</a>, <a>dynamoDBAction_roleArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hashKeyField:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_hashKeyField</a> - The hash key name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hashKeyValue:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_hashKeyValue</a> - The hash key value.
newDynamoDBAction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DynamoDBAction

-- | The hash key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
dynamoDBAction_hashKeyType :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe DynamoKeyType)

-- | The type of operation to be performed. This follows the substitution
--   template, so it can be <tt>${operation}</tt>, but the substitution
--   must result in one of the following: <tt>INSERT</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>,
--   or <tt>DELETE</tt>.
dynamoDBAction_operation :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The range key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyType :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe DynamoKeyType)

-- | The action payload. This name can be customized.
dynamoDBAction_payloadField :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The range key name.
dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyField :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The range key value.
dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyValue :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the DynamoDB table.
dynamoDBAction_tableName :: Lens' DynamoDBAction Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
dynamoDBAction_roleArn :: Lens' DynamoDBAction Text

-- | The hash key name.
dynamoDBAction_hashKeyField :: Lens' DynamoDBAction Text

-- | The hash key value.
dynamoDBAction_hashKeyValue :: Lens' DynamoDBAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBAction.DynamoDBAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBAction.DynamoDBAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBAction.DynamoDBAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBAction.DynamoDBAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBAction.DynamoDBAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBAction.DynamoDBAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBAction.DynamoDBAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBAction.DynamoDBAction


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.EffectivePolicy

-- | The policy that has the effect on the authorization results.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEffectivePolicy</a> smart constructor.
data EffectivePolicy
EffectivePolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EffectivePolicy

-- | The policy name.
[$sel:policyName:EffectivePolicy'] :: EffectivePolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM policy document.
[$sel:policyDocument:EffectivePolicy'] :: EffectivePolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The policy ARN.
[$sel:policyArn:EffectivePolicy'] :: EffectivePolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EffectivePolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:EffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>effectivePolicy_policyName</a> - The policy name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyDocument:EffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>effectivePolicy_policyDocument</a> - The IAM policy document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyArn:EffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>effectivePolicy_policyArn</a> - The policy ARN.
newEffectivePolicy :: EffectivePolicy

-- | The policy name.
effectivePolicy_policyName :: Lens' EffectivePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM policy document.
effectivePolicy_policyDocument :: Lens' EffectivePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The policy ARN.
effectivePolicy_policyArn :: Lens' EffectivePolicy (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ElasticsearchAction

-- | Describes an action that writes data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service
--   domain.
--   
--   The <tt>Elasticsearch</tt> action can only be used by existing rule
--   actions. To create a new rule action or to update an existing rule
--   action, use the <tt>OpenSearch</tt> rule action instead. For more
--   information, see <a>OpenSearchAction</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchAction</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticsearchAction
ElasticsearchAction' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchAction

-- | The IAM role ARN that has access to OpenSearch.
[$sel:roleArn:ElasticsearchAction'] :: ElasticsearchAction -> Text

-- | The endpoint of your OpenSearch domain.
[$sel:endpoint:ElasticsearchAction'] :: ElasticsearchAction -> Text

-- | The index where you want to store your data.
[$sel:index:ElasticsearchAction'] :: ElasticsearchAction -> Text

-- | The type of document you are storing.
[$sel:type':ElasticsearchAction'] :: ElasticsearchAction -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the document you are storing.
[$sel:id:ElasticsearchAction'] :: ElasticsearchAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ElasticsearchAction'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchAction_roleArn</a> - The IAM role ARN that has access
--   to OpenSearch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:ElasticsearchAction'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchAction_endpoint</a> - The endpoint of your OpenSearch
--   domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:index:ElasticsearchAction'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchAction_index</a> - The index where you want to store
--   your data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ElasticsearchAction'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchAction_type</a> - The type of document you are
--   storing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ElasticsearchAction'</a>, <a>elasticsearchAction_id</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the document you are storing.
newElasticsearchAction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchAction

-- | The IAM role ARN that has access to OpenSearch.
elasticsearchAction_roleArn :: Lens' ElasticsearchAction Text

-- | The endpoint of your OpenSearch domain.
elasticsearchAction_endpoint :: Lens' ElasticsearchAction Text

-- | The index where you want to store your data.
elasticsearchAction_index :: Lens' ElasticsearchAction Text

-- | The type of document you are storing.
elasticsearchAction_type :: Lens' ElasticsearchAction Text

-- | The unique identifier for the document you are storing.
elasticsearchAction_id :: Lens' ElasticsearchAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ElasticsearchAction.ElasticsearchAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ElasticsearchAction.ElasticsearchAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ElasticsearchAction.ElasticsearchAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ElasticsearchAction.ElasticsearchAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ElasticsearchAction.ElasticsearchAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ElasticsearchAction.ElasticsearchAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ElasticsearchAction.ElasticsearchAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ElasticsearchAction.ElasticsearchAction

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Field

-- | Describes the name and data type at a field.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newField</a> smart constructor.
data Field
Field' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe FieldType -> Field

-- | The name of the field.
[$sel:name:Field'] :: Field -> Maybe Text

-- | The data type of the field.
[$sel:type':Field'] :: Field -> Maybe FieldType

-- | Create a value of <a>Field</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Field'</a>, <a>field_name</a> - The name of the field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Field'</a>, <a>field_type</a> - The data type of the
--   field.
newField :: Field

-- | The name of the field.
field_name :: Lens' Field (Maybe Text)

-- | The data type of the field.
field_type :: Lens' Field (Maybe FieldType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Field.Field
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Field.Field
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Field.Field
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Field.Field
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Field.Field
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Field.Field
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Field.Field
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Field.Field


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.FirehoseAction

-- | Describes an action that writes data to an Amazon Kinesis Firehose
--   stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFirehoseAction</a> smart constructor.
data FirehoseAction
FirehoseAction' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> FirehoseAction

-- | Whether to deliver the Kinesis Data Firehose stream as a batch by
--   using <a>PutRecordBatch</a> . The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule's SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element forms one record in the
--   <a>PutRecordBatch</a> request. The resulting array can't have more
--   than 500 records.
[$sel:batchMode:FirehoseAction'] :: FirehoseAction -> Maybe Bool

-- | A character separator that will be used to separate records written to
--   the Firehose stream. Valid values are: '\n' (newline), '\t' (tab),
--   '\r\n' (Windows newline), ',' (comma).
[$sel:separator:FirehoseAction'] :: FirehoseAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
[$sel:roleArn:FirehoseAction'] :: FirehoseAction -> Text

-- | The delivery stream name.
[$sel:deliveryStreamName:FirehoseAction'] :: FirehoseAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FirehoseAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchMode:FirehoseAction'</a>, <a>firehoseAction_batchMode</a>
--   - Whether to deliver the Kinesis Data Firehose stream as a batch by
--   using <a>PutRecordBatch</a> . The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule's SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element forms one record in the
--   <a>PutRecordBatch</a> request. The resulting array can't have more
--   than 500 records.
--   
--   <a>$sel:separator:FirehoseAction'</a>, <a>firehoseAction_separator</a>
--   - A character separator that will be used to separate records written
--   to the Firehose stream. Valid values are: '\n' (newline), '\t' (tab),
--   '\r\n' (Windows newline), ',' (comma).
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:FirehoseAction'</a>, <a>firehoseAction_roleArn</a> -
--   The IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamName:FirehoseAction'</a>,
--   <a>firehoseAction_deliveryStreamName</a> - The delivery stream name.
newFirehoseAction :: Text -> Text -> FirehoseAction

-- | Whether to deliver the Kinesis Data Firehose stream as a batch by
--   using <a>PutRecordBatch</a> . The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule's SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element forms one record in the
--   <a>PutRecordBatch</a> request. The resulting array can't have more
--   than 500 records.
firehoseAction_batchMode :: Lens' FirehoseAction (Maybe Bool)

-- | A character separator that will be used to separate records written to
--   the Firehose stream. Valid values are: '\n' (newline), '\t' (tab),
--   '\r\n' (Windows newline), ',' (comma).
firehoseAction_separator :: Lens' FirehoseAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
firehoseAction_roleArn :: Lens' FirehoseAction Text

-- | The delivery stream name.
firehoseAction_deliveryStreamName :: Lens' FirehoseAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.FirehoseAction.FirehoseAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.FirehoseAction.FirehoseAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.FirehoseAction.FirehoseAction

--   header keys and values in an HTTP authorization request.

--   The query string keys and values in an HTTP authorization request.

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotAnalyticsAction

-- | Sends message data to an IoT Analytics channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIotAnalyticsAction</a> smart constructor.
data IotAnalyticsAction
IotAnalyticsAction' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> IotAnalyticsAction

-- | Whether to process the action as a batch. The default value is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is delivered as a separate
--   message when passed by <a>BatchPutMessage</a> to the IoT Analytics
--   channel. The resulting array can't have more than 100 messages.
[$sel:batchMode:IotAnalyticsAction'] :: IotAnalyticsAction -> Maybe Bool

-- | (deprecated) The ARN of the IoT Analytics channel to which message
--   data will be sent.
[$sel:channelArn:IotAnalyticsAction'] :: IotAnalyticsAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the IoT Analytics channel to which message data will be
--   sent.
[$sel:channelName:IotAnalyticsAction'] :: IotAnalyticsAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the role which has a policy that grants IoT Analytics
--   permission to send message data via IoT Analytics
--   (iotanalytics:BatchPutMessage).
[$sel:roleArn:IotAnalyticsAction'] :: IotAnalyticsAction -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IotAnalyticsAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchMode:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_batchMode</a> - Whether to process the action as
--   a batch. The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is delivered as a separate
--   message when passed by <a>BatchPutMessage</a> to the IoT Analytics
--   channel. The resulting array can't have more than 100 messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelArn:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_channelArn</a> - (deprecated) The ARN of the IoT
--   Analytics channel to which message data will be sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelName:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_channelName</a> - The name of the IoT Analytics
--   channel to which message data will be sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the role which has a
--   policy that grants IoT Analytics permission to send message data via
--   IoT Analytics (iotanalytics:BatchPutMessage).
newIotAnalyticsAction :: IotAnalyticsAction

-- | Whether to process the action as a batch. The default value is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is delivered as a separate
--   message when passed by <a>BatchPutMessage</a> to the IoT Analytics
--   channel. The resulting array can't have more than 100 messages.
iotAnalyticsAction_batchMode :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Bool)

-- | (deprecated) The ARN of the IoT Analytics channel to which message
--   data will be sent.
iotAnalyticsAction_channelArn :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the IoT Analytics channel to which message data will be
--   sent.
iotAnalyticsAction_channelName :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the role which has a policy that grants IoT Analytics
--   permission to send message data via IoT Analytics
--   (iotanalytics:BatchPutMessage).
iotAnalyticsAction_roleArn :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotAnalyticsAction.IotAnalyticsAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotAnalyticsAction.IotAnalyticsAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotAnalyticsAction.IotAnalyticsAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotAnalyticsAction.IotAnalyticsAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotAnalyticsAction.IotAnalyticsAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotAnalyticsAction.IotAnalyticsAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotAnalyticsAction.IotAnalyticsAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotAnalyticsAction.IotAnalyticsAction


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotEventsAction

-- | Sends an input to an IoT Events detector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIotEventsAction</a> smart constructor.
data IotEventsAction
IotEventsAction' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> IotEventsAction

-- | Whether to process the event actions as a batch. The default value is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is treated as a separate
--   message when it's sent to IoT Events by calling <a>BatchPutMessage</a>
--   . The resulting array can't have more than 10 messages.
[$sel:batchMode:IotEventsAction'] :: IotEventsAction -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ID of the message. The default <tt>messageId</tt> is a new UUID
--   value.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>--a new UUID value will be assigned.
--   
--   Assign a value to this property to ensure that only one input
--   (message) with a given <tt>messageId</tt> will be processed by an IoT
--   Events detector.
[$sel:messageId:IotEventsAction'] :: IotEventsAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the IoT Events input.
[$sel:inputName:IotEventsAction'] :: IotEventsAction -> Text

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an input to an
--   IoT Events detector. ("Action":"iotevents:BatchPutMessage").
[$sel:roleArn:IotEventsAction'] :: IotEventsAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IotEventsAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchMode:IotEventsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotEventsAction_batchMode</a> - Whether to process the event
--   actions as a batch. The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is treated as a separate
--   message when it's sent to IoT Events by calling <a>BatchPutMessage</a>
--   . The resulting array can't have more than 10 messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:IotEventsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotEventsAction_messageId</a> - The ID of the message. The default
--   <tt>messageId</tt> is a new UUID value.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>--a new UUID value will be assigned.
--   
--   Assign a value to this property to ensure that only one input
--   (message) with a given <tt>messageId</tt> will be processed by an IoT
--   Events detector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputName:IotEventsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotEventsAction_inputName</a> - The name of the IoT Events input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:IotEventsAction'</a>, <a>iotEventsAction_roleArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an input to an
--   IoT Events detector. ("Action":"iotevents:BatchPutMessage").
newIotEventsAction :: Text -> Text -> IotEventsAction

-- | Whether to process the event actions as a batch. The default value is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is treated as a separate
--   message when it's sent to IoT Events by calling <a>BatchPutMessage</a>
--   . The resulting array can't have more than 10 messages.
iotEventsAction_batchMode :: Lens' IotEventsAction (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ID of the message. The default <tt>messageId</tt> is a new UUID
--   value.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>--a new UUID value will be assigned.
--   
--   Assign a value to this property to ensure that only one input
--   (message) with a given <tt>messageId</tt> will be processed by an IoT
--   Events detector.
iotEventsAction_messageId :: Lens' IotEventsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the IoT Events input.
iotEventsAction_inputName :: Lens' IotEventsAction Text

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an input to an
--   IoT Events detector. ("Action":"iotevents:BatchPutMessage").
iotEventsAction_roleArn :: Lens' IotEventsAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotEventsAction.IotEventsAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotEventsAction.IotEventsAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotEventsAction.IotEventsAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotEventsAction.IotEventsAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotEventsAction.IotEventsAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotEventsAction.IotEventsAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotEventsAction.IotEventsAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotEventsAction.IotEventsAction

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AbortCriteria

-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAbortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data AbortCriteria
AbortCriteria' :: JobExecutionFailureType -> AbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AbortCriteria

-- | The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.
[$sel:failureType:AbortCriteria'] :: AbortCriteria -> JobExecutionFailureType

-- | The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
[$sel:action:AbortCriteria'] :: AbortCriteria -> AbortAction

-- | The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
[$sel:thresholdPercentage:AbortCriteria'] :: AbortCriteria -> Double

-- | The minimum number of things which must receive job execution
--   notifications before the job can be aborted.
[$sel:minNumberOfExecutedThings:AbortCriteria'] :: AbortCriteria -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AbortCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureType:AbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>abortCriteria_failureType</a> - The type of job execution failures
--   that can initiate a job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:AbortCriteria'</a>, <a>abortCriteria_action</a> - The
--   type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thresholdPercentage:AbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>abortCriteria_thresholdPercentage</a> - The minimum percentage of
--   job execution failures that must occur to initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
--   
--   <a>$sel:minNumberOfExecutedThings:AbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>abortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings</a> - The minimum number of
--   things which must receive job execution notifications before the job
--   can be aborted.
newAbortCriteria :: JobExecutionFailureType -> AbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AbortCriteria

-- | The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.
abortCriteria_failureType :: Lens' AbortCriteria JobExecutionFailureType

-- | The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
abortCriteria_action :: Lens' AbortCriteria AbortAction

-- | The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
abortCriteria_thresholdPercentage :: Lens' AbortCriteria Double

-- | The minimum number of things which must receive job execution
--   notifications before the job can be aborted.
abortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings :: Lens' AbortCriteria Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AbortCriteria.AbortCriteria
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AbortCriteria.AbortCriteria
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AbortCriteria.AbortCriteria
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AbortCriteria.AbortCriteria
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AbortCriteria.AbortCriteria
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AbortCriteria.AbortCriteria
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AbortCriteria.AbortCriteria
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AbortCriteria.AbortCriteria


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AbortConfig

-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAbortConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AbortConfig
AbortConfig' :: NonEmpty AbortCriteria -> AbortConfig

-- | The list of criteria that determine when and how to abort the job.

-- | Create a value of <a>AbortConfig</a> with all optional fields omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecution

-- | The job execution object represents the execution of a job on a
--   particular device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecution</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecution
JobExecution' :: Maybe JobExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe JobExecutionStatusDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> JobExecution

-- | The status of the job execution (IN_PROGRESS, QUEUED, FAILED,
--   SUCCEEDED, TIMED_OUT, CANCELED, or REJECTED).
[$sel:status:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe JobExecutionStatus

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to the job when it was created.
[$sel:jobId:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last
--   updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The estimated number of seconds that remain before the job execution
--   status will be changed to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>. The timeout interval can
--   be anywhere between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The
--   actual job execution timeout can occur up to 60 seconds later than the
--   estimated duration. This value will not be included if the job
--   execution has reached a terminal status.
[$sel:approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Integer

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was
--   queued.
[$sel:queuedAt:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job
--   execution.
[$sel:statusDetails:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe JobExecutionStatusDetails

-- | The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.
[$sel:thingArn:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies
--   this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be
--   used in commands which return or update job execution information.
[$sel:executionNumber:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Integer

-- | The version of the job execution. Job execution versions are
--   incremented each time they are updated by a device.
[$sel:versionNumber:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Integer

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
[$sel:startedAt:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job execution was canceled with the
--   optional <tt>force</tt> parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:forceCanceled:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_status</a> - The
--   status of the job execution (IN_PROGRESS, QUEUED, FAILED, SUCCEEDED,
--   TIMED_OUT, CANCELED, or REJECTED).
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_jobId</a> - The
--   unique identifier you assigned to the job when it was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_lastUpdatedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since the
--   epoch, when the job execution was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut</a> - The estimated
--   number of seconds that remain before the job execution status will be
--   changed to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>. The timeout interval can be anywhere
--   between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The actual job
--   execution timeout can occur up to 60 seconds later than the estimated
--   duration. This value will not be included if the job execution has
--   reached a terminal status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queuedAt:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_queuedAt</a> - The
--   time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was queued.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusDetails:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_statusDetails</a> - A collection of name/value pairs
--   that describe the status of the job execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingArn:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_thingArn</a> - The
--   ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionNumber:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_executionNumber</a> - A string (consisting of the
--   digits "0" through "9") which identifies this particular job execution
--   on this particular device. It can be used in commands which return or
--   update job execution information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionNumber:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_versionNumber</a> - The version of the job execution.
--   Job execution versions are incremented each time they are updated by a
--   device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startedAt:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_startedAt</a> -
--   The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceCanceled:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_forceCanceled</a> - Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job
--   execution was canceled with the optional <tt>force</tt> parameter set
--   to <tt>true</tt>.
newJobExecution :: JobExecution

-- | The status of the job execution (IN_PROGRESS, QUEUED, FAILED,
--   SUCCEEDED, TIMED_OUT, CANCELED, or REJECTED).
jobExecution_status :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe JobExecutionStatus)

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to the job when it was created.
jobExecution_jobId :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last
--   updated.
jobExecution_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The estimated number of seconds that remain before the job execution
--   status will be changed to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>. The timeout interval can
--   be anywhere between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The
--   actual job execution timeout can occur up to 60 seconds later than the
--   estimated duration. This value will not be included if the job
--   execution has reached a terminal status.
jobExecution_approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was
--   queued.
jobExecution_queuedAt :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job
--   execution.
jobExecution_statusDetails :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe JobExecutionStatusDetails)

-- | The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.
jobExecution_thingArn :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies
--   this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be
--   used in commands which return or update job execution information.
jobExecution_executionNumber :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Integer)

-- | The version of the job execution. Job execution versions are
--   incremented each time they are updated by a device.
jobExecution_versionNumber :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
jobExecution_startedAt :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job execution was canceled with the
--   optional <tt>force</tt> parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
jobExecution_forceCanceled :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecution.JobExecution
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecution.JobExecution
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecution.JobExecution
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecution.JobExecution
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecution.JobExecution
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecution.JobExecution
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecution.JobExecution


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecutionSummary

-- | The job execution summary.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecutionSummary</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecutionSummary
JobExecutionSummary' :: Maybe JobExecutionStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> JobExecutionSummary

-- | The status of the job execution.
[$sel:status:JobExecutionSummary'] :: JobExecutionSummary -> Maybe JobExecutionStatus

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last
--   updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobExecutionSummary'] :: JobExecutionSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was
--   queued.
[$sel:queuedAt:JobExecutionSummary'] :: JobExecutionSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies
--   this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be
--   used later in commands which return or update job execution
--   information.
[$sel:executionNumber:JobExecutionSummary'] :: JobExecutionSummary -> Maybe Integer

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
[$sel:startedAt:JobExecutionSummary'] :: JobExecutionSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecutionSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_status</a> - The status of the job execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_lastUpdatedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since
--   the epoch, when the job execution was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queuedAt:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_queuedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since the
--   epoch, when the job execution was queued.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionNumber:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_executionNumber</a> - A string (consisting of
--   the digits "0" through "9") which identifies this particular job
--   execution on this particular device. It can be used later in commands
--   which return or update job execution information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startedAt:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_startedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since the
--   epoch, when the job execution started.
newJobExecutionSummary :: JobExecutionSummary

-- | The status of the job execution.
jobExecutionSummary_status :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe JobExecutionStatus)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last
--   updated.
jobExecutionSummary_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was
--   queued.
jobExecutionSummary_queuedAt :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies
--   this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be
--   used later in commands which return or update job execution
--   information.
jobExecutionSummary_executionNumber :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
jobExecutionSummary_startedAt :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecutionSummary.JobExecutionSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecutionSummary.JobExecutionSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecutionSummary.JobExecutionSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecutionSummary.JobExecutionSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecutionSummary.JobExecutionSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecutionSummary.JobExecutionSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecutionSummary.JobExecutionSummary


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecutionSummaryForJob

-- | Contains a summary of information about job executions for a specific
--   job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecutionSummaryForJob</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecutionSummaryForJob
JobExecutionSummaryForJob' :: Maybe JobExecutionSummary -> Maybe Text -> JobExecutionSummaryForJob

-- | Contains a subset of information about a job execution.
[$sel:jobExecutionSummary:JobExecutionSummaryForJob'] :: JobExecutionSummaryForJob -> Maybe JobExecutionSummary

-- | The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.
[$sel:thingArn:JobExecutionSummaryForJob'] :: JobExecutionSummaryForJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecutionSummaryForJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExecutionSummary:JobExecutionSummaryForJob'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummaryForJob_jobExecutionSummary</a> - Contains a
--   subset of information about a job execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingArn:JobExecutionSummaryForJob'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummaryForJob_thingArn</a> - The ARN of the thing on
--   which the job execution is running.
newJobExecutionSummaryForJob :: JobExecutionSummaryForJob

-- | Contains a subset of information about a job execution.
jobExecutionSummaryForJob_jobExecutionSummary :: Lens' JobExecutionSummaryForJob (Maybe JobExecutionSummary)

-- | The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.
jobExecutionSummaryForJob_thingArn :: Lens' JobExecutionSummaryForJob (Maybe Text)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecutionSummaryForJob.JobExecutionSummaryForJob

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobExecutionSummaryForJob.JobExecutionSummaryForJob

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobProcessDetails

-- | The job process details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobProcessDetails</a> smart constructor.
data JobProcessDetails
JobProcessDetails' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> JobProcessDetails

-- | The number of things that are no longer scheduled to execute the job
--   because they have been deleted or have been removed from the group
--   that was a target of the job.
[$sel:numberOfRemovedThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things that are awaiting execution of the job.
[$sel:numberOfQueuedThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things that failed executing the job.
[$sel:numberOfFailedThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things which successfully completed the job.
[$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things currently executing the job.
[$sel:numberOfInProgressThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things that cancelled the job.
[$sel:numberOfCanceledThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things whose job execution status is <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
[$sel:numberOfTimedOutThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things that rejected the job.
[$sel:numberOfRejectedThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The target devices to which the job execution is being rolled out.
--   This value will be null after the job execution has finished rolling
--   out to all the target devices.
[$sel:processingTargets:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>JobProcessDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRemovedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfRemovedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that are no longer scheduled to execute the job because they have been
--   deleted or have been removed from the group that was a target of the
--   job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfQueuedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfQueuedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that are awaiting execution of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfFailedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfFailedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that failed executing the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfSucceededThings</a> - The number of
--   things which successfully completed the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfInProgressThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfInProgressThings</a> - The number of
--   things currently executing the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfCanceledThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfCanceledThings</a> - The number of things
--   that cancelled the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfTimedOutThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfTimedOutThings</a> - The number of things
--   whose job execution status is <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRejectedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfRejectedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that rejected the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingTargets:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_processingTargets</a> - The target devices to
--   which the job execution is being rolled out. This value will be null
--   after the job execution has finished rolling out to all the target
--   devices.
newJobProcessDetails :: JobProcessDetails

-- | The number of things that are no longer scheduled to execute the job
--   because they have been deleted or have been removed from the group
--   that was a target of the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfRemovedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that are awaiting execution of the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfQueuedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that failed executing the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfFailedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things which successfully completed the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfSucceededThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things currently executing the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfInProgressThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that cancelled the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfCanceledThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things whose job execution status is <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfTimedOutThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that rejected the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfRejectedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The target devices to which the job execution is being rolled out.
--   This value will be null after the job execution has finished rolling
--   out to all the target devices.
jobProcessDetails_processingTargets :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobProcessDetails.JobProcessDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobProcessDetails.JobProcessDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobProcessDetails.JobProcessDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobProcessDetails.JobProcessDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobProcessDetails.JobProcessDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobProcessDetails.JobProcessDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobProcessDetails.JobProcessDetails

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.KafkaAction

-- | Send messages to an Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon
--   MSK) or self-managed Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKafkaAction</a> smart constructor.
data KafkaAction
KafkaAction' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> HashMap Text Text -> KafkaAction

-- | The Kafka message key.
[$sel:key:KafkaAction'] :: KafkaAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The Kafka message partition.
[$sel:partition:KafkaAction'] :: KafkaAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of Kafka action's VPC <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt>.
[$sel:destinationArn:KafkaAction'] :: KafkaAction -> Text

-- | The Kafka topic for messages to be sent to the Kafka broker.
[$sel:topic:KafkaAction'] :: KafkaAction -> Text

-- | Properties of the Apache Kafka producer client.
[$sel:clientProperties:KafkaAction'] :: KafkaAction -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KafkaAction</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:KafkaAction'</a>, <a>kafkaAction_key</a> - The Kafka
--   message key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partition:KafkaAction'</a>, <a>kafkaAction_partition</a> - The
--   Kafka message partition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationArn:KafkaAction'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaAction_destinationArn</a> - The ARN of Kafka action's VPC
--   <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:KafkaAction'</a>, <a>kafkaAction_topic</a> - The Kafka
--   topic for messages to be sent to the Kafka broker.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientProperties:KafkaAction'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaAction_clientProperties</a> - Properties of the Apache Kafka
--   producer client.
newKafkaAction :: Text -> Text -> KafkaAction

-- | The Kafka message key.
kafkaAction_key :: Lens' KafkaAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The Kafka message partition.
kafkaAction_partition :: Lens' KafkaAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of Kafka action's VPC <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt>.
kafkaAction_destinationArn :: Lens' KafkaAction Text

-- | The Kafka topic for messages to be sent to the Kafka broker.
kafkaAction_topic :: Lens' KafkaAction Text

-- | Properties of the Apache Kafka producer client.
kafkaAction_clientProperties :: Lens' KafkaAction (HashMap Text Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.KafkaAction.KafkaAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.KafkaAction.KafkaAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.KafkaAction.KafkaAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.KafkaAction.KafkaAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.KafkaAction.KafkaAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.KafkaAction.KafkaAction

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.EnableIoTLoggingParams

-- | Parameters used when defining a mitigation action that enable Amazon
--   Web Services IoT Core logging.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableIoTLoggingParams</a> smart constructor.
data EnableIoTLoggingParams
EnableIoTLoggingParams' :: Text -> LogLevel -> EnableIoTLoggingParams

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used for logging.
[$sel:roleArnForLogging:EnableIoTLoggingParams'] :: EnableIoTLoggingParams -> Text

-- | Specifies the type of information to be logged.
[$sel:logLevel:EnableIoTLoggingParams'] :: EnableIoTLoggingParams -> LogLevel

-- | Create a value of <a>EnableIoTLoggingParams</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArnForLogging:EnableIoTLoggingParams'</a>,
--   <a>enableIoTLoggingParams_roleArnForLogging</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role used for logging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logLevel:EnableIoTLoggingParams'</a>,
--   <a>enableIoTLoggingParams_logLevel</a> - Specifies the type of
--   information to be logged.
newEnableIoTLoggingParams :: Text -> LogLevel -> EnableIoTLoggingParams

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used for logging.
enableIoTLoggingParams_roleArnForLogging :: Lens' EnableIoTLoggingParams Text

-- | Specifies the type of information to be logged.
enableIoTLoggingParams_logLevel :: Lens' EnableIoTLoggingParams LogLevel
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.EnableIoTLoggingParams.EnableIoTLoggingParams
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.EnableIoTLoggingParams.EnableIoTLoggingParams

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricDimension

-- | The dimension of a metric.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricDimension</a> smart constructor.
data MetricDimension
MetricDimension' :: Maybe DimensionValueOperator -> Text -> MetricDimension

-- | Defines how the <tt>dimensionValues</tt> of a dimension are
--   interpreted. For example, for dimension type TOPIC_FILTER, the
--   <tt>IN</tt> operator, a message will be counted only if its topic
--   matches one of the topic filters. With <tt>NOT_IN</tt> operator, a
--   message will be counted only if it doesn't match any of the topic
--   filters. The operator is optional: if it's not provided (is
--   <tt>null</tt>), it will be interpreted as <tt>IN</tt>.
[$sel:operator:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Maybe DimensionValueOperator

-- | A unique identifier for the dimension.
[$sel:dimensionName:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:operator:MetricDimension'</a>, <a>metricDimension_operator</a>
--   - Defines how the <tt>dimensionValues</tt> of a dimension are
--   interpreted. For example, for dimension type TOPIC_FILTER, the
--   <tt>IN</tt> operator, a message will be counted only if its topic
--   matches one of the topic filters. With <tt>NOT_IN</tt> operator, a
--   message will be counted only if it doesn't match any of the topic
--   filters. The operator is optional: if it's not provided (is
--   <tt>null</tt>), it will be interpreted as <tt>IN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:MetricDimension'</a>,
--   <a>metricDimension_dimensionName</a> - A unique identifier for the
--   dimension.
newMetricDimension :: Text -> MetricDimension

-- | Defines how the <tt>dimensionValues</tt> of a dimension are
--   interpreted. For example, for dimension type TOPIC_FILTER, the
--   <tt>IN</tt> operator, a message will be counted only if its topic
--   matches one of the topic filters. With <tt>NOT_IN</tt> operator, a
--   message will be counted only if it doesn't match any of the topic
--   filters. The operator is optional: if it's not provided (is
--   <tt>null</tt>), it will be interpreted as <tt>IN</tt>.
metricDimension_operator :: Lens' MetricDimension (Maybe DimensionValueOperator)

-- | A unique identifier for the dimension.
metricDimension_dimensionName :: Lens' MetricDimension Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricDimension.MetricDimension


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricToRetain

-- | The metric you want to retain. Dimensions are optional.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricToRetain</a> smart constructor.
data MetricToRetain
MetricToRetain' :: Maybe MetricDimension -> Text -> MetricToRetain

-- | The dimension of a metric. This can't be used with custom metrics.
[$sel:metricDimension:MetricToRetain'] :: MetricToRetain -> Maybe MetricDimension

-- | What is measured by the behavior.
[$sel:metric:MetricToRetain'] :: MetricToRetain -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricToRetain</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricDimension:MetricToRetain'</a>,
--   <a>metricToRetain_metricDimension</a> - The dimension of a metric.
--   This can't be used with custom metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:MetricToRetain'</a>, <a>metricToRetain_metric</a> -
--   What is measured by the behavior.
newMetricToRetain :: Text -> MetricToRetain

-- | The dimension of a metric. This can't be used with custom metrics.
metricToRetain_metricDimension :: Lens' MetricToRetain (Maybe MetricDimension)

-- | What is measured by the behavior.
metricToRetain_metric :: Lens' MetricToRetain Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricToRetain.MetricToRetain
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricToRetain.MetricToRetain
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricToRetain.MetricToRetain
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricToRetain.MetricToRetain
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricToRetain.MetricToRetain

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricValue

-- | The value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricValue</a> smart constructor.
data MetricValue
MetricValue' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Natural] -> Maybe [Double] -> Maybe Double -> Maybe [Text] -> MetricValue

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of CIDRs, use this
--   to specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
[$sel:cidrs:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe [Text]

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a numeric value, use this
--   to specify that numeric value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
[$sel:count:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe Natural

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of ports, use this
--   to specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
[$sel:ports:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe [Natural]

-- | The numeral values of a metric.
[$sel:numbers:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe [Double]

-- | The numeral value of a metric.
[$sel:number:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe Double

-- | The string values of a metric.
[$sel:strings:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricValue</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cidrs:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_cidrs</a> - If the
--   <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of CIDRs, use this to
--   specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_count</a> - If the
--   <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a numeric value, use this to
--   specify that numeric value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ports:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_ports</a> - If the
--   <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of ports, use this to
--   specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numbers:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_numbers</a> - The
--   numeral values of a metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:number:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_number</a> - The
--   numeral value of a metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:strings:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_strings</a> - The
--   string values of a metric.
newMetricValue :: MetricValue

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of CIDRs, use this
--   to specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
metricValue_cidrs :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe [Text])

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a numeric value, use this
--   to specify that numeric value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
metricValue_count :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe Natural)

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of ports, use this
--   to specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
metricValue_ports :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe [Natural])

-- | The numeral values of a metric.
metricValue_numbers :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe [Double])

-- | The numeral value of a metric.
metricValue_number :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe Double)

-- | The string values of a metric.
metricValue_strings :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricValue.MetricValue
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricValue.MetricValue
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricValue.MetricValue
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricValue.MetricValue
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricValue.MetricValue
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricValue.MetricValue
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricValue.MetricValue
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MetricValue.MetricValue


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionIdentifier

-- | Information that identifies a mitigation action. This information is
--   returned by ListMitigationActions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMitigationActionIdentifier</a> smart constructor.
data MitigationActionIdentifier
MitigationActionIdentifier' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> MitigationActionIdentifier

-- | The friendly name of the mitigation action.
[$sel:actionName:MitigationActionIdentifier'] :: MitigationActionIdentifier -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when this mitigation action was created.
[$sel:creationDate:MitigationActionIdentifier'] :: MitigationActionIdentifier -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The IAM role ARN used to apply this mitigation action.
[$sel:actionArn:MitigationActionIdentifier'] :: MitigationActionIdentifier -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MitigationActionIdentifier</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionName:MitigationActionIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionIdentifier_actionName</a> - The friendly name of
--   the mitigation action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:MitigationActionIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionIdentifier_creationDate</a> - The date when this
--   mitigation action was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionArn:MitigationActionIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionIdentifier_actionArn</a> - The IAM role ARN used to
--   apply this mitigation action.
newMitigationActionIdentifier :: MitigationActionIdentifier

-- | The friendly name of the mitigation action.
mitigationActionIdentifier_actionName :: Lens' MitigationActionIdentifier (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when this mitigation action was created.
mitigationActionIdentifier_creationDate :: Lens' MitigationActionIdentifier (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The IAM role ARN used to apply this mitigation action.
mitigationActionIdentifier_actionArn :: Lens' MitigationActionIdentifier (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionIdentifier.MitigationActionIdentifier
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionIdentifier.MitigationActionIdentifier

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MqttContext

-- | Specifies the MQTT context to use for the test authorizer request
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMqttContext</a> smart constructor.
data MqttContext
MqttContext' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Base64 -> MqttContext

-- | The value of the <tt>clientId</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.
[$sel:clientId:MqttContext'] :: MqttContext -> Maybe Text

-- | The value of the <tt>username</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.
[$sel:username:MqttContext'] :: MqttContext -> Maybe Text

-- | The value of the <tt>password</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.
[$sel:password:MqttContext'] :: MqttContext -> Maybe Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>MqttContext</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientId:MqttContext'</a>, <a>mqttContext_clientId</a> - The
--   value of the <tt>clientId</tt> key in an MQTT authorization request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:MqttContext'</a>, <a>mqttContext_username</a> - The
--   value of the <tt>username</tt> key in an MQTT authorization request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:MqttContext'</a>, <a>mqttContext_password</a> - The
--   value of the <tt>password</tt> key in an MQTT authorization request.--
--   -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes
--   Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64
--   representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
newMqttContext :: MqttContext

-- | The value of the <tt>clientId</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.
mqttContext_clientId :: Lens' MqttContext (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the <tt>username</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.
mqttContext_username :: Lens' MqttContext (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the <tt>password</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes
--   and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to
--   Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
mqttContext_password :: Lens' MqttContext (Maybe ByteString)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MqttContext.MqttContext
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MqttContext.MqttContext
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MqttContext.MqttContext
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MqttContext.MqttContext
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MqttContext.MqttContext
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MqttContext.MqttContext
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MqttContext.MqttContext

-- | A certificate that has been transferred but not yet accepted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutgoingCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data OutgoingCertificate

[$sel:transferDate:OutgoingCertificate'] :: OutgoingCertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The certificate ARN.
[$sel:certificateArn:OutgoingCertificate'] :: OutgoingCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The certificate ID.
[$sel:certificateId:OutgoingCertificate'] :: OutgoingCertificate -> Maybe Text

--   initiated.

--   <a>outgoingCertificate_certificateArn</a> - The certificate ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:OutgoingCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>outgoingCertificate_certificateId</a> - The certificate ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferredTo:OutgoingCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>outgoingCertificate_transferredTo</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account to which the transfer was made.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:OutgoingCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>outgoingCertificate_creationDate</a> - The certificate creation
--   date.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferMessage:OutgoingCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>outgoingCertificate_transferMessage</a> - The transfer message.

[$sel:percent:PercentPair'] :: PercentPair -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>PercentPair</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:PercentPair'</a>, <a>percentPair_value</a> - The value
--   of the percentile.

--   percentile.
