-- | The percentile.
percentPair_percent :: Lens' PercentPair (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PercentPair.PercentPair
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PercentPair.PercentPair
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PercentPair.PercentPair
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PercentPair.PercentPair
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PercentPair.PercentPair
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PercentPair.PercentPair
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PercentPair.PercentPair


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Policy

-- | Describes an IoT policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data Policy
Policy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Policy

-- | The policy name.
[$sel:policyName:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | The policy ARN.
[$sel:policyArn:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Policy</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policyName</a> - The policy
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyArn:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policyArn</a> - The policy
--   ARN.
newPolicy :: Policy

-- | The policy name.
policy_policyName :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | The policy ARN.
policy_policyArn :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Policy.Policy


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ImplicitDeny

-- | Information that implicitly denies authorization. When policy doesn't
--   explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is considered an
--   implicit deny.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImplicitDeny</a> smart constructor.
data ImplicitDeny
ImplicitDeny' :: Maybe [Policy] -> ImplicitDeny

-- | Policies that don't contain a matching allow or deny statement for the
--   specified action on the specified resource.
[$sel:policies:ImplicitDeny'] :: ImplicitDeny -> Maybe [Policy]

-- | Create a value of <a>ImplicitDeny</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policies:ImplicitDeny'</a>, <a>implicitDeny_policies</a> -
--   Policies that don't contain a matching allow or deny statement for the
--   specified action on the specified resource.
newImplicitDeny :: ImplicitDeny

-- | Policies that don't contain a matching allow or deny statement for the
--   specified action on the specified resource.
implicitDeny_policies :: Lens' ImplicitDeny (Maybe [Policy])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ImplicitDeny.ImplicitDeny
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ImplicitDeny.ImplicitDeny
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ImplicitDeny.ImplicitDeny
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ImplicitDeny.ImplicitDeny
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ImplicitDeny.ImplicitDeny
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ImplicitDeny.ImplicitDeny
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ImplicitDeny.ImplicitDeny


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExplicitDeny

-- | Information that explicitly denies authorization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExplicitDeny</a> smart constructor.
data ExplicitDeny
ExplicitDeny' :: Maybe [Policy] -> ExplicitDeny

-- | The policies that denied the authorization.
[$sel:policies:ExplicitDeny'] :: ExplicitDeny -> Maybe [Policy]

-- | Create a value of <a>ExplicitDeny</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policies:ExplicitDeny'</a>, <a>explicitDeny_policies</a> - The
--   policies that denied the authorization.
newExplicitDeny :: ExplicitDeny

-- | The policies that denied the authorization.
explicitDeny_policies :: Lens' ExplicitDeny (Maybe [Policy])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExplicitDeny.ExplicitDeny
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExplicitDeny.ExplicitDeny
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExplicitDeny.ExplicitDeny
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExplicitDeny.ExplicitDeny
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExplicitDeny.ExplicitDeny
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExplicitDeny.ExplicitDeny
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExplicitDeny.ExplicitDeny


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Denied

-- | Contains information that denied the authorization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDenied</a> smart constructor.
data Denied
Denied' :: Maybe ImplicitDeny -> Maybe ExplicitDeny -> Denied

-- | Information that implicitly denies the authorization. When a policy
--   doesn't explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is
--   considered an implicit deny.
[$sel:implicitDeny:Denied'] :: Denied -> Maybe ImplicitDeny

-- | Information that explicitly denies the authorization.
[$sel:explicitDeny:Denied'] :: Denied -> Maybe ExplicitDeny

-- | Create a value of <a>Denied</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:implicitDeny:Denied'</a>, <a>denied_implicitDeny</a> -
--   Information that implicitly denies the authorization. When a policy
--   doesn't explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is
--   considered an implicit deny.
--   
--   <a>$sel:explicitDeny:Denied'</a>, <a>denied_explicitDeny</a> -
--   Information that explicitly denies the authorization.
newDenied :: Denied

-- | Information that implicitly denies the authorization. When a policy
--   doesn't explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is
--   considered an implicit deny.
denied_implicitDeny :: Lens' Denied (Maybe ImplicitDeny)

-- | Information that explicitly denies the authorization.
denied_explicitDeny :: Lens' Denied (Maybe ExplicitDeny)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Denied.Denied
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Denied.Denied
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Denied.Denied
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Denied.Denied
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Denied.Denied
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Denied.Denied
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Denied.Denied


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Allowed

--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   policies that allowed the authentication.

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Allowed.Allowed


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthResult

-- | The authorizer result.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthResult</a> smart constructor.
data AuthResult
AuthResult' :: Maybe Denied -> Maybe AuthDecision -> Maybe Allowed -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe AuthInfo -> AuthResult

-- | The policies and statements that denied the specified action.
[$sel:denied:AuthResult'] :: AuthResult -> Maybe Denied

-- | The final authorization decision of this scenario. Multiple statements
--   are taken into account when determining the authorization decision. An
--   explicit deny statement can override multiple allow statements.
[$sel:authDecision:AuthResult'] :: AuthResult -> Maybe AuthDecision

-- | The policies and statements that allowed the specified action.
[$sel:allowed:AuthResult'] :: AuthResult -> Maybe Allowed

-- | Contains any missing context values found while evaluating policy.
[$sel:missingContextValues:AuthResult'] :: AuthResult -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Authorization information.
[$sel:authInfo:AuthResult'] :: AuthResult -> Maybe AuthInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthResult</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:denied:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_denied</a> - The
--   policies and statements that denied the specified action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authDecision:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_authDecision</a> -
--   The final authorization decision of this scenario. Multiple statements
--   are taken into account when determining the authorization decision. An
--   explicit deny statement can override multiple allow statements.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowed:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_allowed</a> - The
--   policies and statements that allowed the specified action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingContextValues:AuthResult'</a>,
--   <a>authResult_missingContextValues</a> - Contains any missing context
--   values found while evaluating policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authInfo:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_authInfo</a> -
--   Authorization information.
newAuthResult :: AuthResult

-- | The policies and statements that denied the specified action.
authResult_denied :: Lens' AuthResult (Maybe Denied)

-- | The final authorization decision of this scenario. Multiple statements
--   are taken into account when determining the authorization decision. An
--   explicit deny statement can override multiple allow statements.
authResult_authDecision :: Lens' AuthResult (Maybe AuthDecision)

-- | The policies and statements that allowed the specified action.
authResult_allowed :: Lens' AuthResult (Maybe Allowed)

-- | Contains any missing context values found while evaluating policy.
authResult_missingContextValues :: Lens' AuthResult (Maybe [Text])

-- | Authorization information.
authResult_authInfo :: Lens' AuthResult (Maybe AuthInfo)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthResult.AuthResult
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthResult.AuthResult
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthResult.AuthResult
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthResult.AuthResult
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthResult.AuthResult
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthResult.AuthResult
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuthResult.AuthResult

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PolicyVersion

-- | Describes a policy version.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyVersion</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyVersion
PolicyVersion' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> PolicyVersion

-- | The policy version ID.
[$sel:versionId:PolicyVersion'] :: PolicyVersion -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time the policy was created.
[$sel:createDate:PolicyVersion'] :: PolicyVersion -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies whether the policy version is the default.
[$sel:isDefaultVersion:PolicyVersion'] :: PolicyVersion -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyVersion</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:PolicyVersion'</a>, <a>policyVersion_versionId</a> -
--   The policy version ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:PolicyVersion'</a>, <a>policyVersion_createDate</a>
--   - The date and time the policy was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefaultVersion:PolicyVersion'</a>,
--   <a>policyVersion_isDefaultVersion</a> - Specifies whether the policy
--   version is the default.
newPolicyVersion :: PolicyVersion

-- | The policy version ID.
policyVersion_versionId :: Lens' PolicyVersion (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time the policy was created.
policyVersion_createDate :: Lens' PolicyVersion (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether the policy version is the default.
policyVersion_isDefaultVersion :: Lens' PolicyVersion (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PolicyVersion.PolicyVersion
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PolicyVersion.PolicyVersion
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PolicyVersion.PolicyVersion

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PresignedUrlConfig

-- | Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPresignedUrlConfig</a> smart constructor.
data PresignedUrlConfig
PresignedUrlConfig' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> PresignedUrlConfig

-- | How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 -
--   3600, the default value is 3600 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated
--   when Jobs receives an MQTT request for the job document.
[$sel:expiresInSec:PresignedUrlConfig'] :: PresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | The ARN of an IAM role that grants grants permission to download files
--   from the S3 bucket where the job data/updates are stored. The role
--   must also grant permission for IoT to download the files.
[$sel:roleArn:PresignedUrlConfig'] :: PresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PresignedUrlConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiresInSec:PresignedUrlConfig'</a>,
--   <a>presignedUrlConfig_expiresInSec</a> - How long (in seconds)
--   pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 - 3600, the default
--   value is 3600 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated when Jobs
--   receives an MQTT request for the job document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:PresignedUrlConfig'</a>,
--   <a>presignedUrlConfig_roleArn</a> - The ARN of an IAM role that grants
--   grants permission to download files from the S3 bucket where the job
--   data/updates are stored. The role must also grant permission for IoT
--   to download the files.
newPresignedUrlConfig :: PresignedUrlConfig

-- | How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 -
--   3600, the default value is 3600 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated
--   when Jobs receives an MQTT request for the job document.
presignedUrlConfig_expiresInSec :: Lens' PresignedUrlConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ARN of an IAM role that grants grants permission to download files
--   from the S3 bucket where the job data/updates are stored. The role
--   must also grant permission for IoT to download the files.
presignedUrlConfig_roleArn :: Lens' PresignedUrlConfig (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PresignedUrlConfig.PresignedUrlConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PresignedUrlConfig.PresignedUrlConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PresignedUrlConfig.PresignedUrlConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PresignedUrlConfig.PresignedUrlConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PresignedUrlConfig.PresignedUrlConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PresignedUrlConfig.PresignedUrlConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PresignedUrlConfig.PresignedUrlConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PresignedUrlConfig.PresignedUrlConfig

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ProvisioningHook

-- | Structure that contains <tt>payloadVersion</tt> and
--   <tt>targetArn</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisioningHook</a> smart constructor.
data ProvisioningHook
ProvisioningHook' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ProvisioningHook

-- | The payload that was sent to the target function.
--   
--   <i>Note:</i> Only Lambda functions are currently supported.
[$sel:payloadVersion:ProvisioningHook'] :: ProvisioningHook -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the target function.
--   
--   <i>Note:</i> Only Lambda functions are currently supported.
[$sel:targetArn:ProvisioningHook'] :: ProvisioningHook -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisioningHook</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:payloadVersion:ProvisioningHook'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningHook_payloadVersion</a> - The payload that was sent to
--   the target function.
--   
--   <i>Note:</i> Only Lambda functions are currently supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetArn:ProvisioningHook'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningHook_targetArn</a> - The ARN of the target function.
--   
--   <i>Note:</i> Only Lambda functions are currently supported.
newProvisioningHook :: Text -> ProvisioningHook

-- | The payload that was sent to the target function.
--   
--   <i>Note:</i> Only Lambda functions are currently supported.
provisioningHook_payloadVersion :: Lens' ProvisioningHook (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the target function.
--   
--   <i>Note:</i> Only Lambda functions are currently supported.
provisioningHook_targetArn :: Lens' ProvisioningHook Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ProvisioningHook.ProvisioningHook
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ProvisioningHook.ProvisioningHook
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ProvisioningHook.ProvisioningHook
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ProvisioningHook.ProvisioningHook
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ProvisioningHook.ProvisioningHook
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ProvisioningHook.ProvisioningHook
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ProvisioningHook.ProvisioningHook
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ProvisioningHook.ProvisioningHook


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ProvisioningTemplateSummary

-- | A summary of information about a fleet provisioning template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisioningTemplateSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ProvisioningTemplateSummary
ProvisioningTemplateSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ProvisioningTemplateSummary

-- | The date when the fleet provisioning template summary was last
--   modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'] :: ProvisioningTemplateSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the fleet provisioning template.
[$sel:templateName:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'] :: ProvisioningTemplateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | True if the fleet provision template is enabled, otherwise false.
[$sel:enabled:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'] :: ProvisioningTemplateSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date when the fleet provisioning template summary was created.
[$sel:creationDate:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'] :: ProvisioningTemplateSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ARN of the fleet provisioning template.
[$sel:templateArn:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'] :: ProvisioningTemplateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the fleet provisioning template.
[$sel:description:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'] :: ProvisioningTemplateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisioningTemplateSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningTemplateSummary_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date when
--   the fleet provisioning template summary was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningTemplateSummary_templateName</a> - The name of the
--   fleet provisioning template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningTemplateSummary_enabled</a> - True if the fleet
--   provision template is enabled, otherwise false.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningTemplateSummary_creationDate</a> - The date when the
--   fleet provisioning template summary was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateArn:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningTemplateSummary_templateArn</a> - The ARN of the fleet
--   provisioning template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ProvisioningTemplateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>provisioningTemplateSummary_description</a> - The description of
--   the fleet provisioning template.
newProvisioningTemplateSummary :: ProvisioningTemplateSummary

-- | The date when the fleet provisioning template summary was last
--   modified.
provisioningTemplateSummary_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' ProvisioningTemplateSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the fleet provisioning template.
provisioningTemplateSummary_templateName :: Lens' ProvisioningTemplateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | True if the fleet provision template is enabled, otherwise false.
provisioningTemplateSummary_enabled :: Lens' ProvisioningTemplateSummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date when the fleet provisioning template summary was created.
provisioningTemplateSummary_creationDate :: Lens' ProvisioningTemplateSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the fleet provisioning template.
provisioningTemplateSummary_templateArn :: Lens' ProvisioningTemplateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the fleet provisioning template.
provisioningTemplateSummary_description :: Lens' ProvisioningTemplateSummary (Maybe Text)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ProvisioningTemplateSummary.ProvisioningTemplateSummary

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | An asset property value entry containing the following information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutAssetPropertyValueEntry</a> smart constructor.
data PutAssetPropertyValueEntry
PutAssetPropertyValueEntry' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NonEmpty AssetPropertyValue -> PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | Optional. A unique identifier for this entry that you can define to
--   better track which message caused an error in case of failure. Accepts
--   substitution templates. Defaults to a new UUID.
[$sel:entryId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the property alias associated with your asset property.
--   You must specify either a <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an
--   <tt>aliasId</tt> and a <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
[$sel:propertyAlias:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset's property. You must specify either a
--   <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an <tt>aliasId</tt> and a
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution templates.
[$sel:propertyId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the IoT SiteWise asset. You must specify either a
--   <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an <tt>aliasId</tt> and a
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution templates.
[$sel:assetId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of property values to insert that each contain timestamp,
--   quality, and value (TQV) information.
[$sel:propertyValues:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> NonEmpty AssetPropertyValue

-- | Create a value of <a>PutAssetPropertyValueEntry</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:entryId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_entryId</a> - Optional. A unique
--   identifier for this entry that you can define to better track which
--   message caused an error in case of failure. Accepts substitution
--   templates. Defaults to a new UUID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyAlias:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyAlias</a> - The name of the
--   property alias associated with your asset property. You must specify
--   either a <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an <tt>aliasId</tt> and a
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyId</a> - The ID of the asset's
--   property. You must specify either a <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an
--   <tt>aliasId</tt> and a <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_assetId</a> - The ID of the IoT SiteWise
--   asset. You must specify either a <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an
--   <tt>aliasId</tt> and a <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyValues:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyValues</a> - A list of property
--   values to insert that each contain timestamp, quality, and value (TQV)
--   information.
newPutAssetPropertyValueEntry :: NonEmpty AssetPropertyValue -> PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | Optional. A unique identifier for this entry that you can define to
--   better track which message caused an error in case of failure. Accepts
--   substitution templates. Defaults to a new UUID.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_entryId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the property alias associated with your asset property.
--   You must specify either a <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an
--   <tt>aliasId</tt> and a <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyAlias :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset's property. You must specify either a
--   <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an <tt>aliasId</tt> and a
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution templates.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the IoT SiteWise asset. You must specify either a
--   <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an <tt>aliasId</tt> and a
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution templates.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_assetId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

--   quality, and value (TQV) information.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyValues :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (NonEmpty AssetPropertyValue)

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.IotSiteWiseAction

-- | Describes an action to send data from an MQTT message that triggered
--   the rule to IoT SiteWise asset properties.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIotSiteWiseAction</a> smart constructor.
data IotSiteWiseAction
IotSiteWiseAction' :: NonEmpty PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Text -> IotSiteWiseAction

-- | A list of asset property value entries.
[$sel:putAssetPropertyValueEntries:IotSiteWiseAction'] :: IotSiteWiseAction -> NonEmpty PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an asset
--   property value to IoT SiteWise. (<tt>"Action":
--   "iotsitewise:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue"</tt>). The trust policy can
--   restrict access to specific asset hierarchy paths.
[$sel:roleArn:IotSiteWiseAction'] :: IotSiteWiseAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IotSiteWiseAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:putAssetPropertyValueEntries:IotSiteWiseAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotSiteWiseAction_putAssetPropertyValueEntries</a> - A list of
--   asset property value entries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:IotSiteWiseAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotSiteWiseAction_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the role that grants IoT
--   permission to send an asset property value to IoT SiteWise.
--   (<tt>"Action": "iotsitewise:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue"</tt>). The
--   trust policy can restrict access to specific asset hierarchy paths.
newIotSiteWiseAction :: NonEmpty PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Text -> IotSiteWiseAction

-- | A list of asset property value entries.
iotSiteWiseAction_putAssetPropertyValueEntries :: Lens' IotSiteWiseAction (NonEmpty PutAssetPropertyValueEntry)

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an asset
--   property value to IoT SiteWise. (<tt>"Action":
--   "iotsitewise:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue"</tt>). The trust policy can
--   restrict access to specific asset hierarchy paths.
iotSiteWiseAction_roleArn :: Lens' IotSiteWiseAction Text

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBv2Action

-- | Describes an action to write to a DynamoDB table.
--   
--   This DynamoDB action writes each attribute in the message payload into
--   it's own column in the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDynamoDBv2Action</a> smart constructor.
data DynamoDBv2Action
DynamoDBv2Action' :: Text -> PutItemInput -> DynamoDBv2Action

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
[$sel:roleArn:DynamoDBv2Action'] :: DynamoDBv2Action -> Text

-- | Specifies the DynamoDB table to which the message data will be
--   written. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "dynamoDBv2": { "roleArn": "aws:iam:12341251:my-role" "putItem": { "tableName": "my-table" } } }
--   </pre>
--   
--   Each attribute in the message payload will be written to a separate
--   column in the DynamoDB database.
[$sel:putItem:DynamoDBv2Action'] :: DynamoDBv2Action -> PutItemInput

-- | Create a value of <a>DynamoDBv2Action</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:DynamoDBv2Action'</a>, <a>dynamoDBv2Action_roleArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:putItem:DynamoDBv2Action'</a>, <a>dynamoDBv2Action_putItem</a>
--   - Specifies the DynamoDB table to which the message data will be
--   written. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "dynamoDBv2": { "roleArn": "aws:iam:12341251:my-role" "putItem": { "tableName": "my-table" } } }
--   </pre>
--   
--   Each attribute in the message payload will be written to a separate
--   column in the DynamoDB database.
newDynamoDBv2Action :: Text -> PutItemInput -> DynamoDBv2Action

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
dynamoDBv2Action_roleArn :: Lens' DynamoDBv2Action Text

-- | Specifies the DynamoDB table to which the message data will be
--   written. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "dynamoDBv2": { "roleArn": "aws:iam:12341251:my-role" "putItem": { "tableName": "my-table" } } }
--   </pre>
--   
--   Each attribute in the message payload will be written to a separate
--   column in the DynamoDB database.
dynamoDBv2Action_putItem :: Lens' DynamoDBv2Action PutItemInput
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBv2Action.DynamoDBv2Action
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBv2Action.DynamoDBv2Action
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBv2Action.DynamoDBv2Action
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBv2Action.DynamoDBv2Action
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBv2Action.DynamoDBv2Action
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBv2Action.DynamoDBv2Action
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBv2Action.DynamoDBv2Action
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DynamoDBv2Action.DynamoDBv2Action


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RateIncreaseCriteria

-- | Allows you to define a criteria to initiate the increase in rate of
--   rollout for a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRateIncreaseCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data RateIncreaseCriteria
RateIncreaseCriteria' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> RateIncreaseCriteria

-- | The threshold for number of notified things that will initiate the
--   increase in rate of rollout.
[$sel:numberOfNotifiedThings:RateIncreaseCriteria'] :: RateIncreaseCriteria -> Maybe Natural

-- | The threshold for number of succeeded things that will initiate the
--   increase in rate of rollout.
[$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:RateIncreaseCriteria'] :: RateIncreaseCriteria -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>RateIncreaseCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfNotifiedThings:RateIncreaseCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>rateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfNotifiedThings</a> - The threshold for
--   number of notified things that will initiate the increase in rate of
--   rollout.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:RateIncreaseCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>rateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfSucceededThings</a> - The threshold
--   for number of succeeded things that will initiate the increase in rate
--   of rollout.
newRateIncreaseCriteria :: RateIncreaseCriteria

-- | The threshold for number of notified things that will initiate the
--   increase in rate of rollout.
rateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfNotifiedThings :: Lens' RateIncreaseCriteria (Maybe Natural)

-- | The threshold for number of succeeded things that will initiate the
--   increase in rate of rollout.
rateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfSucceededThings :: Lens' RateIncreaseCriteria (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RateIncreaseCriteria.RateIncreaseCriteria
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RateIncreaseCriteria.RateIncreaseCriteria
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RateIncreaseCriteria.RateIncreaseCriteria
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RateIncreaseCriteria.RateIncreaseCriteria
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RateIncreaseCriteria.RateIncreaseCriteria
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RateIncreaseCriteria.RateIncreaseCriteria
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RateIncreaseCriteria.RateIncreaseCriteria
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RateIncreaseCriteria.RateIncreaseCriteria


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExponentialRolloutRate

-- | Allows you to create an exponential rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExponentialRolloutRate</a> smart constructor.
data ExponentialRolloutRate
ExponentialRolloutRate' :: Natural -> Double -> RateIncreaseCriteria -> ExponentialRolloutRate

-- | The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute at the start of job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define the initial rate of rollout.
[$sel:baseRatePerMinute:ExponentialRolloutRate'] :: ExponentialRolloutRate -> Natural

-- | The exponential factor to increase the rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
[$sel:incrementFactor:ExponentialRolloutRate'] :: ExponentialRolloutRate -> Double

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
[$sel:rateIncreaseCriteria:ExponentialRolloutRate'] :: ExponentialRolloutRate -> RateIncreaseCriteria

-- | Create a value of <a>ExponentialRolloutRate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseRatePerMinute:ExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>exponentialRolloutRate_baseRatePerMinute</a> - The minimum number
--   of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute at the
--   start of job rollout. This parameter allows you to define the initial
--   rate of rollout.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incrementFactor:ExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>exponentialRolloutRate_incrementFactor</a> - The exponential factor
--   to increase the rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateIncreaseCriteria:ExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>exponentialRolloutRate_rateIncreaseCriteria</a> - The criteria to
--   initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
newExponentialRolloutRate :: Natural -> Double -> RateIncreaseCriteria -> ExponentialRolloutRate

-- | The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute at the start of job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define the initial rate of rollout.
exponentialRolloutRate_baseRatePerMinute :: Lens' ExponentialRolloutRate Natural

-- | The exponential factor to increase the rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
exponentialRolloutRate_incrementFactor :: Lens' ExponentialRolloutRate Double

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
exponentialRolloutRate_rateIncreaseCriteria :: Lens' ExponentialRolloutRate RateIncreaseCriteria
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExponentialRolloutRate.ExponentialRolloutRate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExponentialRolloutRate.ExponentialRolloutRate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExponentialRolloutRate.ExponentialRolloutRate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExponentialRolloutRate.ExponentialRolloutRate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExponentialRolloutRate.ExponentialRolloutRate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExponentialRolloutRate.ExponentialRolloutRate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExponentialRolloutRate.ExponentialRolloutRate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ExponentialRolloutRate.ExponentialRolloutRate

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecutionsRolloutConfig
JobExecutionsRolloutConfig' :: Maybe ExponentialRolloutRate -> Maybe Natural -> JobExecutionsRolloutConfig

--   define an exponential rate for a job rollout.
[$sel:exponentialRate:JobExecutionsRolloutConfig'] :: JobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe ExponentialRolloutRate

--   exponential rate for a job rollout.

--   <a>jobExecutionsRolloutConfig_maximumPerMinute</a> - The maximum
--   number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute.
--   This parameter allows you to create a staged rollout.
newJobExecutionsRolloutConfig :: JobExecutionsRolloutConfig

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RepublishAction

-- | Describes an action to republish to another topic.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRepublishAction</a> smart constructor.
data RepublishAction
RepublishAction' :: Maybe Natural -> Text -> Text -> RepublishAction

-- | The Quality of Service (QoS) level to use when republishing messages.
--   The default value is 0.
[$sel:qos:RepublishAction'] :: RepublishAction -> Maybe Natural

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.
[$sel:roleArn:RepublishAction'] :: RepublishAction -> Text

-- | The name of the MQTT topic.

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:qos:RepublishAction'</a>, <a>republishAction_qos</a> - The
--   Quality of Service (QoS) level to use when republishing messages. The
--   default value is 0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:RepublishAction'</a>, <a>republishAction_roleArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:RepublishAction'</a>, <a>republishAction_topic</a> - The
--   name of the MQTT topic.
newRepublishAction :: Text -> Text -> RepublishAction

-- | The Quality of Service (QoS) level to use when republishing messages.
--   The default value is 0.
republishAction_qos :: Lens' RepublishAction (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.
republishAction_roleArn :: Lens' RepublishAction Text

-- | The name of the MQTT topic.

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ResourceIdentifier

-- | Information that identifies the noncompliant resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceIdentifier</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceIdentifier
ResourceIdentifier' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PolicyVersionIdentifier -> Maybe Text -> ResourceIdentifier

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that has overly permissive actions.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:ResourceIdentifier'] :: ResourceIdentifier -> Maybe Text

-- | The client ID.
[$sel:clientId:ResourceIdentifier'] :: ResourceIdentifier -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the role alias that has overly permissive actions.
[$sel:roleAliasArn:ResourceIdentifier'] :: ResourceIdentifier -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the CA certificate used to authorize the certificate.
[$sel:caCertificateId:ResourceIdentifier'] :: ResourceIdentifier -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the certificate attached to the resource.
[$sel:deviceCertificateId:ResourceIdentifier'] :: ResourceIdentifier -> Maybe Text

-- | The account with which the resource is associated.
[$sel:account:ResourceIdentifier'] :: ResourceIdentifier -> Maybe Text

-- | The version of the policy associated with the resource.
[$sel:policyVersionIdentifier:ResourceIdentifier'] :: ResourceIdentifier -> Maybe PolicyVersionIdentifier

-- | The ID of the Amazon Cognito identity pool.
[$sel:cognitoIdentityPoolId:ResourceIdentifier'] :: ResourceIdentifier -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceIdentifier</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:ResourceIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>resourceIdentifier_iamRoleArn</a> - The ARN of the IAM role that
--   has overly permissive actions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientId:ResourceIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>resourceIdentifier_clientId</a> - The client ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleAliasArn:ResourceIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>resourceIdentifier_roleAliasArn</a> - The ARN of the role alias
--   that has overly permissive actions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:caCertificateId:ResourceIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>resourceIdentifier_caCertificateId</a> - The ID of the CA
--   certificate used to authorize the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceCertificateId:ResourceIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>resourceIdentifier_deviceCertificateId</a> - The ID of the
--   certificate attached to the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:account:ResourceIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>resourceIdentifier_account</a> - The account with which the
--   resource is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyVersionIdentifier:ResourceIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>resourceIdentifier_policyVersionIdentifier</a> - The version of the
--   policy associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cognitoIdentityPoolId:ResourceIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>resourceIdentifier_cognitoIdentityPoolId</a> - The ID of the Amazon
--   Cognito identity pool.
newResourceIdentifier :: ResourceIdentifier

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that has overly permissive actions.
resourceIdentifier_iamRoleArn :: Lens' ResourceIdentifier (Maybe Text)

-- | The client ID.
resourceIdentifier_clientId :: Lens' ResourceIdentifier (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the role alias that has overly permissive actions.
resourceIdentifier_roleAliasArn :: Lens' ResourceIdentifier (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the CA certificate used to authorize the certificate.
resourceIdentifier_caCertificateId :: Lens' ResourceIdentifier (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the certificate attached to the resource.
resourceIdentifier_deviceCertificateId :: Lens' ResourceIdentifier (Maybe Text)

-- | The account with which the resource is associated.
resourceIdentifier_account :: Lens' ResourceIdentifier (Maybe Text)

-- | The version of the policy associated with the resource.
resourceIdentifier_policyVersionIdentifier :: Lens' ResourceIdentifier (Maybe PolicyVersionIdentifier)

-- | The ID of the Amazon Cognito identity pool.
resourceIdentifier_cognitoIdentityPoolId :: Lens' ResourceIdentifier (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditSuppression

-- | Filters out specific findings of a Device Defender audit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditSuppression</a> smart constructor.
data AuditSuppression
AuditSuppression' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ResourceIdentifier -> AuditSuppression

-- | The expiration date (epoch timestamp in seconds) that you want the
--   suppression to adhere to.
[$sel:expirationDate:AuditSuppression'] :: AuditSuppression -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Indicates whether a suppression should exist indefinitely or not.
[$sel:suppressIndefinitely:AuditSuppression'] :: AuditSuppression -> Maybe Bool

-- | The description of the audit suppression.
[$sel:description:AuditSuppression'] :: AuditSuppression -> Maybe Text
[$sel:checkName:AuditSuppression'] :: AuditSuppression -> Text
[$sel:resourceIdentifier:AuditSuppression'] :: AuditSuppression -> ResourceIdentifier

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditSuppression</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expirationDate:AuditSuppression'</a>,
--   <a>auditSuppression_expirationDate</a> - The expiration date (epoch
--   timestamp in seconds) that you want the suppression to adhere to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressIndefinitely:AuditSuppression'</a>,
--   <a>auditSuppression_suppressIndefinitely</a> - Indicates whether a
--   suppression should exist indefinitely or not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:AuditSuppression'</a>,
--   <a>auditSuppression_description</a> - The description of the audit
--   suppression.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkName:AuditSuppression'</a>,
--   <a>auditSuppression_checkName</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceIdentifier:AuditSuppression'</a>,
--   <a>auditSuppression_resourceIdentifier</a> - Undocumented member.
newAuditSuppression :: Text -> ResourceIdentifier -> AuditSuppression

-- | The expiration date (epoch timestamp in seconds) that you want the
--   suppression to adhere to.
auditSuppression_expirationDate :: Lens' AuditSuppression (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indicates whether a suppression should exist indefinitely or not.
auditSuppression_suppressIndefinitely :: Lens' AuditSuppression (Maybe Bool)

-- | The description of the audit suppression.
auditSuppression_description :: Lens' AuditSuppression (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
auditSuppression_checkName :: Lens' AuditSuppression Text

-- | Undocumented member.
auditSuppression_resourceIdentifier :: Lens' AuditSuppression ResourceIdentifier
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditSuppression.AuditSuppression
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditSuppression.AuditSuppression
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditSuppression.AuditSuppression
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditSuppression.AuditSuppression
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditSuppression.AuditSuppression

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditSuppression.AuditSuppression

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RelatedResource

-- | Information about a related resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRelatedResource</a> smart constructor.
data RelatedResource
RelatedResource' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe ResourceIdentifier -> RelatedResource

-- | Other information about the resource.
[$sel:additionalInfo:RelatedResource'] :: RelatedResource -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The type of resource.
[$sel:resourceType:RelatedResource'] :: RelatedResource -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | Information that identifies the resource.
[$sel:resourceIdentifier:RelatedResource'] :: RelatedResource -> Maybe ResourceIdentifier

-- | Create a value of <a>RelatedResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalInfo:RelatedResource'</a>,
--   <a>relatedResource_additionalInfo</a> - Other information about the
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:RelatedResource'</a>,
--   <a>relatedResource_resourceType</a> - The type of resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceIdentifier:RelatedResource'</a>,
--   <a>relatedResource_resourceIdentifier</a> - Information that
--   identifies the resource.
newRelatedResource :: RelatedResource

-- | Other information about the resource.
relatedResource_additionalInfo :: Lens' RelatedResource (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The type of resource.
relatedResource_resourceType :: Lens' RelatedResource (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | Information that identifies the resource.
relatedResource_resourceIdentifier :: Lens' RelatedResource (Maybe ResourceIdentifier)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RelatedResource.RelatedResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RelatedResource.RelatedResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RelatedResource.RelatedResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RelatedResource.RelatedResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RelatedResource.RelatedResource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RelatedResource.RelatedResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.RelatedResource.RelatedResource


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.NonCompliantResource

-- | Information about the resource that was noncompliant with the audit
--   check.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNonCompliantResource</a> smart constructor.
data NonCompliantResource

--   the noncompliant resource.

--   noncompliant resource.

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditFinding

-- | The findings (results) of the audit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditFinding</a> smart constructor.
data AuditFinding
AuditFinding' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuditFindingSeverity -> Maybe [RelatedResource] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe NonCompliantResource -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AuditFinding

-- | Indicates whether the audit finding was suppressed or not during
--   reporting.
[$sel:isSuppressed:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ID of the audit that generated this result (finding).
[$sel:taskId:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Text

-- | The time the result (finding) was discovered.
[$sel:findingTime:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time the audit started.
[$sel:taskStartTime:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A code that indicates the reason that the resource was noncompliant.
[$sel:reasonForNonComplianceCode:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Text

-- | The severity of the result (finding).
[$sel:severity:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe AuditFindingSeverity

-- | The list of related resources.
[$sel:relatedResources:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe [RelatedResource]

-- | The audit check that generated this result.
[$sel:checkName:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource that was found to be noncompliant with the audit check.
[$sel:nonCompliantResource:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe NonCompliantResource

-- | The reason the resource was noncompliant.
[$sel:reasonForNonCompliance:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for this set of audit findings. This identifier is
--   used to apply mitigation tasks to one or more sets of findings.
[$sel:findingId:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditFinding</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isSuppressed:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_isSuppressed</a> - Indicates whether the audit finding
--   was suppressed or not during reporting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskId:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_taskId</a> - The ID
--   of the audit that generated this result (finding).
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingTime:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_findingTime</a>
--   - The time the result (finding) was discovered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStartTime:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_taskStartTime</a> - The time the audit started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonForNonComplianceCode:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_reasonForNonComplianceCode</a> - A code that indicates
--   the reason that the resource was noncompliant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_severity</a> - The
--   severity of the result (finding).
--   
--   <a>$sel:relatedResources:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_relatedResources</a> - The list of related resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkName:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_checkName</a> -
--   The audit check that generated this result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nonCompliantResource:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_nonCompliantResource</a> - The resource that was found
--   to be noncompliant with the audit check.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonForNonCompliance:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_reasonForNonCompliance</a> - The reason the resource
--   was noncompliant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingId:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_findingId</a> - A
--   unique identifier for this set of audit findings. This identifier is
--   used to apply mitigation tasks to one or more sets of findings.
newAuditFinding :: AuditFinding

-- | Indicates whether the audit finding was suppressed or not during
--   reporting.
auditFinding_isSuppressed :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ID of the audit that generated this result (finding).
auditFinding_taskId :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the result (finding) was discovered.
auditFinding_findingTime :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time the audit started.
auditFinding_taskStartTime :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A code that indicates the reason that the resource was noncompliant.
auditFinding_reasonForNonComplianceCode :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Text)

-- | The severity of the result (finding).
auditFinding_severity :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe AuditFindingSeverity)

-- | The list of related resources.
auditFinding_relatedResources :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe [RelatedResource])

-- | The audit check that generated this result.
auditFinding_checkName :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Text)

-- | The resource that was found to be noncompliant with the audit check.
auditFinding_nonCompliantResource :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe NonCompliantResource)

-- | The reason the resource was noncompliant.
auditFinding_reasonForNonCompliance :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for this set of audit findings. This identifier is
--   used to apply mitigation tasks to one or more sets of findings.
auditFinding_findingId :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditFinding.AuditFinding
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditFinding.AuditFinding
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditFinding.AuditFinding
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditFinding.AuditFinding
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditFinding.AuditFinding
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditFinding.AuditFinding
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.AuditFinding.AuditFinding

[$sel:roleAliasArn:RoleAliasDescription'] :: RoleAliasDescription -> Maybe Text

[$sel:lastModifiedDate:RoleAliasDescription'] :: RoleAliasDescription -> Maybe POSIX

[$sel:roleAlias:RoleAliasDescription'] :: RoleAliasDescription -> Maybe Text

[$sel:owner:RoleAliasDescription'] :: RoleAliasDescription -> Maybe Text

[$sel:creationDate:RoleAliasDescription'] :: RoleAliasDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The number of seconds for which the credential is valid.
[$sel:credentialDurationSeconds:RoleAliasDescription'] :: RoleAliasDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | The role ARN.
[$sel:roleArn:RoleAliasDescription'] :: RoleAliasDescription -> Maybe Text

--   omitted.

--   when the role alias was last modified.

--   <a>roleAliasDescription_owner</a> - The role alias owner.

--   <a>$sel:credentialDurationSeconds:RoleAliasDescription'</a>,

--   seconds for which the credential is valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:RoleAliasDescription'</a>,
--   <a>roleAliasDescription_roleArn</a> - The role ARN.
newRoleAliasDescription :: RoleAliasDescription

roleAliasDescription_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' RoleAliasDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

roleAliasDescription_roleAlias :: Lens' RoleAliasDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The role alias owner.
roleAliasDescription_owner :: Lens' RoleAliasDescription (Maybe Text)

roleAliasDescription_creationDate :: Lens' RoleAliasDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The number of seconds for which the credential is valid.

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.S3Action

-- | Describes an action to write data to an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Action</a> smart constructor.
data S3Action
S3Action' :: Maybe CannedAccessControlList -> Text -> Text -> Text -> S3Action

-- | The Amazon S3 canned ACL that controls access to the object identified
--   by the object key. For more information, see <a>S3 canned ACLs</a>.
[$sel:cannedAcl:S3Action'] :: S3Action -> Maybe CannedAccessControlList

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.
[$sel:roleArn:S3Action'] :: S3Action -> Text

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket.
[$sel:bucketName:S3Action'] :: S3Action -> Text

-- | The object key. For more information, see <a>Actions, resources, and
--   condition keys for Amazon S3</a>.
[$sel:key:S3Action'] :: S3Action -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Action</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cannedAcl:S3Action'</a>, <a>s3Action_cannedAcl</a> - The
--   Amazon S3 canned ACL that controls access to the object identified by
--   the object key. For more information, see <a>S3 canned ACLs</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:S3Action'</a>, <a>s3Action_roleArn</a> - The ARN of
--   the IAM role that grants access.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:S3Action'</a>, <a>s3Action_bucketName</a> - The
--   Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:S3Action'</a>, <a>s3Action_key</a> - The object key. For
--   more information, see <a>Actions, resources, and condition keys for
--   Amazon S3</a>.
newS3Action :: Text -> Text -> Text -> S3Action

-- | The Amazon S3 canned ACL that controls access to the object identified
--   by the object key. For more information, see <a>S3 canned ACLs</a>.
s3Action_cannedAcl :: Lens' S3Action (Maybe CannedAccessControlList)

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.
s3Action_roleArn :: Lens' S3Action Text

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket.
s3Action_bucketName :: Lens' S3Action Text

-- | The object key. For more information, see <a>Actions, resources, and
--   condition keys for Amazon S3</a>.
s3Action_key :: Lens' S3Action Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.S3Action.S3Action
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.S3Action.S3Action

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SalesforceAction

-- | Describes an action to write a message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input
--   Stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSalesforceAction</a> smart constructor.
data SalesforceAction
SalesforceAction' :: Text -> Text -> SalesforceAction

-- | The token used to authenticate access to the Salesforce IoT Cloud
--   Input Stream. The token is available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud
--   platform after creation of the Input Stream.
[$sel:token:SalesforceAction'] :: SalesforceAction -> Text

-- | The URL exposed by the Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream. The URL is
--   available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud platform after creation of the
--   Input Stream.
[$sel:url:SalesforceAction'] :: SalesforceAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SalesforceAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:token:SalesforceAction'</a>, <a>salesforceAction_token</a> -
--   The token used to authenticate access to the Salesforce IoT Cloud
--   Input Stream. The token is available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud
--   platform after creation of the Input Stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:SalesforceAction'</a>, <a>salesforceAction_url</a> - The
--   URL exposed by the Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream. The URL is
--   available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud platform after creation of the
--   Input Stream.
newSalesforceAction :: Text -> Text -> SalesforceAction

-- | The token used to authenticate access to the Salesforce IoT Cloud
--   Input Stream. The token is available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud
--   platform after creation of the Input Stream.
salesforceAction_token :: Lens' SalesforceAction Text

-- | The URL exposed by the Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream. The URL is
--   available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud platform after creation of the
--   Input Stream.
salesforceAction_url :: Lens' SalesforceAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SalesforceAction.SalesforceAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SalesforceAction.SalesforceAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SalesforceAction.SalesforceAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SalesforceAction.SalesforceAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SalesforceAction.SalesforceAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SalesforceAction.SalesforceAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SalesforceAction.SalesforceAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SalesforceAction.SalesforceAction


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ScheduledAuditMetadata

-- | Information about the scheduled audit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduledAuditMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduledAuditMetadata
ScheduledAuditMetadata' :: Maybe AuditFrequency -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DayOfWeek -> Maybe Text -> ScheduledAuditMetadata

-- | How often the scheduled audit occurs.
[$sel:frequency:ScheduledAuditMetadata'] :: ScheduledAuditMetadata -> Maybe AuditFrequency

-- | The name of the scheduled audit.
[$sel:scheduledAuditName:ScheduledAuditMetadata'] :: ScheduledAuditMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit is run (if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> is "MONTHLY"). If days 29-31 are specified, and the
--   month does not have that many days, the audit takes place on the
--   "LAST" day of the month.
[$sel:dayOfMonth:ScheduledAuditMetadata'] :: ScheduledAuditMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The day of the week on which the scheduled audit is run (if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> is "WEEKLY" or "BIWEEKLY").
[$sel:dayOfWeek:ScheduledAuditMetadata'] :: ScheduledAuditMetadata -> Maybe DayOfWeek

-- | The ARN of the scheduled audit.
[$sel:scheduledAuditArn:ScheduledAuditMetadata'] :: ScheduledAuditMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduledAuditMetadata</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:frequency:ScheduledAuditMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAuditMetadata_frequency</a> - How often the scheduled
--   audit occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditName:ScheduledAuditMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAuditMetadata_scheduledAuditName</a> - The name of the
--   scheduled audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfMonth:ScheduledAuditMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAuditMetadata_dayOfMonth</a> - The day of the month on
--   which the scheduled audit is run (if the <tt>frequency</tt> is
--   "MONTHLY"). If days 29-31 are specified, and the month does not have
--   that many days, the audit takes place on the "LAST" day of the month.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfWeek:ScheduledAuditMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAuditMetadata_dayOfWeek</a> - The day of the week on which
--   the scheduled audit is run (if the <tt>frequency</tt> is "WEEKLY" or
--   "BIWEEKLY").
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditArn:ScheduledAuditMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAuditMetadata_scheduledAuditArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   scheduled audit.
newScheduledAuditMetadata :: ScheduledAuditMetadata

-- | How often the scheduled audit occurs.
scheduledAuditMetadata_frequency :: Lens' ScheduledAuditMetadata (Maybe AuditFrequency)

-- | The name of the scheduled audit.
scheduledAuditMetadata_scheduledAuditName :: Lens' ScheduledAuditMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit is run (if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> is "MONTHLY"). If days 29-31 are specified, and the
--   month does not have that many days, the audit takes place on the
--   "LAST" day of the month.
scheduledAuditMetadata_dayOfMonth :: Lens' ScheduledAuditMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The day of the week on which the scheduled audit is run (if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> is "WEEKLY" or "BIWEEKLY").
scheduledAuditMetadata_dayOfWeek :: Lens' ScheduledAuditMetadata (Maybe DayOfWeek)

-- | The ARN of the scheduled audit.
scheduledAuditMetadata_scheduledAuditArn :: Lens' ScheduledAuditMetadata (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ScheduledAuditMetadata.ScheduledAuditMetadata
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ScheduledAuditMetadata.ScheduledAuditMetadata
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ScheduledAuditMetadata.ScheduledAuditMetadata
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ScheduledAuditMetadata.ScheduledAuditMetadata
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ScheduledAuditMetadata.ScheduledAuditMetadata
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ScheduledAuditMetadata.ScheduledAuditMetadata
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ScheduledAuditMetadata.ScheduledAuditMetadata

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DomainConfigurationSummary

-- | The summary of a domain configuration. A domain configuration
--   specifies custom IoT-specific information about a domain. A domain
--   configuration can be associated with an Amazon Web Services-managed
--   domain (for example, dbc123defghijk.iot.us-west-2.amazonaws.com), a
--   customer managed domain, or a default endpoint.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Data</li>
--   <li>Jobs</li>
--   <li>CredentialProvider</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainConfigurationSummary</a> smart constructor.
data DomainConfigurationSummary
DomainConfigurationSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServiceType -> DomainConfigurationSummary

-- | The name of the domain configuration. This value must be unique to a
--   region.
[$sel:domainConfigurationName:DomainConfigurationSummary'] :: DomainConfigurationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the domain configuration.
[$sel:domainConfigurationArn:DomainConfigurationSummary'] :: DomainConfigurationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of service delivered by the endpoint.
[$sel:serviceType:DomainConfigurationSummary'] :: DomainConfigurationSummary -> Maybe ServiceType

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainConfigurationSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainConfigurationName:DomainConfigurationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>domainConfigurationSummary_domainConfigurationName</a> - The name
--   of the domain configuration. This value must be unique to a region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainConfigurationArn:DomainConfigurationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>domainConfigurationSummary_domainConfigurationArn</a> - The ARN of
--   the domain configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceType:DomainConfigurationSummary'</a>,
--   <a>domainConfigurationSummary_serviceType</a> - The type of service
--   delivered by the endpoint.
newDomainConfigurationSummary :: DomainConfigurationSummary

-- | The name of the domain configuration. This value must be unique to a
--   region.
domainConfigurationSummary_domainConfigurationName :: Lens' DomainConfigurationSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the domain configuration.
domainConfigurationSummary_domainConfigurationArn :: Lens' DomainConfigurationSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of service delivered by the endpoint.
domainConfigurationSummary_serviceType :: Lens' DomainConfigurationSummary (Maybe ServiceType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DomainConfigurationSummary.DomainConfigurationSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DomainConfigurationSummary.DomainConfigurationSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DomainConfigurationSummary.DomainConfigurationSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DomainConfigurationSummary.DomainConfigurationSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DomainConfigurationSummary.DomainConfigurationSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DomainConfigurationSummary.DomainConfigurationSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DomainConfigurationSummary.DomainConfigurationSummary


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SigV4Authorization

-- | For more information, see <a>Signature Version 4 signing process</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSigV4Authorization</a> smart constructor.
data SigV4Authorization

[$sel:signingRegion:SigV4Authorization'] :: SigV4Authorization -> Text

-- | The service name to use while signing with Sig V4.
[$sel:serviceName:SigV4Authorization'] :: SigV4Authorization -> Text

[$sel:roleArn:SigV4Authorization'] :: SigV4Authorization -> Text

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:SigV4Authorization'</a>,
--   <a>sigV4Authorization_serviceName</a> - The service name to use while
--   signing with Sig V4.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:SigV4Authorization'</a>,
--   <a>sigV4Authorization_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the signing role.
newSigV4Authorization :: Text -> Text -> Text -> SigV4Authorization

-- | The signing region.
sigV4Authorization_signingRegion :: Lens' SigV4Authorization Text

-- | The service name to use while signing with Sig V4.
sigV4Authorization_serviceName :: Lens' SigV4Authorization Text

-- | The ARN of the signing role.
sigV4Authorization_roleArn :: Lens' SigV4Authorization Text

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAuthorization

-- | The authorization method used to send messages.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpAuthorization</a> smart constructor.
data HttpAuthorization
HttpAuthorization' :: Maybe SigV4Authorization -> HttpAuthorization

-- | Use Sig V4 authorization. For more information, see <a>Signature
--   Version 4 Signing Process</a>.
[$sel:sigv4:HttpAuthorization'] :: HttpAuthorization -> Maybe SigV4Authorization

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpAuthorization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sigv4:HttpAuthorization'</a>, <a>httpAuthorization_sigv4</a> -
--   Use Sig V4 authorization. For more information, see <a>Signature
--   Version 4 Signing Process</a>.
newHttpAuthorization :: HttpAuthorization

-- | Use Sig V4 authorization. For more information, see <a>Signature
--   Version 4 Signing Process</a>.
httpAuthorization_sigv4 :: Lens' HttpAuthorization (Maybe SigV4Authorization)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAuthorization.HttpAuthorization
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAuthorization.HttpAuthorization

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAuthorization.HttpAuthorization


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAction

-- | Send data to an HTTPS endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpAction</a> smart constructor.
data HttpAction
HttpAction' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HttpAuthorization -> Maybe [HttpActionHeader] -> Text -> HttpAction

-- | The URL to which IoT sends a confirmation message. The value of the
--   confirmation URL must be a prefix of the endpoint URL. If you do not
--   specify a confirmation URL IoT uses the endpoint URL as the
--   confirmation URL. If you use substitution templates in the
--   confirmationUrl, you must create and enable topic rule destinations
--   that match each possible value of the substitution template before
--   traffic is allowed to your endpoint URL.
[$sel:confirmationUrl:HttpAction'] :: HttpAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The authentication method to use when sending data to an HTTPS
--   endpoint.
[$sel:auth:HttpAction'] :: HttpAction -> Maybe HttpAuthorization

-- | The HTTP headers to send with the message data.
[$sel:headers:HttpAction'] :: HttpAction -> Maybe [HttpActionHeader]

-- | The endpoint URL. If substitution templates are used in the URL, you
--   must also specify a <tt>confirmationUrl</tt>. If this is a new
--   destination, a new <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt> is created if
--   possible.
[$sel:url:HttpAction'] :: HttpAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpAction</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:confirmationUrl:HttpAction'</a>,
--   <a>httpAction_confirmationUrl</a> - The URL to which IoT sends a
--   confirmation message. The value of the confirmation URL must be a
--   prefix of the endpoint URL. If you do not specify a confirmation URL
--   IoT uses the endpoint URL as the confirmation URL. If you use
--   substitution templates in the confirmationUrl, you must create and
--   enable topic rule destinations that match each possible value of the
--   substitution template before traffic is allowed to your endpoint URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:auth:HttpAction'</a>, <a>httpAction_auth</a> - The
--   authentication method to use when sending data to an HTTPS endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:headers:HttpAction'</a>, <a>httpAction_headers</a> - The HTTP
--   headers to send with the message data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:HttpAction'</a>, <a>httpAction_url</a> - The endpoint URL.
--   If substitution templates are used in the URL, you must also specify a
--   <tt>confirmationUrl</tt>. If this is a new destination, a new
--   <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt> is created if possible.
newHttpAction :: Text -> HttpAction

-- | The URL to which IoT sends a confirmation message. The value of the
--   confirmation URL must be a prefix of the endpoint URL. If you do not
--   specify a confirmation URL IoT uses the endpoint URL as the
--   confirmation URL. If you use substitution templates in the
--   confirmationUrl, you must create and enable topic rule destinations
--   that match each possible value of the substitution template before
--   traffic is allowed to your endpoint URL.
httpAction_confirmationUrl :: Lens' HttpAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The authentication method to use when sending data to an HTTPS
--   endpoint.
httpAction_auth :: Lens' HttpAction (Maybe HttpAuthorization)

-- | The HTTP headers to send with the message data.
httpAction_headers :: Lens' HttpAction (Maybe [HttpActionHeader])

-- | The endpoint URL. If substitution templates are used in the URL, you
--   must also specify a <tt>confirmationUrl</tt>. If this is a new
--   destination, a new <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt> is created if
--   possible.
httpAction_url :: Lens' HttpAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAction.HttpAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAction.HttpAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAction.HttpAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAction.HttpAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAction.HttpAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAction.HttpAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAction.HttpAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.HttpAction.HttpAction
