module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SnsAction

-- | Describes an action to publish to an Amazon SNS topic.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnsAction</a> smart constructor.
data SnsAction
SnsAction' :: Maybe MessageFormat -> Text -> Text -> SnsAction

-- | (Optional) The message format of the message to publish. Accepted
--   values are "JSON" and "RAW". The default value of the attribute is
--   "RAW". SNS uses this setting to determine if the payload should be
--   parsed and relevant platform-specific bits of the payload should be
--   extracted. To read more about SNS message formats, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/json-formats.html</a>
--   refer to their official documentation.
[$sel:messageFormat:SnsAction'] :: SnsAction -> Maybe MessageFormat

-- | The ARN of the SNS topic.
[$sel:targetArn:SnsAction'] :: SnsAction -> Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.
[$sel:roleArn:SnsAction'] :: SnsAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SnsAction</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageFormat:SnsAction'</a>, <a>snsAction_messageFormat</a> -
--   (Optional) The message format of the message to publish. Accepted
--   values are "JSON" and "RAW". The default value of the attribute is
--   "RAW". SNS uses this setting to determine if the payload should be
--   parsed and relevant platform-specific bits of the payload should be
--   extracted. To read more about SNS message formats, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/json-formats.html</a>
--   refer to their official documentation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetArn:SnsAction'</a>, <a>snsAction_targetArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the SNS topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:SnsAction'</a>, <a>snsAction_roleArn</a> - The ARN of
--   the IAM role that grants access.
newSnsAction :: Text -> Text -> SnsAction

-- | (Optional) The message format of the message to publish. Accepted
--   values are "JSON" and "RAW". The default value of the attribute is
--   "RAW". SNS uses this setting to determine if the payload should be
--   parsed and relevant platform-specific bits of the payload should be
--   extracted. To read more about SNS message formats, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/json-formats.html</a>
--   refer to their official documentation.
snsAction_messageFormat :: Lens' SnsAction (Maybe MessageFormat)

-- | The ARN of the SNS topic.
snsAction_targetArn :: Lens' SnsAction Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.
snsAction_roleArn :: Lens' SnsAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SnsAction.SnsAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.SnsAction.SnsAction

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StatisticalThreshold

-- | A statistical ranking (percentile) that indicates a threshold value by
--   which a behavior is determined to be in compliance or in violation of
--   the behavior.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStatisticalThreshold</a> smart constructor.
data StatisticalThreshold
StatisticalThreshold' :: Maybe Text -> StatisticalThreshold

-- | The percentile that resolves to a threshold value by which compliance
--   with a behavior is determined. Metrics are collected over the
--   specified period (<tt>durationSeconds</tt>) from all reporting devices
--   in your account and statistical ranks are calculated. Then, the
--   measurements from a device are collected over the same period. If the
--   accumulated measurements from the device fall above or below
--   (<tt>comparisonOperator</tt>) the value associated with the percentile
--   specified, then the device is considered to be in compliance with the
--   behavior, otherwise a violation occurs.
[$sel:statistic:StatisticalThreshold'] :: StatisticalThreshold -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StatisticalThreshold</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:StatisticalThreshold'</a>,
--   <a>statisticalThreshold_statistic</a> - The percentile that resolves
--   to a threshold value by which compliance with a behavior is
--   determined. Metrics are collected over the specified period
--   (<tt>durationSeconds</tt>) from all reporting devices in your account
--   and statistical ranks are calculated. Then, the measurements from a
--   device are collected over the same period. If the accumulated
--   measurements from the device fall above or below
--   (<tt>comparisonOperator</tt>) the value associated with the percentile
--   specified, then the device is considered to be in compliance with the
--   behavior, otherwise a violation occurs.
newStatisticalThreshold :: StatisticalThreshold

-- | The percentile that resolves to a threshold value by which compliance
--   with a behavior is determined. Metrics are collected over the
--   specified period (<tt>durationSeconds</tt>) from all reporting devices
--   in your account and statistical ranks are calculated. Then, the
--   measurements from a device are collected over the same period. If the
--   accumulated measurements from the device fall above or below
--   (<tt>comparisonOperator</tt>) the value associated with the percentile
--   specified, then the device is considered to be in compliance with the
--   behavior, otherwise a violation occurs.
statisticalThreshold_statistic :: Lens' StatisticalThreshold (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StatisticalThreshold.StatisticalThreshold
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StatisticalThreshold.StatisticalThreshold
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StatisticalThreshold.StatisticalThreshold
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StatisticalThreshold.StatisticalThreshold
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StatisticalThreshold.StatisticalThreshold
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StatisticalThreshold.StatisticalThreshold
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StatisticalThreshold.StatisticalThreshold
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StatisticalThreshold.StatisticalThreshold


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.BehaviorCriteria

-- | The criteria by which the behavior is determined to be normal.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBehaviorCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data BehaviorCriteria
BehaviorCriteria' :: Maybe MachineLearningDetectionConfig -> Maybe MetricValue -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe ComparisonOperator -> Maybe StatisticalThreshold -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Natural -> BehaviorCriteria

-- | The configuration of an ML Detect
[$sel:mlDetectionConfig:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe MachineLearningDetectionConfig

-- | The value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
[$sel:value:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe MetricValue

-- | If a device is in violation of the behavior for the specified number
--   of consecutive datapoints, an alarm occurs. If not specified, the
--   default is 1.
[$sel:consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe Natural

-- | The operator that relates the thing measured (<tt>metric</tt>) to the
--   criteria (containing a <tt>value</tt> or
--   <tt>statisticalThreshold</tt>). Valid operators include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>string-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>ip-address-list</tt>: <tt>in-cidr-set</tt> and
--   <tt>not-in-cidr-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number</tt>: <tt>less-than</tt>, <tt>less-than-equals</tt>,
--   <tt>greater-than</tt>, and <tt>greater-than-equals</tt></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:comparisonOperator:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe ComparisonOperator

-- | A statistical ranking (percentile)that indicates a threshold value by
--   which a behavior is determined to be in compliance or in violation of
--   the behavior.
[$sel:statisticalThreshold:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe StatisticalThreshold

-- | Use this to specify the time duration over which the behavior is
--   evaluated, for those criteria that have a time dimension (for example,
--   <tt>NUM_MESSAGES_SENT</tt>). For a <tt>statisticalThreshhold</tt>
--   metric comparison, measurements from all devices are accumulated over
--   this time duration before being used to calculate percentiles, and
--   later, measurements from an individual device are also accumulated
--   over this time duration before being given a percentile rank. Cannot
--   be used with list-based metric datatypes.
[$sel:durationSeconds:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe Int

-- | If an alarm has occurred and the offending device is no longer in
--   violation of the behavior for the specified number of consecutive
--   datapoints, the alarm is cleared. If not specified, the default is 1.
[$sel:consecutiveDatapointsToClear:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>BehaviorCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mlDetectionConfig:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_mlDetectionConfig</a> - The configuration of an ML
--   Detect
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:BehaviorCriteria'</a>, <a>behaviorCriteria_value</a> -
--   The value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm</a> - If a device is
--   in violation of the behavior for the specified number of consecutive
--   datapoints, an alarm occurs. If not specified, the default is 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_comparisonOperator</a> - The operator that relates
--   the thing measured (<tt>metric</tt>) to the criteria (containing a
--   <tt>value</tt> or <tt>statisticalThreshold</tt>). Valid operators
--   include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>string-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>ip-address-list</tt>: <tt>in-cidr-set</tt> and
--   <tt>not-in-cidr-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number</tt>: <tt>less-than</tt>, <tt>less-than-equals</tt>,
--   <tt>greater-than</tt>, and <tt>greater-than-equals</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statisticalThreshold:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_statisticalThreshold</a> - A statistical ranking
--   (percentile)that indicates a threshold value by which a behavior is
--   determined to be in compliance or in violation of the behavior.
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationSeconds:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_durationSeconds</a> - Use this to specify the time
--   duration over which the behavior is evaluated, for those criteria that
--   have a time dimension (for example, <tt>NUM_MESSAGES_SENT</tt>). For a
--   <tt>statisticalThreshhold</tt> metric comparison, measurements from
--   all devices are accumulated over this time duration before being used
--   to calculate percentiles, and later, measurements from an individual
--   device are also accumulated over this time duration before being given
--   a percentile rank. Cannot be used with list-based metric datatypes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:consecutiveDatapointsToClear:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToClear</a> - If an alarm has
--   occurred and the offending device is no longer in violation of the
--   behavior for the specified number of consecutive datapoints, the alarm
--   is cleared. If not specified, the default is 1.
newBehaviorCriteria :: BehaviorCriteria

-- | The configuration of an ML Detect
behaviorCriteria_mlDetectionConfig :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe MachineLearningDetectionConfig)

-- | The value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
behaviorCriteria_value :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe MetricValue)

-- | If a device is in violation of the behavior for the specified number
--   of consecutive datapoints, an alarm occurs. If not specified, the
--   default is 1.
behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe Natural)

-- | The operator that relates the thing measured (<tt>metric</tt>) to the
--   criteria (containing a <tt>value</tt> or
--   <tt>statisticalThreshold</tt>). Valid operators include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>string-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>ip-address-list</tt>: <tt>in-cidr-set</tt> and
--   <tt>not-in-cidr-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number</tt>: <tt>less-than</tt>, <tt>less-than-equals</tt>,
--   <tt>greater-than</tt>, and <tt>greater-than-equals</tt></li>
--   </ul>
behaviorCriteria_comparisonOperator :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe ComparisonOperator)

-- | A statistical ranking (percentile)that indicates a threshold value by
--   which a behavior is determined to be in compliance or in violation of
--   the behavior.
behaviorCriteria_statisticalThreshold :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe StatisticalThreshold)

-- | Use this to specify the time duration over which the behavior is
--   evaluated, for those criteria that have a time dimension (for example,
--   <tt>NUM_MESSAGES_SENT</tt>). For a <tt>statisticalThreshhold</tt>
--   metric comparison, measurements from all devices are accumulated over
--   this time duration before being used to calculate percentiles, and
--   later, measurements from an individual device are also accumulated
--   over this time duration before being given a percentile rank. Cannot
--   be used with list-based metric datatypes.
behaviorCriteria_durationSeconds :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe Int)

-- | If an alarm has occurred and the offending device is no longer in
--   violation of the behavior for the specified number of consecutive
--   datapoints, the alarm is cleared. If not specified, the default is 1.
behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToClear :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.BehaviorCriteria.BehaviorCriteria
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.BehaviorCriteria.BehaviorCriteria
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.BehaviorCriteria.BehaviorCriteria
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.BehaviorCriteria.BehaviorCriteria
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.BehaviorCriteria.BehaviorCriteria
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.BehaviorCriteria.BehaviorCriteria
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.BehaviorCriteria.BehaviorCriteria
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.BehaviorCriteria.BehaviorCriteria


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Behavior

-- | A Device Defender security profile behavior.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBehavior</a> smart constructor.
data Behavior
Behavior' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe MetricDimension -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BehaviorCriteria -> Text -> Behavior

-- | Suppresses alerts.
[$sel:suppressAlerts:Behavior'] :: Behavior -> Maybe Bool

-- | The dimension for a metric in your behavior. For example, using a
--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimension, you can narrow down the scope of the
--   metric to only MQTT topics where the name matches the pattern
--   specified in the dimension. This can't be used with custom metrics.
[$sel:metricDimension:Behavior'] :: Behavior -> Maybe MetricDimension

-- | What is measured by the behavior.
[$sel:metric:Behavior'] :: Behavior -> Maybe Text

-- | The criteria that determine if a device is behaving normally in regard
--   to the <tt>metric</tt>.
[$sel:criteria:Behavior'] :: Behavior -> Maybe BehaviorCriteria

-- | The name you've given to the behavior.
[$sel:name:Behavior'] :: Behavior -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Behavior</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressAlerts:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_suppressAlerts</a> -
--   Suppresses alerts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricDimension:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_metricDimension</a>
--   - The dimension for a metric in your behavior. For example, using a
--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimension, you can narrow down the scope of the
--   metric to only MQTT topics where the name matches the pattern
--   specified in the dimension. This can't be used with custom metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_metric</a> - What is
--   measured by the behavior.
--   
--   <a>$sel:criteria:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_criteria</a> - The
--   criteria that determine if a device is behaving normally in regard to
--   the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_name</a> - The name you've
--   given to the behavior.
newBehavior :: Text -> Behavior

-- | Suppresses alerts.
behavior_suppressAlerts :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe Bool)

-- | The dimension for a metric in your behavior. For example, using a
--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimension, you can narrow down the scope of the
--   metric to only MQTT topics where the name matches the pattern
--   specified in the dimension. This can't be used with custom metrics.
behavior_metricDimension :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe MetricDimension)

-- | What is measured by the behavior.
behavior_metric :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe Text)

-- | The criteria that determine if a device is behaving normally in regard
--   to the <tt>metric</tt>.
behavior_criteria :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe BehaviorCriteria)

-- | The name you've given to the behavior.
behavior_name :: Lens' Behavior Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Behavior.Behavior
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Behavior.Behavior
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Behavior.Behavior
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Behavior.Behavior
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Behavior.Behavior
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Behavior.Behavior
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Behavior.Behavior
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Behavior.Behavior


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Statistics

-- | A map of key-value pairs for all supported statistics. Currently, only
--   count is supported.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data Statistics
Statistics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Statistics

-- | The standard deviation of the aggregated field values.
[$sel:stdDeviation:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The maximum aggregated field value.
[$sel:maximum:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The average of the aggregated field values.
[$sel:average:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The count of things that match the query.
[$sel:count:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The minimum aggregated field value.
[$sel:minimum:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The variance of the aggregated field values.
[$sel:variance:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The sum of the squares of the aggregated field values.
[$sel:sumOfSquares:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The sum of the aggregated field values.
[$sel:sum:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>Statistics</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stdDeviation:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_stdDeviation</a> -
--   The standard deviation of the aggregated field values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximum:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_maximum</a> - The
--   maximum aggregated field value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:average:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_average</a> - The
--   average of the aggregated field values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_count</a> - The count of
--   things that match the query.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimum:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_minimum</a> - The
--   minimum aggregated field value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:variance:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_variance</a> - The
--   variance of the aggregated field values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sumOfSquares:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_sumOfSquares</a> -
--   The sum of the squares of the aggregated field values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sum:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_sum</a> - The sum of the
--   aggregated field values.
newStatistics :: Statistics

-- | The standard deviation of the aggregated field values.
statistics_stdDeviation :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The maximum aggregated field value.
statistics_maximum :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The average of the aggregated field values.
statistics_average :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The count of things that match the query.
statistics_count :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The minimum aggregated field value.
statistics_minimum :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The variance of the aggregated field values.
statistics_variance :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The sum of the squares of the aggregated field values.
statistics_sumOfSquares :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The sum of the aggregated field values.
statistics_sum :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Statistics.Statistics
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Statistics.Statistics
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Statistics.Statistics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Statistics.Statistics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Statistics.Statistics
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Statistics.Statistics
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Statistics.Statistics


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StepFunctionsAction

-- | Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepFunctionsAction</a> smart constructor.
data StepFunctionsAction
StepFunctionsAction' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> StepFunctionsAction

-- | (Optional) A name will be given to the state machine execution
--   consisting of this prefix followed by a UUID. Step Functions
--   automatically creates a unique name for each state machine execution
--   if one is not provided.
[$sel:executionNamePrefix:StepFunctionsAction'] :: StepFunctionsAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Step Functions state machine whose execution will be
--   started.
[$sel:stateMachineName:StepFunctionsAction'] :: StepFunctionsAction -> Text

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to start execution of a
--   state machine ("Action":"states:StartExecution").
[$sel:roleArn:StepFunctionsAction'] :: StepFunctionsAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StepFunctionsAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionNamePrefix:StepFunctionsAction'</a>,
--   <a>stepFunctionsAction_executionNamePrefix</a> - (Optional) A name
--   will be given to the state machine execution consisting of this prefix
--   followed by a UUID. Step Functions automatically creates a unique name
--   for each state machine execution if one is not provided.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateMachineName:StepFunctionsAction'</a>,
--   <a>stepFunctionsAction_stateMachineName</a> - The name of the Step
--   Functions state machine whose execution will be started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:StepFunctionsAction'</a>,
--   <a>stepFunctionsAction_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the role that grants
--   IoT permission to start execution of a state machine
--   ("Action":"states:StartExecution").
newStepFunctionsAction :: Text -> Text -> StepFunctionsAction

-- | (Optional) A name will be given to the state machine execution
--   consisting of this prefix followed by a UUID. Step Functions
--   automatically creates a unique name for each state machine execution
--   if one is not provided.
stepFunctionsAction_executionNamePrefix :: Lens' StepFunctionsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Step Functions state machine whose execution will be
--   started.
stepFunctionsAction_stateMachineName :: Lens' StepFunctionsAction Text

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to start execution of a
--   state machine ("Action":"states:StartExecution").
stepFunctionsAction_roleArn :: Lens' StepFunctionsAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StepFunctionsAction.StepFunctionsAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StepFunctionsAction.StepFunctionsAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StepFunctionsAction.StepFunctionsAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StepFunctionsAction.StepFunctionsAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StepFunctionsAction.StepFunctionsAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StepFunctionsAction.StepFunctionsAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StepFunctionsAction.StepFunctionsAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StepFunctionsAction.StepFunctionsAction

--   associated with a stream.
--

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateFile

-- | Describes a file to be associated with an OTA update.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOTAUpdateFile</a> smart constructor.
data OTAUpdateFile
OTAUpdateFile' :: Maybe FileLocation -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe CodeSigning -> Maybe Text -> OTAUpdateFile

-- | The location of the updated firmware.
[$sel:fileLocation:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe FileLocation

-- | An integer value you can include in the job document to allow your
--   devices to identify the type of file received from the cloud.
[$sel:fileType:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe Natural

-- | The file version.
[$sel:fileVersion:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of name/attribute pairs.
[$sel:attributes:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The code signing method of the file.
[$sel:codeSigning:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe CodeSigning

-- | The name of the file.
[$sel:fileName:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OTAUpdateFile</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileLocation:OTAUpdateFile'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateFile_fileLocation</a> - The location of the updated
--   firmware.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileType:OTAUpdateFile'</a>, <a>oTAUpdateFile_fileType</a> -
--   An integer value you can include in the job document to allow your
--   devices to identify the type of file received from the cloud.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileVersion:OTAUpdateFile'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateFile_fileVersion</a> - The file version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:OTAUpdateFile'</a>, <a>oTAUpdateFile_attributes</a>
--   - A list of name/attribute pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:codeSigning:OTAUpdateFile'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateFile_codeSigning</a> - The code signing method of the
--   file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileName:OTAUpdateFile'</a>, <a>oTAUpdateFile_fileName</a> -
--   The name of the file.
newOTAUpdateFile :: OTAUpdateFile

-- | The location of the updated firmware.
oTAUpdateFile_fileLocation :: Lens' OTAUpdateFile (Maybe FileLocation)

-- | An integer value you can include in the job document to allow your
--   devices to identify the type of file received from the cloud.
oTAUpdateFile_fileType :: Lens' OTAUpdateFile (Maybe Natural)

-- | The file version.
oTAUpdateFile_fileVersion :: Lens' OTAUpdateFile (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of name/attribute pairs.
oTAUpdateFile_attributes :: Lens' OTAUpdateFile (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The code signing method of the file.
oTAUpdateFile_codeSigning :: Lens' OTAUpdateFile (Maybe CodeSigning)

-- | The name of the file.
oTAUpdateFile_fileName :: Lens' OTAUpdateFile (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateFile.OTAUpdateFile
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateFile.OTAUpdateFile
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateFile.OTAUpdateFile
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateFile.OTAUpdateFile
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateFile.OTAUpdateFile
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateFile.OTAUpdateFile
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateFile.OTAUpdateFile
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateFile.OTAUpdateFile

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamInfo

-- | Information about a stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStreamInfo</a> smart constructor.
data StreamInfo
StreamInfo' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty StreamFile) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StreamInfo

-- | The date when the stream was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date when the stream was created.
[$sel:createdAt:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The stream version.
[$sel:streamVersion:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe Natural

-- | The stream ARN.
[$sel:streamArn:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The files to stream.
[$sel:files:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe (NonEmpty StreamFile)

-- | The description of the stream.
[$sel:description:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The stream ID.
[$sel:streamId:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | An IAM role IoT assumes to access your S3 files.
[$sel:roleArn:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StreamInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_lastUpdatedAt</a>
--   - The date when the stream was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_createdAt</a> - The
--   date when the stream was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamVersion:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_streamVersion</a>
--   - The stream version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamArn:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_streamArn</a> - The
--   stream ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:files:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_files</a> - The files to
--   stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_description</a> -
--   The description of the stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamId:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_streamId</a> - The
--   stream ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_roleArn</a> - An IAM
--   role IoT assumes to access your S3 files.
newStreamInfo :: StreamInfo

-- | The date when the stream was last updated.
streamInfo_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date when the stream was created.
streamInfo_createdAt :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The stream version.
streamInfo_streamVersion :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe Natural)

-- | The stream ARN.
streamInfo_streamArn :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The files to stream.
streamInfo_files :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe (NonEmpty StreamFile))

-- | The description of the stream.
streamInfo_description :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The stream ID.
streamInfo_streamId :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | An IAM role IoT assumes to access your S3 files.
streamInfo_roleArn :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamInfo.StreamInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamInfo.StreamInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamInfo.StreamInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamInfo.StreamInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamInfo.StreamInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamInfo.StreamInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamInfo.StreamInfo


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamSummary

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStreamSummary</a> smart constructor.

--

--   The stream ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StreamSummary'</a>,
--   <a>streamSummary_description</a> - A description of the stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamId:StreamSummary'</a>, <a>streamSummary_streamId</a> -
--   The stream ID.

streamSummary_streamId :: Lens' StreamSummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamSummary.StreamSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamSummary.StreamSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamSummary.StreamSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamSummary.StreamSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamSummary.StreamSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamSummary.StreamSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.StreamSummary.StreamSummary


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Tag

-- | A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The tag's value.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag's key.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The tag's value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The tag's key.
newTag :: Text -> Tag

-- | The tag's value.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag's key.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Tag.Tag

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Tag.Tag

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateInfo

-- | Information about an OTA update.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOTAUpdateInfo</a> smart constructor.
data OTAUpdateInfo
OTAUpdateInfo' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Protocol) -> Maybe AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe (NonEmpty OTAUpdateFile) -> Maybe OTAUpdateStatus -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ErrorInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TargetSelection -> OTAUpdateInfo

-- | The date when the OTA update was last updated.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Configuration for the rollout of OTA updates.
[$sel:awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The IoT job ID associated with the OTA update.
[$sel:awsIotJobId:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The protocol used to transfer the OTA update image. Valid values are
--   [HTTP], [MQTT], [HTTP, MQTT]. When both HTTP and MQTT are specified,
--   the target device can choose the protocol.
[$sel:protocols:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe (NonEmpty Protocol)

-- | Configuration information for pre-signed URLs. Valid when
--   <tt>protocols</tt> contains HTTP.
[$sel:awsJobPresignedUrlConfig:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig

-- | A list of files associated with the OTA update.
[$sel:otaUpdateFiles:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe (NonEmpty OTAUpdateFile)

-- | The status of the OTA update.
[$sel:otaUpdateStatus:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe OTAUpdateStatus

-- | The targets of the OTA update.
[$sel:targets:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The IoT job ARN associated with the OTA update.
[$sel:awsIotJobArn:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the OTA update was created.
[$sel:creationDate:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A collection of name/value pairs
[$sel:additionalParameters:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The OTA update ID.
[$sel:otaUpdateId:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Error information associated with the OTA update.
[$sel:errorInfo:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe ErrorInfo

-- | The OTA update ARN.
[$sel:otaUpdateArn:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the OTA update.
[$sel:description:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the OTA update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or
--   will be complete after all those things specified as targets have
--   completed the OTA update (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the OTA update may
--   also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For
--   example, an OTA update will run on a thing when the thing is added to
--   a target group, even after the OTA update was completed by all things
--   originally in the group.
[$sel:targetSelection:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe TargetSelection

-- | Create a value of <a>OTAUpdateInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date when the OTA update
--   was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> - Configuration for
--   the rollout of OTA updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsIotJobId:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_awsIotJobId</a> - The IoT job ID associated with the
--   OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocols:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>, <a>oTAUpdateInfo_protocols</a> -
--   The protocol used to transfer the OTA update image. Valid values are
--   [HTTP], [MQTT], [HTTP, MQTT]. When both HTTP and MQTT are specified,
--   the target device can choose the protocol.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsJobPresignedUrlConfig:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_awsJobPresignedUrlConfig</a> - Configuration
--   information for pre-signed URLs. Valid when <tt>protocols</tt>
--   contains HTTP.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateFiles:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateFiles</a> - A list of files associated with
--   the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateStatus:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateStatus</a> - The status of the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>, <a>oTAUpdateInfo_targets</a> - The
--   targets of the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsIotJobArn:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_awsIotJobArn</a> - The IoT job ARN associated with
--   the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_creationDate</a> - The date when the OTA update was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalParameters:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_additionalParameters</a> - A collection of name/value
--   pairs
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateId:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateId</a> - The OTA update ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorInfo:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>, <a>oTAUpdateInfo_errorInfo</a> -
--   Error information associated with the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateArn:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateArn</a> - The OTA update ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_description</a> - A description of the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_targetSelection</a> - Specifies whether the OTA
--   update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after
--   all those things specified as targets have completed the OTA update
--   (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the OTA update may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, an OTA update will
--   run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after
--   the OTA update was completed by all things originally in the group.
newOTAUpdateInfo :: OTAUpdateInfo

-- | The date when the OTA update was last updated.
oTAUpdateInfo_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Configuration for the rollout of OTA updates.
oTAUpdateInfo_awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig)

-- | The IoT job ID associated with the OTA update.
oTAUpdateInfo_awsIotJobId :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The protocol used to transfer the OTA update image. Valid values are
--   [HTTP], [MQTT], [HTTP, MQTT]. When both HTTP and MQTT are specified,
--   the target device can choose the protocol.
oTAUpdateInfo_protocols :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe (NonEmpty Protocol))

-- | Configuration information for pre-signed URLs. Valid when
--   <tt>protocols</tt> contains HTTP.
oTAUpdateInfo_awsJobPresignedUrlConfig :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig)

-- | A list of files associated with the OTA update.
oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateFiles :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe (NonEmpty OTAUpdateFile))

-- | The status of the OTA update.
oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateStatus :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe OTAUpdateStatus)

-- | The targets of the OTA update.
oTAUpdateInfo_targets :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The IoT job ARN associated with the OTA update.
oTAUpdateInfo_awsIotJobArn :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the OTA update was created.
oTAUpdateInfo_creationDate :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A collection of name/value pairs
oTAUpdateInfo_additionalParameters :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The OTA update ID.
oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateId :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Error information associated with the OTA update.
oTAUpdateInfo_errorInfo :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe ErrorInfo)

-- | The OTA update ARN.
oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateArn :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the OTA update.
oTAUpdateInfo_description :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the OTA update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or
--   will be complete after all those things specified as targets have
--   completed the OTA update (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the OTA update may
--   also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For
--   example, an OTA update will run on a thing when the thing is added to
--   a target group, even after the OTA update was completed by all things
--   originally in the group.
oTAUpdateInfo_targetSelection :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe TargetSelection)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateInfo.OTAUpdateInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateInfo.OTAUpdateInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateInfo.OTAUpdateInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateInfo.OTAUpdateInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateInfo.OTAUpdateInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateInfo.OTAUpdateInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.OTAUpdateInfo.OTAUpdateInfo


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobSummary

-- | The job summary.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobSummary</a> smart constructor.
data JobSummary
JobSummary' :: Maybe JobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe TargetSelection -> JobSummary

-- | The job summary status.
[$sel:status:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe JobStatus

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
[$sel:jobId:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The job ARN.
[$sel:jobArn:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
[$sel:createdAt:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ID of the thing group.
[$sel:thingGroupId:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job completed.
[$sel:completedAt:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job
--   was completed by all things originally in the group.
[$sel:targetSelection:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe TargetSelection

-- | Create a value of <a>JobSummary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_status</a> - The job
--   summary status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobId</a> - The unique
--   identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_lastUpdatedAt</a>
--   - The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobArn</a> - The job
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_createdAt</a> - The
--   time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupId:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_thingGroupId</a> -
--   The ID of the thing group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedAt:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_completedAt</a> -
--   The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:JobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobSummary_targetSelection</a> - Specifies whether the job will
--   continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those
--   things specified as targets have completed the job (SNAPSHOT). If
--   continuous, the job may also be run on a thing when a change is
--   detected in a target. For example, a job will run on a thing when the
--   thing is added to a target group, even after the job was completed by
--   all things originally in the group.
newJobSummary :: JobSummary

-- | The job summary status.
jobSummary_status :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe JobStatus)

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
jobSummary_jobId :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
jobSummary_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The job ARN.
jobSummary_jobArn :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
jobSummary_createdAt :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the thing group.
jobSummary_thingGroupId :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job completed.
jobSummary_completedAt :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job
--   was completed by all things originally in the group.
jobSummary_targetSelection :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe TargetSelection)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.JobSummary.JobSummary


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatistics

-- | Statistics for the checks performed during the audit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTaskStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data TaskStatistics
TaskStatistics' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> TaskStatistics

-- | The number of checks that found noncompliant resources.
[$sel:nonCompliantChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks waiting for data collection.
[$sel:waitingForDataCollectionChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks.
[$sel:failedChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks in this audit.
[$sel:totalChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks in progress.
[$sel:inProgressChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks that found compliant resources.
[$sel:compliantChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks that did not run because the audit was canceled.
[$sel:canceledChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TaskStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nonCompliantChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_nonCompliantChecks</a> - The number of checks that
--   found noncompliant resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitingForDataCollectionChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_waitingForDataCollectionChecks</a> - The number of
--   checks waiting for data collection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_failedChecks</a> - The number of checks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_totalChecks</a> - The number of checks in this
--   audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inProgressChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_inProgressChecks</a> - The number of checks in
--   progress.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compliantChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_compliantChecks</a> - The number of checks that
--   found compliant resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:canceledChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_canceledChecks</a> - The number of checks that did
--   not run because the audit was canceled.
newTaskStatistics :: TaskStatistics

-- | The number of checks that found noncompliant resources.
taskStatistics_nonCompliantChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks waiting for data collection.
taskStatistics_waitingForDataCollectionChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks.
taskStatistics_failedChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks in this audit.
taskStatistics_totalChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks in progress.
taskStatistics_inProgressChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks that found compliant resources.
taskStatistics_compliantChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks that did not run because the audit was canceled.
taskStatistics_canceledChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatistics.TaskStatistics
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatistics.TaskStatistics
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatistics.TaskStatistics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatistics.TaskStatistics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatistics.TaskStatistics
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatistics.TaskStatistics
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatistics.TaskStatistics


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck

-- | Provides summary counts of how many tasks for findings are in a
--   particular state. This information is included in the response from
--   DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTask.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTaskStatisticsForAuditCheck</a> smart constructor.
data TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck
TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck

-- | The number of findings to which the mitigation action task was
--   canceled when applied.
[$sel:canceledFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'] :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of findings skipped because of filter conditions provided
--   in the parameters to the command.
[$sel:skippedFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'] :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of findings to which a task is being applied.
[$sel:totalFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'] :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of findings for which at least one of the actions failed
--   when applied.
[$sel:failedFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'] :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of findings for which all mitigation actions succeeded when
--   applied.
[$sel:succeededFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'] :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:canceledFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_canceledFindingsCount</a> - The number
--   of findings to which the mitigation action task was canceled when
--   applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:skippedFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_skippedFindingsCount</a> - The number
--   of findings skipped because of filter conditions provided in the
--   parameters to the command.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_totalFindingsCount</a> - The total
--   number of findings to which a task is being applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_failedFindingsCount</a> - The number of
--   findings for which at least one of the actions failed when applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:succeededFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_succeededFindingsCount</a> - The number
--   of findings for which all mitigation actions succeeded when applied.
newTaskStatisticsForAuditCheck :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck

-- | The number of findings to which the mitigation action task was
--   canceled when applied.
taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_canceledFindingsCount :: Lens' TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of findings skipped because of filter conditions provided
--   in the parameters to the command.
taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_skippedFindingsCount :: Lens' TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of findings to which a task is being applied.
taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_totalFindingsCount :: Lens' TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of findings for which at least one of the actions failed
--   when applied.
taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_failedFindingsCount :: Lens' TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of findings for which all mitigation actions succeeded when
--   applied.
taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_succeededFindingsCount :: Lens' TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck.TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TermsAggregation

-- | Performs an aggregation that will return a list of buckets. The list
--   of buckets is a ranked list of the number of occurrences of an
--   aggregation field value.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTermsAggregation</a> smart constructor.
data TermsAggregation
TermsAggregation' :: Maybe Natural -> TermsAggregation

-- | The number of buckets to return in the response. Default to 10.
[$sel:maxBuckets:TermsAggregation'] :: TermsAggregation -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>TermsAggregation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxBuckets:TermsAggregation'</a>,
--   <a>termsAggregation_maxBuckets</a> - The number of buckets to return
--   in the response. Default to 10.
newTermsAggregation :: TermsAggregation

-- | The number of buckets to return in the response. Default to 10.
termsAggregation_maxBuckets :: Lens' TermsAggregation (Maybe Natural)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TermsAggregation.TermsAggregation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TermsAggregation.TermsAggregation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TermsAggregation.TermsAggregation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TermsAggregation.TermsAggregation
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TermsAggregation.TermsAggregation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TermsAggregation.TermsAggregation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TermsAggregation.TermsAggregation


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.BucketsAggregationType

-- | The type of bucketed aggregation performed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketsAggregationType</a> smart constructor.
data BucketsAggregationType
BucketsAggregationType' :: Maybe TermsAggregation -> BucketsAggregationType

-- | Performs an aggregation that will return a list of buckets. The list

--   aggregation field value.

--   aggregation that will return a list of buckets. The list of buckets is
--   a ranked list of the number of occurrences of an aggregation field
--   value.
newBucketsAggregationType :: BucketsAggregationType

-- | Performs an aggregation that will return a list of buckets. The list
--   of buckets is a ranked list of the number of occurrences of an
--   aggregation field value.

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingAttribute

-- | The properties of the thing, including thing name, thing type name,
--   and a list of thing attributes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingAttribute</a> smart constructor.
data ThingAttribute
ThingAttribute' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> ThingAttribute

-- | The name of the thing type, if the thing has been associated with a
--   type.
[$sel:thingTypeName:ThingAttribute'] :: ThingAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The thing ARN.
[$sel:thingArn:ThingAttribute'] :: ThingAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of thing attributes which are name-value pairs.
[$sel:attributes:ThingAttribute'] :: ThingAttribute -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The version of the thing record in the registry.
[$sel:version:ThingAttribute'] :: ThingAttribute -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the thing.
[$sel:thingName:ThingAttribute'] :: ThingAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ThingAttribute</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingTypeName:ThingAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>thingAttribute_thingTypeName</a> - The name of the thing type, if
--   the thing has been associated with a type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingArn:ThingAttribute'</a>, <a>thingAttribute_thingArn</a> -
--   The thing ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:ThingAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>thingAttribute_attributes</a> - A list of thing attributes which
--   are name-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:ThingAttribute'</a>, <a>thingAttribute_version</a> -
--   The version of the thing record in the registry.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:ThingAttribute'</a>, <a>thingAttribute_thingName</a>
--   - The name of the thing.
newThingAttribute :: ThingAttribute

-- | The name of the thing type, if the thing has been associated with a
--   type.
thingAttribute_thingTypeName :: Lens' ThingAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The thing ARN.
thingAttribute_thingArn :: Lens' ThingAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of thing attributes which are name-value pairs.
thingAttribute_attributes :: Lens' ThingAttribute (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The version of the thing record in the registry.
thingAttribute_version :: Lens' ThingAttribute (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the thing.
thingAttribute_thingName :: Lens' ThingAttribute (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingAttribute.ThingAttribute
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingAttribute.ThingAttribute
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingAttribute.ThingAttribute
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingAttribute.ThingAttribute
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingAttribute.ThingAttribute
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingAttribute.ThingAttribute
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingAttribute.ThingAttribute


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingConnectivity

-- | The connectivity status of the thing.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingConnectivity</a> smart constructor.
data ThingConnectivity
ThingConnectivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> ThingConnectivity

-- | The reason why the client is disconnected. If the thing has been
--   disconnected for approximately an hour, the <tt>disconnectReason</tt>
--   value might be missing.
[$sel:disconnectReason:ThingConnectivity'] :: ThingConnectivity -> Maybe Text

-- | True if the thing is connected to the Amazon Web Services IoT Core
--   service; false if it is not connected.
[$sel:connected:ThingConnectivity'] :: ThingConnectivity -> Maybe Bool

-- | The epoch time (in milliseconds) when the thing last connected or
--   disconnected. If the thing has been disconnected for approximately an
--   hour, the time value might be missing.
[$sel:timestamp:ThingConnectivity'] :: ThingConnectivity -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>ThingConnectivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:disconnectReason:ThingConnectivity'</a>,
--   <a>thingConnectivity_disconnectReason</a> - The reason why the client
--   is disconnected. If the thing has been disconnected for approximately
--   an hour, the <tt>disconnectReason</tt> value might be missing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connected:ThingConnectivity'</a>,
--   <a>thingConnectivity_connected</a> - True if the thing is connected to
--   the Amazon Web Services IoT Core service; false if it is not
--   connected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:ThingConnectivity'</a>,
--   <a>thingConnectivity_timestamp</a> - The epoch time (in milliseconds)
--   when the thing last connected or disconnected. If the thing has been
--   disconnected for approximately an hour, the time value might be
--   missing.
newThingConnectivity :: ThingConnectivity

-- | The reason why the client is disconnected. If the thing has been
--   disconnected for approximately an hour, the <tt>disconnectReason</tt>
--   value might be missing.
thingConnectivity_disconnectReason :: Lens' ThingConnectivity (Maybe Text)

-- | True if the thing is connected to the Amazon Web Services IoT Core
--   service; false if it is not connected.
thingConnectivity_connected :: Lens' ThingConnectivity (Maybe Bool)

-- | The epoch time (in milliseconds) when the thing last connected or
--   disconnected. If the thing has been disconnected for approximately an
--   hour, the time value might be missing.
thingConnectivity_timestamp :: Lens' ThingConnectivity (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingConnectivity.ThingConnectivity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingConnectivity.ThingConnectivity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingConnectivity.ThingConnectivity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingConnectivity.ThingConnectivity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingConnectivity.ThingConnectivity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingConnectivity.ThingConnectivity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingConnectivity.ThingConnectivity

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingDocument

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingDocument</a> smart constructor.
data ThingDocument
ThingDocument' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe ThingConnectivity -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ThingDocument

-- | Thing group names.
[$sel:thingGroupNames:ThingDocument'] :: ThingDocument -> Maybe [Text]

[$sel:thingTypeName:ThingDocument'] :: ThingDocument -> Maybe Text

[$sel:shadow:ThingDocument'] :: ThingDocument -> Maybe Text

-- | The attributes.

--   IoT Core service.
[$sel:connectivity:ThingDocument'] :: ThingDocument -> Maybe ThingConnectivity

[$sel:thingName:ThingDocument'] :: ThingDocument -> Maybe Text

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   
--   <a>$sel:thingTypeName:ThingDocument'</a>,
--   <a>thingDocument_thingTypeName</a> - The thing type name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shadow:ThingDocument'</a>, <a>thingDocument_shadow</a> - The
--   shadow.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:ThingDocument'</a>, <a>thingDocument_attributes</a>
--   - The attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectivity:ThingDocument'</a>,

--   connected to the Amazon Web Services IoT Core service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:ThingDocument'</a>, <a>thingDocument_thingName</a> -
--   The thing name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingId:ThingDocument'</a>, <a>thingDocument_thingId</a> - The
--   thing ID.
newThingDocument :: ThingDocument

-- | The thing type name.

-- | The shadow.
thingDocument_shadow :: Lens' ThingDocument (Maybe Text)

-- | The attributes.
thingDocument_attributes :: Lens' ThingDocument (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

--   IoT Core service.
thingDocument_connectivity :: Lens' ThingDocument (Maybe ThingConnectivity)

-- | The thing name.
thingDocument_thingName :: Lens' ThingDocument (Maybe Text)

-- | The thing ID.
thingDocument_thingId :: Lens' ThingDocument (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration

-- | Thing group indexing configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingGroupIndexingConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration
ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration' :: Maybe [Field] -> Maybe [Field] -> ThingGroupIndexingMode -> ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration

-- | Contains fields that are indexed and whose types are already known by
--   the Fleet Indexing service.
[$sel:managedFields:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration -> Maybe [Field]

-- | A list of thing group fields to index. This list cannot contain any
--   managed fields. Use the GetIndexingConfiguration API to get a list of
--   managed fields.
--   
--   Contains custom field names and their data type.
[$sel:customFields:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration -> Maybe [Field]

-- | Thing group indexing mode.
[$sel:thingGroupIndexingMode:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration -> ThingGroupIndexingMode

-- | Create a value of <a>ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:managedFields:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_managedFields</a> - Contains fields
--   that are indexed and whose types are already known by the Fleet
--   Indexing service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customFields:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_customFields</a> - A list of thing
--   group fields to index. This list cannot contain any managed fields.
--   Use the GetIndexingConfiguration API to get a list of managed fields.
--   
--   Contains custom field names and their data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupIndexingMode:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_thingGroupIndexingMode</a> - Thing
--   group indexing mode.
newThingGroupIndexingConfiguration :: ThingGroupIndexingMode -> ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration

-- | Contains fields that are indexed and whose types are already known by
--   the Fleet Indexing service.
thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_managedFields :: Lens' ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration (Maybe [Field])

-- | A list of thing group fields to index. This list cannot contain any
--   managed fields. Use the GetIndexingConfiguration API to get a list of
--   managed fields.
--   
--   Contains custom field names and their data type.
thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_customFields :: Lens' ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration (Maybe [Field])

-- | Thing group indexing mode.
thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_thingGroupIndexingMode :: Lens' ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration ThingGroupIndexingMode
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration.ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration.ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration.ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration.ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration
