module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingIndexingConfiguration

-- | The thing indexing configuration. For more information, see
--   <a>Managing Thing Indexing</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingIndexingConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data ThingIndexingConfiguration
ThingIndexingConfiguration' :: Maybe [Field] -> Maybe ThingConnectivityIndexingMode -> Maybe [Field] -> ThingIndexingMode -> ThingIndexingConfiguration

-- | Contains fields that are indexed and whose types are already known by
--   the Fleet Indexing service.
[$sel:managedFields:ThingIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingIndexingConfiguration -> Maybe [Field]

-- | Thing connectivity indexing mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>STATUS  Your thing index contains connectivity status. To enable
--   thing connectivity indexing, <i>thingIndexMode</i> must not be set to
--   OFF.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing connectivity status indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:thingConnectivityIndexingMode:ThingIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingIndexingConfiguration -> Maybe ThingConnectivityIndexingMode

-- | Contains custom field names and their data type.
[$sel:customFields:ThingIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingIndexingConfiguration -> Maybe [Field]

-- | Thing indexing mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>REGISTRY  Your thing index contains registry data only.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW - Your thing index contains registry and
--   shadow data.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:thingIndexingMode:ThingIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingIndexingConfiguration -> ThingIndexingMode

-- | Create a value of <a>ThingIndexingConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:managedFields:ThingIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingIndexingConfiguration_managedFields</a> - Contains fields that
--   are indexed and whose types are already known by the Fleet Indexing
--   service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingConnectivityIndexingMode:ThingIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingIndexingConfiguration_thingConnectivityIndexingMode</a> -
--   Thing connectivity indexing mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>STATUS  Your thing index contains connectivity status. To enable
--   thing connectivity indexing, <i>thingIndexMode</i> must not be set to
--   OFF.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing connectivity status indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:customFields:ThingIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingIndexingConfiguration_customFields</a> - Contains custom field
--   names and their data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingIndexingMode:ThingIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingIndexingConfiguration_thingIndexingMode</a> - Thing indexing
--   mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>REGISTRY  Your thing index contains registry data only.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW - Your thing index contains registry and
--   shadow data.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
newThingIndexingConfiguration :: ThingIndexingMode -> ThingIndexingConfiguration

-- | Contains fields that are indexed and whose types are already known by
--   the Fleet Indexing service.
thingIndexingConfiguration_managedFields :: Lens' ThingIndexingConfiguration (Maybe [Field])

-- | Thing connectivity indexing mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>STATUS  Your thing index contains connectivity status. To enable
--   thing connectivity indexing, <i>thingIndexMode</i> must not be set to
--   OFF.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing connectivity status indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
thingIndexingConfiguration_thingConnectivityIndexingMode :: Lens' ThingIndexingConfiguration (Maybe ThingConnectivityIndexingMode)

-- | Contains custom field names and their data type.
thingIndexingConfiguration_customFields :: Lens' ThingIndexingConfiguration (Maybe [Field])

-- | Thing indexing mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>REGISTRY  Your thing index contains registry data only.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW - Your thing index contains registry and
--   shadow data.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
thingIndexingConfiguration_thingIndexingMode :: Lens' ThingIndexingConfiguration ThingIndexingMode
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingIndexingConfiguration.ThingIndexingConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingIndexingConfiguration.ThingIndexingConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingIndexingConfiguration.ThingIndexingConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingIndexingConfiguration.ThingIndexingConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingIndexingConfiguration.ThingIndexingConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingIndexingConfiguration.ThingIndexingConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingIndexingConfiguration.ThingIndexingConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingIndexingConfiguration.ThingIndexingConfiguration


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingTypeMetadata

-- | The ThingTypeMetadata contains additional information about the thing
--   type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the
--   thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when time was
--   deprecated.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingTypeMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data ThingTypeMetadata
ThingTypeMetadata' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> ThingTypeMetadata

-- | The date and time when the thing type was deprecated.
[$sel:deprecationDate:ThingTypeMetadata'] :: ThingTypeMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the thing type was created.
[$sel:creationDate:ThingTypeMetadata'] :: ThingTypeMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Whether the thing type is deprecated. If <b>true</b>, no new things
--   could be associated with this type.
[$sel:deprecated:ThingTypeMetadata'] :: ThingTypeMetadata -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ThingTypeMetadata</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deprecationDate:ThingTypeMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>thingTypeMetadata_deprecationDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   thing type was deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ThingTypeMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>thingTypeMetadata_creationDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   thing type was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deprecated:ThingTypeMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>thingTypeMetadata_deprecated</a> - Whether the thing type is
--   deprecated. If <b>true</b>, no new things could be associated with
--   this type.
newThingTypeMetadata :: ThingTypeMetadata

-- | The date and time when the thing type was deprecated.
thingTypeMetadata_deprecationDate :: Lens' ThingTypeMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the thing type was created.
thingTypeMetadata_creationDate :: Lens' ThingTypeMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Whether the thing type is deprecated. If <b>true</b>, no new things
--   could be associated with this type.
thingTypeMetadata_deprecated :: Lens' ThingTypeMetadata (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingTypeMetadata.ThingTypeMetadata
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingTypeMetadata.ThingTypeMetadata
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingTypeMetadata.ThingTypeMetadata
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingTypeMetadata.ThingTypeMetadata
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingTypeMetadata.ThingTypeMetadata
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingTypeMetadata.ThingTypeMetadata
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingTypeMetadata.ThingTypeMetadata

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ThingTypeDefinition

-- | The definition of the thing type, including thing type name and
--   description.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingTypeDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data ThingTypeDefinition
ThingTypeDefinition' :: Maybe ThingTypeProperties -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ThingTypeMetadata -> Maybe Text -> ThingTypeDefinition

-- | The ThingTypeProperties for the thing type.
[$sel:thingTypeProperties:ThingTypeDefinition'] :: ThingTypeDefinition -> Maybe ThingTypeProperties

-- | The name of the thing type.

--   ThingTypeProperties for the thing type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingTypeName:ThingTypeDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>thingTypeDefinition_thingTypeName</a> - The name of the thing type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingTypeMetadata:ThingTypeDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>thingTypeDefinition_thingTypeMetadata</a> - The ThingTypeMetadata
--   contains additional information about the thing type including:
--   creation date and time, a value indicating whether the thing type is
--   deprecated, and a date and time when it was deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingTypeArn:ThingTypeDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>thingTypeDefinition_thingTypeArn</a> - The thing type ARN.
newThingTypeDefinition :: ThingTypeDefinition

-- | The ThingTypeProperties for the thing type.
thingTypeDefinition_thingTypeProperties :: Lens' ThingTypeDefinition (Maybe ThingTypeProperties)

-- | The name of the thing type.
thingTypeDefinition_thingTypeName :: Lens' ThingTypeDefinition (Maybe Text)

-- | The ThingTypeMetadata contains additional information about the thing
--   type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the
--   thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when it was deprecated.
thingTypeDefinition_thingTypeMetadata :: Lens' ThingTypeDefinition (Maybe ThingTypeMetadata)

-- | The thing type ARN.
thingTypeDefinition_thingTypeArn :: Lens' ThingTypeDefinition (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimeoutConfig

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimeoutConfig</a> smart constructor.
data TimeoutConfig
TimeoutConfig' :: Maybe Integer -> TimeoutConfig

-- | Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish
--   execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1
--   minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be
--   updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a
--   job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this
--   interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal
--   <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt> status.
[$sel:inProgressTimeoutInMinutes:TimeoutConfig'] :: TimeoutConfig -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>TimeoutConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inProgressTimeoutInMinutes:TimeoutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>timeoutConfig_inProgressTimeoutInMinutes</a> - Specifies the amount
--   of time, in minutes, this device has to finish execution of this job.
--   The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to
--   10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be updated and will apply
--   to all job executions for the job. Whenever a job execution remains in
--   the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this interval, the job
--   execution will fail and switch to the terminal <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>
--   status.
newTimeoutConfig :: TimeoutConfig

-- | Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish
--   execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1
--   minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be
--   updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a
--   job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this
--   interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal
--   <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt> status.
timeoutConfig_inProgressTimeoutInMinutes :: Lens' TimeoutConfig (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimeoutConfig.TimeoutConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimeoutConfig.TimeoutConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimeoutConfig.TimeoutConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimeoutConfig.TimeoutConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimeoutConfig.TimeoutConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimeoutConfig.TimeoutConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimeoutConfig.TimeoutConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimeoutConfig.TimeoutConfig


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Job

-- | The <tt>Job</tt> object contains details about a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJob</a> smart constructor.
data Job
Job' :: Maybe JobStatus -> Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AbortConfig -> Maybe JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TargetSelection -> Maybe TimeoutConfig -> Job

-- | The status of the job, one of <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>DELETION_IN_PROGRESS</tt> or <tt>COMPLETED</tt>.
[$sel:status:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe JobStatus

-- | Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.
[$sel:jobExecutionsRolloutConfig:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
[$sel:jobId:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An ARN identifying the job with format
--   "arn:aws:iot:region:account:job/jobId".
[$sel:jobArn:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Configuration for criteria to abort the job.
[$sel:abortConfig:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe AbortConfig

-- | Details about the job process.
[$sel:jobProcessDetails:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe JobProcessDetails

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
[$sel:namespaceId:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | If the job was updated, provides the reason code for the update.
[$sel:reasonCode:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.
[$sel:presignedUrlConfig:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe PresignedUrlConfig

-- | Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job was canceled with the optional
--   <tt>force</tt> parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:forceCanceled:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ARN of the job template used to create the job.
[$sel:jobTemplateArn:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of IoT things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
[$sel:targets:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was completed.
[$sel:completedAt:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If the job was updated, describes the reason for the update.
[$sel:comment:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | A short text description of the job.
[$sel:description:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a device when the thing representing the device is added to a target
--   group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in
--   the group.
[$sel:targetSelection:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe TargetSelection

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
[$sel:timeoutConfig:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe TimeoutConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>Job</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Job'</a>, <a>job_status</a> - The status of the job,
--   one of <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>DELETION_IN_PROGRESS</tt> or <tt>COMPLETED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExecutionsRolloutConfig:Job'</a>,
--   <a>job_jobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> - Allows you to create a staged
--   rollout of a job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobId</a> - The unique identifier you
--   assigned to this job when it was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:Job'</a>, <a>job_lastUpdatedAt</a> - The time,
--   in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobArn</a> - An ARN identifying the
--   job with format "arn:aws:iot:region:account:job/jobId".
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Job'</a>, <a>job_createdAt</a> - The time, in
--   seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:abortConfig:Job'</a>, <a>job_abortConfig</a> - Configuration
--   for criteria to abort the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobProcessDetails:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobProcessDetails</a> -
--   Details about the job process.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:Job'</a>, <a>job_namespaceId</a> - The namespace
--   used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonCode:Job'</a>, <a>job_reasonCode</a> - If the job was
--   updated, provides the reason code for the update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:presignedUrlConfig:Job'</a>, <a>job_presignedUrlConfig</a> -
--   Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceCanceled:Job'</a>, <a>job_forceCanceled</a> - Will be
--   <tt>true</tt> if the job was canceled with the optional <tt>force</tt>
--   parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobTemplateArn:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobTemplateArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the job template used to create the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:Job'</a>, <a>job_targets</a> - A list of IoT things
--   and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedAt:Job'</a>, <a>job_completedAt</a> - The time, in
--   seconds since the epoch, when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comment:Job'</a>, <a>job_comment</a> - If the job was updated,
--   describes the reason for the update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Job'</a>, <a>job_description</a> - A short text
--   description of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:Job'</a>, <a>job_targetSelection</a> -
--   Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a device when the thing representing the device is added to a target
--   group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in
--   the group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutConfig:Job'</a>, <a>job_timeoutConfig</a> - Specifies
--   the amount of time each device has to finish its execution of the job.
--   A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
newJob :: Job

-- | The status of the job, one of <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>DELETION_IN_PROGRESS</tt> or <tt>COMPLETED</tt>.
job_status :: Lens' Job (Maybe JobStatus)

-- | Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.
job_jobExecutionsRolloutConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig)

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
job_jobId :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
job_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' Job (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An ARN identifying the job with format
--   "arn:aws:iot:region:account:job/jobId".
job_jobArn :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
job_createdAt :: Lens' Job (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Configuration for criteria to abort the job.
job_abortConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe AbortConfig)

-- | Details about the job process.
job_jobProcessDetails :: Lens' Job (Maybe JobProcessDetails)

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
job_namespaceId :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | If the job was updated, provides the reason code for the update.
job_reasonCode :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.
job_presignedUrlConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe PresignedUrlConfig)

-- | Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job was canceled with the optional
--   <tt>force</tt> parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
job_forceCanceled :: Lens' Job (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ARN of the job template used to create the job.
job_jobTemplateArn :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of IoT things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
job_targets :: Lens' Job (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was completed.
job_completedAt :: Lens' Job (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If the job was updated, describes the reason for the update.
job_comment :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | A short text description of the job.
job_description :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a device when the thing representing the device is added to a target
--   group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in
--   the group.
job_targetSelection :: Lens' Job (Maybe TargetSelection)

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
job_timeoutConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe TimeoutConfig)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Job.Job
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Job.Job
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Job.Job
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Job.Job
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Job.Job
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Job.Job
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Job.Job


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamDimension

-- | Metadata attributes of the time series that are written in each
--   measure record.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimestreamDimension</a> smart constructor.
data TimestreamDimension
TimestreamDimension' :: Text -> Text -> TimestreamDimension

-- | The metadata dimension name. This is the name of the column in the
--   Amazon Timestream database table record.
--   
--   Dimensions cannot be named: <tt>measure_name</tt>,
--   <tt>measure_value</tt>, or <tt>time</tt>. These names are reserved.
--   Dimension names cannot start with <tt>ts_</tt> or
--   <tt>measure_value</tt> and they cannot contain the colon (<tt>:</tt>)
--   character.
[$sel:name:TimestreamDimension'] :: TimestreamDimension -> Text

-- | The value to write in this column of the database record.
[$sel:value:TimestreamDimension'] :: TimestreamDimension -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TimestreamDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:TimestreamDimension'</a>, <a>timestreamDimension_name</a>
--   - The metadata dimension name. This is the name of the column in the
--   Amazon Timestream database table record.
--   
--   Dimensions cannot be named: <tt>measure_name</tt>,
--   <tt>measure_value</tt>, or <tt>time</tt>. These names are reserved.
--   Dimension names cannot start with <tt>ts_</tt> or
--   <tt>measure_value</tt> and they cannot contain the colon (<tt>:</tt>)
--   character.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:TimestreamDimension'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamDimension_value</a> - The value to write in this column
--   of the database record.
newTimestreamDimension :: Text -> Text -> TimestreamDimension

-- | The metadata dimension name. This is the name of the column in the
--   Amazon Timestream database table record.
--   
--   Dimensions cannot be named: <tt>measure_name</tt>,
--   <tt>measure_value</tt>, or <tt>time</tt>. These names are reserved.
--   Dimension names cannot start with <tt>ts_</tt> or
--   <tt>measure_value</tt> and they cannot contain the colon (<tt>:</tt>)
--   character.
timestreamDimension_name :: Lens' TimestreamDimension Text

-- | The value to write in this column of the database record.
timestreamDimension_value :: Lens' TimestreamDimension Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamDimension.TimestreamDimension
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamDimension.TimestreamDimension
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamDimension.TimestreamDimension
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamDimension.TimestreamDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamDimension.TimestreamDimension
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamDimension.TimestreamDimension
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamDimension.TimestreamDimension
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamDimension.TimestreamDimension


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamTimestamp

-- | Describes how to interpret an application-defined timestamp value from
--   an MQTT message payload and the precision of that value.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimestreamTimestamp</a> smart constructor.
data TimestreamTimestamp
TimestreamTimestamp' :: Text -> Text -> TimestreamTimestamp

-- | An expression that returns a long epoch time value.
[$sel:value:TimestreamTimestamp'] :: TimestreamTimestamp -> Text

-- | The precision of the timestamp value that results from the expression
--   described in <tt>value</tt>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>SECONDS</tt> | <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt> |
--   <tt>MICROSECONDS</tt> | <tt>NANOSECONDS</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt>.
[$sel:unit:TimestreamTimestamp'] :: TimestreamTimestamp -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TimestreamTimestamp</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:TimestreamTimestamp'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamTimestamp_value</a> - An expression that returns a long
--   epoch time value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:TimestreamTimestamp'</a>, <a>timestreamTimestamp_unit</a>
--   - The precision of the timestamp value that results from the
--   expression described in <tt>value</tt>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>SECONDS</tt> | <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt> |
--   <tt>MICROSECONDS</tt> | <tt>NANOSECONDS</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt>.
newTimestreamTimestamp :: Text -> Text -> TimestreamTimestamp

-- | An expression that returns a long epoch time value.
timestreamTimestamp_value :: Lens' TimestreamTimestamp Text

-- | The precision of the timestamp value that results from the expression
--   described in <tt>value</tt>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>SECONDS</tt> | <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt> |
--   <tt>MICROSECONDS</tt> | <tt>NANOSECONDS</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt>.
timestreamTimestamp_unit :: Lens' TimestreamTimestamp Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamTimestamp.TimestreamTimestamp
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamTimestamp.TimestreamTimestamp
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamTimestamp.TimestreamTimestamp
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamTimestamp.TimestreamTimestamp
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamTimestamp.TimestreamTimestamp
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamTimestamp.TimestreamTimestamp
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamTimestamp.TimestreamTimestamp
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamTimestamp.TimestreamTimestamp


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamAction

-- | The Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT
--   message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the
--   <a>Timestream</a> topic rule action documentation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimestreamAction</a> smart constructor.
data TimestreamAction
TimestreamAction' :: Maybe TimestreamTimestamp -> Text -> Text -> Text -> NonEmpty TimestreamDimension -> TimestreamAction

-- | Specifies an application-defined value to replace the default value
--   assigned to the Timestream record's timestamp in the <tt>time</tt>
--   column.
--   
--   You can use this property to specify the value and the precision of
--   the Timestream record's timestamp. You can specify a value from the
--   message payload or a value computed by a substitution template.
--   
--   If omitted, the topic rule action assigns the timestamp, in
--   milliseconds, at the time it processed the rule.
[$sel:timestamp:TimestreamAction'] :: TimestreamAction -> Maybe TimestreamTimestamp

-- | The ARN of the role that grants permission to write to the Amazon
--   Timestream database table.
[$sel:roleArn:TimestreamAction'] :: TimestreamAction -> Text

-- | The name of an Amazon Timestream database.
[$sel:databaseName:TimestreamAction'] :: TimestreamAction -> Text

-- | The name of the database table into which to write the measure
--   records.
[$sel:tableName:TimestreamAction'] :: TimestreamAction -> Text

-- | Metadata attributes of the time series that are written in each
--   measure record.
[$sel:dimensions:TimestreamAction'] :: TimestreamAction -> NonEmpty TimestreamDimension

-- | Create a value of <a>TimestreamAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:TimestreamAction'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamAction_timestamp</a> - Specifies an application-defined
--   value to replace the default value assigned to the Timestream record's
--   timestamp in the <tt>time</tt> column.
--   
--   You can use this property to specify the value and the precision of
--   the Timestream record's timestamp. You can specify a value from the
--   message payload or a value computed by a substitution template.
--   
--   If omitted, the topic rule action assigns the timestamp, in
--   milliseconds, at the time it processed the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:TimestreamAction'</a>, <a>timestreamAction_roleArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the role that grants permission to write to the Amazon
--   Timestream database table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:TimestreamAction'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamAction_databaseName</a> - The name of an Amazon
--   Timestream database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableName:TimestreamAction'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamAction_tableName</a> - The name of the database table
--   into which to write the measure records.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:TimestreamAction'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamAction_dimensions</a> - Metadata attributes of the time
--   series that are written in each measure record.
newTimestreamAction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> NonEmpty TimestreamDimension -> TimestreamAction

-- | Specifies an application-defined value to replace the default value
--   assigned to the Timestream record's timestamp in the <tt>time</tt>
--   column.
--   
--   You can use this property to specify the value and the precision of
--   the Timestream record's timestamp. You can specify a value from the
--   message payload or a value computed by a substitution template.
--   
--   If omitted, the topic rule action assigns the timestamp, in
--   milliseconds, at the time it processed the rule.
timestreamAction_timestamp :: Lens' TimestreamAction (Maybe TimestreamTimestamp)

-- | The ARN of the role that grants permission to write to the Amazon
--   Timestream database table.
timestreamAction_roleArn :: Lens' TimestreamAction Text

-- | The name of an Amazon Timestream database.
timestreamAction_databaseName :: Lens' TimestreamAction Text

-- | The name of the database table into which to write the measure
--   records.
timestreamAction_tableName :: Lens' TimestreamAction Text

-- | Metadata attributes of the time series that are written in each
--   measure record.
timestreamAction_dimensions :: Lens' TimestreamAction (NonEmpty TimestreamDimension)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamAction.TimestreamAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamAction.TimestreamAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamAction.TimestreamAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamAction.TimestreamAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamAction.TimestreamAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamAction.TimestreamAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamAction.TimestreamAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TimestreamAction.TimestreamAction


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Action

-- | Describes the actions associated with a rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAction</a> smart constructor.
data Action
Action' :: Maybe CloudwatchMetricAction -> Maybe CloudwatchLogsAction -> Maybe DynamoDBv2Action -> Maybe StepFunctionsAction -> Maybe CloudwatchAlarmAction -> Maybe SnsAction -> Maybe DynamoDBAction -> Maybe FirehoseAction -> Maybe TimestreamAction -> Maybe IotSiteWiseAction -> Maybe IotAnalyticsAction -> Maybe LambdaAction -> Maybe OpenSearchAction -> Maybe IotEventsAction -> Maybe SalesforceAction -> Maybe KinesisAction -> Maybe S3Action -> Maybe HttpAction -> Maybe ElasticsearchAction -> Maybe KafkaAction -> Maybe RepublishAction -> Maybe SqsAction -> Action

-- | Capture a CloudWatch metric.
[$sel:cloudwatchMetric:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe CloudwatchMetricAction

-- | Send data to CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:cloudwatchLogs:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe CloudwatchLogsAction

-- | Write to a DynamoDB table. This is a new version of the DynamoDB
--   action. It allows you to write each attribute in an MQTT message
--   payload into a separate DynamoDB column.
[$sel:dynamoDBv2:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe DynamoDBv2Action

-- | Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.
[$sel:stepFunctions:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe StepFunctionsAction

-- | Change the state of a CloudWatch alarm.
[$sel:cloudwatchAlarm:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe CloudwatchAlarmAction

-- | Publish to an Amazon SNS topic.
[$sel:sns:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe SnsAction

-- | Write to a DynamoDB table.
[$sel:dynamoDB:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe DynamoDBAction

-- | Write to an Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
[$sel:firehose:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe FirehoseAction

-- | The Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT
--   message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the
--   <a>Timestream</a> topic rule action documentation.
[$sel:timestream:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe TimestreamAction

-- | Sends data from the MQTT message that triggered the rule to IoT
--   SiteWise asset properties.
[$sel:iotSiteWise:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe IotSiteWiseAction

-- | Sends message data to an IoT Analytics channel.
[$sel:iotAnalytics:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe IotAnalyticsAction

-- | Invoke a Lambda function.
[$sel:lambda:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe LambdaAction

-- | Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
[$sel:openSearch:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe OpenSearchAction

-- | Sends an input to an IoT Events detector.
[$sel:iotEvents:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe IotEventsAction

-- | Send a message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.
[$sel:salesforce:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe SalesforceAction

-- | Write data to an Amazon Kinesis stream.
[$sel:kinesis:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe KinesisAction

-- | Write to an Amazon S3 bucket.
[$sel:s3:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe S3Action

-- | Send data to an HTTPS endpoint.
[$sel:http:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe HttpAction

-- | Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
--   
--   The <tt>Elasticsearch</tt> action can only be used by existing rule
--   actions. To create a new rule action or to update an existing rule
--   action, use the <tt>OpenSearch</tt> rule action instead. For more
--   information, see <a>OpenSearchAction</a>.
[$sel:elasticsearch:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe ElasticsearchAction

-- | Send messages to an Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon
--   MSK) or self-managed Apache Kafka cluster.
[$sel:kafka:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe KafkaAction

-- | Publish to another MQTT topic.
[$sel:republish:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe RepublishAction

-- | Publish to an Amazon SQS queue.
[$sel:sqs:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe SqsAction

-- | Create a value of <a>Action</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudwatchMetric:Action'</a>, <a>action_cloudwatchMetric</a> -
--   Capture a CloudWatch metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudwatchLogs:Action'</a>, <a>action_cloudwatchLogs</a> -
--   Send data to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamoDBv2:Action'</a>, <a>action_dynamoDBv2</a> - Write to a
--   DynamoDB table. This is a new version of the DynamoDB action. It
--   allows you to write each attribute in an MQTT message payload into a
--   separate DynamoDB column.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepFunctions:Action'</a>, <a>action_stepFunctions</a> -
--   Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudwatchAlarm:Action'</a>, <a>action_cloudwatchAlarm</a> -
--   Change the state of a CloudWatch alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sns:Action'</a>, <a>action_sns</a> - Publish to an Amazon SNS
--   topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamoDB:Action'</a>, <a>action_dynamoDB</a> - Write to a
--   DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firehose:Action'</a>, <a>action_firehose</a> - Write to an
--   Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestream:Action'</a>, <a>action_timestream</a> - The
--   Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT
--   message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the
--   <a>Timestream</a> topic rule action documentation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iotSiteWise:Action'</a>, <a>action_iotSiteWise</a> - Sends
--   data from the MQTT message that triggered the rule to IoT SiteWise
--   asset properties.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iotAnalytics:Action'</a>, <a>action_iotAnalytics</a> - Sends
--   message data to an IoT Analytics channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambda:Action'</a>, <a>action_lambda</a> - Invoke a Lambda
--   function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openSearch:Action'</a>, <a>action_openSearch</a> - Write data
--   to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iotEvents:Action'</a>, <a>action_iotEvents</a> - Sends an
--   input to an IoT Events detector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:salesforce:Action'</a>, <a>action_salesforce</a> - Send a
--   message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesis:Action'</a>, <a>action_kinesis</a> - Write data to an
--   Amazon Kinesis stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3:Action'</a>, <a>action_s3</a> - Write to an Amazon S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:http:Action'</a>, <a>action_http</a> - Send data to an HTTPS
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticsearch:Action'</a>, <a>action_elasticsearch</a> - Write
--   data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
--   
--   The <tt>Elasticsearch</tt> action can only be used by existing rule
--   actions. To create a new rule action or to update an existing rule
--   action, use the <tt>OpenSearch</tt> rule action instead. For more
--   information, see <a>OpenSearchAction</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafka:Action'</a>, <a>action_kafka</a> - Send messages to an
--   Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK) or self-managed
--   Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:republish:Action'</a>, <a>action_republish</a> - Publish to
--   another MQTT topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sqs:Action'</a>, <a>action_sqs</a> - Publish to an Amazon SQS
--   queue.
newAction :: Action

-- | Capture a CloudWatch metric.
action_cloudwatchMetric :: Lens' Action (Maybe CloudwatchMetricAction)

-- | Send data to CloudWatch Logs.
action_cloudwatchLogs :: Lens' Action (Maybe CloudwatchLogsAction)

-- | Write to a DynamoDB table. This is a new version of the DynamoDB
--   action. It allows you to write each attribute in an MQTT message
--   payload into a separate DynamoDB column.
action_dynamoDBv2 :: Lens' Action (Maybe DynamoDBv2Action)

-- | Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.
action_stepFunctions :: Lens' Action (Maybe StepFunctionsAction)

-- | Change the state of a CloudWatch alarm.
action_cloudwatchAlarm :: Lens' Action (Maybe CloudwatchAlarmAction)

-- | Publish to an Amazon SNS topic.
action_sns :: Lens' Action (Maybe SnsAction)

-- | Write to a DynamoDB table.
action_dynamoDB :: Lens' Action (Maybe DynamoDBAction)

-- | Write to an Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
action_firehose :: Lens' Action (Maybe FirehoseAction)

-- | The Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT
--   message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the
--   <a>Timestream</a> topic rule action documentation.
action_timestream :: Lens' Action (Maybe TimestreamAction)

-- | Sends data from the MQTT message that triggered the rule to IoT
--   SiteWise asset properties.
action_iotSiteWise :: Lens' Action (Maybe IotSiteWiseAction)

-- | Sends message data to an IoT Analytics channel.
action_iotAnalytics :: Lens' Action (Maybe IotAnalyticsAction)

-- | Invoke a Lambda function.
action_lambda :: Lens' Action (Maybe LambdaAction)

-- | Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
action_openSearch :: Lens' Action (Maybe OpenSearchAction)

-- | Sends an input to an IoT Events detector.
action_iotEvents :: Lens' Action (Maybe IotEventsAction)

-- | Send a message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.
action_salesforce :: Lens' Action (Maybe SalesforceAction)

-- | Write data to an Amazon Kinesis stream.
action_kinesis :: Lens' Action (Maybe KinesisAction)

-- | Write to an Amazon S3 bucket.
action_s3 :: Lens' Action (Maybe S3Action)

-- | Send data to an HTTPS endpoint.
action_http :: Lens' Action (Maybe HttpAction)

-- | Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
--   
--   The <tt>Elasticsearch</tt> action can only be used by existing rule
--   actions. To create a new rule action or to update an existing rule
--   action, use the <tt>OpenSearch</tt> rule action instead. For more
--   information, see <a>OpenSearchAction</a>.
action_elasticsearch :: Lens' Action (Maybe ElasticsearchAction)

-- | Send messages to an Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon
--   MSK) or self-managed Apache Kafka cluster.
action_kafka :: Lens' Action (Maybe KafkaAction)

-- | Publish to another MQTT topic.
action_republish :: Lens' Action (Maybe RepublishAction)

-- | Publish to an Amazon SQS queue.
action_sqs :: Lens' Action (Maybe SqsAction)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Action.Action
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Action.Action
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Action.Action
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Action.Action
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Action.Action
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Action.Action
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Action.Action
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.Action.Action

--   request.

--   value of the <tt>serverName</tt> key in a TLS authorization request.

--   request.

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRule

-- | Describes a rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicRule</a> smart constructor.
data TopicRule
TopicRule' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [Action] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> TopicRule

-- | The date and time the rule was created.
[$sel:createdAt:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The actions associated with the rule.
[$sel:actions:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe [Action]

-- | The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.
[$sel:awsIotSqlVersion:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to perform when an error occurs.
[$sel:errorAction:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Action

-- | Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
[$sel:ruleDisabled:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the rule.
[$sel:ruleName:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The SQL statement used to query the topic. When using a SQL query with
--   multiple lines, be sure to escape the newline characters.
[$sel:sql:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the rule.
[$sel:description:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_createdAt</a> - The
--   date and time the rule was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actions:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_actions</a> - The actions
--   associated with the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsIotSqlVersion:TopicRule'</a>,
--   <a>topicRule_awsIotSqlVersion</a> - The version of the SQL rules
--   engine to use when evaluating the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorAction:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_errorAction</a> - The
--   action to perform when an error occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleDisabled:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_ruleDisabled</a> -
--   Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleName:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_ruleName</a> - The name
--   of the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sql:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_sql</a> - The SQL statement
--   used to query the topic. When using a SQL query with multiple lines,
--   be sure to escape the newline characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_description</a> - The
--   description of the rule.
newTopicRule :: TopicRule

-- | The date and time the rule was created.
topicRule_createdAt :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The actions associated with the rule.
topicRule_actions :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe [Action])

-- | The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.
topicRule_awsIotSqlVersion :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to perform when an error occurs.
topicRule_errorAction :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Action)

-- | Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
topicRule_ruleDisabled :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the rule.
topicRule_ruleName :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The SQL statement used to query the topic. When using a SQL query with
--   multiple lines, be sure to escape the newline characters.
topicRule_sql :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the rule.
topicRule_description :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRule.TopicRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRule.TopicRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRule.TopicRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRule.TopicRule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRule.TopicRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRule.TopicRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRule.TopicRule

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRulePayload

-- | Describes a rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicRulePayload</a> smart constructor.
data TopicRulePayload
TopicRulePayload' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> [Action] -> TopicRulePayload

-- | The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.
[$sel:awsIotSqlVersion:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to take when an error occurs.
[$sel:errorAction:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> Maybe Action

-- | Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
[$sel:ruleDisabled:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> Maybe Bool

-- | The description of the rule.
[$sel:description:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> Maybe Text

-- | The SQL statement used to query the topic. For more information, see
--   <a>IoT SQL Reference</a> in the <i>IoT Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:sql:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> Text

-- | The actions associated with the rule.
[$sel:actions:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> [Action]

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicRulePayload</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsIotSqlVersion:TopicRulePayload'</a>,
--   <a>topicRulePayload_awsIotSqlVersion</a> - The version of the SQL
--   rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorAction:TopicRulePayload'</a>,
--   <a>topicRulePayload_errorAction</a> - The action to take when an error
--   occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleDisabled:TopicRulePayload'</a>,
--   <a>topicRulePayload_ruleDisabled</a> - Specifies whether the rule is
--   disabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:TopicRulePayload'</a>,
--   <a>topicRulePayload_description</a> - The description of the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sql:TopicRulePayload'</a>, <a>topicRulePayload_sql</a> - The
--   SQL statement used to query the topic. For more information, see
--   <a>IoT SQL Reference</a> in the <i>IoT Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actions:TopicRulePayload'</a>, <a>topicRulePayload_actions</a>
--   - The actions associated with the rule.
newTopicRulePayload :: Text -> TopicRulePayload

-- | The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.
topicRulePayload_awsIotSqlVersion :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to take when an error occurs.
topicRulePayload_errorAction :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Action)

-- | Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
topicRulePayload_ruleDisabled :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Bool)

-- | The description of the rule.
topicRulePayload_description :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Text)

-- | The SQL statement used to query the topic. For more information, see
--   <a>IoT SQL Reference</a> in the <i>IoT Developer Guide</i>.
topicRulePayload_sql :: Lens' TopicRulePayload Text

-- | The actions associated with the rule.
topicRulePayload_actions :: Lens' TopicRulePayload [Action]

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRulePayload.TopicRulePayload
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRulePayload.TopicRulePayload

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TransferData

-- | Data used to transfer a certificate to an Amazon Web Services account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTransferData</a> smart constructor.
data TransferData
TransferData' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> TransferData

-- | The date the transfer took place.
[$sel:transferDate:TransferData'] :: TransferData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date the transfer was accepted.
[$sel:acceptDate:TransferData'] :: TransferData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The transfer message.
[$sel:transferMessage:TransferData'] :: TransferData -> Maybe Text

-- | The date the transfer was rejected.
[$sel:rejectDate:TransferData'] :: TransferData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The reason why the transfer was rejected.
[$sel:rejectReason:TransferData'] :: TransferData -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TransferData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferDate:TransferData'</a>,
--   <a>transferData_transferDate</a> - The date the transfer took place.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptDate:TransferData'</a>, <a>transferData_acceptDate</a> -
--   The date the transfer was accepted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferMessage:TransferData'</a>,
--   <a>transferData_transferMessage</a> - The transfer message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rejectDate:TransferData'</a>, <a>transferData_rejectDate</a> -
--   The date the transfer was rejected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rejectReason:TransferData'</a>,
--   <a>transferData_rejectReason</a> - The reason why the transfer was
--   rejected.
newTransferData :: TransferData

-- | The date the transfer took place.
transferData_transferDate :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date the transfer was accepted.
transferData_acceptDate :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The transfer message.
transferData_transferMessage :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the transfer was rejected.
transferData_rejectDate :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The reason why the transfer was rejected.
transferData_rejectReason :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TransferData.TransferData
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TransferData.TransferData
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TransferData.TransferData
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TransferData.TransferData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TransferData.TransferData
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TransferData.TransferData
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TransferData.TransferData


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.CertificateDescription

-- | Describes a certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificateDescription</a> smart constructor.
data CertificateDescription
CertificateDescription' :: Maybe CertificateStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CertificateMode -> Maybe CertificateValidity -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TransferData -> Maybe Natural -> CertificateDescription

-- | The status of the certificate.
[$sel:status:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe CertificateStatus

-- | The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the certificate.
[$sel:ownedBy:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time the certificate was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The certificate ID of the CA certificate used to sign this
--   certificate.
[$sel:caCertificateId:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon Web Services account of the previous owner of the
--   certificate.
[$sel:previousOwnedBy:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The certificate data, in PEM format.
[$sel:certificatePem:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateArn:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateId:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The mode of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateMode:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe CertificateMode

-- | When the certificate is valid.
[$sel:validity:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe CertificateValidity

-- | The date and time the certificate was created.
[$sel:creationDate:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The generation ID of the certificate.
[$sel:generationId:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The transfer data.
[$sel:transferData:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe TransferData

-- | The customer version of the certificate.
[$sel:customerVersion:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>CertificateDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_status</a> - The status of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ownedBy:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_ownedBy</a> - The ID of the Amazon Web
--   Services account that owns the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time the
--   certificate was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:caCertificateId:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_caCertificateId</a> - The certificate ID of
--   the CA certificate used to sign this certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:previousOwnedBy:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_previousOwnedBy</a> - The ID of the Amazon
--   Web Services account of the previous owner of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificatePem:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_certificatePem</a> - The certificate data,
--   in PEM format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_certificateArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_certificateId</a> - The ID of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateMode:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_certificateMode</a> - The mode of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validity:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_validity</a> - When the certificate is
--   valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_creationDate</a> - The date and time the
--   certificate was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:generationId:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_generationId</a> - The generation ID of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferData:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_transferData</a> - The transfer data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customerVersion:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_customerVersion</a> - The customer version
--   of the certificate.
newCertificateDescription :: CertificateDescription

-- | The status of the certificate.
certificateDescription_status :: Lens' CertificateDescription (Maybe CertificateStatus)

-- | The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the certificate.
certificateDescription_ownedBy :: Lens' CertificateDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time the certificate was last modified.
certificateDescription_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' CertificateDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

--   certificate.
certificateDescription_caCertificateId :: Lens' CertificateDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon Web Services account of the previous owner of the
--   certificate.
certificateDescription_previousOwnedBy :: Lens' CertificateDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The certificate data, in PEM format.
certificateDescription_certificatePem :: Lens' CertificateDescription (Maybe Text)

certificateDescription_certificateArn :: Lens' CertificateDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the certificate.
certificateDescription_certificateId :: Lens' CertificateDescription (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionParams

-- | The set of parameters for this mitigation action. You can specify only
--   one type of parameter (in other words, you can apply only one action
--   for each defined mitigation action).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMitigationActionParams</a> smart constructor.
data MitigationActionParams
MitigationActionParams' :: Maybe EnableIoTLoggingParams -> Maybe AddThingsToThingGroupParams -> Maybe UpdateCACertificateParams -> Maybe UpdateDeviceCertificateParams -> Maybe ReplaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams -> Maybe PublishFindingToSnsParams -> MitigationActionParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that enables Amazon Web
--   Services IoT Core logging at a specified level of detail.
[$sel:enableIoTLoggingParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe EnableIoTLoggingParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that moves devices associated
--   with a certificate to one or more specified thing groups, typically
--   for quarantine.
[$sel:addThingsToThingGroupParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe AddThingsToThingGroupParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the
--   CA certificate to inactive.
[$sel:updateCACertificateParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe UpdateCACertificateParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the
--   device certificate to inactive.
[$sel:updateDeviceCertificateParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe UpdateDeviceCertificateParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that adds a blank policy to
--   restrict permissions.
[$sel:replaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe ReplaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that publishes findings to
--   Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS. You can implement your
--   own custom actions in response to the Amazon SNS messages.
[$sel:publishFindingToSnsParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe PublishFindingToSnsParams

-- | Create a value of <a>MitigationActionParams</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableIoTLoggingParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionParams_enableIoTLoggingParams</a> - Parameters to
--   define a mitigation action that enables Amazon Web Services IoT Core
--   logging at a specified level of detail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addThingsToThingGroupParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionParams_addThingsToThingGroupParams</a> - Parameters
--   to define a mitigation action that moves devices associated with a
--   certificate to one or more specified thing groups, typically for
--   quarantine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateCACertificateParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionParams_updateCACertificateParams</a> - Parameters
--   to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the CA
--   certificate to inactive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateDeviceCertificateParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionParams_updateDeviceCertificateParams</a> -
--   Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the
--   device certificate to inactive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionParams_replaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams</a> -
--   Parameters to define a mitigation action that adds a blank policy to
--   restrict permissions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publishFindingToSnsParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionParams_publishFindingToSnsParams</a> - Parameters
--   to define a mitigation action that publishes findings to Amazon Simple
--   Notification Service (Amazon SNS. You can implement your own custom
--   actions in response to the Amazon SNS messages.
newMitigationActionParams :: MitigationActionParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that enables Amazon Web
--   Services IoT Core logging at a specified level of detail.
mitigationActionParams_enableIoTLoggingParams :: Lens' MitigationActionParams (Maybe EnableIoTLoggingParams)

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that moves devices associated
--   with a certificate to one or more specified thing groups, typically
--   for quarantine.
mitigationActionParams_addThingsToThingGroupParams :: Lens' MitigationActionParams (Maybe AddThingsToThingGroupParams)

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the
--   CA certificate to inactive.
mitigationActionParams_updateCACertificateParams :: Lens' MitigationActionParams (Maybe UpdateCACertificateParams)

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the
--   device certificate to inactive.
mitigationActionParams_updateDeviceCertificateParams :: Lens' MitigationActionParams (Maybe UpdateDeviceCertificateParams)

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that adds a blank policy to
--   restrict permissions.
mitigationActionParams_replaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams :: Lens' MitigationActionParams (Maybe ReplaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams)

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that publishes findings to
--   Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS. You can implement your
--   own custom actions in response to the Amazon SNS messages.
mitigationActionParams_publishFindingToSnsParams :: Lens' MitigationActionParams (Maybe PublishFindingToSnsParams)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionParams.MitigationActionParams
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionParams.MitigationActionParams
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionParams.MitigationActionParams
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionParams.MitigationActionParams
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionParams.MitigationActionParams
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionParams.MitigationActionParams
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionParams.MitigationActionParams
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationActionParams.MitigationActionParams


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationAction

-- | Describes which changes should be applied as part of a mitigation
--   action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMitigationAction</a> smart constructor.
data MitigationAction
MitigationAction' :: Maybe MitigationActionParams -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MitigationAction

-- | The set of parameters for this mitigation action. The parameters vary,
--   depending on the kind of action you apply.
[$sel:actionParams:MitigationAction'] :: MitigationAction -> Maybe MitigationActionParams

-- | A user-friendly name for the mitigation action.
[$sel:name:MitigationAction'] :: MitigationAction -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for the mitigation action.
[$sel:id:MitigationAction'] :: MitigationAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role ARN used to apply this mitigation action.
[$sel:roleArn:MitigationAction'] :: MitigationAction -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MitigationAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionParams:MitigationAction'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationAction_actionParams</a> - The set of parameters for this
--   mitigation action. The parameters vary, depending on the kind of
--   action you apply.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:MitigationAction'</a>, <a>mitigationAction_name</a> - A
--   user-friendly name for the mitigation action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:MitigationAction'</a>, <a>mitigationAction_id</a> - A
--   unique identifier for the mitigation action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:MitigationAction'</a>, <a>mitigationAction_roleArn</a>
--   - The IAM role ARN used to apply this mitigation action.
newMitigationAction :: MitigationAction

-- | The set of parameters for this mitigation action. The parameters vary,
--   depending on the kind of action you apply.
mitigationAction_actionParams :: Lens' MitigationAction (Maybe MitigationActionParams)

-- | A user-friendly name for the mitigation action.
mitigationAction_name :: Lens' MitigationAction (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for the mitigation action.
mitigationAction_id :: Lens' MitigationAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role ARN used to apply this mitigation action.
mitigationAction_roleArn :: Lens' MitigationAction (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationAction.MitigationAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationAction.MitigationAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationAction.MitigationAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationAction.MitigationAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationAction.MitigationAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationAction.MitigationAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.MitigationAction.MitigationAction

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ActiveViolation

-- | Information about an active Device Defender security profile behavior
--   violation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActiveViolation</a> smart constructor.
data ActiveViolation
ActiveViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe MetricValue -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Behavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VerificationState -> ActiveViolation

-- | The description of the verification state of the violation.
[$sel:verificationStateDescription:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The value of the metric (the measurement) that caused the most recent
--   violation.
[$sel:lastViolationValue:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe MetricValue

-- | The time the most recent violation occurred.
[$sel:lastViolationTime:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time the violation started.
[$sel:violationStartTime:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ID of the active violation.
[$sel:violationId:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The behavior that is being violated.
[$sel:behavior:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe Behavior

-- | The security profile with the behavior is in violation.
[$sel:securityProfileName:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The details of a violation event.
[$sel:violationEventAdditionalInfo:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo

-- | The name of the thing responsible for the active violation.
[$sel:thingName:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).
[$sel:verificationState:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe VerificationState

-- | Create a value of <a>ActiveViolation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationStateDescription:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_verificationStateDescription</a> - The description
--   of the verification state of the violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastViolationValue:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_lastViolationValue</a> - The value of the metric
--   (the measurement) that caused the most recent violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastViolationTime:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_lastViolationTime</a> - The time the most recent
--   violation occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationStartTime:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_violationStartTime</a> - The time the violation
--   started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationId:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_violationId</a> - The ID of the active violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behavior:ActiveViolation'</a>, <a>activeViolation_behavior</a>
--   - The behavior that is being violated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileName:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_securityProfileName</a> - The security profile with
--   the behavior is in violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationEventAdditionalInfo:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_violationEventAdditionalInfo</a> - The details of a
--   violation event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_thingName</a> - The name of the thing responsible
--   for the active violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationState:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_verificationState</a> - The verification state of
--   the violation (detect alarm).
newActiveViolation :: ActiveViolation

-- | The description of the verification state of the violation.
activeViolation_verificationStateDescription :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the metric (the measurement) that caused the most recent
--   violation.
activeViolation_lastViolationValue :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe MetricValue)

-- | The time the most recent violation occurred.
activeViolation_lastViolationTime :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time the violation started.
activeViolation_violationStartTime :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the active violation.
activeViolation_violationId :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The behavior that is being violated.
activeViolation_behavior :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe Behavior)

-- | The security profile with the behavior is in violation.
activeViolation_securityProfileName :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The details of a violation event.
activeViolation_violationEventAdditionalInfo :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo)

-- | The name of the thing responsible for the active violation.
activeViolation_thingName :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).
activeViolation_verificationState :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe VerificationState)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ActiveViolation.ActiveViolation

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary

-- | The summary of the mitigation action tasks.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary
DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ViolationEventOccurrenceRange -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe DetectMitigationActionsTaskStatistics -> Maybe [MitigationAction] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe DetectMitigationActionsTaskTarget -> Maybe DetectMitigationActionsTaskStatus -> DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary

-- | Includes only active violations.
[$sel:onlyActiveViolationsIncluded:DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary'] :: DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | Includes suppressed alerts.
[$sel:suppressedAlertsIncluded:DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary'] :: DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the time period of which violation events occurred between.
[$sel:violationEventOccurrenceRange:DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary'] :: DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary -> Maybe ViolationEventOccurrenceRange
