[$sel:taskId:DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary'] :: DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The date the task started.
[$sel:taskStartTime:DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary'] :: DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The statistics of a mitigation action task.
[$sel:taskStatistics:DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary'] :: DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary -> Maybe DetectMitigationActionsTaskStatistics

-- | The definition of the actions.
[$sel:actionsDefinition:DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary'] :: DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary -> Maybe [MitigationAction]

-- | The date the task ended.
[$sel:taskEndTime:DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary'] :: DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies the ML Detect findings to which the mitigation actions are
--   applied.
[$sel:target:DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary'] :: DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary -> Maybe DetectMitigationActionsTaskTarget

-- | The status of the task.
[$sel:taskStatus:DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary'] :: DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary -> Maybe DetectMitigationActionsTaskStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>DetectMitigationActionsTaskSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.ViolationEvent

-- | Information about a Device Defender security profile behavior
--   violation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newViolationEvent</a> smart constructor.
data ViolationEvent
ViolationEvent' :: Maybe ViolationEventType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Behavior -> Maybe MetricValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VerificationState -> ViolationEvent

-- | The type of violation event.
[$sel:violationEventType:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe ViolationEventType

-- | The description of the verification state of the violation.
[$sel:verificationStateDescription:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the violation event.
[$sel:violationId:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The behavior that was violated.
[$sel:behavior:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe Behavior

-- | The value of the metric (the measurement).
[$sel:metricValue:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe MetricValue

-- | The name of the security profile whose behavior was violated.
[$sel:securityProfileName:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The details of a violation event.
[$sel:violationEventAdditionalInfo:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo

-- | The time the violation event occurred.
[$sel:violationEventTime:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the thing responsible for the violation event.
[$sel:thingName:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).
[$sel:verificationState:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe VerificationState

-- | Create a value of <a>ViolationEvent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationEventType:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_violationEventType</a> - The type of violation
--   event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationStateDescription:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_verificationStateDescription</a> - The description
--   of the verification state of the violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationId:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_violationId</a> - The ID of the violation event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behavior:ViolationEvent'</a>, <a>violationEvent_behavior</a> -
--   The behavior that was violated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricValue:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_metricValue</a> - The value of the metric (the
--   measurement).
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileName:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_securityProfileName</a> - The name of the security
--   profile whose behavior was violated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationEventAdditionalInfo:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_violationEventAdditionalInfo</a> - The details of a
--   violation event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationEventTime:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_violationEventTime</a> - The time the violation
--   event occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:ViolationEvent'</a>, <a>violationEvent_thingName</a>
--   - The name of the thing responsible for the violation event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationState:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_verificationState</a> - The verification state of

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.VpcDestinationConfiguration

--   destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVpcDestinationConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data VpcDestinationConfiguration

[$sel:vpcId:VpcDestinationConfiguration'] :: VpcDestinationConfiguration -> Text

--   network interfaces (ENIs).

--   fields omitted.

--   VPC destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:VpcDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>vpcDestinationConfiguration_vpcId</a> - The ID of the VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:VpcDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>vpcDestinationConfiguration_roleArn</a> - The ARN of a role that
--   has permission to create and attach to elastic network interfaces
--   (ENIs).

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration

-- | Configuration of the topic rule destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicRuleDestinationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration
TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration' :: Maybe VpcDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe HttpUrlDestinationConfiguration -> TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration

-- | Configuration of the virtual private cloud (VPC) connection.
[$sel:vpcConfiguration:TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration'] :: TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe VpcDestinationConfiguration

-- | Configuration of the HTTP URL.
[$sel:httpUrlConfiguration:TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration'] :: TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration -> Maybe HttpUrlDestinationConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcConfiguration:TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>topicRuleDestinationConfiguration_vpcConfiguration</a> -
--   Configuration of the virtual private cloud (VPC) connection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpUrlConfiguration:TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>topicRuleDestinationConfiguration_httpUrlConfiguration</a> -
--   Configuration of the HTTP URL.
newTopicRuleDestinationConfiguration :: TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration

-- | Configuration of the virtual private cloud (VPC) connection.
topicRuleDestinationConfiguration_vpcConfiguration :: Lens' TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration (Maybe VpcDestinationConfiguration)

-- | Configuration of the HTTP URL.
topicRuleDestinationConfiguration_httpUrlConfiguration :: Lens' TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration (Maybe HttpUrlDestinationConfiguration)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration.TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.VpcDestinationProperties

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRuleDestination

-- | A topic rule destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicRuleDestination</a> smart constructor.
data TopicRuleDestination
TopicRuleDestination' :: Maybe VpcDestinationProperties -> Maybe TopicRuleDestinationStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe HttpUrlDestinationProperties -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> TopicRuleDestination

-- | Properties of the virtual private cloud (VPC) connection.
[$sel:vpcProperties:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe VpcDestinationProperties

-- | The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>ERROR</i> Confirmation could not be completed, for example if
--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can
--   set <tt>status</tt> to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>. Calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe TopicRuleDestinationStatus

-- | The date and time when the topic rule destination was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Properties of the HTTP URL.
[$sel:httpUrlProperties:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe HttpUrlDestinationProperties

-- | The topic rule destination URL.
[$sel:arn:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the topic rule destination was created.
[$sel:createdAt:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Additional details or reason why the topic rule destination is in the
--   current status.
[$sel:statusReason:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicRuleDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcProperties:TopicRuleDestination'</a>,
--   <a>topicRuleDestination_vpcProperties</a> - Properties of the virtual
--   private cloud (VPC) connection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:TopicRuleDestination'</a>,
--   <a>topicRuleDestination_status</a> - The status of the topic rule
--   destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>

--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can

--   </ul>

-- | The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:

--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>

--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>

--   </ul>

module Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRuleDestinationSummary

-- | Information about the topic rule destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicRuleDestinationSummary</a> smart constructor.
data TopicRuleDestinationSummary
TopicRuleDestinationSummary' :: Maybe TopicRuleDestinationStatus -> Maybe HttpUrlDestinationSummary -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe VpcDestinationSummary -> Maybe Text -> TopicRuleDestinationSummary

-- | The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>ERROR</i> Confirmation could not be completed, for example if
--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can
--   set <tt>status</tt> to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>. Calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:TopicRuleDestinationSummary'] :: TopicRuleDestinationSummary -> Maybe TopicRuleDestinationStatus

-- | Information about the HTTP URL.
[$sel:httpUrlSummary:TopicRuleDestinationSummary'] :: TopicRuleDestinationSummary -> Maybe HttpUrlDestinationSummary

-- | The date and time when the topic rule destination was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:TopicRuleDestinationSummary'] :: TopicRuleDestinationSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The topic rule destination ARN.
[$sel:arn:TopicRuleDestinationSummary'] :: TopicRuleDestinationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the topic rule destination was created.
[$sel:createdAt:TopicRuleDestinationSummary'] :: TopicRuleDestinationSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Information about the virtual private cloud (VPC) connection.
[$sel:vpcDestinationSummary:TopicRuleDestinationSummary'] :: TopicRuleDestinationSummary -> Maybe VpcDestinationSummary

-- | The reason the topic rule destination is in the current status.
[$sel:statusReason:TopicRuleDestinationSummary'] :: TopicRuleDestinationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicRuleDestinationSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to

--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.Types.TopicRuleDestinationSummary.TopicRuleDestinationSummary


module Network.AWS.IoT.Types

-- | API version <tt>2015-05-28</tt> of the Amazon IoT SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | This exception occurs if you attempt to start a task with the same
--   task-id as an existing task but with a different clientRequestToken.
_TaskAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Unable to verify the CA certificate used to sign the device
--   certificate you are attempting to register. This is happens when you
--   have registered more than one CA certificate that has the same subject
--   field and public key.
_CertificateConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The Rule-SQL expression can't be parsed correctly.
_SqlParseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The index is not ready.
_IndexNotReadyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request is not valid.
_InvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't transfer the certificate because authorization policies are
--   still attached.
_TransferConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The certificate operation is not allowed.
_CertificateStateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The response is invalid.
_InvalidResponseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The registration code is invalid.
_RegistrationCodeValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The policy documentation is not valid.
_MalformedPolicyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't delete the resource because it is attached to one or more
--   resources.
_DeleteConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource already exists.
_ResourceAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource is not configured.
_NotConfiguredException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The certificate is invalid.
_CertificateValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource with the same name already exists.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource registration failed.
_ResourceRegistrationFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The query is invalid.
_InvalidQueryException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't revert the certificate transfer because the transfer is
--   already complete.
_TransferAlreadyCompletedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The rate exceeds the limit.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The aggregation is invalid.
_InvalidAggregationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A conflicting resource update exception. This exception is thrown when
--   two pending updates cause a conflict.
_ConflictingResourceUpdateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An unexpected error has occurred.
_InternalFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The number of policy versions exceeds the limit.
_VersionsLimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The service is temporarily unavailable.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An unexpected error has occurred.
_InternalException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An exception thrown when the version of an entity specified with the
--   <tt>expectedVersion</tt> parameter does not match the latest version
--   in the system.
_VersionConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You are not authorized to perform this operation.
_UnauthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An attempt was made to change to an invalid state, for example by
--   deleting a job or a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS" without
--   setting the <tt>force</tt> parameter.
_InvalidStateTransitionException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource does not exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A limit has been exceeded.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAbortConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AbortConfig
AbortConfig' :: NonEmpty AbortCriteria -> AbortConfig

-- | The list of criteria that determine when and how to abort the job.
[$sel:criteriaList:AbortConfig'] :: AbortConfig -> NonEmpty AbortCriteria

-- | Create a value of <a>AbortConfig</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:criteriaList:AbortConfig'</a>, <a>abortConfig_criteriaList</a>
--   - The list of criteria that determine when and how to abort the job.
newAbortConfig :: NonEmpty AbortCriteria -> AbortConfig

-- | The list of criteria that determine when and how to abort the job.
abortConfig_criteriaList :: Lens' AbortConfig (NonEmpty AbortCriteria)

-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAbortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data AbortCriteria
AbortCriteria' :: JobExecutionFailureType -> AbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AbortCriteria

-- | The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.
[$sel:failureType:AbortCriteria'] :: AbortCriteria -> JobExecutionFailureType

-- | The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
[$sel:action:AbortCriteria'] :: AbortCriteria -> AbortAction

-- | The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
[$sel:thresholdPercentage:AbortCriteria'] :: AbortCriteria -> Double

-- | The minimum number of things which must receive job execution
--   notifications before the job can be aborted.
[$sel:minNumberOfExecutedThings:AbortCriteria'] :: AbortCriteria -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AbortCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureType:AbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>abortCriteria_failureType</a> - The type of job execution failures
--   that can initiate a job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:AbortCriteria'</a>, <a>abortCriteria_action</a> - The
--   type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thresholdPercentage:AbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>abortCriteria_thresholdPercentage</a> - The minimum percentage of
--   job execution failures that must occur to initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
--   
--   <a>$sel:minNumberOfExecutedThings:AbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>abortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings</a> - The minimum number of
--   things which must receive job execution notifications before the job
--   can be aborted.
newAbortCriteria :: JobExecutionFailureType -> AbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AbortCriteria

-- | The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.
abortCriteria_failureType :: Lens' AbortCriteria JobExecutionFailureType

-- | The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
abortCriteria_action :: Lens' AbortCriteria AbortAction

-- | The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
abortCriteria_thresholdPercentage :: Lens' AbortCriteria Double

-- | The minimum number of things which must receive job execution
--   notifications before the job can be aborted.
abortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings :: Lens' AbortCriteria Natural

-- | Describes the actions associated with a rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAction</a> smart constructor.
data Action
Action' :: Maybe CloudwatchMetricAction -> Maybe CloudwatchLogsAction -> Maybe DynamoDBv2Action -> Maybe StepFunctionsAction -> Maybe CloudwatchAlarmAction -> Maybe SnsAction -> Maybe DynamoDBAction -> Maybe FirehoseAction -> Maybe TimestreamAction -> Maybe IotSiteWiseAction -> Maybe IotAnalyticsAction -> Maybe LambdaAction -> Maybe OpenSearchAction -> Maybe IotEventsAction -> Maybe SalesforceAction -> Maybe KinesisAction -> Maybe S3Action -> Maybe HttpAction -> Maybe ElasticsearchAction -> Maybe KafkaAction -> Maybe RepublishAction -> Maybe SqsAction -> Action

-- | Capture a CloudWatch metric.
[$sel:cloudwatchMetric:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe CloudwatchMetricAction

-- | Send data to CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:cloudwatchLogs:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe CloudwatchLogsAction

-- | Write to a DynamoDB table. This is a new version of the DynamoDB
--   action. It allows you to write each attribute in an MQTT message
--   payload into a separate DynamoDB column.
[$sel:dynamoDBv2:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe DynamoDBv2Action

-- | Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.
[$sel:stepFunctions:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe StepFunctionsAction

-- | Change the state of a CloudWatch alarm.
[$sel:cloudwatchAlarm:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe CloudwatchAlarmAction

-- | Publish to an Amazon SNS topic.
[$sel:sns:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe SnsAction

-- | Write to a DynamoDB table.
[$sel:dynamoDB:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe DynamoDBAction

-- | Write to an Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
[$sel:firehose:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe FirehoseAction

-- | The Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT
--   message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the
--   <a>Timestream</a> topic rule action documentation.
[$sel:timestream:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe TimestreamAction

-- | Sends data from the MQTT message that triggered the rule to IoT
--   SiteWise asset properties.
[$sel:iotSiteWise:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe IotSiteWiseAction

-- | Sends message data to an IoT Analytics channel.
[$sel:iotAnalytics:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe IotAnalyticsAction

-- | Invoke a Lambda function.
[$sel:lambda:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe LambdaAction

-- | Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
[$sel:openSearch:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe OpenSearchAction

-- | Sends an input to an IoT Events detector.
[$sel:iotEvents:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe IotEventsAction

-- | Send a message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.
[$sel:salesforce:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe SalesforceAction

-- | Write data to an Amazon Kinesis stream.
[$sel:kinesis:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe KinesisAction

-- | Write to an Amazon S3 bucket.
[$sel:s3:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe S3Action

-- | Send data to an HTTPS endpoint.
[$sel:http:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe HttpAction

-- | Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
--   
--   The <tt>Elasticsearch</tt> action can only be used by existing rule
--   actions. To create a new rule action or to update an existing rule
--   action, use the <tt>OpenSearch</tt> rule action instead. For more
--   information, see <a>OpenSearchAction</a>.
[$sel:elasticsearch:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe ElasticsearchAction

-- | Send messages to an Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon
--   MSK) or self-managed Apache Kafka cluster.
[$sel:kafka:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe KafkaAction

-- | Publish to another MQTT topic.
[$sel:republish:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe RepublishAction

-- | Publish to an Amazon SQS queue.
[$sel:sqs:Action'] :: Action -> Maybe SqsAction

-- | Create a value of <a>Action</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudwatchMetric:Action'</a>, <a>action_cloudwatchMetric</a> -
--   Capture a CloudWatch metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudwatchLogs:Action'</a>, <a>action_cloudwatchLogs</a> -
--   Send data to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamoDBv2:Action'</a>, <a>action_dynamoDBv2</a> - Write to a
--   DynamoDB table. This is a new version of the DynamoDB action. It
--   allows you to write each attribute in an MQTT message payload into a
--   separate DynamoDB column.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepFunctions:Action'</a>, <a>action_stepFunctions</a> -
--   Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudwatchAlarm:Action'</a>, <a>action_cloudwatchAlarm</a> -
--   Change the state of a CloudWatch alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sns:Action'</a>, <a>action_sns</a> - Publish to an Amazon SNS
--   topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamoDB:Action'</a>, <a>action_dynamoDB</a> - Write to a
--   DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firehose:Action'</a>, <a>action_firehose</a> - Write to an
--   Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestream:Action'</a>, <a>action_timestream</a> - The
--   Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT
--   message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the
--   <a>Timestream</a> topic rule action documentation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iotSiteWise:Action'</a>, <a>action_iotSiteWise</a> - Sends
--   data from the MQTT message that triggered the rule to IoT SiteWise
--   asset properties.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iotAnalytics:Action'</a>, <a>action_iotAnalytics</a> - Sends
--   message data to an IoT Analytics channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambda:Action'</a>, <a>action_lambda</a> - Invoke a Lambda
--   function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openSearch:Action'</a>, <a>action_openSearch</a> - Write data
--   to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iotEvents:Action'</a>, <a>action_iotEvents</a> - Sends an
--   input to an IoT Events detector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:salesforce:Action'</a>, <a>action_salesforce</a> - Send a
--   message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesis:Action'</a>, <a>action_kinesis</a> - Write data to an
--   Amazon Kinesis stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3:Action'</a>, <a>action_s3</a> - Write to an Amazon S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:http:Action'</a>, <a>action_http</a> - Send data to an HTTPS
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticsearch:Action'</a>, <a>action_elasticsearch</a> - Write
--   data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
--   
--   The <tt>Elasticsearch</tt> action can only be used by existing rule
--   actions. To create a new rule action or to update an existing rule
--   action, use the <tt>OpenSearch</tt> rule action instead. For more
--   information, see <a>OpenSearchAction</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafka:Action'</a>, <a>action_kafka</a> - Send messages to an
--   Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK) or self-managed
--   Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:republish:Action'</a>, <a>action_republish</a> - Publish to
--   another MQTT topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sqs:Action'</a>, <a>action_sqs</a> - Publish to an Amazon SQS
--   queue.
newAction :: Action

-- | Capture a CloudWatch metric.
action_cloudwatchMetric :: Lens' Action (Maybe CloudwatchMetricAction)

-- | Send data to CloudWatch Logs.
action_cloudwatchLogs :: Lens' Action (Maybe CloudwatchLogsAction)

-- | Write to a DynamoDB table. This is a new version of the DynamoDB
--   action. It allows you to write each attribute in an MQTT message
--   payload into a separate DynamoDB column.
action_dynamoDBv2 :: Lens' Action (Maybe DynamoDBv2Action)

-- | Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.
action_stepFunctions :: Lens' Action (Maybe StepFunctionsAction)

-- | Change the state of a CloudWatch alarm.
action_cloudwatchAlarm :: Lens' Action (Maybe CloudwatchAlarmAction)

-- | Publish to an Amazon SNS topic.
action_sns :: Lens' Action (Maybe SnsAction)

-- | Write to a DynamoDB table.
action_dynamoDB :: Lens' Action (Maybe DynamoDBAction)

-- | Write to an Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
action_firehose :: Lens' Action (Maybe FirehoseAction)

-- | The Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT
--   message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the
--   <a>Timestream</a> topic rule action documentation.
action_timestream :: Lens' Action (Maybe TimestreamAction)

-- | Sends data from the MQTT message that triggered the rule to IoT
--   SiteWise asset properties.
action_iotSiteWise :: Lens' Action (Maybe IotSiteWiseAction)

-- | Sends message data to an IoT Analytics channel.
action_iotAnalytics :: Lens' Action (Maybe IotAnalyticsAction)

-- | Invoke a Lambda function.
action_lambda :: Lens' Action (Maybe LambdaAction)

-- | Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
action_openSearch :: Lens' Action (Maybe OpenSearchAction)

-- | Sends an input to an IoT Events detector.
action_iotEvents :: Lens' Action (Maybe IotEventsAction)

-- | Send a message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.
action_salesforce :: Lens' Action (Maybe SalesforceAction)

-- | Write data to an Amazon Kinesis stream.
action_kinesis :: Lens' Action (Maybe KinesisAction)

-- | Write to an Amazon S3 bucket.
action_s3 :: Lens' Action (Maybe S3Action)

-- | Send data to an HTTPS endpoint.
action_http :: Lens' Action (Maybe HttpAction)

-- | Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
--   
--   The <tt>Elasticsearch</tt> action can only be used by existing rule
--   actions. To create a new rule action or to update an existing rule
--   action, use the <tt>OpenSearch</tt> rule action instead. For more
--   information, see <a>OpenSearchAction</a>.
action_elasticsearch :: Lens' Action (Maybe ElasticsearchAction)

-- | Send messages to an Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon
--   MSK) or self-managed Apache Kafka cluster.
action_kafka :: Lens' Action (Maybe KafkaAction)

-- | Publish to another MQTT topic.
action_republish :: Lens' Action (Maybe RepublishAction)

-- | Publish to an Amazon SQS queue.
action_sqs :: Lens' Action (Maybe SqsAction)

-- | Information about an active Device Defender security profile behavior
--   violation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActiveViolation</a> smart constructor.
data ActiveViolation
ActiveViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe MetricValue -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Behavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VerificationState -> ActiveViolation

-- | The description of the verification state of the violation.
[$sel:verificationStateDescription:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The value of the metric (the measurement) that caused the most recent
--   violation.
[$sel:lastViolationValue:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe MetricValue

-- | The time the most recent violation occurred.
[$sel:lastViolationTime:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time the violation started.
[$sel:violationStartTime:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ID of the active violation.
[$sel:violationId:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The behavior that is being violated.
[$sel:behavior:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe Behavior

-- | The security profile with the behavior is in violation.
[$sel:securityProfileName:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The details of a violation event.
[$sel:violationEventAdditionalInfo:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo

-- | The name of the thing responsible for the active violation.
[$sel:thingName:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe Text

-- | The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).
[$sel:verificationState:ActiveViolation'] :: ActiveViolation -> Maybe VerificationState

-- | Create a value of <a>ActiveViolation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationStateDescription:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_verificationStateDescription</a> - The description
--   of the verification state of the violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastViolationValue:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_lastViolationValue</a> - The value of the metric
--   (the measurement) that caused the most recent violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastViolationTime:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_lastViolationTime</a> - The time the most recent
--   violation occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationStartTime:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_violationStartTime</a> - The time the violation
--   started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationId:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_violationId</a> - The ID of the active violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behavior:ActiveViolation'</a>, <a>activeViolation_behavior</a>
--   - The behavior that is being violated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileName:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_securityProfileName</a> - The security profile with
--   the behavior is in violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationEventAdditionalInfo:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_violationEventAdditionalInfo</a> - The details of a
--   violation event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_thingName</a> - The name of the thing responsible
--   for the active violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationState:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_verificationState</a> - The verification state of
--   the violation (detect alarm).
newActiveViolation :: ActiveViolation

-- | The description of the verification state of the violation.
activeViolation_verificationStateDescription :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the metric (the measurement) that caused the most recent
--   violation.
activeViolation_lastViolationValue :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe MetricValue)

-- | The time the most recent violation occurred.
activeViolation_lastViolationTime :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time the violation started.
activeViolation_violationStartTime :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the active violation.
activeViolation_violationId :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The behavior that is being violated.
activeViolation_behavior :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe Behavior)

-- | The security profile with the behavior is in violation.
activeViolation_securityProfileName :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The details of a violation event.
activeViolation_violationEventAdditionalInfo :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo)

-- | The name of the thing responsible for the active violation.
activeViolation_thingName :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe Text)

-- | The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).
activeViolation_verificationState :: Lens' ActiveViolation (Maybe VerificationState)

-- | Parameters used when defining a mitigation action that move a set of
--   things to a thing group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddThingsToThingGroupParams</a> smart constructor.
data AddThingsToThingGroupParams
AddThingsToThingGroupParams' :: Maybe Bool -> NonEmpty Text -> AddThingsToThingGroupParams

-- | Specifies if this mitigation action can move the things that triggered
--   the mitigation action even if they are part of one or more dynamic
--   thing groups.
[$sel:overrideDynamicGroups:AddThingsToThingGroupParams'] :: AddThingsToThingGroupParams -> Maybe Bool

-- | The list of groups to which you want to add the things that triggered
--   the mitigation action. You can add a thing to a maximum of 10 groups,
--   but you can't add a thing to more than one group in the same
--   hierarchy.
[$sel:thingGroupNames:AddThingsToThingGroupParams'] :: AddThingsToThingGroupParams -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AddThingsToThingGroupParams</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:overrideDynamicGroups:AddThingsToThingGroupParams'</a>,
--   <a>addThingsToThingGroupParams_overrideDynamicGroups</a> - Specifies
--   if this mitigation action can move the things that triggered the
--   mitigation action even if they are part of one or more dynamic thing
--   groups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupNames:AddThingsToThingGroupParams'</a>,
--   <a>addThingsToThingGroupParams_thingGroupNames</a> - The list of
--   groups to which you want to add the things that triggered the
--   mitigation action. You can add a thing to a maximum of 10 groups, but
--   you can't add a thing to more than one group in the same hierarchy.
newAddThingsToThingGroupParams :: NonEmpty Text -> AddThingsToThingGroupParams

-- | Specifies if this mitigation action can move the things that triggered
--   the mitigation action even if they are part of one or more dynamic
--   thing groups.
addThingsToThingGroupParams_overrideDynamicGroups :: Lens' AddThingsToThingGroupParams (Maybe Bool)

-- | The list of groups to which you want to add the things that triggered
--   the mitigation action. You can add a thing to a maximum of 10 groups,
--   but you can't add a thing to more than one group in the same
--   hierarchy.
addThingsToThingGroupParams_thingGroupNames :: Lens' AddThingsToThingGroupParams (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The type of aggregation queries.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAggregationType</a> smart constructor.
data AggregationType
AggregationType' :: Maybe [Text] -> AggregationTypeName -> AggregationType

-- | A list of the values of aggregation types.
[$sel:values:AggregationType'] :: AggregationType -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the aggregation type.
[$sel:name:AggregationType'] :: AggregationType -> AggregationTypeName

-- | Create a value of <a>AggregationType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:AggregationType'</a>, <a>aggregationType_values</a> - A
--   list of the values of aggregation types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AggregationType'</a>, <a>aggregationType_name</a> - The
--   name of the aggregation type.
newAggregationType :: AggregationTypeName -> AggregationType

-- | A list of the values of aggregation types.
aggregationType_values :: Lens' AggregationType (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the aggregation type.
aggregationType_name :: Lens' AggregationType AggregationTypeName

-- | A structure containing the alert target ARN and the role ARN.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAlertTarget</a> smart constructor.
data AlertTarget
AlertTarget' :: Text -> Text -> AlertTarget

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification target to which
--   alerts are sent.
[$sel:alertTargetArn:AlertTarget'] :: AlertTarget -> Text

-- | The ARN of the role that grants permission to send alerts to the
--   notification target.
[$sel:roleArn:AlertTarget'] :: AlertTarget -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AlertTarget</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alertTargetArn:AlertTarget'</a>,
--   <a>alertTarget_alertTargetArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the notification target to which alerts are sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:AlertTarget'</a>, <a>alertTarget_roleArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the role that grants permission to send alerts to the notification
--   target.
newAlertTarget :: Text -> Text -> AlertTarget

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification target to which
--   alerts are sent.
alertTarget_alertTargetArn :: Lens' AlertTarget Text

-- | The ARN of the role that grants permission to send alerts to the
--   notification target.
alertTarget_roleArn :: Lens' AlertTarget Text

-- | Contains information that allowed the authorization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAllowed</a> smart constructor.
data Allowed
Allowed' :: Maybe [Policy] -> Allowed

-- | A list of policies that allowed the authentication.
[$sel:policies:Allowed'] :: Allowed -> Maybe [Policy]

-- | Create a value of <a>Allowed</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policies:Allowed'</a>, <a>allowed_policies</a> - A list of
--   policies that allowed the authentication.
newAllowed :: Allowed

-- | A list of policies that allowed the authentication.
allowed_policies :: Lens' Allowed (Maybe [Policy])

-- | An asset property timestamp entry containing the following
--   information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetPropertyTimestamp</a> smart constructor.
data AssetPropertyTimestamp
AssetPropertyTimestamp' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> AssetPropertyTimestamp

-- | Optional. A string that contains the nanosecond time offset. Accepts
--   substitution templates.
[$sel:offsetInNanos:AssetPropertyTimestamp'] :: AssetPropertyTimestamp -> Maybe Text

-- | A string that contains the time in seconds since epoch. Accepts
--   substitution templates.
[$sel:timeInSeconds:AssetPropertyTimestamp'] :: AssetPropertyTimestamp -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetPropertyTimestamp</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:offsetInNanos:AssetPropertyTimestamp'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyTimestamp_offsetInNanos</a> - Optional. A string that
--   contains the nanosecond time offset. Accepts substitution templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeInSeconds:AssetPropertyTimestamp'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyTimestamp_timeInSeconds</a> - A string that contains
--   the time in seconds since epoch. Accepts substitution templates.
newAssetPropertyTimestamp :: Text -> AssetPropertyTimestamp

-- | Optional. A string that contains the nanosecond time offset. Accepts
--   substitution templates.
assetPropertyTimestamp_offsetInNanos :: Lens' AssetPropertyTimestamp (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that contains the time in seconds since epoch. Accepts
--   substitution templates.
assetPropertyTimestamp_timeInSeconds :: Lens' AssetPropertyTimestamp Text

-- | An asset property value entry containing the following information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetPropertyValue</a> smart constructor.
data AssetPropertyValue
AssetPropertyValue' :: Maybe Text -> AssetPropertyVariant -> AssetPropertyTimestamp -> AssetPropertyValue

-- | Optional. A string that describes the quality of the value. Accepts
--   substitution templates. Must be <tt>GOOD</tt>, <tt>BAD</tt>, or
--   <tt>UNCERTAIN</tt>.
[$sel:quality:AssetPropertyValue'] :: AssetPropertyValue -> Maybe Text

-- | The value of the asset property.
[$sel:value:AssetPropertyValue'] :: AssetPropertyValue -> AssetPropertyVariant

-- | The asset property value timestamp.
[$sel:timestamp:AssetPropertyValue'] :: AssetPropertyValue -> AssetPropertyTimestamp

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetPropertyValue</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:quality:AssetPropertyValue'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyValue_quality</a> - Optional. A string that describes
--   the quality of the value. Accepts substitution templates. Must be
--   <tt>GOOD</tt>, <tt>BAD</tt>, or <tt>UNCERTAIN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:AssetPropertyValue'</a>, <a>assetPropertyValue_value</a>
--   - The value of the asset property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:AssetPropertyValue'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyValue_timestamp</a> - The asset property value
--   timestamp.
newAssetPropertyValue :: AssetPropertyVariant -> AssetPropertyTimestamp -> AssetPropertyValue

-- | Optional. A string that describes the quality of the value. Accepts
--   substitution templates. Must be <tt>GOOD</tt>, <tt>BAD</tt>, or
--   <tt>UNCERTAIN</tt>.
assetPropertyValue_quality :: Lens' AssetPropertyValue (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the asset property.
assetPropertyValue_value :: Lens' AssetPropertyValue AssetPropertyVariant

-- | The asset property value timestamp.
assetPropertyValue_timestamp :: Lens' AssetPropertyValue AssetPropertyTimestamp

-- | Contains an asset property value (of a single type).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetPropertyVariant</a> smart constructor.
data AssetPropertyVariant
AssetPropertyVariant' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AssetPropertyVariant

-- | Optional. A string that contains the integer value of the value entry.
--   Accepts substitution templates.
[$sel:integerValue:AssetPropertyVariant'] :: AssetPropertyVariant -> Maybe Text

-- | Optional. A string that contains the double value of the value entry.
--   Accepts substitution templates.
[$sel:doubleValue:AssetPropertyVariant'] :: AssetPropertyVariant -> Maybe Text

-- | Optional. The string value of the value entry. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
[$sel:stringValue:AssetPropertyVariant'] :: AssetPropertyVariant -> Maybe Text

-- | Optional. A string that contains the boolean value (<tt>true</tt> or
--   <tt>false</tt>) of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.
[$sel:booleanValue:AssetPropertyVariant'] :: AssetPropertyVariant -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetPropertyVariant</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:integerValue:AssetPropertyVariant'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyVariant_integerValue</a> - Optional. A string that
--   contains the integer value of the value entry. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:doubleValue:AssetPropertyVariant'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyVariant_doubleValue</a> - Optional. A string that
--   contains the double value of the value entry. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stringValue:AssetPropertyVariant'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyVariant_stringValue</a> - Optional. The string value
--   of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:booleanValue:AssetPropertyVariant'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyVariant_booleanValue</a> - Optional. A string that
--   contains the boolean value (<tt>true</tt> or <tt>false</tt>) of the
--   value entry. Accepts substitution templates.
newAssetPropertyVariant :: AssetPropertyVariant

-- | Optional. A string that contains the integer value of the value entry.
--   Accepts substitution templates.
assetPropertyVariant_integerValue :: Lens' AssetPropertyVariant (Maybe Text)

-- | Optional. A string that contains the double value of the value entry.
--   Accepts substitution templates.
assetPropertyVariant_doubleValue :: Lens' AssetPropertyVariant (Maybe Text)

-- | Optional. The string value of the value entry. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
assetPropertyVariant_stringValue :: Lens' AssetPropertyVariant (Maybe Text)

-- | Optional. A string that contains the boolean value (<tt>true</tt> or
--   <tt>false</tt>) of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.
assetPropertyVariant_booleanValue :: Lens' AssetPropertyVariant (Maybe Text)

-- | The attribute payload.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttributePayload</a> smart constructor.
data AttributePayload
AttributePayload' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Bool -> AttributePayload

-- | A JSON string containing up to three key-value pair in JSON format.
--   For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"attributes\":{\"string1\":\"string2\"}}
--   </pre>
[$sel:attributes:AttributePayload'] :: AttributePayload -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Specifies whether the list of attributes provided in the
--   <tt>AttributePayload</tt> is merged with the attributes stored in the
--   registry, instead of overwriting them.
--   
--   To remove an attribute, call <tt>UpdateThing</tt> with an empty
--   attribute value.
--   
--   The <tt>merge</tt> attribute is only valid when calling
--   <tt>UpdateThing</tt> or <tt>UpdateThingGroup</tt>.
[$sel:merge:AttributePayload'] :: AttributePayload -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>AttributePayload</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:AttributePayload'</a>,
--   <a>attributePayload_attributes</a> - A JSON string containing up to
--   three key-value pair in JSON format. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"attributes\":{\"string1\":\"string2\"}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:merge:AttributePayload'</a>, <a>attributePayload_merge</a> -
--   Specifies whether the list of attributes provided in the
--   <tt>AttributePayload</tt> is merged with the attributes stored in the
--   registry, instead of overwriting them.
--   
--   To remove an attribute, call <tt>UpdateThing</tt> with an empty
--   attribute value.
--   
--   The <tt>merge</tt> attribute is only valid when calling
--   <tt>UpdateThing</tt> or <tt>UpdateThingGroup</tt>.
newAttributePayload :: AttributePayload

-- | A JSON string containing up to three key-value pair in JSON format.
--   For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"attributes\":{\"string1\":\"string2\"}}
--   </pre>
attributePayload_attributes :: Lens' AttributePayload (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Specifies whether the list of attributes provided in the
--   <tt>AttributePayload</tt> is merged with the attributes stored in the
--   registry, instead of overwriting them.
--   
--   To remove an attribute, call <tt>UpdateThing</tt> with an empty
--   attribute value.
--   
--   The <tt>merge</tt> attribute is only valid when calling
--   <tt>UpdateThing</tt> or <tt>UpdateThingGroup</tt>.
attributePayload_merge :: Lens' AttributePayload (Maybe Bool)

-- | Which audit checks are enabled and disabled for this account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditCheckConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data AuditCheckConfiguration
AuditCheckConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> AuditCheckConfiguration

-- | True if this audit check is enabled for this account.
[$sel:enabled:AuditCheckConfiguration'] :: AuditCheckConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditCheckConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:AuditCheckConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckConfiguration_enabled</a> - True if this audit check is
--   enabled for this account.
newAuditCheckConfiguration :: AuditCheckConfiguration

-- | True if this audit check is enabled for this account.
auditCheckConfiguration_enabled :: Lens' AuditCheckConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Information about the audit check.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditCheckDetails</a> smart constructor.
data AuditCheckDetails
AuditCheckDetails' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuditCheckRunStatus -> AuditCheckDetails

-- | Describes how many of the non-compliant resources created during the
--   evaluation of an audit check were marked as suppressed.
[$sel:suppressedNonCompliantResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of resources on which the check was performed.
[$sel:totalResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Integer

-- | True if the check is complete and found all resources compliant.
[$sel:checkCompliant:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of resources that were found noncompliant during the check.
[$sel:nonCompliantResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Integer

-- | The code of any error encountered when this check is performed during
--   this audit. One of "INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS" or
--   "AUDIT_CHECK_DISABLED".
[$sel:errorCode:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The message associated with any error encountered when this check is
--   performed during this audit.
[$sel:message:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The completion status of this check. One of "IN_PROGRESS",
--   "WAITING_FOR_DATA_COLLECTION", "CANCELED", "COMPLETED_COMPLIANT",
--   "COMPLETED_NON_COMPLIANT", or "FAILED".
[$sel:checkRunStatus:AuditCheckDetails'] :: AuditCheckDetails -> Maybe AuditCheckRunStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditCheckDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressedNonCompliantResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_suppressedNonCompliantResourcesCount</a> -
--   Describes how many of the non-compliant resources created during the
--   evaluation of an audit check were marked as suppressed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_totalResourcesCount</a> - The number of resources
--   on which the check was performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkCompliant:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_checkCompliant</a> - True if the check is
--   complete and found all resources compliant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nonCompliantResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_nonCompliantResourcesCount</a> - The number of
--   resources that were found noncompliant during the check.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_errorCode</a> - The code of any error encountered
--   when this check is performed during this audit. One of
--   "INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS" or "AUDIT_CHECK_DISABLED".
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_message</a> - The message associated with any
--   error encountered when this check is performed during this audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkRunStatus:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_checkRunStatus</a> - The completion status of
--   this check. One of "IN_PROGRESS", "WAITING_FOR_DATA_COLLECTION",
--   "CANCELED", "COMPLETED_COMPLIANT", "COMPLETED_NON_COMPLIANT", or
--   "FAILED".
newAuditCheckDetails :: AuditCheckDetails

-- | Describes how many of the non-compliant resources created during the
--   evaluation of an audit check were marked as suppressed.
auditCheckDetails_suppressedNonCompliantResourcesCount :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of resources on which the check was performed.
auditCheckDetails_totalResourcesCount :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Integer)

-- | True if the check is complete and found all resources compliant.
auditCheckDetails_checkCompliant :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of resources that were found noncompliant during the check.
auditCheckDetails_nonCompliantResourcesCount :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Integer)

-- | The code of any error encountered when this check is performed during
--   this audit. One of "INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS" or
--   "AUDIT_CHECK_DISABLED".
auditCheckDetails_errorCode :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The message associated with any error encountered when this check is
--   performed during this audit.
auditCheckDetails_message :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The completion status of this check. One of "IN_PROGRESS",
--   "WAITING_FOR_DATA_COLLECTION", "CANCELED", "COMPLETED_COMPLIANT",
--   "COMPLETED_NON_COMPLIANT", or "FAILED".
auditCheckDetails_checkRunStatus :: Lens' AuditCheckDetails (Maybe AuditCheckRunStatus)

-- | The findings (results) of the audit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditFinding</a> smart constructor.
data AuditFinding
AuditFinding' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuditFindingSeverity -> Maybe [RelatedResource] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe NonCompliantResource -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AuditFinding

-- | Indicates whether the audit finding was suppressed or not during
--   reporting.
[$sel:isSuppressed:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ID of the audit that generated this result (finding).
[$sel:taskId:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Text

-- | The time the result (finding) was discovered.
[$sel:findingTime:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time the audit started.
[$sel:taskStartTime:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A code that indicates the reason that the resource was noncompliant.
[$sel:reasonForNonComplianceCode:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Text

-- | The severity of the result (finding).
[$sel:severity:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe AuditFindingSeverity

-- | The list of related resources.
[$sel:relatedResources:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe [RelatedResource]

-- | The audit check that generated this result.
[$sel:checkName:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource that was found to be noncompliant with the audit check.
[$sel:nonCompliantResource:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe NonCompliantResource

-- | The reason the resource was noncompliant.
[$sel:reasonForNonCompliance:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for this set of audit findings. This identifier is
--   used to apply mitigation tasks to one or more sets of findings.
[$sel:findingId:AuditFinding'] :: AuditFinding -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditFinding</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isSuppressed:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_isSuppressed</a> - Indicates whether the audit finding
--   was suppressed or not during reporting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskId:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_taskId</a> - The ID
--   of the audit that generated this result (finding).
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingTime:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_findingTime</a>
--   - The time the result (finding) was discovered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStartTime:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_taskStartTime</a> - The time the audit started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonForNonComplianceCode:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_reasonForNonComplianceCode</a> - A code that indicates
--   the reason that the resource was noncompliant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_severity</a> - The
--   severity of the result (finding).
--   
--   <a>$sel:relatedResources:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_relatedResources</a> - The list of related resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkName:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_checkName</a> -
--   The audit check that generated this result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nonCompliantResource:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_nonCompliantResource</a> - The resource that was found
--   to be noncompliant with the audit check.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonForNonCompliance:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_reasonForNonCompliance</a> - The reason the resource
--   was noncompliant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingId:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_findingId</a> - A
--   unique identifier for this set of audit findings. This identifier is
--   used to apply mitigation tasks to one or more sets of findings.
newAuditFinding :: AuditFinding

-- | Indicates whether the audit finding was suppressed or not during
--   reporting.
auditFinding_isSuppressed :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ID of the audit that generated this result (finding).
auditFinding_taskId :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the result (finding) was discovered.
auditFinding_findingTime :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time the audit started.
auditFinding_taskStartTime :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A code that indicates the reason that the resource was noncompliant.
auditFinding_reasonForNonComplianceCode :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Text)

-- | The severity of the result (finding).
auditFinding_severity :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe AuditFindingSeverity)

-- | The list of related resources.
auditFinding_relatedResources :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe [RelatedResource])

-- | The audit check that generated this result.
auditFinding_checkName :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Text)

-- | The resource that was found to be noncompliant with the audit check.
auditFinding_nonCompliantResource :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe NonCompliantResource)

-- | The reason the resource was noncompliant.
auditFinding_reasonForNonCompliance :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for this set of audit findings. This identifier is
--   used to apply mitigation tasks to one or more sets of findings.
auditFinding_findingId :: Lens' AuditFinding (Maybe Text)

-- | Returned by ListAuditMitigationActionsTask, this object contains
--   information that describes a mitigation action that has been started.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata
AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata' :: Maybe AuditMitigationActionsExecutionStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata

-- | The current status of the task being executed.
[$sel:status:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe AuditMitigationActionsExecutionStatus

-- | The date and time when the task was started.
[$sel:startTime:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the task that applies the mitigation action.
[$sel:taskId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the mitigation action being applied by the
--   task.
[$sel:actionId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The friendly name of the mitigation action being applied by the task.
[$sel:actionName:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the task was completed or canceled. Blank if
--   the task is still running.
[$sel:endTime:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If an error occurred, the code that indicates which type of error
--   occurred.
[$sel:errorCode:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the findings to which the task and
--   associated mitigation action are applied.
[$sel:findingId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | If an error occurred, a message that describes the error.
[$sel:message:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'] :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_status</a> - The current
--   status of the task being executed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_startTime</a> - The date and
--   time when the task was started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_taskId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the task that applies the mitigation action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_actionId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the mitigation action being applied by the task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionName:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_actionName</a> - The
--   friendly name of the mitigation action being applied by the task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_endTime</a> - The date and
--   time when the task was completed or canceled. Blank if the task is
--   still running.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_errorCode</a> - If an error
--   occurred, the code that indicates which type of error occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingId:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_findingId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the findings to which the task and associated
--   mitigation action are applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_message</a> - If an error
--   occurred, a message that describes the error.
newAuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata :: AuditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata

--   task.

--   occurred.

-- | Used in MitigationActionParams, this information identifies the target
--   findings to which the mitigation actions are applied. Only one entry
--   appears.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget
AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text (NonEmpty Text)) -> AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget

-- | If the task will apply a mitigation action to findings from a specific
--   audit, this value uniquely identifies the audit.
[$sel:auditTaskId:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'] :: AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | If the task will apply a mitigation action to one or more listed
--   findings, this value uniquely identifies those findings.
[$sel:findingIds:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'] :: AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Specifies a filter in the form of an audit check and set of reason
--   codes that identify the findings from the audit to which the audit
--   mitigation actions task apply.
[$sel:auditCheckToReasonCodeFilter:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'] :: AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget -> Maybe (HashMap Text (NonEmpty Text))

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:auditTaskId:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_auditTaskId</a> - If the task will
--   apply a mitigation action to findings from a specific audit, this
--   value uniquely identifies the audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingIds:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_findingIds</a> - If the task will
--   apply a mitigation action to one or more listed findings, this value
--   uniquely identifies those findings.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:auditCheckToReasonCodeFilter:AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget'</a>,
--   <a>auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_auditCheckToReasonCodeFilter</a> -
--   Specifies a filter in the form of an audit check and set of reason
--   codes that identify the findings from the audit to which the audit
--   mitigation actions task apply.
newAuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget :: AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget

-- | If the task will apply a mitigation action to findings from a specific
--   audit, this value uniquely identifies the audit.
auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_auditTaskId :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | If the task will apply a mitigation action to one or more listed
--   findings, this value uniquely identifies those findings.
auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_findingIds :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | Specifies a filter in the form of an audit check and set of reason
--   codes that identify the findings from the audit to which the audit
--   mitigation actions task apply.
auditMitigationActionsTaskTarget_auditCheckToReasonCodeFilter :: Lens' AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget (Maybe (HashMap Text (NonEmpty Text)))

-- | Information about the targets to which audit notifications are sent.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditNotificationTarget</a> smart constructor.
data AuditNotificationTarget
AuditNotificationTarget' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> AuditNotificationTarget

-- | The ARN of the target (SNS topic) to which audit notifications are
--   sent.
[$sel:targetArn:AuditNotificationTarget'] :: AuditNotificationTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | True if notifications to the target are enabled.
[$sel:enabled:AuditNotificationTarget'] :: AuditNotificationTarget -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ARN of the role that grants permission to send notifications to
--   the target.
[$sel:roleArn:AuditNotificationTarget'] :: AuditNotificationTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditNotificationTarget</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   topic) to which audit notifications are sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:AuditNotificationTarget'</a>,
--   <a>auditNotificationTarget_enabled</a> - True if notifications to the
--   target are enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:AuditNotificationTarget'</a>,
--   <a>auditNotificationTarget_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the role that
--   grants permission to send notifications to the target.
newAuditNotificationTarget :: AuditNotificationTarget

--   sent.

--   the target.

-- | Filters out specific findings of a Device Defender audit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditSuppression</a> smart constructor.
data AuditSuppression
AuditSuppression' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ResourceIdentifier -> AuditSuppression

-- | The expiration date (epoch timestamp in seconds) that you want the
--   suppression to adhere to.
[$sel:expirationDate:AuditSuppression'] :: AuditSuppression -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Indicates whether a suppression should exist indefinitely or not.
[$sel:suppressIndefinitely:AuditSuppression'] :: AuditSuppression -> Maybe Bool

-- | The description of the audit suppression.
[$sel:description:AuditSuppression'] :: AuditSuppression -> Maybe Text
[$sel:checkName:AuditSuppression'] :: AuditSuppression -> Text
[$sel:resourceIdentifier:AuditSuppression'] :: AuditSuppression -> ResourceIdentifier

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   timestamp in seconds) that you want the suppression to adhere to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressIndefinitely:AuditSuppression'</a>,
--   <a>auditSuppression_suppressIndefinitely</a> - Indicates whether a
--   suppression should exist indefinitely or not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:AuditSuppression'</a>,
--   <a>auditSuppression_description</a> - The description of the audit
--   suppression.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkName:AuditSuppression'</a>,
--   <a>auditSuppression_checkName</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceIdentifier:AuditSuppression'</a>,
--   <a>auditSuppression_resourceIdentifier</a> - Undocumented member.
newAuditSuppression :: Text -> ResourceIdentifier -> AuditSuppression

--   suppression to adhere to.
auditSuppression_expirationDate :: Lens' AuditSuppression (Maybe UTCTime)

auditSuppression_suppressIndefinitely :: Lens' AuditSuppression (Maybe Bool)

auditSuppression_description :: Lens' AuditSuppression (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
auditSuppression_checkName :: Lens' AuditSuppression Text

-- | Undocumented member.
auditSuppression_resourceIdentifier :: Lens' AuditSuppression ResourceIdentifier

--   "SCHEDULED_AUDIT_TASK".

-- | A collection of authorization information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthInfo</a> smart constructor.
data AuthInfo

-- | The type of action for which the principal is being authorized.
[$sel:actionType:AuthInfo'] :: AuthInfo -> Maybe ActionType

-- | The resources for which the principal is being authorized to perform
--   the specified action.
[$sel:resources:AuthInfo'] :: AuthInfo -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--
