--   type of action for which the principal is being authorized.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:AuthInfo'</a>, <a>authInfo_resources</a> - The
--   resources for which the principal is being authorized to perform the
--   specified action.
newAuthInfo :: AuthInfo

-- | The type of action for which the principal is being authorized.
authInfo_actionType :: Lens' AuthInfo (Maybe ActionType)

-- | The resources for which the principal is being authorized to perform
--   the specified action.
authInfo_resources :: Lens' AuthInfo [Text]

-- | The authorizer result.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthResult</a> smart constructor.
data AuthResult
AuthResult' :: Maybe Denied -> Maybe AuthDecision -> Maybe Allowed -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe AuthInfo -> AuthResult

-- | The policies and statements that denied the specified action.
[$sel:denied:AuthResult'] :: AuthResult -> Maybe Denied

-- | The final authorization decision of this scenario. Multiple statements
--   are taken into account when determining the authorization decision. An
--   explicit deny statement can override multiple allow statements.
[$sel:authDecision:AuthResult'] :: AuthResult -> Maybe AuthDecision

-- | The policies and statements that allowed the specified action.
[$sel:allowed:AuthResult'] :: AuthResult -> Maybe Allowed

-- | Contains any missing context values found while evaluating policy.
[$sel:missingContextValues:AuthResult'] :: AuthResult -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Authorization information.
[$sel:authInfo:AuthResult'] :: AuthResult -> Maybe AuthInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthResult</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:denied:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_denied</a> - The
--   policies and statements that denied the specified action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authDecision:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_authDecision</a> -
--   The final authorization decision of this scenario. Multiple statements
--   are taken into account when determining the authorization decision. An
--   explicit deny statement can override multiple allow statements.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowed:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_allowed</a> - The
--   policies and statements that allowed the specified action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingContextValues:AuthResult'</a>,
--   <a>authResult_missingContextValues</a> - Contains any missing context
--   values found while evaluating policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authInfo:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_authInfo</a> -
--   Authorization information.
newAuthResult :: AuthResult

-- | The policies and statements that denied the specified action.
authResult_denied :: Lens' AuthResult (Maybe Denied)

-- | The final authorization decision of this scenario. Multiple statements
--   are taken into account when determining the authorization decision. An
--   explicit deny statement can override multiple allow statements.
authResult_authDecision :: Lens' AuthResult (Maybe AuthDecision)

-- | The policies and statements that allowed the specified action.
authResult_allowed :: Lens' AuthResult (Maybe Allowed)

-- | Contains any missing context values found while evaluating policy.
authResult_missingContextValues :: Lens' AuthResult (Maybe [Text])

-- | Authorization information.
authResult_authInfo :: Lens' AuthResult (Maybe AuthInfo)

-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobAbortConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobAbortConfig
AwsJobAbortConfig' :: NonEmpty AwsJobAbortCriteria -> AwsJobAbortConfig

-- | The list of criteria that determine when and how to abort the job.
[$sel:abortCriteriaList:AwsJobAbortConfig'] :: AwsJobAbortConfig -> NonEmpty AwsJobAbortCriteria

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobAbortConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:abortCriteriaList:AwsJobAbortConfig'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortConfig_abortCriteriaList</a> - The list of criteria that
--   determine when and how to abort the job.
newAwsJobAbortConfig :: NonEmpty AwsJobAbortCriteria -> AwsJobAbortConfig

-- | The list of criteria that determine when and how to abort the job.
awsJobAbortConfig_abortCriteriaList :: Lens' AwsJobAbortConfig (NonEmpty AwsJobAbortCriteria)

-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobAbortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobAbortCriteria
AwsJobAbortCriteria' :: AwsJobAbortCriteriaFailureType -> AwsJobAbortCriteriaAbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AwsJobAbortCriteria

-- | The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.
[$sel:failureType:AwsJobAbortCriteria'] :: AwsJobAbortCriteria -> AwsJobAbortCriteriaFailureType

-- | The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
[$sel:action:AwsJobAbortCriteria'] :: AwsJobAbortCriteria -> AwsJobAbortCriteriaAbortAction

-- | The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
[$sel:thresholdPercentage:AwsJobAbortCriteria'] :: AwsJobAbortCriteria -> Double

-- | The minimum number of things which must receive job execution
--   notifications before the job can be aborted.
[$sel:minNumberOfExecutedThings:AwsJobAbortCriteria'] :: AwsJobAbortCriteria -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobAbortCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureType:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_failureType</a> - The type of job execution
--   failures that can initiate a job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_action</a> - The type of job action to take to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thresholdPercentage:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_thresholdPercentage</a> - The minimum
--   percentage of job execution failures that must occur to initiate the
--   job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
--   
--   <a>$sel:minNumberOfExecutedThings:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings</a> - The minimum
--   number of things which must receive job execution notifications before
--   the job can be aborted.
newAwsJobAbortCriteria :: AwsJobAbortCriteriaFailureType -> AwsJobAbortCriteriaAbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AwsJobAbortCriteria

-- | The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.
awsJobAbortCriteria_failureType :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria AwsJobAbortCriteriaFailureType

-- | The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
awsJobAbortCriteria_action :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria AwsJobAbortCriteriaAbortAction

-- | The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
awsJobAbortCriteria_thresholdPercentage :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria Double

-- | The minimum number of things which must receive job execution
--   notifications before the job can be aborted.
awsJobAbortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria Natural

-- | Configuration for the rollout of OTA updates.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig
AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig' :: Maybe AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate -> Maybe Natural -> AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define an exponential rate increase for a job rollout.
[$sel:exponentialRate:AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig'] :: AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate

-- | The maximum number of OTA update job executions started per minute.
[$sel:maximumPerMinute:AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig'] :: AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:exponentialRate:AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig_exponentialRate</a> - The rate of
--   increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to define an
--   exponential rate increase for a job rollout.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumPerMinute:AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig_maximumPerMinute</a> - The maximum
--   number of OTA update job executions started per minute.
newAwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig :: AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define an exponential rate increase for a job rollout.
awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig_exponentialRate :: Lens' AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig (Maybe AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate)

-- | The maximum number of OTA update job executions started per minute.
awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig_maximumPerMinute :: Lens' AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define an exponential rate increase for a job rollout.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobExponentialRolloutRate</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate
AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate' :: Natural -> Double -> AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria -> AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate

-- | The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute, at the start of the job rollout. This is the initial rate
--   of the rollout.
[$sel:baseRatePerMinute:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'] :: AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate -> Natural

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. The number of things notified
--   is multiplied by this factor.
[$sel:incrementFactor:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'] :: AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate -> Double

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
[$sel:rateIncreaseCriteria:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'] :: AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate -> AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseRatePerMinute:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_baseRatePerMinute</a> - The minimum
--   number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute,
--   at the start of the job rollout. This is the initial rate of the
--   rollout.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incrementFactor:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_incrementFactor</a> - The rate of
--   increase for a job rollout. The number of things notified is
--   multiplied by this factor.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateIncreaseCriteria:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_rateIncreaseCriteria</a> - The
--   criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
newAwsJobExponentialRolloutRate :: Natural -> Double -> AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria -> AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate

-- | The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute, at the start of the job rollout. This is the initial rate
--   of the rollout.
awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_baseRatePerMinute :: Lens' AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate Natural

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. The number of things notified
--   is multiplied by this factor.
awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_incrementFactor :: Lens' AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate Double

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_rateIncreaseCriteria :: Lens' AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

-- | Configuration information for pre-signed URLs. Valid when
--   <tt>protocols</tt> contains HTTP.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobPresignedUrlConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig
AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig' :: Maybe Integer -> AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig

-- | How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 -
--   3600, the default value is 1800 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated
--   when a request for the job document is received.
[$sel:expiresInSec:AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig'] :: AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiresInSec:AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobPresignedUrlConfig_expiresInSec</a> - How long (in seconds)
--   pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 - 3600, the default
--   value is 1800 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated when a request
--   for the job document is received.
newAwsJobPresignedUrlConfig :: AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig

-- | How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 -
--   3600, the default value is 1800 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated
--   when a request for the job document is received.
awsJobPresignedUrlConfig_expiresInSec :: Lens' AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig (Maybe Integer)

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria
AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

-- | When this number of things have been notified, it will initiate an
--   increase in the rollout rate.
[$sel:numberOfNotifiedThings:AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria'] :: AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria -> Maybe Natural

-- | When this number of things have succeeded in their job execution, it
--   will initiate an increase in the rollout rate.
[$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria'] :: AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfNotifiedThings:AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfNotifiedThings</a> - When this
--   number of things have been notified, it will initiate an increase in
--   the rollout rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfSucceededThings</a> - When this
--   number of things have succeeded in their job execution, it will
--   initiate an increase in the rollout rate.
newAwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria :: AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

-- | When this number of things have been notified, it will initiate an
--   increase in the rollout rate.
awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfNotifiedThings :: Lens' AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria (Maybe Natural)

-- | When this number of things have succeeded in their job execution, it
--   will initiate an increase in the rollout rate.
awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfSucceededThings :: Lens' AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobTimeoutConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobTimeoutConfig
AwsJobTimeoutConfig' :: Maybe Integer -> AwsJobTimeoutConfig

-- | Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish
--   execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1
--   minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be
--   updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a
--   job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this
--   interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal
--   <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt> status.
[$sel:inProgressTimeoutInMinutes:AwsJobTimeoutConfig'] :: AwsJobTimeoutConfig -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobTimeoutConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inProgressTimeoutInMinutes:AwsJobTimeoutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobTimeoutConfig_inProgressTimeoutInMinutes</a> - Specifies the
--   amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish execution of
--   this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1 minute and 7
--   days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be updated and
--   will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a job execution
--   remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this interval, the
--   job execution will fail and switch to the terminal <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>
--   status.
newAwsJobTimeoutConfig :: AwsJobTimeoutConfig

-- | Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish
--   execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1
--   minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be
--   updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a
--   job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this
--   interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal
--   <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt> status.
awsJobTimeoutConfig_inProgressTimeoutInMinutes :: Lens' AwsJobTimeoutConfig (Maybe Integer)

-- | A Device Defender security profile behavior.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBehavior</a> smart constructor.
data Behavior
Behavior' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe MetricDimension -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BehaviorCriteria -> Text -> Behavior

-- | Suppresses alerts.
[$sel:suppressAlerts:Behavior'] :: Behavior -> Maybe Bool

-- | The dimension for a metric in your behavior. For example, using a
--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimension, you can narrow down the scope of the
--   metric to only MQTT topics where the name matches the pattern
--   specified in the dimension. This can't be used with custom metrics.
[$sel:metricDimension:Behavior'] :: Behavior -> Maybe MetricDimension

-- | What is measured by the behavior.
[$sel:metric:Behavior'] :: Behavior -> Maybe Text

-- | The criteria that determine if a device is behaving normally in regard
--   to the <tt>metric</tt>.
[$sel:criteria:Behavior'] :: Behavior -> Maybe BehaviorCriteria

-- | The name you've given to the behavior.
[$sel:name:Behavior'] :: Behavior -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Behavior</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressAlerts:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_suppressAlerts</a> -
--   Suppresses alerts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricDimension:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_metricDimension</a>
--   - The dimension for a metric in your behavior. For example, using a
--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimension, you can narrow down the scope of the
--   metric to only MQTT topics where the name matches the pattern
--   specified in the dimension. This can't be used with custom metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_metric</a> - What is
--   measured by the behavior.
--   
--   <a>$sel:criteria:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_criteria</a> - The
--   criteria that determine if a device is behaving normally in regard to
--   the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_name</a> - The name you've
--   given to the behavior.
newBehavior :: Text -> Behavior

-- | Suppresses alerts.
behavior_suppressAlerts :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe Bool)

-- | The dimension for a metric in your behavior. For example, using a
--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimension, you can narrow down the scope of the
--   metric to only MQTT topics where the name matches the pattern
--   specified in the dimension. This can't be used with custom metrics.
behavior_metricDimension :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe MetricDimension)

-- | What is measured by the behavior.
behavior_metric :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe Text)

-- | The criteria that determine if a device is behaving normally in regard
--   to the <tt>metric</tt>.
behavior_criteria :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe BehaviorCriteria)

-- | The name you've given to the behavior.
behavior_name :: Lens' Behavior Text

-- | The criteria by which the behavior is determined to be normal.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBehaviorCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data BehaviorCriteria
BehaviorCriteria' :: Maybe MachineLearningDetectionConfig -> Maybe MetricValue -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe ComparisonOperator -> Maybe StatisticalThreshold -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Natural -> BehaviorCriteria

-- | The configuration of an ML Detect
[$sel:mlDetectionConfig:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe MachineLearningDetectionConfig

-- | The value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
[$sel:value:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe MetricValue

-- | If a device is in violation of the behavior for the specified number
--   of consecutive datapoints, an alarm occurs. If not specified, the
--   default is 1.
[$sel:consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe Natural

-- | The operator that relates the thing measured (<tt>metric</tt>) to the
--   criteria (containing a <tt>value</tt> or
--   <tt>statisticalThreshold</tt>). Valid operators include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>string-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>ip-address-list</tt>: <tt>in-cidr-set</tt> and
--   <tt>not-in-cidr-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number</tt>: <tt>less-than</tt>, <tt>less-than-equals</tt>,
--   <tt>greater-than</tt>, and <tt>greater-than-equals</tt></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:comparisonOperator:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe ComparisonOperator

-- | A statistical ranking (percentile)that indicates a threshold value by
--   which a behavior is determined to be in compliance or in violation of
--   the behavior.
[$sel:statisticalThreshold:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe StatisticalThreshold

-- | Use this to specify the time duration over which the behavior is
--   evaluated, for those criteria that have a time dimension (for example,
--   <tt>NUM_MESSAGES_SENT</tt>). For a <tt>statisticalThreshhold</tt>
--   metric comparison, measurements from all devices are accumulated over
--   this time duration before being used to calculate percentiles, and
--   later, measurements from an individual device are also accumulated
--   over this time duration before being given a percentile rank. Cannot
--   be used with list-based metric datatypes.
[$sel:durationSeconds:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe Int

-- | If an alarm has occurred and the offending device is no longer in
--   violation of the behavior for the specified number of consecutive
--   datapoints, the alarm is cleared. If not specified, the default is 1.
[$sel:consecutiveDatapointsToClear:BehaviorCriteria'] :: BehaviorCriteria -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>BehaviorCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mlDetectionConfig:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_mlDetectionConfig</a> - The configuration of an ML
--   Detect
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:BehaviorCriteria'</a>, <a>behaviorCriteria_value</a> -
--   The value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm</a> - If a device is
--   in violation of the behavior for the specified number of consecutive
--   datapoints, an alarm occurs. If not specified, the default is 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_comparisonOperator</a> - The operator that relates
--   the thing measured (<tt>metric</tt>) to the criteria (containing a
--   <tt>value</tt> or <tt>statisticalThreshold</tt>). Valid operators
--   include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>string-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>ip-address-list</tt>: <tt>in-cidr-set</tt> and
--   <tt>not-in-cidr-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number</tt>: <tt>less-than</tt>, <tt>less-than-equals</tt>,
--   <tt>greater-than</tt>, and <tt>greater-than-equals</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statisticalThreshold:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_statisticalThreshold</a> - A statistical ranking
--   (percentile)that indicates a threshold value by which a behavior is
--   determined to be in compliance or in violation of the behavior.
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationSeconds:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_durationSeconds</a> - Use this to specify the time
--   duration over which the behavior is evaluated, for those criteria that
--   have a time dimension (for example, <tt>NUM_MESSAGES_SENT</tt>). For a
--   <tt>statisticalThreshhold</tt> metric comparison, measurements from
--   all devices are accumulated over this time duration before being used
--   to calculate percentiles, and later, measurements from an individual
--   device are also accumulated over this time duration before being given
--   a percentile rank. Cannot be used with list-based metric datatypes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:consecutiveDatapointsToClear:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToClear</a> - If an alarm has
--   occurred and the offending device is no longer in violation of the
--   behavior for the specified number of consecutive datapoints, the alarm
--   is cleared. If not specified, the default is 1.
newBehaviorCriteria :: BehaviorCriteria

-- | The configuration of an ML Detect
behaviorCriteria_mlDetectionConfig :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe MachineLearningDetectionConfig)

-- | The value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
behaviorCriteria_value :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe MetricValue)

-- | If a device is in violation of the behavior for the specified number
--   of consecutive datapoints, an alarm occurs. If not specified, the
--   default is 1.
behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe Natural)

-- | The operator that relates the thing measured (<tt>metric</tt>) to the
--   criteria (containing a <tt>value</tt> or
--   <tt>statisticalThreshold</tt>). Valid operators include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>string-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>ip-address-list</tt>: <tt>in-cidr-set</tt> and
--   <tt>not-in-cidr-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number</tt>: <tt>less-than</tt>, <tt>less-than-equals</tt>,
--   <tt>greater-than</tt>, and <tt>greater-than-equals</tt></li>
--   </ul>
behaviorCriteria_comparisonOperator :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe ComparisonOperator)

-- | A statistical ranking (percentile)that indicates a threshold value by
--   which a behavior is determined to be in compliance or in violation of
--   the behavior.
behaviorCriteria_statisticalThreshold :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe StatisticalThreshold)

-- | Use this to specify the time duration over which the behavior is
--   evaluated, for those criteria that have a time dimension (for example,
--   <tt>NUM_MESSAGES_SENT</tt>). For a <tt>statisticalThreshhold</tt>
--   metric comparison, measurements from all devices are accumulated over
--   this time duration before being used to calculate percentiles, and
--   later, measurements from an individual device are also accumulated
--   over this time duration before being given a percentile rank. Cannot
--   be used with list-based metric datatypes.
behaviorCriteria_durationSeconds :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe Int)

-- | If an alarm has occurred and the offending device is no longer in
--   violation of the behavior for the specified number of consecutive
--   datapoints, the alarm is cleared. If not specified, the default is 1.
behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToClear :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe Natural)

-- | A count of documents that meets a specific aggregation criteria.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucket</a> smart constructor.
data Bucket
Bucket' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Bucket

-- | The value counted for the particular bucket.
[$sel:keyValue:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of documents that have the value counted for the particular
--   bucket.
[$sel:count:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>Bucket</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   counted for the particular bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_count</a> - The number of
--   documents that have the value counted for the particular bucket.
newBucket :: Bucket

-- | The value counted for the particular bucket.
bucket_keyValue :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of documents that have the value counted for the particular
--   bucket.
bucket_count :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Int)

-- | The type of bucketed aggregation performed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketsAggregationType</a> smart constructor.
data BucketsAggregationType
BucketsAggregationType' :: Maybe TermsAggregation -> BucketsAggregationType

-- | Performs an aggregation that will return a list of buckets. The list
--   of buckets is a ranked list of the number of occurrences of an
--   aggregation field value.
[$sel:termsAggregation:BucketsAggregationType'] :: BucketsAggregationType -> Maybe TermsAggregation

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketsAggregationType</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>bucketsAggregationType_termsAggregation</a> - Performs an
--   aggregation that will return a list of buckets. The list of buckets is
--   a ranked list of the number of occurrences of an aggregation field
--   value.
newBucketsAggregationType :: BucketsAggregationType

--   of buckets is a ranked list of the number of occurrences of an
--   aggregation field value.
bucketsAggregationType_termsAggregation :: Lens' BucketsAggregationType (Maybe TermsAggregation)

-- | A CA certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCACertificate</a> smart constructor.
data CACertificate
CACertificate' :: Maybe CACertificateStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> CACertificate

-- | The status of the CA certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
[$sel:status:CACertificate'] :: CACertificate -> Maybe CACertificateStatus

-- | The ARN of the CA certificate.
[$sel:certificateArn:CACertificate'] :: CACertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the CA certificate.
[$sel:certificateId:CACertificate'] :: CACertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The date the CA certificate was created.
[$sel:creationDate:CACertificate'] :: CACertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>CACertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CACertificate'</a>, <a>cACertificate_status</a> - The
--   status of the CA certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:CACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificate_certificateArn</a> - The ARN of the CA certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:CACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificate_certificateId</a> - The ID of the CA certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:CACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificate_creationDate</a> - The date the CA certificate was
--   created.
newCACertificate :: CACertificate

-- | The status of the CA certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
cACertificate_status :: Lens' CACertificate (Maybe CACertificateStatus)

-- | The ARN of the CA certificate.
cACertificate_certificateArn :: Lens' CACertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the CA certificate.
cACertificate_certificateId :: Lens' CACertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the CA certificate was created.
cACertificate_creationDate :: Lens' CACertificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Describes a CA certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCACertificateDescription</a> smart constructor.
data CACertificateDescription
CACertificateDescription' :: Maybe CACertificateStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CertificateValidity -> Maybe AutoRegistrationStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> CACertificateDescription

-- | The status of a CA certificate.
[$sel:status:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe CACertificateStatus

-- | The owner of the CA certificate.
[$sel:ownedBy:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The date the CA certificate was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The CA certificate data, in PEM format.
[$sel:certificatePem:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The CA certificate ARN.
[$sel:certificateArn:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The CA certificate ID.
[$sel:certificateId:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | When the CA certificate is valid.
[$sel:validity:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe CertificateValidity

-- | Whether the CA certificate configured for auto registration of device
--   certificates. Valid values are "ENABLE" and "DISABLE"
[$sel:autoRegistrationStatus:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe AutoRegistrationStatus

-- | The date the CA certificate was created.
[$sel:creationDate:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The generation ID of the CA certificate.
[$sel:generationId:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The customer version of the CA certificate.
[$sel:customerVersion:CACertificateDescription'] :: CACertificateDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>CACertificateDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CACertificateDescription'</a>,

--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ownedBy:CACertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>cACertificateDescription_ownedBy</a> - The owner of the CA
--   certificate.
--

--   certificate was last modified.

--   data, in PEM format.

--   ARN.

--   <a>cACertificateDescription_autoRegistrationStatus</a> - Whether the

--   certificates. Valid values are "ENABLE" and "DISABLE"

--   <a>$sel:creationDate:CACertificateDescription'</a>,

--   certificate was created.

cACertificateDescription_customerVersion :: Lens' CACertificateDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | Information about a certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data Certificate
Certificate' :: Maybe CertificateStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CertificateMode -> Maybe POSIX -> Certificate

-- | The status of the certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
[$sel:status:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe CertificateStatus

-- | The ARN of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateArn:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
[$sel:certificateId:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The mode of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateMode:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe CertificateMode

-- | The date and time the certificate was created.
[$sel:creationDate:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>Certificate</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_status</a> - The
--   status of the certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateArn</a> - The ARN of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateId</a> - The ID of the certificate. (The
--   last part of the certificate ARN contains the certificate ID.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateMode:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_certificateMode</a> - The mode of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_creationDate</a>
--   - The date and time the certificate was created.
newCertificate :: Certificate

-- | The status of the certificate.
--   
--   The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be
--   used.
certificate_status :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe CertificateStatus)

-- | The ARN of the certificate.
certificate_certificateArn :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
certificate_certificateId :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The mode of the certificate.
certificate_certificateMode :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe CertificateMode)

-- | The date and time the certificate was created.
certificate_creationDate :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Describes a certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificateDescription</a> smart constructor.
data CertificateDescription
CertificateDescription' :: Maybe CertificateStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CertificateMode -> Maybe CertificateValidity -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TransferData -> Maybe Natural -> CertificateDescription

-- | The status of the certificate.
[$sel:status:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe CertificateStatus

-- | The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the certificate.
[$sel:ownedBy:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time the certificate was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The certificate ID of the CA certificate used to sign this
--   certificate.
[$sel:caCertificateId:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the Amazon Web Services account of the previous owner of the
--   certificate.
[$sel:previousOwnedBy:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The certificate data, in PEM format.
[$sel:certificatePem:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateArn:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateId:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The mode of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateMode:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe CertificateMode

-- | When the certificate is valid.
[$sel:validity:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe CertificateValidity

-- | The date and time the certificate was created.
[$sel:creationDate:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The generation ID of the certificate.
[$sel:generationId:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The transfer data.
[$sel:transferData:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe TransferData

-- | The customer version of the certificate.
[$sel:customerVersion:CertificateDescription'] :: CertificateDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>CertificateDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_status</a> - The status of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ownedBy:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_ownedBy</a> - The ID of the Amazon Web
--   Services account that owns the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time the
--   certificate was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:caCertificateId:CertificateDescription'</a>,

--   the CA certificate used to sign this certificate.

--   Web Services account of the previous owner of the certificate.

--   <a>$sel:certificatePem:CertificateDescription'</a>,

--   certificate.

--   certificate.

newCertificateDescription :: CertificateDescription

certificateDescription_status :: Lens' CertificateDescription (Maybe CertificateStatus)

-- | When the certificate is valid.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificateValidity</a> smart constructor.
data CertificateValidity
CertificateValidity' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> CertificateValidity

-- | The certificate is not valid before this date.
[$sel:notBefore:CertificateValidity'] :: CertificateValidity -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The certificate is not valid after this date.
[$sel:notAfter:CertificateValidity'] :: CertificateValidity -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>CertificateValidity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:notBefore:CertificateValidity'</a>,
--   <a>certificateValidity_notBefore</a> - The certificate is not valid
--   before this date.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notAfter:CertificateValidity'</a>,
--   <a>certificateValidity_notAfter</a> - The certificate is not valid
--   after this date.
newCertificateValidity :: CertificateValidity

-- | The certificate is not valid before this date.
certificateValidity_notBefore :: Lens' CertificateValidity (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The certificate is not valid after this date.
certificateValidity_notAfter :: Lens' CertificateValidity (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Describes an action that updates a CloudWatch alarm.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudwatchAlarmAction</a> smart constructor.
data CloudwatchAlarmAction
CloudwatchAlarmAction' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CloudwatchAlarmAction

[$sel:roleArn:CloudwatchAlarmAction'] :: CloudwatchAlarmAction -> Text

-- | The CloudWatch alarm name.
[$sel:alarmName:CloudwatchAlarmAction'] :: CloudwatchAlarmAction -> Text

-- | The reason for the alarm change.
[$sel:stateReason:CloudwatchAlarmAction'] :: CloudwatchAlarmAction -> Text

-- | The value of the alarm state. Acceptable values are: OK, ALARM,
--   INSUFFICIENT_DATA.
[$sel:stateValue:CloudwatchAlarmAction'] :: CloudwatchAlarmAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudwatchAlarmAction</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   
--   <a>$sel:stateReason:CloudwatchAlarmAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchAlarmAction_stateReason</a> - The reason for the alarm
--   change.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateValue:CloudwatchAlarmAction'</a>,
--   <a>cloudwatchAlarmAction_stateValue</a> - The value of the alarm
--   state. Acceptable values are: OK, ALARM, INSUFFICIENT_DATA.

-- | Describes the method to use when code signing a file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCodeSigning</a> smart constructor.
data CodeSigning
CodeSigning' :: Maybe CustomCodeSigning -> Maybe StartSigningJobParameter -> Maybe Text -> CodeSigning

-- | A custom method for code signing a file.
[$sel:customCodeSigning:CodeSigning'] :: CodeSigning -> Maybe CustomCodeSigning

-- | Describes the code-signing job.
[$sel:startSigningJobParameter:CodeSigning'] :: CodeSigning -> Maybe StartSigningJobParameter

-- | The ID of the <tt>AWSSignerJob</tt> which was created to sign the
--   file.
[$sel:awsSignerJobId:CodeSigning'] :: CodeSigning -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CodeSigning</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customCodeSigning:CodeSigning'</a>,
--   <a>codeSigning_customCodeSigning</a> - A custom method for code
--   signing a file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startSigningJobParameter:CodeSigning'</a>,
--   <a>codeSigning_startSigningJobParameter</a> - Describes the
--   code-signing job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsSignerJobId:CodeSigning'</a>,
--   <a>codeSigning_awsSignerJobId</a> - The ID of the
--   <tt>AWSSignerJob</tt> which was created to sign the file.
newCodeSigning :: CodeSigning

-- | A custom method for code signing a file.
codeSigning_customCodeSigning :: Lens' CodeSigning (Maybe CustomCodeSigning)

-- | Describes the code-signing job.
codeSigning_startSigningJobParameter :: Lens' CodeSigning (Maybe StartSigningJobParameter)

-- | The ID of the <tt>AWSSignerJob</tt> which was created to sign the
--   file.
codeSigning_awsSignerJobId :: Lens' CodeSigning (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the certificate chain being used when code signing a file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCodeSigningCertificateChain</a> smart constructor.
data CodeSigningCertificateChain
CodeSigningCertificateChain' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CodeSigningCertificateChain

-- | The name of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateName:CodeSigningCertificateChain'] :: CodeSigningCertificateChain -> Maybe Text

-- | A base64 encoded binary representation of the code signing certificate
--   chain.
[$sel:inlineDocument:CodeSigningCertificateChain'] :: CodeSigningCertificateChain -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CodeSigningCertificateChain</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>codeSigningCertificateChain_certificateName</a> - The name of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inlineDocument:CodeSigningCertificateChain'</a>,
--   <a>codeSigningCertificateChain_inlineDocument</a> - A base64 encoded
--   binary representation of the code signing certificate chain.
newCodeSigningCertificateChain :: CodeSigningCertificateChain

-- | The name of the certificate.
codeSigningCertificateChain_certificateName :: Lens' CodeSigningCertificateChain (Maybe Text)

-- | A base64 encoded binary representation of the code signing certificate
--   chain.
codeSigningCertificateChain_inlineDocument :: Lens' CodeSigningCertificateChain (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the signature for a file.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCodeSigningSignature</a> smart constructor.
data CodeSigningSignature
CodeSigningSignature' :: Maybe Base64 -> CodeSigningSignature

-- | A base64 encoded binary representation of the code signing signature.
[$sel:inlineDocument:CodeSigningSignature'] :: CodeSigningSignature -> Maybe Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>CodeSigningSignature</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inlineDocument:CodeSigningSignature'</a>,
--   <a>codeSigningSignature_inlineDocument</a> - A base64 encoded binary
--   representation of the code signing signature.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This
--   <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The
--   underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
newCodeSigningSignature :: CodeSigningSignature

-- | A base64 encoded binary representation of the code signing
--   signature.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes
--   and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to
--   Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
codeSigningSignature_inlineDocument :: Lens' CodeSigningSignature (Maybe ByteString)

-- | Contains information that denied the authorization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDenied</a> smart constructor.
data Denied
Denied' :: Maybe ImplicitDeny -> Maybe ExplicitDeny -> Denied

-- | Information that implicitly denies the authorization. When a policy
--   doesn't explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is
--   considered an implicit deny.
[$sel:implicitDeny:Denied'] :: Denied -> Maybe ImplicitDeny

-- | Information that explicitly denies the authorization.
[$sel:explicitDeny:Denied'] :: Denied -> Maybe ExplicitDeny

-- | Create a value of <a>Denied</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   Information that implicitly denies the authorization. When a policy
--   doesn't explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is
--   considered an implicit deny.
--   
--   <a>$sel:explicitDeny:Denied'</a>, <a>denied_explicitDeny</a> -
--   Information that explicitly denies the authorization.
newDenied :: Denied

-- | Information that implicitly denies the authorization. When a policy
--   doesn't explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is
--   considered an implicit deny.
denied_implicitDeny :: Lens' Denied (Maybe ImplicitDeny)

-- | Information that explicitly denies the authorization.
denied_explicitDeny :: Lens' Denied (Maybe ExplicitDeny)

-- | Describes an action to write to a DynamoDB table.
--   
--   The <tt>tableName</tt>, <tt>hashKeyField</tt>, and
--   <tt>rangeKeyField</tt> values must match the values used when you
--   created the table.
--   
--   The <tt>hashKeyValue</tt> and <tt>rangeKeyvalue</tt> fields use a
--   substitution template syntax. These templates provide data at runtime.
--   The syntax is as follows: ${<i>sql-expression</i>}.
--   
--   You can specify any valid expression in a WHERE or SELECT clause,
--   including JSON properties, comparisons, calculations, and functions.
--   For example, the following field uses the third level of the topic:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "hashKeyValue": "${topic(3)}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following field uses the timestamp:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "rangeKeyValue": "${timestamp()}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDynamoDBAction</a> smart constructor.
data DynamoDBAction
DynamoDBAction' :: Maybe DynamoKeyType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DynamoKeyType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DynamoDBAction

-- | The hash key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
[$sel:hashKeyType:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe DynamoKeyType

-- | The type of operation to be performed. This follows the substitution
--   template, so it can be <tt>${operation}</tt>, but the substitution
--   must result in one of the following: <tt>INSERT</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>,
--   or <tt>DELETE</tt>.
[$sel:operation:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The range key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
[$sel:rangeKeyType:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe DynamoKeyType

-- | The action payload. This name can be customized.
[$sel:payloadField:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The range key name.
[$sel:rangeKeyField:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The range key value.
[$sel:rangeKeyValue:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the DynamoDB table.
[$sel:tableName:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
[$sel:roleArn:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Text

-- | The hash key name.
[$sel:hashKeyField:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Text

-- | The hash key value.
[$sel:hashKeyValue:DynamoDBAction'] :: DynamoDBAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DynamoDBAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hashKeyType:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_hashKeyType</a> - The hash key type. Valid values
--   are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
--   
--   <a>$sel:operation:DynamoDBAction'</a>, <a>dynamoDBAction_operation</a>
--   - The type of operation to be performed. This follows the substitution
--   template, so it can be <tt>${operation}</tt>, but the substitution
--   must result in one of the following: <tt>INSERT</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>,
--   or <tt>DELETE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeKeyType:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyType</a> - The range key type. Valid values
--   are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
--   
--   <a>$sel:payloadField:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_payloadField</a> - The action payload. This name can
--   be customized.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeKeyField:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyField</a> - The range key name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeKeyValue:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyValue</a> - The range key value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableName:DynamoDBAction'</a>, <a>dynamoDBAction_tableName</a>
--   - The name of the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:DynamoDBAction'</a>, <a>dynamoDBAction_roleArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hashKeyField:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_hashKeyField</a> - The hash key name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hashKeyValue:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_hashKeyValue</a> - The hash key value.
newDynamoDBAction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DynamoDBAction

-- | The hash key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
dynamoDBAction_hashKeyType :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe DynamoKeyType)

-- | The type of operation to be performed. This follows the substitution
--   template, so it can be <tt>${operation}</tt>, but the substitution
--   must result in one of the following: <tt>INSERT</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>,
--   or <tt>DELETE</tt>.
dynamoDBAction_operation :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The range key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyType :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe DynamoKeyType)

-- | The action payload. This name can be customized.
dynamoDBAction_payloadField :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The range key name.
dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyField :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The range key value.
dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyValue :: Lens' DynamoDBAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the DynamoDB table.
dynamoDBAction_tableName :: Lens' DynamoDBAction Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
dynamoDBAction_roleArn :: Lens' DynamoDBAction Text

-- | The hash key name.
dynamoDBAction_hashKeyField :: Lens' DynamoDBAction Text

-- | The hash key value.
dynamoDBAction_hashKeyValue :: Lens' DynamoDBAction Text

-- | Describes an action to write to a DynamoDB table.
--   
--   This DynamoDB action writes each attribute in the message payload into
--   it's own column in the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDynamoDBv2Action</a> smart constructor.
data DynamoDBv2Action
DynamoDBv2Action' :: Text -> PutItemInput -> DynamoDBv2Action

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
[$sel:roleArn:DynamoDBv2Action'] :: DynamoDBv2Action -> Text

-- | Specifies the DynamoDB table to which the message data will be
--   written. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "dynamoDBv2": { "roleArn": "aws:iam:12341251:my-role" "putItem": { "tableName": "my-table" } } }
--   </pre>
--   
--   Each attribute in the message payload will be written to a separate
--   column in the DynamoDB database.
[$sel:putItem:DynamoDBv2Action'] :: DynamoDBv2Action -> PutItemInput

-- | Create a value of <a>DynamoDBv2Action</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:DynamoDBv2Action'</a>, <a>dynamoDBv2Action_roleArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:putItem:DynamoDBv2Action'</a>, <a>dynamoDBv2Action_putItem</a>
--   - Specifies the DynamoDB table to which the message data will be
--   written. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "dynamoDBv2": { "roleArn": "aws:iam:12341251:my-role" "putItem": { "tableName": "my-table" } } }
--   </pre>
--   
--   Each attribute in the message payload will be written to a separate
--   column in the DynamoDB database.
newDynamoDBv2Action :: Text -> PutItemInput -> DynamoDBv2Action

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
dynamoDBv2Action_roleArn :: Lens' DynamoDBv2Action Text

-- | Specifies the DynamoDB table to which the message data will be
--   written. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "dynamoDBv2": { "roleArn": "aws:iam:12341251:my-role" "putItem": { "tableName": "my-table" } } }
--   </pre>
--   
--   Each attribute in the message payload will be written to a separate
--   column in the DynamoDB database.
dynamoDBv2Action_putItem :: Lens' DynamoDBv2Action PutItemInput

-- | Describes an action that writes data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service
--   domain.
--   
--   The <tt>Elasticsearch</tt> action can only be used by existing rule
--   actions. To create a new rule action or to update an existing rule
--   action, use the <tt>OpenSearch</tt> rule action instead. For more
--   information, see <a>OpenSearchAction</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchAction</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticsearchAction
ElasticsearchAction' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchAction

-- | The IAM role ARN that has access to OpenSearch.
[$sel:roleArn:ElasticsearchAction'] :: ElasticsearchAction -> Text

-- | The endpoint of your OpenSearch domain.
[$sel:endpoint:ElasticsearchAction'] :: ElasticsearchAction -> Text

-- | The index where you want to store your data.
[$sel:index:ElasticsearchAction'] :: ElasticsearchAction -> Text

-- | The type of document you are storing.
[$sel:type':ElasticsearchAction'] :: ElasticsearchAction -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the document you are storing.
[$sel:id:ElasticsearchAction'] :: ElasticsearchAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ElasticsearchAction'</a>,

--   to OpenSearch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:ElasticsearchAction'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchAction_endpoint</a> - The endpoint of your OpenSearch
--   domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:index:ElasticsearchAction'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchAction_index</a> - The index where you want to store
--   your data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ElasticsearchAction'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchAction_type</a> - The type of document you are
--   storing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ElasticsearchAction'</a>, <a>elasticsearchAction_id</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the document you are storing.
newElasticsearchAction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchAction

-- | The endpoint of your OpenSearch domain.
elasticsearchAction_endpoint :: Lens' ElasticsearchAction Text

-- | The index where you want to store your data.
elasticsearchAction_index :: Lens' ElasticsearchAction Text

-- | The type of document you are storing.
elasticsearchAction_type :: Lens' ElasticsearchAction Text

-- | The unique identifier for the document you are storing.
elasticsearchAction_id :: Lens' ElasticsearchAction Text

-- | Allows you to create an exponential rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExponentialRolloutRate</a> smart constructor.
data ExponentialRolloutRate
ExponentialRolloutRate' :: Natural -> Double -> RateIncreaseCriteria -> ExponentialRolloutRate

-- | The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute at the start of job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define the initial rate of rollout.
[$sel:baseRatePerMinute:ExponentialRolloutRate'] :: ExponentialRolloutRate -> Natural

-- | The exponential factor to increase the rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
[$sel:incrementFactor:ExponentialRolloutRate'] :: ExponentialRolloutRate -> Double

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
[$sel:rateIncreaseCriteria:ExponentialRolloutRate'] :: ExponentialRolloutRate -> RateIncreaseCriteria

-- | Create a value of <a>ExponentialRolloutRate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseRatePerMinute:ExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>exponentialRolloutRate_baseRatePerMinute</a> - The minimum number
--   of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute at the
--   start of job rollout. This parameter allows you to define the initial
--   rate of rollout.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incrementFactor:ExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>exponentialRolloutRate_incrementFactor</a> - The exponential factor
--   to increase the rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateIncreaseCriteria:ExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>exponentialRolloutRate_rateIncreaseCriteria</a> - The criteria to
--   initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
newExponentialRolloutRate :: Natural -> Double -> RateIncreaseCriteria -> ExponentialRolloutRate

-- | The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute at the start of job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define the initial rate of rollout.
exponentialRolloutRate_baseRatePerMinute :: Lens' ExponentialRolloutRate Natural

-- | The exponential factor to increase the rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
exponentialRolloutRate_incrementFactor :: Lens' ExponentialRolloutRate Double

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
exponentialRolloutRate_rateIncreaseCriteria :: Lens' ExponentialRolloutRate RateIncreaseCriteria

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:type':Field'</a>, <a>field_type</a> - The data type of the
--   field.
newField :: Field

-- | Describes an action that writes data to an Amazon Kinesis Firehose
--   stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFirehoseAction</a> smart constructor.
data FirehoseAction
FirehoseAction' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> FirehoseAction

-- | Whether to deliver the Kinesis Data Firehose stream as a batch by
--   using <a>PutRecordBatch</a> . The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule's SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element forms one record in the
--   <a>PutRecordBatch</a> request. The resulting array can't have more
--   than 500 records.
[$sel:batchMode:FirehoseAction'] :: FirehoseAction -> Maybe Bool

-- | A character separator that will be used to separate records written to
--   the Firehose stream. Valid values are: '\n' (newline), '\t' (tab),
--   '\r\n' (Windows newline), ',' (comma).
[$sel:separator:FirehoseAction'] :: FirehoseAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
[$sel:roleArn:FirehoseAction'] :: FirehoseAction -> Text

-- | The delivery stream name.
[$sel:deliveryStreamName:FirehoseAction'] :: FirehoseAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FirehoseAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchMode:FirehoseAction'</a>, <a>firehoseAction_batchMode</a>
--   - Whether to deliver the Kinesis Data Firehose stream as a batch by
--   using <a>PutRecordBatch</a> . The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule's SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element forms one record in the
--   <a>PutRecordBatch</a> request. The resulting array can't have more
--   than 500 records.
--   
--   <a>$sel:separator:FirehoseAction'</a>, <a>firehoseAction_separator</a>
--   - A character separator that will be used to separate records written
--   to the Firehose stream. Valid values are: '\n' (newline), '\t' (tab),
--   '\r\n' (Windows newline), ',' (comma).
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:FirehoseAction'</a>, <a>firehoseAction_roleArn</a> -
--   The IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamName:FirehoseAction'</a>,
--   <a>firehoseAction_deliveryStreamName</a> - The delivery stream name.
newFirehoseAction :: Text -> Text -> FirehoseAction

-- | Whether to deliver the Kinesis Data Firehose stream as a batch by
--   using <a>PutRecordBatch</a> . The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule's SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element forms one record in the
--   <a>PutRecordBatch</a> request. The resulting array can't have more
--   than 500 records.
firehoseAction_batchMode :: Lens' FirehoseAction (Maybe Bool)

-- | A character separator that will be used to separate records written to
--   the Firehose stream. Valid values are: '\n' (newline), '\t' (tab),
--   '\r\n' (Windows newline), ',' (comma).
firehoseAction_separator :: Lens' FirehoseAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
firehoseAction_roleArn :: Lens' FirehoseAction Text

-- | The delivery stream name.
firehoseAction_deliveryStreamName :: Lens' FirehoseAction Text

-- | Send data to an HTTPS endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpAction</a> smart constructor.
data HttpAction
HttpAction' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HttpAuthorization -> Maybe [HttpActionHeader] -> Text -> HttpAction

-- | The URL to which IoT sends a confirmation message. The value of the
--   confirmation URL must be a prefix of the endpoint URL. If you do not
--   specify a confirmation URL IoT uses the endpoint URL as the
--   confirmation URL. If you use substitution templates in the
--   confirmationUrl, you must create and enable topic rule destinations
--   that match each possible value of the substitution template before
--   traffic is allowed to your endpoint URL.
[$sel:confirmationUrl:HttpAction'] :: HttpAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The authentication method to use when sending data to an HTTPS
--   endpoint.
[$sel:auth:HttpAction'] :: HttpAction -> Maybe HttpAuthorization

-- | The HTTP headers to send with the message data.
[$sel:headers:HttpAction'] :: HttpAction -> Maybe [HttpActionHeader]

-- | The endpoint URL. If substitution templates are used in the URL, you
--   must also specify a <tt>confirmationUrl</tt>. If this is a new
--   destination, a new <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt> is created if
--   possible.
[$sel:url:HttpAction'] :: HttpAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpAction</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:confirmationUrl:HttpAction'</a>,
--   <a>httpAction_confirmationUrl</a> - The URL to which IoT sends a
--   confirmation message. The value of the confirmation URL must be a
--   prefix of the endpoint URL. If you do not specify a confirmation URL
--   IoT uses the endpoint URL as the confirmation URL. If you use
--   substitution templates in the confirmationUrl, you must create and
--   enable topic rule destinations that match each possible value of the
--   substitution template before traffic is allowed to your endpoint URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:auth:HttpAction'</a>, <a>httpAction_auth</a> - The
--   authentication method to use when sending data to an HTTPS endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:headers:HttpAction'</a>, <a>httpAction_headers</a> - The HTTP
--   headers to send with the message data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:HttpAction'</a>, <a>httpAction_url</a> - The endpoint URL.
--   If substitution templates are used in the URL, you must also specify a
--   <tt>confirmationUrl</tt>. If this is a new destination, a new
--   <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt> is created if possible.
newHttpAction :: Text -> HttpAction

-- | The URL to which IoT sends a confirmation message. The value of the
--   confirmation URL must be a prefix of the endpoint URL. If you do not
--   specify a confirmation URL IoT uses the endpoint URL as the
--   confirmation URL. If you use substitution templates in the
--   confirmationUrl, you must create and enable topic rule destinations
--   that match each possible value of the substitution template before
--   traffic is allowed to your endpoint URL.
httpAction_confirmationUrl :: Lens' HttpAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The authentication method to use when sending data to an HTTPS
--   endpoint.
httpAction_auth :: Lens' HttpAction (Maybe HttpAuthorization)

-- | The HTTP headers to send with the message data.
httpAction_headers :: Lens' HttpAction (Maybe [HttpActionHeader])

-- | The endpoint URL. If substitution templates are used in the URL, you
--   must also specify a <tt>confirmationUrl</tt>. If this is a new
--   destination, a new <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt> is created if
--   possible.
httpAction_url :: Lens' HttpAction Text

-- | The HTTP action header.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpActionHeader</a> smart constructor.
data HttpActionHeader
HttpActionHeader' :: Text -> Text -> HttpActionHeader

-- | The HTTP header key.
[$sel:key:HttpActionHeader'] :: HttpActionHeader -> Text

-- | The HTTP header value. Substitution templates are supported.
[$sel:value:HttpActionHeader'] :: HttpActionHeader -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpActionHeader</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:HttpActionHeader'</a>, <a>httpActionHeader_key</a> - The
--   HTTP header key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:HttpActionHeader'</a>, <a>httpActionHeader_value</a> -
--   The HTTP header value. Substitution templates are supported.
newHttpActionHeader :: Text -> Text -> HttpActionHeader

-- | The HTTP header key.
httpActionHeader_key :: Lens' HttpActionHeader Text

-- | The HTTP header value. Substitution templates are supported.
httpActionHeader_value :: Lens' HttpActionHeader Text

-- | The authorization method used to send messages.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpAuthorization</a> smart constructor.
data HttpAuthorization
HttpAuthorization' :: Maybe SigV4Authorization -> HttpAuthorization

-- | Use Sig V4 authorization. For more information, see <a>Signature
--   Version 4 Signing Process</a>.
[$sel:sigv4:HttpAuthorization'] :: HttpAuthorization -> Maybe SigV4Authorization

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpAuthorization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sigv4:HttpAuthorization'</a>, <a>httpAuthorization_sigv4</a> -
--   Use Sig V4 authorization. For more information, see <a>Signature
--   Version 4 Signing Process</a>.
newHttpAuthorization :: HttpAuthorization

-- | Use Sig V4 authorization. For more information, see <a>Signature
--   Version 4 Signing Process</a>.
httpAuthorization_sigv4 :: Lens' HttpAuthorization (Maybe SigV4Authorization)

-- | Specifies the HTTP context to use for the test authorizer request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpContext</a> smart constructor.
data HttpContext
HttpContext' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> HttpContext

-- | The header keys and values in an HTTP authorization request.
[$sel:headers:HttpContext'] :: HttpContext -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The query string keys and values in an HTTP authorization request.
[$sel:queryString:HttpContext'] :: HttpContext -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpContext</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:headers:HttpContext'</a>, <a>httpContext_headers</a> - The
--   header keys and values in an HTTP authorization request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queryString:HttpContext'</a>, <a>httpContext_queryString</a> -
--   The query string keys and values in an HTTP authorization request.
newHttpContext :: HttpContext

-- | The header keys and values in an HTTP authorization request.
httpContext_headers :: Lens' HttpContext (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The query string keys and values in an HTTP authorization request.
httpContext_queryString :: Lens' HttpContext (Maybe Text)

-- | HTTP URL destination configuration used by the topic rule's HTTP

-- | Information that implicitly denies authorization. When policy doesn't
--   explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is considered an
--   implicit deny.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImplicitDeny</a> smart constructor.
data ImplicitDeny
ImplicitDeny' :: Maybe [Policy] -> ImplicitDeny

-- | Policies that don't contain a matching allow or deny statement for the
--   specified action on the specified resource.
[$sel:policies:ImplicitDeny'] :: ImplicitDeny -> Maybe [Policy]

-- | Create a value of <a>ImplicitDeny</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--
