--   Policies that don't contain a matching allow or deny statement for the
--   specified action on the specified resource.
newImplicitDeny :: ImplicitDeny

-- | Policies that don't contain a matching allow or deny statement for the
--   specified action on the specified resource.
implicitDeny_policies :: Lens' ImplicitDeny (Maybe [Policy])

-- | Sends message data to an IoT Analytics channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIotAnalyticsAction</a> smart constructor.
data IotAnalyticsAction
IotAnalyticsAction' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> IotAnalyticsAction

-- | Whether to process the action as a batch. The default value is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is delivered as a separate
--   message when passed by <a>BatchPutMessage</a> to the IoT Analytics
--   channel. The resulting array can't have more than 100 messages.
[$sel:batchMode:IotAnalyticsAction'] :: IotAnalyticsAction -> Maybe Bool

-- | (deprecated) The ARN of the IoT Analytics channel to which message
--   data will be sent.
[$sel:channelArn:IotAnalyticsAction'] :: IotAnalyticsAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the IoT Analytics channel to which message data will be
--   sent.
[$sel:channelName:IotAnalyticsAction'] :: IotAnalyticsAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the role which has a policy that grants IoT Analytics
--   permission to send message data via IoT Analytics
--   (iotanalytics:BatchPutMessage).
[$sel:roleArn:IotAnalyticsAction'] :: IotAnalyticsAction -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IotAnalyticsAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchMode:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_batchMode</a> - Whether to process the action as
--   a batch. The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is delivered as a separate
--   message when passed by <a>BatchPutMessage</a> to the IoT Analytics
--   channel. The resulting array can't have more than 100 messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelArn:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_channelArn</a> - (deprecated) The ARN of the IoT
--   Analytics channel to which message data will be sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelName:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_channelName</a> - The name of the IoT Analytics
--   channel to which message data will be sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the role which has a
--   policy that grants IoT Analytics permission to send message data via
--   IoT Analytics (iotanalytics:BatchPutMessage).
newIotAnalyticsAction :: IotAnalyticsAction

-- | Whether to process the action as a batch. The default value is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is delivered as a separate
--   message when passed by <a>BatchPutMessage</a> to the IoT Analytics
--   channel. The resulting array can't have more than 100 messages.
iotAnalyticsAction_batchMode :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Bool)

-- | (deprecated) The ARN of the IoT Analytics channel to which message
--   data will be sent.
iotAnalyticsAction_channelArn :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the IoT Analytics channel to which message data will be
--   sent.
iotAnalyticsAction_channelName :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the role which has a policy that grants IoT Analytics
--   permission to send message data via IoT Analytics
--   (iotanalytics:BatchPutMessage).
iotAnalyticsAction_roleArn :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | Sends an input to an IoT Events detector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIotEventsAction</a> smart constructor.
data IotEventsAction
IotEventsAction' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> IotEventsAction

-- | Whether to process the event actions as a batch. The default value is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is treated as a separate
--   message when it's sent to IoT Events by calling <a>BatchPutMessage</a>
--   . The resulting array can't have more than 10 messages.
[$sel:batchMode:IotEventsAction'] :: IotEventsAction -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ID of the message. The default <tt>messageId</tt> is a new UUID
--   value.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>--a new UUID value will be assigned.
--   
--   Assign a value to this property to ensure that only one input
--   (message) with a given <tt>messageId</tt> will be processed by an IoT
--   Events detector.
[$sel:messageId:IotEventsAction'] :: IotEventsAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the IoT Events input.
[$sel:inputName:IotEventsAction'] :: IotEventsAction -> Text

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an input to an
--   IoT Events detector. ("Action":"iotevents:BatchPutMessage").
[$sel:roleArn:IotEventsAction'] :: IotEventsAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IotEventsAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchMode:IotEventsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotEventsAction_batchMode</a> - Whether to process the event
--   actions as a batch. The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is treated as a separate
--   message when it's sent to IoT Events by calling <a>BatchPutMessage</a>
--   . The resulting array can't have more than 10 messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:IotEventsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotEventsAction_messageId</a> - The ID of the message. The default
--   <tt>messageId</tt> is a new UUID value.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>--a new UUID value will be assigned.
--   
--   Assign a value to this property to ensure that only one input
--   (message) with a given <tt>messageId</tt> will be processed by an IoT
--   Events detector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputName:IotEventsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotEventsAction_inputName</a> - The name of the IoT Events input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:IotEventsAction'</a>, <a>iotEventsAction_roleArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an input to an
--   IoT Events detector. ("Action":"iotevents:BatchPutMessage").
newIotEventsAction :: Text -> Text -> IotEventsAction

-- | Whether to process the event actions as a batch. The default value is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is treated as a separate
--   message when it's sent to IoT Events by calling <a>BatchPutMessage</a>
--   . The resulting array can't have more than 10 messages.
iotEventsAction_batchMode :: Lens' IotEventsAction (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ID of the message. The default <tt>messageId</tt> is a new UUID
--   value.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>--a new UUID value will be assigned.
--   
--   Assign a value to this property to ensure that only one input
--   (message) with a given <tt>messageId</tt> will be processed by an IoT
--   Events detector.
iotEventsAction_messageId :: Lens' IotEventsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the IoT Events input.
iotEventsAction_inputName :: Lens' IotEventsAction Text

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an input to an
--   IoT Events detector. ("Action":"iotevents:BatchPutMessage").
iotEventsAction_roleArn :: Lens' IotEventsAction Text

-- | Describes an action to send data from an MQTT message that triggered
--   the rule to IoT SiteWise asset properties.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIotSiteWiseAction</a> smart constructor.
data IotSiteWiseAction
IotSiteWiseAction' :: NonEmpty PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Text -> IotSiteWiseAction

-- | A list of asset property value entries.
[$sel:putAssetPropertyValueEntries:IotSiteWiseAction'] :: IotSiteWiseAction -> NonEmpty PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an asset
--   property value to IoT SiteWise. (<tt>"Action":
--   "iotsitewise:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue"</tt>). The trust policy can
--   restrict access to specific asset hierarchy paths.
[$sel:roleArn:IotSiteWiseAction'] :: IotSiteWiseAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IotSiteWiseAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:putAssetPropertyValueEntries:IotSiteWiseAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotSiteWiseAction_putAssetPropertyValueEntries</a> - A list of
--   asset property value entries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:IotSiteWiseAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotSiteWiseAction_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the role that grants IoT
--   permission to send an asset property value to IoT SiteWise.
--   (<tt>"Action": "iotsitewise:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue"</tt>). The
--   trust policy can restrict access to specific asset hierarchy paths.
newIotSiteWiseAction :: NonEmpty PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Text -> IotSiteWiseAction

-- | A list of asset property value entries.
iotSiteWiseAction_putAssetPropertyValueEntries :: Lens' IotSiteWiseAction (NonEmpty PutAssetPropertyValueEntry)

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an asset
--   property value to IoT SiteWise. (<tt>"Action":
--   "iotsitewise:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue"</tt>). The trust policy can
--   restrict access to specific asset hierarchy paths.
iotSiteWiseAction_roleArn :: Lens' IotSiteWiseAction Text

-- | The <tt>Job</tt> object contains details about a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJob</a> smart constructor.
data Job
Job' :: Maybe JobStatus -> Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AbortConfig -> Maybe JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TargetSelection -> Maybe TimeoutConfig -> Job

-- | The status of the job, one of <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>DELETION_IN_PROGRESS</tt> or <tt>COMPLETED</tt>.
[$sel:status:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe JobStatus

-- | Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.
[$sel:jobExecutionsRolloutConfig:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
[$sel:jobId:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An ARN identifying the job with format
--   "arn:aws:iot:region:account:job/jobId".
[$sel:jobArn:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Configuration for criteria to abort the job.
[$sel:abortConfig:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe AbortConfig

-- | Details about the job process.
[$sel:jobProcessDetails:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe JobProcessDetails

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
[$sel:namespaceId:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | If the job was updated, provides the reason code for the update.
[$sel:reasonCode:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.
[$sel:presignedUrlConfig:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe PresignedUrlConfig

-- | Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job was canceled with the optional
--   <tt>force</tt> parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:forceCanceled:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ARN of the job template used to create the job.
[$sel:jobTemplateArn:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of IoT things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
[$sel:targets:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was completed.
[$sel:completedAt:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If the job was updated, describes the reason for the update.
[$sel:comment:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | A short text description of the job.
[$sel:description:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a device when the thing representing the device is added to a target
--   group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in
--   the group.
[$sel:targetSelection:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe TargetSelection

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
[$sel:timeoutConfig:Job'] :: Job -> Maybe TimeoutConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>Job</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Job'</a>, <a>job_status</a> - The status of the job,
--   one of <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>DELETION_IN_PROGRESS</tt> or <tt>COMPLETED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExecutionsRolloutConfig:Job'</a>,
--   <a>job_jobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> - Allows you to create a staged
--   rollout of a job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobId</a> - The unique identifier you
--   assigned to this job when it was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:Job'</a>, <a>job_lastUpdatedAt</a> - The time,
--   in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobArn</a> - An ARN identifying the
--   job with format "arn:aws:iot:region:account:job/jobId".
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Job'</a>, <a>job_createdAt</a> - The time, in
--   seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:abortConfig:Job'</a>, <a>job_abortConfig</a> - Configuration
--   for criteria to abort the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobProcessDetails:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobProcessDetails</a> -
--   Details about the job process.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:Job'</a>, <a>job_namespaceId</a> - The namespace
--   used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonCode:Job'</a>, <a>job_reasonCode</a> - If the job was
--   updated, provides the reason code for the update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:presignedUrlConfig:Job'</a>, <a>job_presignedUrlConfig</a> -
--   Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceCanceled:Job'</a>, <a>job_forceCanceled</a> - Will be
--   <tt>true</tt> if the job was canceled with the optional <tt>force</tt>
--   parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobTemplateArn:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobTemplateArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the job template used to create the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:Job'</a>, <a>job_targets</a> - A list of IoT things
--   and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedAt:Job'</a>, <a>job_completedAt</a> - The time, in
--   seconds since the epoch, when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comment:Job'</a>, <a>job_comment</a> - If the job was updated,
--   describes the reason for the update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Job'</a>, <a>job_description</a> - A short text
--   description of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:Job'</a>, <a>job_targetSelection</a> -
--   Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a device when the thing representing the device is added to a target
--   group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in
--   the group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutConfig:Job'</a>, <a>job_timeoutConfig</a> - Specifies
--   the amount of time each device has to finish its execution of the job.
--   A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
newJob :: Job

-- | The status of the job, one of <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>DELETION_IN_PROGRESS</tt> or <tt>COMPLETED</tt>.
job_status :: Lens' Job (Maybe JobStatus)

-- | Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.
job_jobExecutionsRolloutConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig)

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
job_jobId :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
job_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' Job (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An ARN identifying the job with format
--   "arn:aws:iot:region:account:job/jobId".
job_jobArn :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
job_createdAt :: Lens' Job (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Configuration for criteria to abort the job.
job_abortConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe AbortConfig)

-- | Details about the job process.
job_jobProcessDetails :: Lens' Job (Maybe JobProcessDetails)

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
job_namespaceId :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | If the job was updated, provides the reason code for the update.
job_reasonCode :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.
job_presignedUrlConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe PresignedUrlConfig)

-- | Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job was canceled with the optional
--   <tt>force</tt> parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
job_forceCanceled :: Lens' Job (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ARN of the job template used to create the job.
job_jobTemplateArn :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of IoT things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
job_targets :: Lens' Job (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was completed.
job_completedAt :: Lens' Job (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If the job was updated, describes the reason for the update.
job_comment :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | A short text description of the job.
job_description :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a device when the thing representing the device is added to a target
--   group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in
--   the group.
job_targetSelection :: Lens' Job (Maybe TargetSelection)

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
job_timeoutConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe TimeoutConfig)

-- | The job execution object represents the execution of a job on a
--   particular device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecution</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecution
JobExecution' :: Maybe JobExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe JobExecutionStatusDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> JobExecution

-- | The status of the job execution (IN_PROGRESS, QUEUED, FAILED,
--   SUCCEEDED, TIMED_OUT, CANCELED, or REJECTED).
[$sel:status:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe JobExecutionStatus

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to the job when it was created.
[$sel:jobId:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last
--   updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The estimated number of seconds that remain before the job execution
--   status will be changed to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>. The timeout interval can
--   be anywhere between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The
--   actual job execution timeout can occur up to 60 seconds later than the
--   estimated duration. This value will not be included if the job
--   execution has reached a terminal status.
[$sel:approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Integer

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was
--   queued.
[$sel:queuedAt:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job
--   execution.
[$sel:statusDetails:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe JobExecutionStatusDetails

-- | The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.
[$sel:thingArn:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies
--   this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be
--   used in commands which return or update job execution information.
[$sel:executionNumber:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Integer

-- | The version of the job execution. Job execution versions are
--   incremented each time they are updated by a device.
[$sel:versionNumber:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Integer

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
[$sel:startedAt:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job execution was canceled with the
--   optional <tt>force</tt> parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:forceCanceled:JobExecution'] :: JobExecution -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_status</a> - The
--   status of the job execution (IN_PROGRESS, QUEUED, FAILED, SUCCEEDED,
--   TIMED_OUT, CANCELED, or REJECTED).
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_jobId</a> - The
--   unique identifier you assigned to the job when it was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_lastUpdatedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since the
--   epoch, when the job execution was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut</a> - The estimated
--   number of seconds that remain before the job execution status will be
--   changed to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>. The timeout interval can be anywhere
--   between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The actual job
--   execution timeout can occur up to 60 seconds later than the estimated
--   duration. This value will not be included if the job execution has
--   reached a terminal status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queuedAt:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_queuedAt</a> - The
--   time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was queued.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusDetails:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_statusDetails</a> - A collection of name/value pairs
--   that describe the status of the job execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingArn:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_thingArn</a> - The
--   ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionNumber:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_executionNumber</a> - A string (consisting of the
--   digits "0" through "9") which identifies this particular job execution
--   on this particular device. It can be used in commands which return or
--   update job execution information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionNumber:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_versionNumber</a> - The version of the job execution.
--   Job execution versions are incremented each time they are updated by a
--   device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startedAt:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_startedAt</a> -
--   The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceCanceled:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_forceCanceled</a> - Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job
--   execution was canceled with the optional <tt>force</tt> parameter set
--   to <tt>true</tt>.
newJobExecution :: JobExecution

-- | The status of the job execution (IN_PROGRESS, QUEUED, FAILED,
--   SUCCEEDED, TIMED_OUT, CANCELED, or REJECTED).
jobExecution_status :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe JobExecutionStatus)

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to the job when it was created.
jobExecution_jobId :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last
--   updated.
jobExecution_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The estimated number of seconds that remain before the job execution
--   status will be changed to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>. The timeout interval can
--   be anywhere between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The
--   actual job execution timeout can occur up to 60 seconds later than the
--   estimated duration. This value will not be included if the job
--   execution has reached a terminal status.
jobExecution_approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was
--   queued.
jobExecution_queuedAt :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job
--   execution.
jobExecution_statusDetails :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe JobExecutionStatusDetails)

-- | The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.
jobExecution_thingArn :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies
--   this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be
--   used in commands which return or update job execution information.
jobExecution_executionNumber :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Integer)

-- | The version of the job execution. Job execution versions are
--   incremented each time they are updated by a device.
jobExecution_versionNumber :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
jobExecution_startedAt :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job execution was canceled with the
--   optional <tt>force</tt> parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
jobExecution_forceCanceled :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Bool)

-- | Details of the job execution status.
--

data JobExecutionStatusDetails
JobExecutionStatusDetails' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> JobExecutionStatusDetails

-- | The job execution status.
[$sel:detailsMap:JobExecutionStatusDetails'] :: JobExecutionStatusDetails -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecutionStatusDetails</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

newJobExecutionStatusDetails :: JobExecutionStatusDetails

-- | The job execution status.
jobExecutionStatusDetails_detailsMap :: Lens' JobExecutionStatusDetails (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The job execution summary.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecutionSummary</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecutionSummary
JobExecutionSummary' :: Maybe JobExecutionStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> JobExecutionSummary

-- | The status of the job execution.
[$sel:status:JobExecutionSummary'] :: JobExecutionSummary -> Maybe JobExecutionStatus

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last
--   updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobExecutionSummary'] :: JobExecutionSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was
--   queued.
[$sel:queuedAt:JobExecutionSummary'] :: JobExecutionSummary -> Maybe POSIX

--   this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be
--   used later in commands which return or update job execution
--   information.
[$sel:executionNumber:JobExecutionSummary'] :: JobExecutionSummary -> Maybe Integer

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
[$sel:startedAt:JobExecutionSummary'] :: JobExecutionSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecutionSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_status</a> - The status of the job execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_lastUpdatedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since
--   the epoch, when the job execution was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queuedAt:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_queuedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since the
--   epoch, when the job execution was queued.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionNumber:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_executionNumber</a> - A string (consisting of
--   the digits "0" through "9") which identifies this particular job
--   execution on this particular device. It can be used later in commands
--   which return or update job execution information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startedAt:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_startedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since the
--   epoch, when the job execution started.
newJobExecutionSummary :: JobExecutionSummary

-- | The status of the job execution.
jobExecutionSummary_status :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe JobExecutionStatus)

--   updated.

--   queued.

--   information.
jobExecutionSummary_executionNumber :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe Integer)

jobExecutionSummary_startedAt :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecutionsRolloutConfig
JobExecutionsRolloutConfig' :: Maybe ExponentialRolloutRate -> Maybe Natural -> JobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define an exponential rate for a job rollout.
[$sel:exponentialRate:JobExecutionsRolloutConfig'] :: JobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe ExponentialRolloutRate

-- | The maximum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute. This parameter allows you to create a staged rollout.
[$sel:maximumPerMinute:JobExecutionsRolloutConfig'] :: JobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:exponentialRate:JobExecutionsRolloutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionsRolloutConfig_exponentialRate</a> - The rate of
--   increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to define an
--   exponential rate for a job rollout.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumPerMinute:JobExecutionsRolloutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionsRolloutConfig_maximumPerMinute</a> - The maximum
--   number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute.
--   This parameter allows you to create a staged rollout.
newJobExecutionsRolloutConfig :: JobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define an exponential rate for a job rollout.
jobExecutionsRolloutConfig_exponentialRate :: Lens' JobExecutionsRolloutConfig (Maybe ExponentialRolloutRate)

-- | The maximum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute. This parameter allows you to create a staged rollout.
jobExecutionsRolloutConfig_maximumPerMinute :: Lens' JobExecutionsRolloutConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | The job process details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobProcessDetails</a> smart constructor.
data JobProcessDetails
JobProcessDetails' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> JobProcessDetails

-- | The number of things that are no longer scheduled to execute the job
--   because they have been deleted or have been removed from the group
--   that was a target of the job.
[$sel:numberOfRemovedThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things that are awaiting execution of the job.
[$sel:numberOfQueuedThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things that failed executing the job.
[$sel:numberOfFailedThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things which successfully completed the job.
[$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things currently executing the job.
[$sel:numberOfInProgressThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things that cancelled the job.
[$sel:numberOfCanceledThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things whose job execution status is <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
[$sel:numberOfTimedOutThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of things that rejected the job.
[$sel:numberOfRejectedThings:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Int

-- | The target devices to which the job execution is being rolled out.
--   This value will be null after the job execution has finished rolling
--   out to all the target devices.
[$sel:processingTargets:JobProcessDetails'] :: JobProcessDetails -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>JobProcessDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRemovedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfRemovedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that are no longer scheduled to execute the job because they have been
--   deleted or have been removed from the group that was a target of the
--   job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfQueuedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfQueuedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that are awaiting execution of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfFailedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfFailedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that failed executing the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfSucceededThings</a> - The number of
--   things which successfully completed the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfInProgressThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfInProgressThings</a> - The number of
--   things currently executing the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfCanceledThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfCanceledThings</a> - The number of things
--   that cancelled the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfTimedOutThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfTimedOutThings</a> - The number of things
--   whose job execution status is <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRejectedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfRejectedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that rejected the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingTargets:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_processingTargets</a> - The target devices to
--   which the job execution is being rolled out. This value will be null
--   after the job execution has finished rolling out to all the target
--   devices.
newJobProcessDetails :: JobProcessDetails

-- | The number of things that are no longer scheduled to execute the job
--   because they have been deleted or have been removed from the group
--   that was a target of the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfRemovedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that are awaiting execution of the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfQueuedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that failed executing the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfFailedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things which successfully completed the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfSucceededThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things currently executing the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfInProgressThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that cancelled the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfCanceledThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things whose job execution status is <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfTimedOutThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that rejected the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfRejectedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The target devices to which the job execution is being rolled out.
--   This value will be null after the job execution has finished rolling
--   out to all the target devices.
jobProcessDetails_processingTargets :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe [Text])

-- | The job summary.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobSummary</a> smart constructor.
data JobSummary
JobSummary' :: Maybe JobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe TargetSelection -> JobSummary

-- | The job summary status.
[$sel:status:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe JobStatus

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
[$sel:jobId:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The job ARN.
[$sel:jobArn:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
[$sel:createdAt:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ID of the thing group.
[$sel:thingGroupId:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job completed.
[$sel:completedAt:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job
--   was completed by all things originally in the group.
[$sel:targetSelection:JobSummary'] :: JobSummary -> Maybe TargetSelection

-- | Create a value of <a>JobSummary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_status</a> - The job
--   summary status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobId</a> - The unique
--   identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_lastUpdatedAt</a>
--   - The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobArn</a> - The job
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_createdAt</a> - The
--   time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupId:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_thingGroupId</a> -
--   The ID of the thing group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedAt:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_completedAt</a> -
--   The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:JobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobSummary_targetSelection</a> - Specifies whether the job will
--   continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those
--   things specified as targets have completed the job (SNAPSHOT). If
--   continuous, the job may also be run on a thing when a change is
--   detected in a target. For example, a job will run on a thing when the
--   thing is added to a target group, even after the job was completed by
--   all things originally in the group.
newJobSummary :: JobSummary

-- | The job summary status.
jobSummary_status :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe JobStatus)

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
jobSummary_jobId :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
jobSummary_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The job ARN.
jobSummary_jobArn :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
jobSummary_createdAt :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the thing group.
jobSummary_thingGroupId :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job completed.
jobSummary_completedAt :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job
--   was completed by all things originally in the group.
jobSummary_targetSelection :: Lens' JobSummary (Maybe TargetSelection)

-- | An object that contains information about the job template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobTemplateSummary</a> smart constructor.
data JobTemplateSummary
JobTemplateSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> JobTemplateSummary

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job template was
--   created.
[$sel:createdAt:JobTemplateSummary'] :: JobTemplateSummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier of the job template.
[$sel:jobTemplateId:JobTemplateSummary'] :: JobTemplateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the job template.
[$sel:jobTemplateArn:JobTemplateSummary'] :: JobTemplateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the job template.
[$sel:description:JobTemplateSummary'] :: JobTemplateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JobTemplateSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:JobTemplateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobTemplateSummary_createdAt</a> - The time, in seconds since the
--   epoch, when the job template was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobTemplateId:JobTemplateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobTemplateSummary_jobTemplateId</a> - The unique identifier of the
--   job template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobTemplateArn:JobTemplateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobTemplateSummary_jobTemplateArn</a> - The ARN of the job
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:JobTemplateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobTemplateSummary_description</a> - A description of the job
--   template.
newJobTemplateSummary :: JobTemplateSummary

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job template was
--   created.
jobTemplateSummary_createdAt :: Lens' JobTemplateSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

jobTemplateSummary_jobTemplateId :: Lens' JobTemplateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the job template.
jobTemplateSummary_jobTemplateArn :: Lens' JobTemplateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the job template.
jobTemplateSummary_description :: Lens' JobTemplateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Send messages to an Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon
--   MSK) or self-managed Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKafkaAction</a> smart constructor.
data KafkaAction
KafkaAction' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> HashMap Text Text -> KafkaAction

-- | The Kafka message key.
[$sel:key:KafkaAction'] :: KafkaAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The Kafka message partition.
[$sel:partition:KafkaAction'] :: KafkaAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of Kafka action's VPC <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt>.
[$sel:destinationArn:KafkaAction'] :: KafkaAction -> Text

-- | The Kafka topic for messages to be sent to the Kafka broker.
[$sel:topic:KafkaAction'] :: KafkaAction -> Text

-- | Properties of the Apache Kafka producer client.
[$sel:clientProperties:KafkaAction'] :: KafkaAction -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KafkaAction</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:KafkaAction'</a>, <a>kafkaAction_key</a> - The Kafka
--   message key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partition:KafkaAction'</a>, <a>kafkaAction_partition</a> - The
--   Kafka message partition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationArn:KafkaAction'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaAction_destinationArn</a> - The ARN of Kafka action's VPC
--   <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:KafkaAction'</a>, <a>kafkaAction_topic</a> - The Kafka
--   topic for messages to be sent to the Kafka broker.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientProperties:KafkaAction'</a>,
--   <a>kafkaAction_clientProperties</a> - Properties of the Apache Kafka
--   producer client.
newKafkaAction :: Text -> Text -> KafkaAction

-- | The Kafka message key.
kafkaAction_key :: Lens' KafkaAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The Kafka message partition.
kafkaAction_partition :: Lens' KafkaAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of Kafka action's VPC <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt>.
kafkaAction_destinationArn :: Lens' KafkaAction Text

-- | The Kafka topic for messages to be sent to the Kafka broker.
kafkaAction_topic :: Lens' KafkaAction Text

-- | Properties of the Apache Kafka producer client.
kafkaAction_clientProperties :: Lens' KafkaAction (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The configuration of an ML Detect Security Profile.

data MachineLearningDetectionConfig

--   optional fields omitted.

--   <tt>Medium</tt>, or <tt>High</tt>.
machineLearningDetectionConfig_confidenceLevel :: Lens' MachineLearningDetectionConfig ConfidenceLevel

-- | The dimension of a metric.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricDimension</a> smart constructor.
data MetricDimension
MetricDimension' :: Maybe DimensionValueOperator -> Text -> MetricDimension

-- | Defines how the <tt>dimensionValues</tt> of a dimension are
--   interpreted. For example, for dimension type TOPIC_FILTER, the
--   <tt>IN</tt> operator, a message will be counted only if its topic
--   matches one of the topic filters. With <tt>NOT_IN</tt> operator, a
--   message will be counted only if it doesn't match any of the topic
--   filters. The operator is optional: if it's not provided (is
--   <tt>null</tt>), it will be interpreted as <tt>IN</tt>.
[$sel:operator:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Maybe DimensionValueOperator

-- | A unique identifier for the dimension.
[$sel:dimensionName:MetricDimension'] :: MetricDimension -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:operator:MetricDimension'</a>, <a>metricDimension_operator</a>
--   - Defines how the <tt>dimensionValues</tt> of a dimension are
--   interpreted. For example, for dimension type TOPIC_FILTER, the
--   <tt>IN</tt> operator, a message will be counted only if its topic
--   matches one of the topic filters. With <tt>NOT_IN</tt> operator, a
--   message will be counted only if it doesn't match any of the topic
--   filters. The operator is optional: if it's not provided (is
--   <tt>null</tt>), it will be interpreted as <tt>IN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:MetricDimension'</a>,
--   <a>metricDimension_dimensionName</a> - A unique identifier for the
--   dimension.
newMetricDimension :: Text -> MetricDimension

-- | Defines how the <tt>dimensionValues</tt> of a dimension are
--   interpreted. For example, for dimension type TOPIC_FILTER, the
--   <tt>IN</tt> operator, a message will be counted only if its topic
--   matches one of the topic filters. With <tt>NOT_IN</tt> operator, a
--   message will be counted only if it doesn't match any of the topic
--   filters. The operator is optional: if it's not provided (is
--   <tt>null</tt>), it will be interpreted as <tt>IN</tt>.
metricDimension_operator :: Lens' MetricDimension (Maybe DimensionValueOperator)

-- | A unique identifier for the dimension.
metricDimension_dimensionName :: Lens' MetricDimension Text

-- | The metric you want to retain. Dimensions are optional.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricToRetain</a> smart constructor.
data MetricToRetain
MetricToRetain' :: Maybe MetricDimension -> Text -> MetricToRetain

-- | The dimension of a metric. This can't be used with custom metrics.
[$sel:metricDimension:MetricToRetain'] :: MetricToRetain -> Maybe MetricDimension

-- | What is measured by the behavior.
[$sel:metric:MetricToRetain'] :: MetricToRetain -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricToRetain</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricDimension:MetricToRetain'</a>,
--   <a>metricToRetain_metricDimension</a> - The dimension of a metric.
--   This can't be used with custom metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:MetricToRetain'</a>, <a>metricToRetain_metric</a> -
--   What is measured by the behavior.
newMetricToRetain :: Text -> MetricToRetain

-- | The dimension of a metric. This can't be used with custom metrics.
metricToRetain_metricDimension :: Lens' MetricToRetain (Maybe MetricDimension)

-- | What is measured by the behavior.
metricToRetain_metric :: Lens' MetricToRetain Text

-- | The value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricValue</a> smart constructor.
data MetricValue
MetricValue' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Natural] -> Maybe [Double] -> Maybe Double -> Maybe [Text] -> MetricValue

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of CIDRs, use this
--   to specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
[$sel:cidrs:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe [Text]

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a numeric value, use this
--   to specify that numeric value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
[$sel:count:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe Natural

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of ports, use this
--   to specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
[$sel:ports:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe [Natural]

-- | The numeral values of a metric.
[$sel:numbers:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe [Double]

-- | The numeral value of a metric.
[$sel:number:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe Double

-- | The string values of a metric.
[$sel:strings:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricValue</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cidrs:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_cidrs</a> - If the
--   <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of CIDRs, use this to
--   specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_count</a> - If the
--   <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a numeric value, use this to
--   specify that numeric value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ports:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_ports</a> - If the
--   <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of ports, use this to
--   specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numbers:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_numbers</a> - The
--   numeral values of a metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:number:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_number</a> - The
--   numeral value of a metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:strings:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_strings</a> - The
--   string values of a metric.
newMetricValue :: MetricValue

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of CIDRs, use this
--   to specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
metricValue_cidrs :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe [Text])

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a numeric value, use this
--   to specify that numeric value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
metricValue_count :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe Natural)

-- | If the <tt>comparisonOperator</tt> calls for a set of ports, use this
--   to specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
metricValue_ports :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe [Natural])

-- | The numeral values of a metric.
metricValue_numbers :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe [Double])

-- | The numeral value of a metric.
metricValue_number :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe Double)

-- | The string values of a metric.
metricValue_strings :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe [Text])

-- | Describes which changes should be applied as part of a mitigation
--   action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMitigationAction</a> smart constructor.
data MitigationAction
MitigationAction' :: Maybe MitigationActionParams -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MitigationAction

-- | The set of parameters for this mitigation action. The parameters vary,
--   depending on the kind of action you apply.
[$sel:actionParams:MitigationAction'] :: MitigationAction -> Maybe MitigationActionParams

-- | A user-friendly name for the mitigation action.
[$sel:name:MitigationAction'] :: MitigationAction -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for the mitigation action.
[$sel:id:MitigationAction'] :: MitigationAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role ARN used to apply this mitigation action.
[$sel:roleArn:MitigationAction'] :: MitigationAction -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MitigationAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionParams:MitigationAction'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationAction_actionParams</a> - The set of parameters for this
--   mitigation action. The parameters vary, depending on the kind of
--   action you apply.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:MitigationAction'</a>, <a>mitigationAction_name</a> - A
--   user-friendly name for the mitigation action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:MitigationAction'</a>, <a>mitigationAction_id</a> - A
--   unique identifier for the mitigation action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:MitigationAction'</a>, <a>mitigationAction_roleArn</a>
--   - The IAM role ARN used to apply this mitigation action.
newMitigationAction :: MitigationAction

-- | The set of parameters for this mitigation action. The parameters vary,
--   depending on the kind of action you apply.
mitigationAction_actionParams :: Lens' MitigationAction (Maybe MitigationActionParams)

mitigationAction_name :: Lens' MitigationAction (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for the mitigation action.
mitigationAction_id :: Lens' MitigationAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role ARN used to apply this mitigation action.
mitigationAction_roleArn :: Lens' MitigationAction (Maybe Text)

-- | Information that identifies a mitigation action. This information is
--   returned by ListMitigationActions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMitigationActionIdentifier</a> smart constructor.
data MitigationActionIdentifier
MitigationActionIdentifier' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> MitigationActionIdentifier

[$sel:actionName:MitigationActionIdentifier'] :: MitigationActionIdentifier -> Maybe Text

mitigationActionIdentifier_actionArn :: Lens' MitigationActionIdentifier (Maybe Text)

-- | The set of parameters for this mitigation action. You can specify only
--   one type of parameter (in other words, you can apply only one action
--   for each defined mitigation action).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMitigationActionParams</a> smart constructor.
data MitigationActionParams
MitigationActionParams' :: Maybe EnableIoTLoggingParams -> Maybe AddThingsToThingGroupParams -> Maybe UpdateCACertificateParams -> Maybe UpdateDeviceCertificateParams -> Maybe ReplaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams -> Maybe PublishFindingToSnsParams -> MitigationActionParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that enables Amazon Web
--   Services IoT Core logging at a specified level of detail.
[$sel:enableIoTLoggingParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe EnableIoTLoggingParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that moves devices associated
--   with a certificate to one or more specified thing groups, typically
--   for quarantine.
[$sel:addThingsToThingGroupParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe AddThingsToThingGroupParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the
--   CA certificate to inactive.
[$sel:updateCACertificateParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe UpdateCACertificateParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the
--   device certificate to inactive.
[$sel:updateDeviceCertificateParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe UpdateDeviceCertificateParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that adds a blank policy to
--   restrict permissions.
[$sel:replaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe ReplaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that publishes findings to
--   Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS. You can implement your
--   own custom actions in response to the Amazon SNS messages.
[$sel:publishFindingToSnsParams:MitigationActionParams'] :: MitigationActionParams -> Maybe PublishFindingToSnsParams

-- | Create a value of <a>MitigationActionParams</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableIoTLoggingParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionParams_enableIoTLoggingParams</a> - Parameters to
--   define a mitigation action that enables Amazon Web Services IoT Core
--   logging at a specified level of detail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addThingsToThingGroupParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionParams_addThingsToThingGroupParams</a> - Parameters
--   to define a mitigation action that moves devices associated with a
--   certificate to one or more specified thing groups, typically for
--   quarantine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateCACertificateParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionParams_updateCACertificateParams</a> - Parameters
--   to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the CA
--   certificate to inactive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateDeviceCertificateParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionParams_updateDeviceCertificateParams</a> -
--   Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the
--   device certificate to inactive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,

--   restrict permissions.
--

--   <a>mitigationActionParams_publishFindingToSnsParams</a> - Parameters
--   to define a mitigation action that publishes findings to Amazon Simple
--   Notification Service (Amazon SNS. You can implement your own custom
--   actions in response to the Amazon SNS messages.
newMitigationActionParams :: MitigationActionParams

--   Services IoT Core logging at a specified level of detail.
mitigationActionParams_enableIoTLoggingParams :: Lens' MitigationActionParams (Maybe EnableIoTLoggingParams)

--   for quarantine.

mitigationActionParams_publishFindingToSnsParams :: Lens' MitigationActionParams (Maybe PublishFindingToSnsParams)

-- | Specifies the MQTT context to use for the test authorizer request
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMqttContext</a> smart constructor.
data MqttContext
MqttContext' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Base64 -> MqttContext

-- | The value of the <tt>clientId</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.
[$sel:clientId:MqttContext'] :: MqttContext -> Maybe Text

-- | The value of the <tt>username</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.
[$sel:username:MqttContext'] :: MqttContext -> Maybe Text

-- | The value of the <tt>password</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.
[$sel:password:MqttContext'] :: MqttContext -> Maybe Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>MqttContext</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientId:MqttContext'</a>, <a>mqttContext_clientId</a> - The
--   value of the <tt>clientId</tt> key in an MQTT authorization request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:MqttContext'</a>, <a>mqttContext_username</a> - The
--   value of the <tt>username</tt> key in an MQTT authorization request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:MqttContext'</a>, <a>mqttContext_password</a> - The
--   value of the <tt>password</tt> key in an MQTT authorization request.--
--   -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes
--   Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64
--   representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
newMqttContext :: MqttContext

-- | The value of the <tt>clientId</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.
mqttContext_clientId :: Lens' MqttContext (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the <tt>username</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.
mqttContext_username :: Lens' MqttContext (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the <tt>password</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes
--   and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to
--   Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
mqttContext_password :: Lens' MqttContext (Maybe ByteString)

-- | Describes a file to be associated with an OTA update.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOTAUpdateFile</a> smart constructor.
data OTAUpdateFile
OTAUpdateFile' :: Maybe FileLocation -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe CodeSigning -> Maybe Text -> OTAUpdateFile

-- | The location of the updated firmware.
[$sel:fileLocation:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe FileLocation

--   devices to identify the type of file received from the cloud.
[$sel:fileType:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe Natural

[$sel:fileVersion:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe Text

[$sel:attributes:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

[$sel:codeSigning:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe CodeSigning

[$sel:fileName:OTAUpdateFile'] :: OTAUpdateFile -> Maybe Text

--   An integer value you can include in the job document to allow your
--   devices to identify the type of file received from the cloud.

--

--   file.

-- | Information about an OTA update.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOTAUpdateInfo</a> smart constructor.
data OTAUpdateInfo
OTAUpdateInfo' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Protocol) -> Maybe AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe (NonEmpty OTAUpdateFile) -> Maybe OTAUpdateStatus -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ErrorInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TargetSelection -> OTAUpdateInfo

-- | The date when the OTA update was last updated.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Configuration for the rollout of OTA updates.
[$sel:awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The IoT job ID associated with the OTA update.
[$sel:awsIotJobId:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The protocol used to transfer the OTA update image. Valid values are
--   [HTTP], [MQTT], [HTTP, MQTT]. When both HTTP and MQTT are specified,
--   the target device can choose the protocol.
[$sel:protocols:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe (NonEmpty Protocol)

-- | Configuration information for pre-signed URLs. Valid when
--   <tt>protocols</tt> contains HTTP.
[$sel:awsJobPresignedUrlConfig:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig

-- | A list of files associated with the OTA update.
[$sel:otaUpdateFiles:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe (NonEmpty OTAUpdateFile)

-- | The status of the OTA update.
[$sel:otaUpdateStatus:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe OTAUpdateStatus

-- | The targets of the OTA update.
[$sel:targets:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The IoT job ARN associated with the OTA update.
[$sel:awsIotJobArn:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the OTA update was created.
[$sel:creationDate:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A collection of name/value pairs
[$sel:additionalParameters:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The OTA update ID.
[$sel:otaUpdateId:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Error information associated with the OTA update.
[$sel:errorInfo:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe ErrorInfo

-- | The OTA update ARN.
[$sel:otaUpdateArn:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the OTA update.
[$sel:description:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the OTA update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or
--   will be complete after all those things specified as targets have
--   completed the OTA update (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the OTA update may
--   also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For
--   example, an OTA update will run on a thing when the thing is added to
--   a target group, even after the OTA update was completed by all things
--   originally in the group.
[$sel:targetSelection:OTAUpdateInfo'] :: OTAUpdateInfo -> Maybe TargetSelection

-- | Create a value of <a>OTAUpdateInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date when the OTA update
--   was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> - Configuration for
--   the rollout of OTA updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsIotJobId:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_awsIotJobId</a> - The IoT job ID associated with the
--   OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocols:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>, <a>oTAUpdateInfo_protocols</a> -
--   The protocol used to transfer the OTA update image. Valid values are
--   [HTTP], [MQTT], [HTTP, MQTT]. When both HTTP and MQTT are specified,
--   the target device can choose the protocol.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsJobPresignedUrlConfig:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_awsJobPresignedUrlConfig</a> - Configuration
--   information for pre-signed URLs. Valid when <tt>protocols</tt>
--   contains HTTP.

--   the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateStatus:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateStatus</a> - The status of the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>, <a>oTAUpdateInfo_targets</a> - The
--   targets of the OTA update.
--

--   pairs

--

--   Error information associated with the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateArn:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateArn</a> - The OTA update ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_description</a> - A description of the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_targetSelection</a> - Specifies whether the OTA
--   update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after
--   all those things specified as targets have completed the OTA update
--   (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the OTA update may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, an OTA update will
--   run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after
--   the OTA update was completed by all things originally in the group.
newOTAUpdateInfo :: OTAUpdateInfo

-- | The protocol used to transfer the OTA update image. Valid values are
--   [HTTP], [MQTT], [HTTP, MQTT]. When both HTTP and MQTT are specified,
--   the target device can choose the protocol.
oTAUpdateInfo_protocols :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe (NonEmpty Protocol))

--   <tt>protocols</tt> contains HTTP.

oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateArn :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the OTA update.
oTAUpdateInfo_description :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the OTA update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or
--   will be complete after all those things specified as targets have
--   completed the OTA update (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the OTA update may
--   also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For
--   example, an OTA update will run on a thing when the thing is added to
--   a target group, even after the OTA update was completed by all things
--   originally in the group.
oTAUpdateInfo_targetSelection :: Lens' OTAUpdateInfo (Maybe TargetSelection)

-- | An OTA update summary.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOTAUpdateSummary</a> smart constructor.
data OTAUpdateSummary
OTAUpdateSummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OTAUpdateSummary

[$sel:creationDate:OTAUpdateSummary'] :: OTAUpdateSummary -> Maybe POSIX

--   omitted.

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:OTAUpdateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateSummary_creationDate</a> - The date when the OTA update
--   was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateId:OTAUpdateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateSummary_otaUpdateId</a> - The OTA update ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateArn:OTAUpdateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateSummary_otaUpdateArn</a> - The OTA update ARN.

-- | Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPresignedUrlConfig</a> smart constructor.
data PresignedUrlConfig
PresignedUrlConfig' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> PresignedUrlConfig

-- | How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 -
--   3600, the default value is 3600 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated
--   when Jobs receives an MQTT request for the job document.
[$sel:expiresInSec:PresignedUrlConfig'] :: PresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | The ARN of an IAM role that grants grants permission to download files
--   from the S3 bucket where the job data/updates are stored. The role
--   must also grant permission for IoT to download the files.
[$sel:roleArn:PresignedUrlConfig'] :: PresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PresignedUrlConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiresInSec:PresignedUrlConfig'</a>,
--   <a>presignedUrlConfig_expiresInSec</a> - How long (in seconds)
--   pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 - 3600, the default
--   value is 3600 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated when Jobs
--   receives an MQTT request for the job document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:PresignedUrlConfig'</a>,
--   <a>presignedUrlConfig_roleArn</a> - The ARN of an IAM role that grants
--   grants permission to download files from the S3 bucket where the job
--   data/updates are stored. The role must also grant permission for IoT
--   to download the files.
newPresignedUrlConfig :: PresignedUrlConfig

-- | How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 -
--   3600, the default value is 3600 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated
--   when Jobs receives an MQTT request for the job document.
presignedUrlConfig_expiresInSec :: Lens' PresignedUrlConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ARN of an IAM role that grants grants permission to download files
--   from the S3 bucket where the job data/updates are stored. The role
--   must also grant permission for IoT to download the files.
presignedUrlConfig_roleArn :: Lens' PresignedUrlConfig (Maybe Text)
