-- | An asset property value entry containing the following information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutAssetPropertyValueEntry</a> smart constructor.
data PutAssetPropertyValueEntry
PutAssetPropertyValueEntry' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NonEmpty AssetPropertyValue -> PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | Optional. A unique identifier for this entry that you can define to
--   better track which message caused an error in case of failure. Accepts
--   substitution templates. Defaults to a new UUID.
[$sel:entryId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the property alias associated with your asset property.
--   You must specify either a <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an
--   <tt>aliasId</tt> and a <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
[$sel:propertyAlias:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset's property. You must specify either a
--   <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an <tt>aliasId</tt> and a
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution templates.
[$sel:propertyId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the IoT SiteWise asset. You must specify either a
--   <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an <tt>aliasId</tt> and a
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution templates.
[$sel:assetId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of property values to insert that each contain timestamp,
--   quality, and value (TQV) information.
[$sel:propertyValues:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> NonEmpty AssetPropertyValue

-- | Create a value of <a>PutAssetPropertyValueEntry</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:entryId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_entryId</a> - Optional. A unique
--   identifier for this entry that you can define to better track which
--   message caused an error in case of failure. Accepts substitution
--   templates. Defaults to a new UUID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyAlias:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyAlias</a> - The name of the
--   property alias associated with your asset property. You must specify
--   either a <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an <tt>aliasId</tt> and a
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyId</a> - The ID of the asset's
--   property. You must specify either a <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an
--   <tt>aliasId</tt> and a <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_assetId</a> - The ID of the IoT SiteWise
--   asset. You must specify either a <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an
--   <tt>aliasId</tt> and a <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyValues:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyValues</a> - A list of property
--   values to insert that each contain timestamp, quality, and value (TQV)
--   information.
newPutAssetPropertyValueEntry :: NonEmpty AssetPropertyValue -> PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | Optional. A unique identifier for this entry that you can define to
--   better track which message caused an error in case of failure. Accepts
--   substitution templates. Defaults to a new UUID.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_entryId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the property alias associated with your asset property.
--   You must specify either a <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an
--   <tt>aliasId</tt> and a <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyAlias :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset's property. You must specify either a
--   <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an <tt>aliasId</tt> and a
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution templates.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the IoT SiteWise asset. You must specify either a
--   <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an <tt>aliasId</tt> and a
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution templates.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_assetId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of property values to insert that each contain timestamp,
--   quality, and value (TQV) information.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyValues :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (NonEmpty AssetPropertyValue)

--   rollout.
--

--   platform after creation of the Input Stream.

--   Input Stream. The token is available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud
--   platform after creation of the Input Stream.

--   URL exposed by the Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream. The URL is
--   available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud platform after creation of the
--   Input Stream.

--   Input Stream.

-- | Information about the scheduled audit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduledAuditMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data ScheduledAuditMetadata
ScheduledAuditMetadata' :: Maybe AuditFrequency -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DayOfWeek -> Maybe Text -> ScheduledAuditMetadata

-- | How often the scheduled audit occurs.
[$sel:frequency:ScheduledAuditMetadata'] :: ScheduledAuditMetadata -> Maybe AuditFrequency

-- | The name of the scheduled audit.
[$sel:scheduledAuditName:ScheduledAuditMetadata'] :: ScheduledAuditMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit is run (if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> is "MONTHLY"). If days 29-31 are specified, and the
--   month does not have that many days, the audit takes place on the
--   "LAST" day of the month.
[$sel:dayOfMonth:ScheduledAuditMetadata'] :: ScheduledAuditMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The day of the week on which the scheduled audit is run (if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> is "WEEKLY" or "BIWEEKLY").
[$sel:dayOfWeek:ScheduledAuditMetadata'] :: ScheduledAuditMetadata -> Maybe DayOfWeek

-- | The ARN of the scheduled audit.
[$sel:scheduledAuditArn:ScheduledAuditMetadata'] :: ScheduledAuditMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduledAuditMetadata</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:frequency:ScheduledAuditMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAuditMetadata_frequency</a> - How often the scheduled
--   audit occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditName:ScheduledAuditMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAuditMetadata_scheduledAuditName</a> - The name of the
--   scheduled audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfMonth:ScheduledAuditMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAuditMetadata_dayOfMonth</a> - The day of the month on
--   which the scheduled audit is run (if the <tt>frequency</tt> is
--   "MONTHLY"). If days 29-31 are specified, and the month does not have
--   that many days, the audit takes place on the "LAST" day of the month.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfWeek:ScheduledAuditMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAuditMetadata_dayOfWeek</a> - The day of the week on which
--   the scheduled audit is run (if the <tt>frequency</tt> is "WEEKLY" or
--   "BIWEEKLY").
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditArn:ScheduledAuditMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>scheduledAuditMetadata_scheduledAuditArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   scheduled audit.
newScheduledAuditMetadata :: ScheduledAuditMetadata

-- | How often the scheduled audit occurs.
scheduledAuditMetadata_frequency :: Lens' ScheduledAuditMetadata (Maybe AuditFrequency)

-- | The name of the scheduled audit.
scheduledAuditMetadata_scheduledAuditName :: Lens' ScheduledAuditMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit is run (if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> is "MONTHLY"). If days 29-31 are specified, and the
--   month does not have that many days, the audit takes place on the
--   "LAST" day of the month.
scheduledAuditMetadata_dayOfMonth :: Lens' ScheduledAuditMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The day of the week on which the scheduled audit is run (if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> is "WEEKLY" or "BIWEEKLY").
scheduledAuditMetadata_dayOfWeek :: Lens' ScheduledAuditMetadata (Maybe DayOfWeek)

-- | The ARN of the scheduled audit.
scheduledAuditMetadata_scheduledAuditArn :: Lens' ScheduledAuditMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes an action to publish to an Amazon SNS topic.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnsAction</a> smart constructor.
data SnsAction
SnsAction' :: Maybe MessageFormat -> Text -> Text -> SnsAction

-- | (Optional) The message format of the message to publish. Accepted
--   values are "JSON" and "RAW". The default value of the attribute is
--   "RAW". SNS uses this setting to determine if the payload should be
--   parsed and relevant platform-specific bits of the payload should be
--   extracted. To read more about SNS message formats, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/json-formats.html</a>
--   refer to their official documentation.

--   parsed and relevant platform-specific bits of the payload should be

-- | A statistical ranking (percentile) that indicates a threshold value by
--   which a behavior is determined to be in compliance or in violation of
--   the behavior.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStatisticalThreshold</a> smart constructor.
data StatisticalThreshold
StatisticalThreshold' :: Maybe Text -> StatisticalThreshold

-- | The percentile that resolves to a threshold value by which compliance
--   with a behavior is determined. Metrics are collected over the
--   specified period (<tt>durationSeconds</tt>) from all reporting devices
--   in your account and statistical ranks are calculated. Then, the
--   measurements from a device are collected over the same period. If the
--   accumulated measurements from the device fall above or below
--   (<tt>comparisonOperator</tt>) the value associated with the percentile
--   specified, then the device is considered to be in compliance with the
--   behavior, otherwise a violation occurs.
[$sel:statistic:StatisticalThreshold'] :: StatisticalThreshold -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StatisticalThreshold</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:StatisticalThreshold'</a>,
--   <a>statisticalThreshold_statistic</a> - The percentile that resolves
--   to a threshold value by which compliance with a behavior is
--   determined. Metrics are collected over the specified period
--   (<tt>durationSeconds</tt>) from all reporting devices in your account
--   and statistical ranks are calculated. Then, the measurements from a
--   device are collected over the same period. If the accumulated
--   measurements from the device fall above or below
--   (<tt>comparisonOperator</tt>) the value associated with the percentile
--   specified, then the device is considered to be in compliance with the
--   behavior, otherwise a violation occurs.
newStatisticalThreshold :: StatisticalThreshold

-- | The percentile that resolves to a threshold value by which compliance
--   with a behavior is determined. Metrics are collected over the
--   specified period (<tt>durationSeconds</tt>) from all reporting devices
--   in your account and statistical ranks are calculated. Then, the
--   measurements from a device are collected over the same period. If the
--   accumulated measurements from the device fall above or below
--   (<tt>comparisonOperator</tt>) the value associated with the percentile
--   specified, then the device is considered to be in compliance with the
--   behavior, otherwise a violation occurs.
statisticalThreshold_statistic :: Lens' StatisticalThreshold (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of key-value pairs for all supported statistics. Currently, only
--   count is supported.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data Statistics
Statistics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Statistics

-- | The standard deviation of the aggregated field values.
[$sel:stdDeviation:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The maximum aggregated field value.
[$sel:maximum:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The average of the aggregated field values.
[$sel:average:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The count of things that match the query.
[$sel:count:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The minimum aggregated field value.
[$sel:minimum:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The variance of the aggregated field values.
[$sel:variance:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The sum of the squares of the aggregated field values.
[$sel:sumOfSquares:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The sum of the aggregated field values.
[$sel:sum:Statistics'] :: Statistics -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>Statistics</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stdDeviation:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_stdDeviation</a> -
--   The standard deviation of the aggregated field values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximum:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_maximum</a> - The
--   maximum aggregated field value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:average:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_average</a> - The
--   average of the aggregated field values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_count</a> - The count of
--   things that match the query.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimum:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_minimum</a> - The
--   minimum aggregated field value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:variance:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_variance</a> - The
--   variance of the aggregated field values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sumOfSquares:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_sumOfSquares</a> -
--   The sum of the squares of the aggregated field values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sum:Statistics'</a>, <a>statistics_sum</a> - The sum of the
--   aggregated field values.
newStatistics :: Statistics

-- | The standard deviation of the aggregated field values.
statistics_stdDeviation :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The maximum aggregated field value.
statistics_maximum :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The average of the aggregated field values.
statistics_average :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The count of things that match the query.
statistics_count :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The minimum aggregated field value.
statistics_minimum :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The variance of the aggregated field values.
statistics_variance :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The sum of the squares of the aggregated field values.
statistics_sumOfSquares :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The sum of the aggregated field values.
statistics_sum :: Lens' Statistics (Maybe Double)

-- | Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStepFunctionsAction</a> smart constructor.
data StepFunctionsAction
StepFunctionsAction' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> StepFunctionsAction

-- | (Optional) A name will be given to the state machine execution
--   consisting of this prefix followed by a UUID. Step Functions
--   automatically creates a unique name for each state machine execution
--   if one is not provided.
[$sel:executionNamePrefix:StepFunctionsAction'] :: StepFunctionsAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Step Functions state machine whose execution will be
--   started.
[$sel:stateMachineName:StepFunctionsAction'] :: StepFunctionsAction -> Text

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to start execution of a
--   state machine ("Action":"states:StartExecution").
[$sel:roleArn:StepFunctionsAction'] :: StepFunctionsAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StepFunctionsAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>stepFunctionsAction_executionNamePrefix</a> - (Optional) A name
--   will be given to the state machine execution consisting of this prefix
--   followed by a UUID. Step Functions automatically creates a unique name
--   for each state machine execution if one is not provided.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateMachineName:StepFunctionsAction'</a>,
--   <a>stepFunctionsAction_stateMachineName</a> - The name of the Step
--   Functions state machine whose execution will be started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:StepFunctionsAction'</a>,
--   <a>stepFunctionsAction_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the role that grants
--   IoT permission to start execution of a state machine
--   ("Action":"states:StartExecution").
newStepFunctionsAction :: Text -> Text -> StepFunctionsAction

-- | (Optional) A name will be given to the state machine execution
--   consisting of this prefix followed by a UUID. Step Functions
--   automatically creates a unique name for each state machine execution
--   if one is not provided.

--   started.

--   state machine ("Action":"states:StartExecution").
stepFunctionsAction_roleArn :: Lens' StepFunctionsAction Text

newStreamFile :: StreamFile

-- | The location of the file in S3.
streamFile_s3Location :: Lens' StreamFile (Maybe S3Location)

-- | The file ID.
streamFile_fileId :: Lens' StreamFile (Maybe Natural)

-- | Information about a stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStreamInfo</a> smart constructor.
data StreamInfo
StreamInfo' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty StreamFile) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StreamInfo

-- | The date when the stream was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date when the stream was created.
[$sel:createdAt:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The stream version.
[$sel:streamVersion:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe Natural

-- | The stream ARN.
[$sel:streamArn:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The files to stream.
[$sel:files:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe (NonEmpty StreamFile)

-- | The description of the stream.
[$sel:description:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The stream ID.
[$sel:streamId:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | An IAM role IoT assumes to access your S3 files.
[$sel:roleArn:StreamInfo'] :: StreamInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StreamInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_lastUpdatedAt</a>
--   - The date when the stream was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_createdAt</a> - The
--   date when the stream was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamVersion:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_streamVersion</a>
--   - The stream version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamArn:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_streamArn</a> - The
--   stream ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:files:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_files</a> - The files to
--   stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_description</a> -
--   The description of the stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamId:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_streamId</a> - The
--   stream ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:StreamInfo'</a>, <a>streamInfo_roleArn</a> - An IAM
--   role IoT assumes to access your S3 files.
newStreamInfo :: StreamInfo

-- | The date when the stream was last updated.
streamInfo_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date when the stream was created.
streamInfo_createdAt :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The stream version.
streamInfo_streamVersion :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe Natural)

-- | The stream ARN.
streamInfo_streamArn :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The files to stream.
streamInfo_files :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe (NonEmpty StreamFile))

-- | The description of the stream.
streamInfo_description :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The stream ID.
streamInfo_streamId :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | An IAM role IoT assumes to access your S3 files.
streamInfo_roleArn :: Lens' StreamInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag

-- | The tag's value.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag's key.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

newTag :: Text -> Tag

tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | Statistics for the checks performed during the audit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTaskStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data TaskStatistics
TaskStatistics' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> TaskStatistics

-- | The number of checks that found noncompliant resources.
[$sel:nonCompliantChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks waiting for data collection.
[$sel:waitingForDataCollectionChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks.
[$sel:failedChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks in this audit.
[$sel:totalChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks in progress.
[$sel:inProgressChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks that found compliant resources.
[$sel:compliantChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of checks that did not run because the audit was canceled.
[$sel:canceledChecks:TaskStatistics'] :: TaskStatistics -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TaskStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nonCompliantChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_nonCompliantChecks</a> - The number of checks that
--   found noncompliant resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitingForDataCollectionChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_waitingForDataCollectionChecks</a> - The number of
--   checks waiting for data collection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_failedChecks</a> - The number of checks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_totalChecks</a> - The number of checks in this
--   audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inProgressChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_inProgressChecks</a> - The number of checks in
--   progress.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compliantChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_compliantChecks</a> - The number of checks that
--   found compliant resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:canceledChecks:TaskStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatistics_canceledChecks</a> - The number of checks that did
--   not run because the audit was canceled.
newTaskStatistics :: TaskStatistics

-- | The number of checks that found noncompliant resources.
taskStatistics_nonCompliantChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks waiting for data collection.
taskStatistics_waitingForDataCollectionChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks.
taskStatistics_failedChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks in this audit.
taskStatistics_totalChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks in progress.
taskStatistics_inProgressChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks that found compliant resources.
taskStatistics_compliantChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of checks that did not run because the audit was canceled.
taskStatistics_canceledChecks :: Lens' TaskStatistics (Maybe Int)

-- | Provides summary counts of how many tasks for findings are in a
--   particular state. This information is included in the response from
--   DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTask.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTaskStatisticsForAuditCheck</a> smart constructor.
data TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck
TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck

-- | The number of findings to which the mitigation action task was
--   canceled when applied.
[$sel:canceledFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'] :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of findings skipped because of filter conditions provided
--   in the parameters to the command.
[$sel:skippedFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'] :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of findings to which a task is being applied.
[$sel:totalFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'] :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of findings for which at least one of the actions failed
--   when applied.
[$sel:failedFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'] :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of findings for which all mitigation actions succeeded when
--   applied.
[$sel:succeededFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'] :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:canceledFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_canceledFindingsCount</a> - The number
--   of findings to which the mitigation action task was canceled when
--   applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:skippedFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_skippedFindingsCount</a> - The number
--   of findings skipped because of filter conditions provided in the
--   parameters to the command.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_totalFindingsCount</a> - The total
--   number of findings to which a task is being applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_failedFindingsCount</a> - The number of
--   findings for which at least one of the actions failed when applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:succeededFindingsCount:TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck'</a>,
--   <a>taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_succeededFindingsCount</a> - The number
--   of findings for which all mitigation actions succeeded when applied.
newTaskStatisticsForAuditCheck :: TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck

-- | The number of findings to which the mitigation action task was
--   canceled when applied.
taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_canceledFindingsCount :: Lens' TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of findings skipped because of filter conditions provided
--   in the parameters to the command.
taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_skippedFindingsCount :: Lens' TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of findings to which a task is being applied.
taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_totalFindingsCount :: Lens' TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of findings for which at least one of the actions failed
--   when applied.
taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_failedFindingsCount :: Lens' TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of findings for which all mitigation actions succeeded when
--   applied.
taskStatisticsForAuditCheck_succeededFindingsCount :: Lens' TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck (Maybe Integer)

-- | Performs an aggregation that will return a list of buckets. The list
--   of buckets is a ranked list of the number of occurrences of an
--   aggregation field value.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTermsAggregation</a> smart constructor.
data TermsAggregation
TermsAggregation' :: Maybe Natural -> TermsAggregation

-- | The number of buckets to return in the response. Default to 10.
[$sel:maxBuckets:TermsAggregation'] :: TermsAggregation -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>TermsAggregation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxBuckets:TermsAggregation'</a>,
--   <a>termsAggregation_maxBuckets</a> - The number of buckets to return
--   in the response. Default to 10.
newTermsAggregation :: TermsAggregation

-- | The number of buckets to return in the response. Default to 10.
termsAggregation_maxBuckets :: Lens' TermsAggregation (Maybe Natural)

-- | The properties of the thing, including thing name, thing type name,
--   and a list of thing attributes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingAttribute</a> smart constructor.
data ThingAttribute
ThingAttribute' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> ThingAttribute

-- | The name of the thing type, if the thing has been associated with a
--   type.
[$sel:thingTypeName:ThingAttribute'] :: ThingAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The thing ARN.
[$sel:thingArn:ThingAttribute'] :: ThingAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of thing attributes which are name-value pairs.
[$sel:attributes:ThingAttribute'] :: ThingAttribute -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The version of the thing record in the registry.
[$sel:version:ThingAttribute'] :: ThingAttribute -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the thing.
[$sel:thingName:ThingAttribute'] :: ThingAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ThingAttribute</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingTypeName:ThingAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>thingAttribute_thingTypeName</a> - The name of the thing type, if
--   the thing has been associated with a type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingArn:ThingAttribute'</a>, <a>thingAttribute_thingArn</a> -
--   The thing ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:ThingAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>thingAttribute_attributes</a> - A list of thing attributes which
--   are name-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:ThingAttribute'</a>, <a>thingAttribute_version</a> -
--   The version of the thing record in the registry.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:ThingAttribute'</a>, <a>thingAttribute_thingName</a>
--   - The name of the thing.
newThingAttribute :: ThingAttribute

-- | The name of the thing type, if the thing has been associated with a
--   type.
thingAttribute_thingTypeName :: Lens' ThingAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The thing ARN.
thingAttribute_thingArn :: Lens' ThingAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of thing attributes which are name-value pairs.
thingAttribute_attributes :: Lens' ThingAttribute (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The version of the thing record in the registry.
thingAttribute_version :: Lens' ThingAttribute (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the thing.
thingAttribute_thingName :: Lens' ThingAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The connectivity status of the thing.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingConnectivity</a> smart constructor.
data ThingConnectivity
ThingConnectivity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> ThingConnectivity

-- | The reason why the client is disconnected. If the thing has been
--   disconnected for approximately an hour, the <tt>disconnectReason</tt>
--   value might be missing.
[$sel:disconnectReason:ThingConnectivity'] :: ThingConnectivity -> Maybe Text

-- | True if the thing is connected to the Amazon Web Services IoT Core
--   service; false if it is not connected.
[$sel:connected:ThingConnectivity'] :: ThingConnectivity -> Maybe Bool

-- | The epoch time (in milliseconds) when the thing last connected or
--   disconnected. If the thing has been disconnected for approximately an
--   hour, the time value might be missing.
[$sel:timestamp:ThingConnectivity'] :: ThingConnectivity -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>ThingConnectivity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:disconnectReason:ThingConnectivity'</a>,
--   <a>thingConnectivity_disconnectReason</a> - The reason why the client
--   is disconnected. If the thing has been disconnected for approximately
--   an hour, the <tt>disconnectReason</tt> value might be missing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connected:ThingConnectivity'</a>,
--   <a>thingConnectivity_connected</a> - True if the thing is connected to
--   the Amazon Web Services IoT Core service; false if it is not
--   connected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:ThingConnectivity'</a>,
--   <a>thingConnectivity_timestamp</a> - The epoch time (in milliseconds)
--   when the thing last connected or disconnected. If the thing has been
--   disconnected for approximately an hour, the time value might be
--   missing.
newThingConnectivity :: ThingConnectivity

-- | The reason why the client is disconnected. If the thing has been
--   disconnected for approximately an hour, the <tt>disconnectReason</tt>
--   value might be missing.
thingConnectivity_disconnectReason :: Lens' ThingConnectivity (Maybe Text)

-- | True if the thing is connected to the Amazon Web Services IoT Core
--   service; false if it is not connected.
thingConnectivity_connected :: Lens' ThingConnectivity (Maybe Bool)

-- | The epoch time (in milliseconds) when the thing last connected or
--   disconnected. If the thing has been disconnected for approximately an
--   hour, the time value might be missing.
thingConnectivity_timestamp :: Lens' ThingConnectivity (Maybe Integer)

-- | Thing group indexing configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingGroupIndexingConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration
ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration' :: Maybe [Field] -> Maybe [Field] -> ThingGroupIndexingMode -> ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration

-- | Contains fields that are indexed and whose types are already known by
--   the Fleet Indexing service.
[$sel:managedFields:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration -> Maybe [Field]

-- | A list of thing group fields to index. This list cannot contain any
--   managed fields. Use the GetIndexingConfiguration API to get a list of
--   managed fields.
--   
--   Contains custom field names and their data type.
[$sel:customFields:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration -> Maybe [Field]

-- | Thing group indexing mode.
[$sel:thingGroupIndexingMode:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration -> ThingGroupIndexingMode

-- | Create a value of <a>ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:managedFields:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_managedFields</a> - Contains fields
--   that are indexed and whose types are already known by the Fleet
--   Indexing service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customFields:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_customFields</a> - A list of thing
--   group fields to index. This list cannot contain any managed fields.
--   Use the GetIndexingConfiguration API to get a list of managed fields.
--   
--   Contains custom field names and their data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupIndexingMode:ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_thingGroupIndexingMode</a> - Thing
--   group indexing mode.
newThingGroupIndexingConfiguration :: ThingGroupIndexingMode -> ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration

-- | Contains fields that are indexed and whose types are already known by
--   the Fleet Indexing service.
thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_managedFields :: Lens' ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration (Maybe [Field])

-- | A list of thing group fields to index. This list cannot contain any
--   managed fields. Use the GetIndexingConfiguration API to get a list of
--   managed fields.
--   
--   Contains custom field names and their data type.
thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_customFields :: Lens' ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration (Maybe [Field])

-- | Thing group indexing mode.
thingGroupIndexingConfiguration_thingGroupIndexingMode :: Lens' ThingGroupIndexingConfiguration ThingGroupIndexingMode

-- | Thing group metadata.

-- | The thing indexing configuration. For more information, see
--   <a>Managing Thing Indexing</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingIndexingConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data ThingIndexingConfiguration
ThingIndexingConfiguration' :: Maybe [Field] -> Maybe ThingConnectivityIndexingMode -> Maybe [Field] -> ThingIndexingMode -> ThingIndexingConfiguration

-- | Contains fields that are indexed and whose types are already known by
--   the Fleet Indexing service.
[$sel:managedFields:ThingIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingIndexingConfiguration -> Maybe [Field]

-- | Thing connectivity indexing mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>STATUS  Your thing index contains connectivity status. To enable
--   thing connectivity indexing, <i>thingIndexMode</i> must not be set to
--   OFF.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing connectivity status indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:thingConnectivityIndexingMode:ThingIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingIndexingConfiguration -> Maybe ThingConnectivityIndexingMode

-- | Contains custom field names and their data type.
[$sel:customFields:ThingIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingIndexingConfiguration -> Maybe [Field]

-- | Thing indexing mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>REGISTRY  Your thing index contains registry data only.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW - Your thing index contains registry and
--   shadow data.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:thingIndexingMode:ThingIndexingConfiguration'] :: ThingIndexingConfiguration -> ThingIndexingMode

-- | Create a value of <a>ThingIndexingConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:managedFields:ThingIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingIndexingConfiguration_managedFields</a> - Contains fields that
--   are indexed and whose types are already known by the Fleet Indexing
--   service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingConnectivityIndexingMode:ThingIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingIndexingConfiguration_thingConnectivityIndexingMode</a> -
--   Thing connectivity indexing mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>STATUS  Your thing index contains connectivity status. To enable
--   thing connectivity indexing, <i>thingIndexMode</i> must not be set to
--   OFF.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing connectivity status indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:customFields:ThingIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingIndexingConfiguration_customFields</a> - Contains custom field
--   names and their data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingIndexingMode:ThingIndexingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>thingIndexingConfiguration_thingIndexingMode</a> - Thing indexing
--   mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>REGISTRY  Your thing index contains registry data only.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW - Your thing index contains registry and
--   shadow data.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
newThingIndexingConfiguration :: ThingIndexingMode -> ThingIndexingConfiguration

-- | Contains fields that are indexed and whose types are already known by
--   the Fleet Indexing service.
thingIndexingConfiguration_managedFields :: Lens' ThingIndexingConfiguration (Maybe [Field])

-- | Thing connectivity indexing mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>STATUS  Your thing index contains connectivity status. To enable
--   thing connectivity indexing, <i>thingIndexMode</i> must not be set to
--   OFF.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing connectivity status indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
thingIndexingConfiguration_thingConnectivityIndexingMode :: Lens' ThingIndexingConfiguration (Maybe ThingConnectivityIndexingMode)

thingIndexingConfiguration_customFields :: Lens' ThingIndexingConfiguration (Maybe [Field])

-- | Thing indexing mode. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>REGISTRY  Your thing index contains registry data only.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW - Your thing index contains registry and
--   shadow data.</li>
--   <li>OFF - Thing indexing is disabled.</li>
--   </ul>
thingIndexingConfiguration_thingIndexingMode :: Lens' ThingIndexingConfiguration ThingIndexingMode

-- | The definition of the thing type, including thing type name and
--   description.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingTypeDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data ThingTypeDefinition
ThingTypeDefinition' :: Maybe ThingTypeProperties -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ThingTypeMetadata -> Maybe Text -> ThingTypeDefinition

[$sel:thingTypeProperties:ThingTypeDefinition'] :: ThingTypeDefinition -> Maybe ThingTypeProperties

-- | The name of the thing type.
[$sel:thingTypeName:ThingTypeDefinition'] :: ThingTypeDefinition -> Maybe Text

--   type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the
--   thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when it was deprecated.

--   contains additional information about the thing type including:
--   creation date and time, a value indicating whether the thing type is
--   deprecated, and a date and time when it was deprecated.

--   <a>thingTypeDefinition_thingTypeArn</a> - The thing type ARN.

--   type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the
--   thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when it was deprecated.
thingTypeDefinition_thingTypeMetadata :: Lens' ThingTypeDefinition (Maybe ThingTypeMetadata)

thingTypeDefinition_thingTypeArn :: Lens' ThingTypeDefinition (Maybe Text)

-- | The ThingTypeMetadata contains additional information about the thing
--   type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the
--   thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when time was
--   deprecated.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThingTypeMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data ThingTypeMetadata

--   could be associated with this type.
thingTypeMetadata_deprecated :: Lens' ThingTypeMetadata (Maybe Bool)

data ThingTypeProperties

-- | The description of the thing type.
thingTypeProperties_thingTypeDescription :: Lens' ThingTypeProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimeoutConfig</a> smart constructor.
data TimeoutConfig
TimeoutConfig' :: Maybe Integer -> TimeoutConfig

-- | Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish
--   execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1
--   minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be
--   updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a
--   job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this
--   interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal
--   <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt> status.
[$sel:inProgressTimeoutInMinutes:TimeoutConfig'] :: TimeoutConfig -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>TimeoutConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inProgressTimeoutInMinutes:TimeoutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>timeoutConfig_inProgressTimeoutInMinutes</a> - Specifies the amount
--   of time, in minutes, this device has to finish execution of this job.
--   The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to
--   10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be updated and will apply
--   to all job executions for the job. Whenever a job execution remains in
--   the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this interval, the job
--   execution will fail and switch to the terminal <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>
--   status.
newTimeoutConfig :: TimeoutConfig

-- | Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish
--   execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1
--   minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be
--   updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a
--   job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this
--   interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal
--   <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt> status.
timeoutConfig_inProgressTimeoutInMinutes :: Lens' TimeoutConfig (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT
--   message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the
--   <a>Timestream</a> topic rule action documentation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimestreamAction</a> smart constructor.
data TimestreamAction
TimestreamAction' :: Maybe TimestreamTimestamp -> Text -> Text -> Text -> NonEmpty TimestreamDimension -> TimestreamAction

-- | Specifies an application-defined value to replace the default value
--   assigned to the Timestream record's timestamp in the <tt>time</tt>
--   column.
--   
--   You can use this property to specify the value and the precision of
--   the Timestream record's timestamp. You can specify a value from the
--   message payload or a value computed by a substitution template.
--   
--   If omitted, the topic rule action assigns the timestamp, in
--   milliseconds, at the time it processed the rule.
[$sel:timestamp:TimestreamAction'] :: TimestreamAction -> Maybe TimestreamTimestamp

-- | The ARN of the role that grants permission to write to the Amazon
--   Timestream database table.
[$sel:roleArn:TimestreamAction'] :: TimestreamAction -> Text

-- | The name of an Amazon Timestream database.
[$sel:databaseName:TimestreamAction'] :: TimestreamAction -> Text

-- | The name of the database table into which to write the measure
--   records.
[$sel:tableName:TimestreamAction'] :: TimestreamAction -> Text

-- | Metadata attributes of the time series that are written in each
--   measure record.
[$sel:dimensions:TimestreamAction'] :: TimestreamAction -> NonEmpty TimestreamDimension

-- | Create a value of <a>TimestreamAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:TimestreamAction'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamAction_timestamp</a> - Specifies an application-defined
--   value to replace the default value assigned to the Timestream record's
--   timestamp in the <tt>time</tt> column.
--   
--   You can use this property to specify the value and the precision of
--   the Timestream record's timestamp. You can specify a value from the
--   message payload or a value computed by a substitution template.
--   
--   If omitted, the topic rule action assigns the timestamp, in
--   milliseconds, at the time it processed the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:TimestreamAction'</a>, <a>timestreamAction_roleArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the role that grants permission to write to the Amazon
--   Timestream database table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:TimestreamAction'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamAction_databaseName</a> - The name of an Amazon
--   Timestream database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableName:TimestreamAction'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamAction_tableName</a> - The name of the database table
--   into which to write the measure records.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:TimestreamAction'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamAction_dimensions</a> - Metadata attributes of the time
--   series that are written in each measure record.
newTimestreamAction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> NonEmpty TimestreamDimension -> TimestreamAction

-- | Specifies an application-defined value to replace the default value
--   assigned to the Timestream record's timestamp in the <tt>time</tt>
--   column.
--   
--   You can use this property to specify the value and the precision of
--   the Timestream record's timestamp. You can specify a value from the
--   message payload or a value computed by a substitution template.
--   
--   If omitted, the topic rule action assigns the timestamp, in
--   milliseconds, at the time it processed the rule.
timestreamAction_timestamp :: Lens' TimestreamAction (Maybe TimestreamTimestamp)

-- | The ARN of the role that grants permission to write to the Amazon
--   Timestream database table.
timestreamAction_roleArn :: Lens' TimestreamAction Text

-- | The name of an Amazon Timestream database.
timestreamAction_databaseName :: Lens' TimestreamAction Text

-- | The name of the database table into which to write the measure
--   records.
timestreamAction_tableName :: Lens' TimestreamAction Text

-- | Metadata attributes of the time series that are written in each
--   measure record.
timestreamAction_dimensions :: Lens' TimestreamAction (NonEmpty TimestreamDimension)

-- | Metadata attributes of the time series that are written in each
--   measure record.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimestreamDimension</a> smart constructor.
data TimestreamDimension
TimestreamDimension' :: Text -> Text -> TimestreamDimension

-- | The metadata dimension name. This is the name of the column in the
--   Amazon Timestream database table record.
--   
--   Dimensions cannot be named: <tt>measure_name</tt>,
--   <tt>measure_value</tt>, or <tt>time</tt>. These names are reserved.
--   Dimension names cannot start with <tt>ts_</tt> or
--   <tt>measure_value</tt> and they cannot contain the colon (<tt>:</tt>)
--   character.
[$sel:name:TimestreamDimension'] :: TimestreamDimension -> Text

-- | The value to write in this column of the database record.
[$sel:value:TimestreamDimension'] :: TimestreamDimension -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TimestreamDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:TimestreamDimension'</a>, <a>timestreamDimension_name</a>
--   - The metadata dimension name. This is the name of the column in the
--   Amazon Timestream database table record.
--   
--   Dimensions cannot be named: <tt>measure_name</tt>,
--   <tt>measure_value</tt>, or <tt>time</tt>. These names are reserved.
--   Dimension names cannot start with <tt>ts_</tt> or
--   <tt>measure_value</tt> and they cannot contain the colon (<tt>:</tt>)
--   character.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:TimestreamDimension'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamDimension_value</a> - The value to write in this column
--   of the database record.
newTimestreamDimension :: Text -> Text -> TimestreamDimension

-- | The metadata dimension name. This is the name of the column in the
--   Amazon Timestream database table record.
--   
--   Dimensions cannot be named: <tt>measure_name</tt>,
--   <tt>measure_value</tt>, or <tt>time</tt>. These names are reserved.
--   Dimension names cannot start with <tt>ts_</tt> or
--   <tt>measure_value</tt> and they cannot contain the colon (<tt>:</tt>)
--   character.
timestreamDimension_name :: Lens' TimestreamDimension Text

-- | The value to write in this column of the database record.
timestreamDimension_value :: Lens' TimestreamDimension Text

-- | Describes how to interpret an application-defined timestamp value from
--   an MQTT message payload and the precision of that value.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimestreamTimestamp</a> smart constructor.
data TimestreamTimestamp
TimestreamTimestamp' :: Text -> Text -> TimestreamTimestamp

-- | An expression that returns a long epoch time value.
[$sel:value:TimestreamTimestamp'] :: TimestreamTimestamp -> Text

-- | The precision of the timestamp value that results from the expression
--   described in <tt>value</tt>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>SECONDS</tt> | <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt> |
--   <tt>MICROSECONDS</tt> | <tt>NANOSECONDS</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt>.
[$sel:unit:TimestreamTimestamp'] :: TimestreamTimestamp -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TimestreamTimestamp</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:TimestreamTimestamp'</a>,
--   <a>timestreamTimestamp_value</a> - An expression that returns a long
--   epoch time value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:TimestreamTimestamp'</a>, <a>timestreamTimestamp_unit</a>
--   - The precision of the timestamp value that results from the
--   expression described in <tt>value</tt>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>SECONDS</tt> | <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt> |
--   <tt>MICROSECONDS</tt> | <tt>NANOSECONDS</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt>.
newTimestreamTimestamp :: Text -> Text -> TimestreamTimestamp

-- | An expression that returns a long epoch time value.
timestreamTimestamp_value :: Lens' TimestreamTimestamp Text

-- | The precision of the timestamp value that results from the expression
--   described in <tt>value</tt>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>SECONDS</tt> | <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt> |
--   <tt>MICROSECONDS</tt> | <tt>NANOSECONDS</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt>.
timestreamTimestamp_unit :: Lens' TimestreamTimestamp Text

-- | Specifies the TLS context to use for the test authorizer request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTlsContext</a> smart constructor.
data TlsContext
TlsContext' :: Maybe Text -> TlsContext

-- | The value of the <tt>serverName</tt> key in a TLS authorization
--   request.
[$sel:serverName:TlsContext'] :: TlsContext -> Maybe Text

--   fields.

--   
--   <a>$sel:serverName:TlsContext'</a>, <a>tlsContext_serverName</a> - The
--   value of the <tt>serverName</tt> key in a TLS authorization request.
newTlsContext :: TlsContext

-- | The value of the <tt>serverName</tt> key in a TLS authorization
--   request.
tlsContext_serverName :: Lens' TlsContext (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicRule</a> smart constructor.
data TopicRule
TopicRule' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [Action] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> TopicRule

-- | The date and time the rule was created.
[$sel:createdAt:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The actions associated with the rule.
[$sel:actions:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe [Action]

-- | The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.
[$sel:awsIotSqlVersion:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to perform when an error occurs.
[$sel:errorAction:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Action

-- | Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
[$sel:ruleDisabled:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the rule.
[$sel:ruleName:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The SQL statement used to query the topic. When using a SQL query with
--   multiple lines, be sure to escape the newline characters.
[$sel:sql:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the rule.
[$sel:description:TopicRule'] :: TopicRule -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_createdAt</a> - The
--   date and time the rule was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actions:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_actions</a> - The actions
--   associated with the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsIotSqlVersion:TopicRule'</a>,
--   <a>topicRule_awsIotSqlVersion</a> - The version of the SQL rules
--   engine to use when evaluating the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorAction:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_errorAction</a> - The
--   action to perform when an error occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleDisabled:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_ruleDisabled</a> -
--   Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleName:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_ruleName</a> - The name
--   of the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sql:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_sql</a> - The SQL statement
--   used to query the topic. When using a SQL query with multiple lines,
--   be sure to escape the newline characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:TopicRule'</a>, <a>topicRule_description</a> - The
--   description of the rule.
newTopicRule :: TopicRule

-- | The date and time the rule was created.
topicRule_createdAt :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The actions associated with the rule.
topicRule_actions :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe [Action])

-- | The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.
topicRule_awsIotSqlVersion :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to perform when an error occurs.
topicRule_errorAction :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Action)

-- | Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
topicRule_ruleDisabled :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the rule.
topicRule_ruleName :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The SQL statement used to query the topic. When using a SQL query with
--   multiple lines, be sure to escape the newline characters.
topicRule_sql :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the rule.
topicRule_description :: Lens' TopicRule (Maybe Text)

-- | A topic rule destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicRuleDestination</a> smart constructor.
data TopicRuleDestination
TopicRuleDestination' :: Maybe VpcDestinationProperties -> Maybe TopicRuleDestinationStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe HttpUrlDestinationProperties -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> TopicRuleDestination

-- | Properties of the virtual private cloud (VPC) connection.
[$sel:vpcProperties:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe VpcDestinationProperties

-- | The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>ERROR</i> Confirmation could not be completed, for example if
--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can
--   set <tt>status</tt> to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>. Calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe TopicRuleDestinationStatus

-- | The date and time when the topic rule destination was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedAt:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Properties of the HTTP URL.
[$sel:httpUrlProperties:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe HttpUrlDestinationProperties

-- | The topic rule destination URL.
[$sel:arn:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the topic rule destination was created.
[$sel:createdAt:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Additional details or reason why the topic rule destination is in the
--   current status.
[$sel:statusReason:TopicRuleDestination'] :: TopicRuleDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicRuleDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcProperties:TopicRuleDestination'</a>,
--   <a>topicRuleDestination_vpcProperties</a> - Properties of the virtual
--   private cloud (VPC) connection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:TopicRuleDestination'</a>,
--   <a>topicRuleDestination_status</a> - The status of the topic rule
--   destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>ERROR</i> Confirmation could not be completed, for example if
--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can
--   set <tt>status</tt> to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>. Calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:TopicRuleDestination'</a>,
--   <a>topicRuleDestination_lastUpdatedAt</a> - The date and time when the

--   <a>topicRuleDestination_httpUrlProperties</a> - Properties of the HTTP
--   URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:TopicRuleDestination'</a>, <a>topicRuleDestination_arn</a>
--   - The topic rule destination URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:TopicRuleDestination'</a>,
--   <a>topicRuleDestination_createdAt</a> - The date and time when the
--   topic rule destination was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:TopicRuleDestination'</a>,
--   <a>topicRuleDestination_statusReason</a> - Additional details or
--   reason why the topic rule destination is in the current status.
newTopicRuleDestination :: TopicRuleDestination

-- | Properties of the virtual private cloud (VPC) connection.

-- | The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>

--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can

--

--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>

--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>ERROR</i> Confirmation could not be completed, for example if
--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can
--   set <tt>status</tt> to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>. Calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Describes a rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicRulePayload</a> smart constructor.
data TopicRulePayload
TopicRulePayload' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Action -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> [Action] -> TopicRulePayload

-- | The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.
[$sel:awsIotSqlVersion:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to take when an error occurs.
[$sel:errorAction:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> Maybe Action

-- | Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
[$sel:ruleDisabled:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> Maybe Bool

-- | The description of the rule.
[$sel:description:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> Maybe Text

-- | The SQL statement used to query the topic. For more information, see
--   <a>IoT SQL Reference</a> in the <i>IoT Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:sql:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> Text

-- | The actions associated with the rule.
[$sel:actions:TopicRulePayload'] :: TopicRulePayload -> [Action]

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicRulePayload</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsIotSqlVersion:TopicRulePayload'</a>,
--   <a>topicRulePayload_awsIotSqlVersion</a> - The version of the SQL
--   rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorAction:TopicRulePayload'</a>,
--   <a>topicRulePayload_errorAction</a> - The action to take when an error
--   occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleDisabled:TopicRulePayload'</a>,
--   <a>topicRulePayload_ruleDisabled</a> - Specifies whether the rule is
--   disabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:TopicRulePayload'</a>,
--   <a>topicRulePayload_description</a> - The description of the rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sql:TopicRulePayload'</a>, <a>topicRulePayload_sql</a> - The
--   SQL statement used to query the topic. For more information, see
--   <a>IoT SQL Reference</a> in the <i>IoT Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actions:TopicRulePayload'</a>, <a>topicRulePayload_actions</a>
--   - The actions associated with the rule.
newTopicRulePayload :: Text -> TopicRulePayload

-- | The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.
topicRulePayload_awsIotSqlVersion :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to take when an error occurs.
topicRulePayload_errorAction :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Action)

-- | Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
topicRulePayload_ruleDisabled :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Bool)

-- | The description of the rule.
topicRulePayload_description :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Text)

-- | The SQL statement used to query the topic. For more information, see
--   <a>IoT SQL Reference</a> in the <i>IoT Developer Guide</i>.
topicRulePayload_sql :: Lens' TopicRulePayload Text

-- | The actions associated with the rule.
topicRulePayload_actions :: Lens' TopicRulePayload [Action]

-- | Data used to transfer a certificate to an Amazon Web Services account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTransferData</a> smart constructor.
data TransferData
TransferData' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> TransferData

-- | The date the transfer took place.
[$sel:transferDate:TransferData'] :: TransferData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date the transfer was accepted.
[$sel:acceptDate:TransferData'] :: TransferData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The transfer message.
[$sel:transferMessage:TransferData'] :: TransferData -> Maybe Text

-- | The date the transfer was rejected.
[$sel:rejectDate:TransferData'] :: TransferData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The reason why the transfer was rejected.
[$sel:rejectReason:TransferData'] :: TransferData -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TransferData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferDate:TransferData'</a>,
--   <a>transferData_transferDate</a> - The date the transfer took place.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptDate:TransferData'</a>, <a>transferData_acceptDate</a> -
--   The date the transfer was accepted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferMessage:TransferData'</a>,
--   <a>transferData_transferMessage</a> - The transfer message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rejectDate:TransferData'</a>, <a>transferData_rejectDate</a> -
--   The date the transfer was rejected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rejectReason:TransferData'</a>,
--   <a>transferData_rejectReason</a> - The reason why the transfer was
--   rejected.
newTransferData :: TransferData

-- | The date the transfer took place.
transferData_transferDate :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date the transfer was accepted.
transferData_acceptDate :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The transfer message.
transferData_transferMessage :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the transfer was rejected.
transferData_rejectDate :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The reason why the transfer was rejected.
transferData_rejectReason :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe Text)

-- | Parameters to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the
--   CA certificate to inactive.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateCACertificateParams</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateCACertificateParams
UpdateCACertificateParams' :: CACertificateUpdateAction -> UpdateCACertificateParams

-- | The action that you want to apply to the CA certificate. The only
--   supported value is <tt>DEACTIVATE</tt>.
[$sel:action:UpdateCACertificateParams'] :: UpdateCACertificateParams -> CACertificateUpdateAction

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateCACertificateParams</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:UpdateCACertificateParams'</a>,
--   <a>updateCACertificateParams_action</a> - The action that you want to
--   apply to the CA certificate. The only supported value is
--   <tt>DEACTIVATE</tt>.
newUpdateCACertificateParams :: CACertificateUpdateAction -> UpdateCACertificateParams

-- | The action that you want to apply to the CA certificate. The only
--   supported value is <tt>DEACTIVATE</tt>.
updateCACertificateParams_action :: Lens' UpdateCACertificateParams CACertificateUpdateAction

-- | Information about a Device Defender security profile behavior
--   violation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newViolationEvent</a> smart constructor.
data ViolationEvent
ViolationEvent' :: Maybe ViolationEventType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Behavior -> Maybe MetricValue -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VerificationState -> ViolationEvent

-- | The type of violation event.
[$sel:violationEventType:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe ViolationEventType

-- | The description of the verification state of the violation.
[$sel:verificationStateDescription:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the violation event.
[$sel:violationId:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The behavior that was violated.
[$sel:behavior:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe Behavior

-- | The value of the metric (the measurement).
[$sel:metricValue:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe MetricValue

-- | The name of the security profile whose behavior was violated.
[$sel:securityProfileName:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The details of a violation event.
[$sel:violationEventAdditionalInfo:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo

-- | The time the violation event occurred.
[$sel:violationEventTime:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the thing responsible for the violation event.
[$sel:thingName:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).
[$sel:verificationState:ViolationEvent'] :: ViolationEvent -> Maybe VerificationState

-- | Create a value of <a>ViolationEvent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationEventType:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_violationEventType</a> - The type of violation
--   event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationStateDescription:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_verificationStateDescription</a> - The description
--   of the verification state of the violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationId:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_violationId</a> - The ID of the violation event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behavior:ViolationEvent'</a>, <a>violationEvent_behavior</a> -
--   The behavior that was violated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricValue:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_metricValue</a> - The value of the metric (the
--   measurement).
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileName:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_securityProfileName</a> - The name of the security
--   profile whose behavior was violated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationEventAdditionalInfo:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_violationEventAdditionalInfo</a> - The details of a
--   violation event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationEventTime:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_violationEventTime</a> - The time the violation
--   event occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:ViolationEvent'</a>, <a>violationEvent_thingName</a>
--   - The name of the thing responsible for the violation event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationState:ViolationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>violationEvent_verificationState</a> - The verification state of
--   the violation (detect alarm).
newViolationEvent :: ViolationEvent

-- | The type of violation event.
violationEvent_violationEventType :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe ViolationEventType)

-- | The description of the verification state of the violation.
violationEvent_verificationStateDescription :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe Text)

violationEvent_violationId :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the metric (the measurement).
violationEvent_metricValue :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe MetricValue)

violationEvent_securityProfileName :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the violation event occurred.
violationEvent_violationEventTime :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the thing responsible for the violation event.
violationEvent_thingName :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).
violationEvent_verificationState :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe VerificationState)

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newViolationEventAdditionalInfo</a> smart constructor.

--   <tt>Medium</tt>, or <tt>High</tt>.
newViolationEventAdditionalInfo :: ViolationEventAdditionalInfo

--   <tt>Medium</tt>, or <tt>High</tt>.
violationEventAdditionalInfo_confidenceLevel :: Lens' ViolationEventAdditionalInfo (Maybe ConfidenceLevel)

--   occurred.

--   occurred.

--   occurred.

-- | The configuration information for a virtual private cloud (VPC)
--   destination.

[$sel:vpcId:VpcDestinationConfiguration'] :: VpcDestinationConfiguration -> Text

--   network interfaces (ENIs).

--   fields omitted.
