-- | Transfers the specified certificate to the specified Amazon Web
--   Services account.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>TransferCertificate</a> action.
--   
--   You can cancel the transfer until it is acknowledged by the recipient.
--   
--   No notification is sent to the transfer destination's account. It is
--   up to the caller to notify the transfer target.
--   
--   The certificate being transferred must not be in the ACTIVE state. You
--   can use the UpdateCertificate action to deactivate it.
--   
--   The certificate must not have any policies attached to it. You can use
--   the DetachPolicy action to detach them.
module Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate

-- | The input for the TransferCertificate operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTransferCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data TransferCertificate
TransferCertificate' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> TransferCertificate

-- | The transfer message.
[$sel:transferMessage:TransferCertificate'] :: TransferCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
[$sel:certificateId:TransferCertificate'] :: TransferCertificate -> Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account.
[$sel:targetAwsAccount:TransferCertificate'] :: TransferCertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TransferCertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferMessage:TransferCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>transferCertificate_transferMessage</a> - The transfer message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:TransferCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>transferCertificate_certificateId</a> - The ID of the certificate.
--   (The last part of the certificate ARN contains the certificate ID.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAwsAccount:TransferCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>transferCertificate_targetAwsAccount</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   account.
newTransferCertificate :: Text -> Text -> TransferCertificate

-- | The transfer message.
transferCertificate_transferMessage :: Lens' TransferCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
transferCertificate_certificateId :: Lens' TransferCertificate Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services account.
transferCertificate_targetAwsAccount :: Lens' TransferCertificate Text

-- | The output from the TransferCertificate operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTransferCertificateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TransferCertificateResponse
TransferCertificateResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> TransferCertificateResponse

-- | The ARN of the certificate.
[$sel:transferredCertificateArn:TransferCertificateResponse'] :: TransferCertificateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:TransferCertificateResponse'] :: TransferCertificateResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TransferCertificateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferredCertificateArn:TransferCertificateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>transferCertificateResponse_transferredCertificateArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:TransferCertificateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>transferCertificateResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newTransferCertificateResponse :: Int -> TransferCertificateResponse

-- | The ARN of the certificate.
transferCertificateResponse_transferredCertificateArn :: Lens' TransferCertificateResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
transferCertificateResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' TransferCertificateResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificate
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificateResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificateResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificateResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificateResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificateResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificate
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificate
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificate
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.IoT.TransferCertificate.TransferCertificate


-- | Tests a custom authorization behavior by invoking a specified custom
--   authorizer. Use this to test and debug the custom authorization
--   behavior of devices that connect to the IoT device gateway.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>TestInvokeAuthorizer</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.TestInvokeAuthorizer

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTestInvokeAuthorizer</a> smart constructor.
data TestInvokeAuthorizer
TestInvokeAuthorizer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TlsContext -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HttpContext -> Maybe MqttContext -> Text -> TestInvokeAuthorizer

-- | The token returned by your custom authentication service.
[$sel:token:TestInvokeAuthorizer'] :: TestInvokeAuthorizer -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies a test TLS authorization request.
[$sel:tlsContext:TestInvokeAuthorizer'] :: TestInvokeAuthorizer -> Maybe TlsContext

-- | The signature made with the token and your custom authentication
--   service's private key. This value must be Base-64-encoded.
[$sel:tokenSignature:TestInvokeAuthorizer'] :: TestInvokeAuthorizer -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies a test HTTP authorization request.
[$sel:httpContext:TestInvokeAuthorizer'] :: TestInvokeAuthorizer -> Maybe HttpContext

-- | Specifies a test MQTT authorization request.
[$sel:mqttContext:TestInvokeAuthorizer'] :: TestInvokeAuthorizer -> Maybe MqttContext

-- | The custom authorizer name.
[$sel:authorizerName:TestInvokeAuthorizer'] :: TestInvokeAuthorizer -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TestInvokeAuthorizer</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   authentication service.

--   <a>testInvokeAuthorizer_tlsContext</a> - Specifies a test TLS
--   authorization request.

--   <a>$sel:tokenSignature:TestInvokeAuthorizer'</a>,
--   <a>testInvokeAuthorizer_tokenSignature</a> - The signature made with
--   the token and your custom authentication service's private key. This
--   value must be Base-64-encoded.

--   authorization request.

-- | Tests if a specified principal is authorized to perform an IoT action
--   on a specified resource. Use this to test and debug the authorization
--   behavior of devices that connect to the IoT device gateway.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>TestAuthorization</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.TestAuthorization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTestAuthorization</a> smart constructor.
data TestAuthorization
TestAuthorization' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> NonEmpty AuthInfo -> TestAuthorization

-- | The MQTT client ID.
[$sel:clientId:TestAuthorization'] :: TestAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | When testing custom authorization, the policies specified here are
--   treated as if they are attached to the principal being authorized.
[$sel:policyNamesToAdd:TestAuthorization'] :: TestAuthorization -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The principal. Valid principals are CertificateArn
--   (arn:aws:iot:<i>region</i>:<i>accountId</i>:cert/<i>certificateId</i>),
--   thingGroupArn
--   (arn:aws:iot:<i>region</i>:<i>accountId</i>:thinggroup/<i>groupName</i>)
--   and CognitoId (<i>region</i>:<i>id</i>).
[$sel:principal:TestAuthorization'] :: TestAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | The Cognito identity pool ID.
[$sel:cognitoIdentityPoolId:TestAuthorization'] :: TestAuthorization -> Maybe Text

-- | When testing custom authorization, the policies specified here are
--   treated as if they are not attached to the principal being authorized.
[$sel:policyNamesToSkip:TestAuthorization'] :: TestAuthorization -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of authorization info objects. Simulating authorization will
--   create a response for each <tt>authInfo</tt> object in the list.
[$sel:authInfos:TestAuthorization'] :: TestAuthorization -> NonEmpty AuthInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>TestAuthorization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientId:TestAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>testAuthorization_clientId</a> - The MQTT client ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyNamesToAdd:TestAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>testAuthorization_policyNamesToAdd</a> - When testing custom
--   authorization, the policies specified here are treated as if they are
--   attached to the principal being authorized.
--   
--   <a>$sel:principal:TestAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>testAuthorization_principal</a> - The principal. Valid principals
--   are CertificateArn
--   (arn:aws:iot:<i>region</i>:<i>accountId</i>:cert/<i>certificateId</i>),
--   thingGroupArn
--   (arn:aws:iot:<i>region</i>:<i>accountId</i>:thinggroup/<i>groupName</i>)
--   and CognitoId (<i>region</i>:<i>id</i>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:cognitoIdentityPoolId:TestAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>testAuthorization_cognitoIdentityPoolId</a> - The Cognito identity
--   pool ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyNamesToSkip:TestAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>testAuthorization_policyNamesToSkip</a> - When testing custom
--   authorization, the policies specified here are treated as if they are
--   not attached to the principal being authorized.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authInfos:TestAuthorization'</a>,
--   <a>testAuthorization_authInfos</a> - A list of authorization info
--   objects. Simulating authorization will create a response for each
--   <tt>authInfo</tt> object in the list.
newTestAuthorization :: NonEmpty AuthInfo -> TestAuthorization

-- | The MQTT client ID.
testAuthorization_clientId :: Lens' TestAuthorization (Maybe Text)

-- | When testing custom authorization, the policies specified here are
--   treated as if they are attached to the principal being authorized.
testAuthorization_policyNamesToAdd :: Lens' TestAuthorization (Maybe [Text])

-- | The principal. Valid principals are CertificateArn
--   (arn:aws:iot:<i>region</i>:<i>accountId</i>:cert/<i>certificateId</i>),
--   thingGroupArn
--   (arn:aws:iot:<i>region</i>:<i>accountId</i>:thinggroup/<i>groupName</i>)
--   and CognitoId (<i>region</i>:<i>id</i>).
testAuthorization_principal :: Lens' TestAuthorization (Maybe Text)

-- | The Cognito identity pool ID.
testAuthorization_cognitoIdentityPoolId :: Lens' TestAuthorization (Maybe Text)

-- | When testing custom authorization, the policies specified here are
--   treated as if they are not attached to the principal being authorized.
testAuthorization_policyNamesToSkip :: Lens' TestAuthorization (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of authorization info objects. Simulating authorization will
--   create a response for each <tt>authInfo</tt> object in the list.
testAuthorization_authInfos :: Lens' TestAuthorization (NonEmpty AuthInfo)

data TestAuthorizationResponse
TestAuthorizationResponse' :: Maybe [AuthResult] -> Int -> TestAuthorizationResponse

-- | The authentication results.
[$sel:authResults:TestAuthorizationResponse'] :: TestAuthorizationResponse -> Maybe [AuthResult]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:TestAuthorizationResponse'] :: TestAuthorizationResponse -> Int

-- | Creates a bulk thing provisioning task.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>StartThingRegistrationTask</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.StartThingRegistrationTask

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartThingRegistrationTask</a> smart constructor.
data StartThingRegistrationTask
StartThingRegistrationTask' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StartThingRegistrationTask

-- | The provisioning template.
[$sel:templateBody:StartThingRegistrationTask'] :: StartThingRegistrationTask -> Text

-- | The S3 bucket that contains the input file.
[$sel:inputFileBucket:StartThingRegistrationTask'] :: StartThingRegistrationTask -> Text

-- | The name of input file within the S3 bucket. This file contains a
--   newline delimited JSON file. Each line contains the parameter values
--   to provision one device (thing).
[$sel:inputFileKey:StartThingRegistrationTask'] :: StartThingRegistrationTask -> Text

-- | The IAM role ARN that grants permission the input file.
[$sel:roleArn:StartThingRegistrationTask'] :: StartThingRegistrationTask -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartThingRegistrationTask</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateBody:StartThingRegistrationTask'</a>,
--   <a>startThingRegistrationTask_templateBody</a> - The provisioning
--   template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputFileBucket:StartThingRegistrationTask'</a>,
--   <a>startThingRegistrationTask_inputFileBucket</a> - The S3 bucket that
--   contains the input file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputFileKey:StartThingRegistrationTask'</a>,
--   <a>startThingRegistrationTask_inputFileKey</a> - The name of input
--   file within the S3 bucket. This file contains a newline delimited JSON
--   file. Each line contains the parameter values to provision one device
--   (thing).
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:StartThingRegistrationTask'</a>,
--   <a>startThingRegistrationTask_roleArn</a> - The IAM role ARN that
--   grants permission the input file.

--   the status of the task or to cancel it.
[$sel:taskId:StartAuditMitigationActionsTask'] :: StartAuditMitigationActionsTask -> Text

--   applied. You can apply them to a type of audit check, to all findings
--   from an audit, or to a specific set of findings.
[$sel:target:StartAuditMitigationActionsTask'] :: StartAuditMitigationActionsTask -> AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget

-- | For an audit check, specifies which mitigation actions to apply. Those
--   actions must be defined in your Amazon Web Services accounts.
[$sel:auditCheckToActionsMapping:StartAuditMitigationActionsTask'] :: StartAuditMitigationActionsTask -> HashMap Text (NonEmpty Text)

--   you try to start a new task with the same token as a task that already
--   exists, an exception occurs. If you omit this value, a unique client
--   request token is generated automatically.

-- | Sets the specified version of the specified policy as the policy's
--   default (operative) version. This action affects all certificates to
--   which the policy is attached. To list the principals the policy is
--   attached to, use the ListPrincipalPolicies action.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>SetDefaultPolicyVersion</a>
--   action.

-- | The query search index.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>SearchIndex</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.SearchIndex

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchIndex</a> smart constructor.
data SearchIndex
SearchIndex' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Text -> SearchIndex

-- | The query version.
[$sel:queryVersion:SearchIndex'] :: SearchIndex -> Maybe Text

-- | The token used to get the next set of results, or <tt>null</tt> if
--   there are no additional results.
[$sel:nextToken:SearchIndex'] :: SearchIndex -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time.
[$sel:maxResults:SearchIndex'] :: SearchIndex -> Maybe Natural

-- | The search index name.
[$sel:indexName:SearchIndex'] :: SearchIndex -> Maybe Text

-- | The search query string.
[$sel:queryString:SearchIndex'] :: SearchIndex -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchIndex</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:queryVersion:SearchIndex'</a>, <a>searchIndex_queryVersion</a>
--   - The query version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:SearchIndex'</a>, <a>searchIndex_nextToken</a> - The
--   token used to get the next set of results, or <tt>null</tt> if there
--   are no additional results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:SearchIndex'</a>, <a>searchIndex_maxResults</a> -
--   The maximum number of results to return at one time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexName:SearchIndex'</a>, <a>searchIndex_indexName</a> - The
--   search index name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queryString:SearchIndex'</a>, <a>searchIndex_queryString</a> -
--   The search query string.
newSearchIndex :: Text -> SearchIndex

-- | The query version.
searchIndex_queryVersion :: Lens' SearchIndex (Maybe Text)

-- | The token used to get the next set of results, or <tt>null</tt> if
--   there are no additional results.
searchIndex_nextToken :: Lens' SearchIndex (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time.
searchIndex_maxResults :: Lens' SearchIndex (Maybe Natural)

-- | The search index name.
searchIndex_indexName :: Lens' SearchIndex (Maybe Text)

-- | The search query string.
searchIndex_queryString :: Lens' SearchIndex Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchIndexResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SearchIndexResponse
SearchIndexResponse' :: Maybe [ThingGroupDocument] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ThingDocument] -> Int -> SearchIndexResponse

-- | The thing groups that match the search query.
[$sel:thingGroups:SearchIndexResponse'] :: SearchIndexResponse -> Maybe [ThingGroupDocument]

-- | The token used to get the next set of results, or <tt>null</tt> if
--   there are no additional results.
[$sel:nextToken:SearchIndexResponse'] :: SearchIndexResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The things that match the search query.
[$sel:things:SearchIndexResponse'] :: SearchIndexResponse -> Maybe [ThingDocument]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SearchIndexResponse'] :: SearchIndexResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchIndexResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroups:SearchIndexResponse'</a>,
--   <a>searchIndexResponse_thingGroups</a> - The thing groups that match
--   the search query.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:SearchIndex'</a>,
--   <a>searchIndexResponse_nextToken</a> - The token used to get the next
--   set of results, or <tt>null</tt> if there are no additional results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:things:SearchIndexResponse'</a>,
--   <a>searchIndexResponse_things</a> - The things that match the search
--   query.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:SearchIndexResponse'</a>,
--   <a>searchIndexResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newSearchIndexResponse :: Int -> SearchIndexResponse

-- | The thing groups that match the search query.
searchIndexResponse_thingGroups :: Lens' SearchIndexResponse (Maybe [ThingGroupDocument])

-- | The token used to get the next set of results, or <tt>null</tt> if
--   there are no additional results.
searchIndexResponse_nextToken :: Lens' SearchIndexResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The things that match the search query.
searchIndexResponse_things :: Lens' SearchIndexResponse (Maybe [ThingDocument])

-- | The response's http status code.
searchIndexResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SearchIndexResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.SearchIndex.SearchIndex
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.SearchIndex.SearchIndex
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.SearchIndex.SearchIndex
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.SearchIndex.SearchIndexResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.SearchIndex.SearchIndexResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.SearchIndex.SearchIndexResponse

-- | Remove the specified thing from the specified group.
--   
--   You must specify either a <tt>thingGroupArn</tt> or a
--   <tt>thingGroupName</tt> to identify the thing group and either a
--   <tt>thingArn</tt> or a <tt>thingName</tt> to identify the thing to
--   remove from the thing group.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>RemoveThingFromThingGroup</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.RemoveThingFromThingGroup

--   fields omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   remove from the group.

-- | Rejects a pending certificate transfer. After IoT rejects a
--   certificate transfer, the certificate status changes from
--   <b>PENDING_TRANSFER</b> to <b>INACTIVE</b>.
--   
--   To check for pending certificate transfers, call ListCertificates to
--   enumerate your certificates.
--   
--   This operation can only be called by the transfer destination. After
--   it is called, the certificate will be returned to the source's account
--   in the INACTIVE state.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>RejectCertificateTransfer</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.RejectCertificateTransfer

-- | The input for the RejectCertificateTransfer operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRejectCertificateTransfer</a> smart constructor.
data RejectCertificateTransfer
RejectCertificateTransfer' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> RejectCertificateTransfer

-- | The reason the certificate transfer was rejected.
[$sel:rejectReason:RejectCertificateTransfer'] :: RejectCertificateTransfer -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
[$sel:certificateId:RejectCertificateTransfer'] :: RejectCertificateTransfer -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RejectCertificateTransfer</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rejectReason:RejectCertificateTransfer'</a>,
--   <a>rejectCertificateTransfer_rejectReason</a> - The reason the
--   certificate transfer was rejected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:RejectCertificateTransfer'</a>,
--   <a>rejectCertificateTransfer_certificateId</a> - The ID of the
--   certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN contains the
--   certificate ID.)
newRejectCertificateTransfer :: Text -> RejectCertificateTransfer

-- | The reason the certificate transfer was rejected.
rejectCertificateTransfer_rejectReason :: Lens' RejectCertificateTransfer (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
rejectCertificateTransfer_certificateId :: Lens' RejectCertificateTransfer Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRejectCertificateTransferResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RejectCertificateTransferResponse
RejectCertificateTransferResponse' :: RejectCertificateTransferResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>RejectCertificateTransferResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newRejectCertificateTransferResponse :: RejectCertificateTransferResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.RejectCertificateTransfer.RejectCertificateTransfer
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.RejectCertificateTransfer.RejectCertificateTransfer
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.RejectCertificateTransfer.RejectCertificateTransfer
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.RejectCertificateTransfer.RejectCertificateTransfer
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.RejectCertificateTransfer.RejectCertificateTransferResponse

-- | Provisions a thing in the device registry. RegisterThing calls other
--   IoT control plane APIs. These calls might exceed your account level
--   <a>IoT Throttling Limits</a> and cause throttle errors. Please contact
--   <a>Amazon Web Services Customer Support</a> to raise your throttling
--   limits if necessary.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>RegisterThing</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.RegisterThing

-- | Registers a device certificate with IoT. If you have more than one CA
--   certificate that has the same subject field, you must specify the CA
--   certificate that was used to sign the device certificate being
--   registered.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>RegisterCertificate</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.RegisterCertificate

-- | The input to the RegisterCertificate operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterCertificate
RegisterCertificate' :: Maybe CertificateStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> RegisterCertificate

-- | The status of the register certificate request.
[$sel:status:RegisterCertificate'] :: RegisterCertificate -> Maybe CertificateStatus

-- | The CA certificate used to sign the device certificate being
--   registered.
[$sel:caCertificatePem:RegisterCertificate'] :: RegisterCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | A boolean value that specifies if the certificate is set to active.
[$sel:setAsActive:RegisterCertificate'] :: RegisterCertificate -> Maybe Bool

-- | The certificate data, in PEM format.
[$sel:certificatePem:RegisterCertificate'] :: RegisterCertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterCertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   certificate request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:caCertificatePem:RegisterCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCertificate_caCertificatePem</a> - The CA certificate used
--   to sign the device certificate being registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:setAsActive:RegisterCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCertificate_setAsActive</a> - A boolean value that
--   specifies if the certificate is set to active.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificatePem:RegisterCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCertificate_certificatePem</a> - The certificate data, in
--   PEM format.
newRegisterCertificate :: Text -> RegisterCertificate

-- | The status of the register certificate request.
registerCertificate_status :: Lens' RegisterCertificate (Maybe CertificateStatus)

-- | The CA certificate used to sign the device certificate being
--   registered.
registerCertificate_caCertificatePem :: Lens' RegisterCertificate (Maybe Text)

--

[$sel:httpStatus:RegisterCertificateResponse'] :: RegisterCertificateResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterCertificateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--

--   <a>registerCertificateResponse_certificateId</a> - The certificate
--   identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RegisterCertificateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>registerCertificateResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newRegisterCertificateResponse :: Int -> RegisterCertificateResponse

-- | The certificate ARN.
registerCertificateResponse_certificateArn :: Lens' RegisterCertificateResponse (Maybe Text)

registerCertificateResponse_certificateId :: Lens' RegisterCertificateResponse (Maybe Text)

registerCertificateResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RegisterCertificateResponse Int

-- | Registers a CA certificate with IoT. This CA certificate can then be
--   used to sign device certificates, which can be then registered with
--   IoT. You can register up to 10 CA certificates per Amazon Web Services
--   account that have the same subject field. This enables you to have up
--   to 10 certificate authorities sign your device certificates. If you
--   have more than one CA certificate registered, make sure you pass the
--   CA certificate when you register your device certificates with the
--   RegisterCertificate action.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>RegisterCACertificate</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.RegisterCACertificate

-- | The input to the RegisterCACertificate operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterCACertificate</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterCACertificate
RegisterCACertificate' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe RegistrationConfig -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> RegisterCACertificate

-- | A boolean value that specifies if the CA certificate is set to active.
[$sel:setAsActive:RegisterCACertificate'] :: RegisterCACertificate -> Maybe Bool

-- | Allows this CA certificate to be used for auto registration of device
--   certificates.
[$sel:allowAutoRegistration:RegisterCACertificate'] :: RegisterCACertificate -> Maybe Bool

-- | Information about the registration configuration.
[$sel:registrationConfig:RegisterCACertificate'] :: RegisterCACertificate -> Maybe RegistrationConfig

-- | Metadata which can be used to manage the CA certificate.
--   
--   For URI Request parameters use format:
--   ...key1=value1&amp;key2=value2...
--   
--   For the CLI command-line parameter use format: &amp;&amp;tags
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
--   
--   For the cli-input-json file use format: "tags":
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
[$sel:tags:RegisterCACertificate'] :: RegisterCACertificate -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The CA certificate.
[$sel:caCertificate:RegisterCACertificate'] :: RegisterCACertificate -> Text

-- | The private key verification certificate.
[$sel:verificationCertificate:RegisterCACertificate'] :: RegisterCACertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterCACertificate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:setAsActive:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_setAsActive</a> - A boolean value that
--   specifies if the CA certificate is set to active.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowAutoRegistration:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_allowAutoRegistration</a> - Allows this CA
--   certificate to be used for auto registration of device certificates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registrationConfig:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_registrationConfig</a> - Information about
--   the registration configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_tags</a> - Metadata which can be used to
--   manage the CA certificate.
--   
--   For URI Request parameters use format:
--   ...key1=value1&amp;key2=value2...
--   
--   For the CLI command-line parameter use format: &amp;&amp;tags
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
--   
--   For the cli-input-json file use format: "tags":
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
--   
--   <a>$sel:caCertificate:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_caCertificate</a> - The CA certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationCertificate:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_verificationCertificate</a> - The private key
--   verification certificate.
newRegisterCACertificate :: Text -> Text -> RegisterCACertificate

-- | A boolean value that specifies if the CA certificate is set to active.
registerCACertificate_setAsActive :: Lens' RegisterCACertificate (Maybe Bool)

-- | Allows this CA certificate to be used for auto registration of device
--   certificates.

-- | Information about the registration configuration.
registerCACertificate_registrationConfig :: Lens' RegisterCACertificate (Maybe RegistrationConfig)

-- | Metadata which can be used to manage the CA certificate.
--   
--   For URI Request parameters use format:
--   ...key1=value1&amp;key2=value2...
--   
--   For the CLI command-line parameter use format: &amp;&amp;tags
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
--   
--   For the cli-input-json file use format: "tags":
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
registerCACertificate_tags :: Lens' RegisterCACertificate (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The CA certificate.
registerCACertificate_caCertificate :: Lens' RegisterCACertificate Text

-- | The private key verification certificate.
registerCACertificate_verificationCertificate :: Lens' RegisterCACertificate Text

-- | Set a verification state and provide a description of that
--   verification state on a violation (detect alarm).

-- | Lists the Device Defender security profile violations discovered
--   during the given time period. You can use filters to limit the results
--   to those alerts issued for a particular security profile, behavior, or
--   thing (device).
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>ListViolationEvents</a> action.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoT.ListViolationEvents

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListViolationEvents</a> smart constructor.
data ListViolationEvents
ListViolationEvents' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe BehaviorCriteriaType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VerificationState -> Maybe Natural -> POSIX -> POSIX -> ListViolationEvents

-- | The token for the next set of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListViolationEvents'] :: ListViolationEvents -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of all suppressed alerts.
[$sel:listSuppressedAlerts:ListViolationEvents'] :: ListViolationEvents -> Maybe Bool

-- | The criteria for a behavior.
[$sel:behaviorCriteriaType:ListViolationEvents'] :: ListViolationEvents -> Maybe BehaviorCriteriaType

-- | A filter to limit results to those alerts generated by the specified
--   security profile.
[$sel:securityProfileName:ListViolationEvents'] :: ListViolationEvents -> Maybe Text

-- | A filter to limit results to those alerts caused by the specified
--   thing.
[$sel:thingName:ListViolationEvents'] :: ListViolationEvents -> Maybe Text

-- | The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).
[$sel:verificationState:ListViolationEvents'] :: ListViolationEvents -> Maybe VerificationState

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time.
[$sel:maxResults:ListViolationEvents'] :: ListViolationEvents -> Maybe Natural

-- | The start time for the alerts to be listed.
[$sel:startTime:ListViolationEvents'] :: ListViolationEvents -> POSIX

-- | The end time for the alerts to be listed.
[$sel:endTime:ListViolationEvents'] :: ListViolationEvents -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>ListViolationEvents</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListViolationEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listViolationEvents_nextToken</a> - The token for the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listSuppressedAlerts:ListViolationEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listViolationEvents_listSuppressedAlerts</a> - A list of all
--   suppressed alerts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviorCriteriaType:ListViolationEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listViolationEvents_behaviorCriteriaType</a> - The criteria for a
--   behavior.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileName:ListViolationEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listViolationEvents_securityProfileName</a> - A filter to limit
--   results to those alerts generated by the specified security profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:ListViolationEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listViolationEvents_thingName</a> - A filter to limit results to
--   those alerts caused by the specified thing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationState:ListViolationEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listViolationEvents_verificationState</a> - The verification state
--   of the violation (detect alarm).
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListViolationEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listViolationEvents_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to return at one time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:ListViolationEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listViolationEvents_startTime</a> - The start time for the alerts
--   to be listed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:ListViolationEvents'</a>,
--   <a>listViolationEvents_endTime</a> - The end time for the alerts to be
--   listed.
newListViolationEvents :: UTCTime -> UTCTime -> ListViolationEvents

-- | The token for the next set of results.
listViolationEvents_nextToken :: Lens' ListViolationEvents (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of all suppressed alerts.
listViolationEvents_listSuppressedAlerts :: Lens' ListViolationEvents (Maybe Bool)

-- | The criteria for a behavior.
listViolationEvents_behaviorCriteriaType :: Lens' ListViolationEvents (Maybe BehaviorCriteriaType)

-- | A filter to limit results to those alerts generated by the specified
--   security profile.
listViolationEvents_securityProfileName :: Lens' ListViolationEvents (Maybe Text)

-- | A filter to limit results to those alerts caused by the specified
--   thing.
listViolationEvents_thingName :: Lens' ListViolationEvents (Maybe Text)

-- | The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).
listViolationEvents_verificationState :: Lens' ListViolationEvents (Maybe VerificationState)

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time.
listViolationEvents_maxResults :: Lens' ListViolationEvents (Maybe Natural)

-- | The start time for the alerts to be listed.
listViolationEvents_startTime :: Lens' ListViolationEvents UTCTime

-- | The end time for the alerts to be listed.
listViolationEvents_endTime :: Lens' ListViolationEvents UTCTime

--   the given time period, potentially filtered by security profile,

--

-- | Lists logging levels.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>ListV2LoggingLevels</a> action.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListV2LoggingLevels</a> smart constructor.
data ListV2LoggingLevels
ListV2LoggingLevels' :: Maybe LogTargetType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListV2LoggingLevels

-- | The type of resource for which you are configuring logging. Must be
--   <tt>THING_Group</tt>.
[$sel:targetType:ListV2LoggingLevels'] :: ListV2LoggingLevels -> Maybe LogTargetType

-- | To retrieve the next set of results, the <tt>nextToken</tt> value from
--   a previous response; otherwise <b>null</b> to receive the first set of
--   results.

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--

--   <a>listV2LoggingLevels_nextToken</a> - To retrieve the next set of
--   results, the <tt>nextToken</tt> value from a previous response;
--   otherwise <b>null</b> to receive the first set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListV2LoggingLevels'</a>,
--   <a>listV2LoggingLevels_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to return at one time.
newListV2LoggingLevels :: ListV2LoggingLevels

-- | The type of resource for which you are configuring logging. Must be
--   <tt>THING_Group</tt>.
listV2LoggingLevels_targetType :: Lens' ListV2LoggingLevels (Maybe LogTargetType)

-- | To retrieve the next set of results, the <tt>nextToken</tt> value from
--   a previous response; otherwise <b>null</b> to receive the first set of

-- | Lists your things. Use the <b>attributeName</b> and
--   <b>attributeValue</b> parameters to filter your things. For example,
--   calling <tt>ListThings</tt> with attributeName=Color and
--   attributeValue=Red retrieves all things in the registry that contain
--   an attribute <b>Color</b> with the value <b>Red</b>.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>ListThings</a> action.
--   
--   You will not be charged for calling this API if an <tt>Access
--   denied</tt> error is returned. You will also not be charged if no
--   attributes or pagination token was provided in request and no
--   pagination token and no results were returned.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoT.ListThings

-- | The input for the ListThings operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListThings</a> smart constructor.
data ListThings
ListThings' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListThings

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the action returns the thing resources with
--   attribute values that start with the <tt>attributeValue</tt> provided.
--   
--   When <tt>false</tt>, or not present, the action returns only the thing
--   resources with attribute values that match the entire
--   <tt>attributeValue</tt> provided.
[$sel:usePrefixAttributeValue:ListThings'] :: ListThings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The attribute value used to search for things.
[$sel:attributeValue:ListThings'] :: ListThings -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the thing type used to search for things.
[$sel:thingTypeName:ListThings'] :: ListThings -> Maybe Text

-- | To retrieve the next set of results, the <tt>nextToken</tt> value from
--   a previous response; otherwise <b>null</b> to receive the first set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListThings'] :: ListThings -> Maybe Text

-- | The attribute name used to search for things.
[$sel:attributeName:ListThings'] :: ListThings -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return in this operation.
[$sel:maxResults:ListThings'] :: ListThings -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListThings</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--   <tt>attributeValue</tt> provided.

-- | Lists the Device Defender security profiles you've created. You can
--   filter security profiles by dimension or custom metric.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>ListSecurityProfiles</a> action.
--   
--   <tt>dimensionName</tt> and <tt>metricName</tt> cannot be used in the
--   same request.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoT.ListSecurityProfiles

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListSecurityProfiles</a> smart constructor.
data ListSecurityProfiles
ListSecurityProfiles' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListSecurityProfiles

-- | The name of the custom metric. Cannot be used with
--   <tt>dimensionName</tt>.
[$sel:metricName:ListSecurityProfiles'] :: ListSecurityProfiles -> Maybe Text

-- | The token for the next set of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListSecurityProfiles'] :: ListSecurityProfiles -> Maybe Text

-- | A filter to limit results to the security profiles that use the
--   defined dimension. Cannot be used with <tt>metricName</tt>
[$sel:dimensionName:ListSecurityProfiles'] :: ListSecurityProfiles -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time.
[$sel:maxResults:ListSecurityProfiles'] :: ListSecurityProfiles -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListSecurityProfiles</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:ListSecurityProfiles'</a>,
--   <a>listSecurityProfiles_metricName</a> - The name of the custom
--   metric. Cannot be used with <tt>dimensionName</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListSecurityProfiles'</a>,
--   <a>listSecurityProfiles_nextToken</a> - The token for the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:ListSecurityProfiles'</a>,
--   <a>listSecurityProfiles_dimensionName</a> - A filter to limit results
--   to the security profiles that use the defined dimension. Cannot be
--   used with <tt>metricName</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListSecurityProfiles'</a>,
--   <a>listSecurityProfiles_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to return at one time.

--   <tt>dimensionName</tt>.

--   defined dimension. Cannot be used with <tt>metricName</tt>

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time.

-- | Lists jobs.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>ListJobs</a> action.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoT.ListJobs

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListJobs</a> smart constructor.
data ListJobs
ListJobs' :: Maybe JobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe TargetSelection -> ListJobs

-- | An optional filter that lets you search for jobs that have the
--   specified status.
[$sel:status:ListJobs'] :: ListJobs -> Maybe JobStatus

-- | A filter that limits the returned jobs to those for the specified
--   group.
[$sel:thingGroupId:ListJobs'] :: ListJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
[$sel:namespaceId:ListJobs'] :: ListJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListJobs'] :: ListJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | A filter that limits the returned jobs to those for the specified
--   group.
[$sel:thingGroupName:ListJobs'] :: ListJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return per request.
[$sel:maxResults:ListJobs'] :: ListJobs -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job
--   was completed by all things originally in the group.
[$sel:targetSelection:ListJobs'] :: ListJobs -> Maybe TargetSelection

-- | Create a value of <a>ListJobs</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ListJobs'</a>, <a>listJobs_status</a> - An optional
--   filter that lets you search for jobs that have the specified status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupId:ListJobs'</a>, <a>listJobs_thingGroupId</a> - A
--   filter that limits the returned jobs to those for the specified group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:ListJobs'</a>, <a>listJobs_namespaceId</a> - The
--   namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListJobs'</a>, <a>listJobs_nextToken</a> - The token
--   to retrieve the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupName:ListJobs'</a>, <a>listJobs_thingGroupName</a> -
--   A filter that limits the returned jobs to those for the specified
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListJobs'</a>, <a>listJobs_maxResults</a> - The
--   maximum number of results to return per request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:ListJobs'</a>, <a>listJobs_targetSelection</a>
--   - Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job
--   was completed by all things originally in the group.
newListJobs :: ListJobs

-- | An optional filter that lets you search for jobs that have the

--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
listJobs_namespaceId :: Lens' ListJobs (Maybe Text)

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results.
listJobs_nextToken :: Lens' ListJobs (Maybe Text)

-- | A filter that limits the returned jobs to those for the specified
--   group.
listJobs_thingGroupName :: Lens' ListJobs (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return per request.

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed

--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on

--   Services accounts.

--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   - The token for the next set of results.
--

--   <a>listDimensions_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results to
--   retrieve at one time.

data ListDimensionsResponse

--   <tt>null</tt> if there are no additional results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListDimensionsResponse'] :: ListDimensionsResponse -> Maybe Text

--   <tt>DescribeDimension</tt> to get details for a dimension.
[$sel:dimensionNames:ListDimensionsResponse'] :: ListDimensionsResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListDimensionsResponse'] :: ListDimensionsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListDimensionsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListDimensions'</a>,
--   <a>listDimensionsResponse_nextToken</a> - A token that can be used to
--   retrieve the next set of results, or <tt>null</tt> if there are no
--   additional results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionNames:ListDimensionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listDimensionsResponse_dimensionNames</a> - A list of the names of
--   the defined dimensions. Use <tt>DescribeDimension</tt> to get details

--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | The input to the ListCertificatesByCA operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListCertificatesByCA</a> smart constructor.
data ListCertificatesByCA

-- | The marker for the next set of results.
[$sel:marker:ListCertificatesByCA'] :: ListCertificatesByCA -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the order for results. If True, the results are returned in
--   ascending order, based on the creation date.
[$sel:ascendingOrder:ListCertificatesByCA'] :: ListCertificatesByCA -> Maybe Bool

-- | The result page size.
[$sel:pageSize:ListCertificatesByCA'] :: ListCertificatesByCA -> Maybe Natural

-- | The ID of the CA certificate. This operation will list all registered
--   device certificate that were signed by this CA certificate.
[$sel:caCertificateId:ListCertificatesByCA'] :: ListCertificatesByCA -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListCertificatesByCA</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   results. If True, the results are returned in ascending order, based
--   on the creation date.

--   <a>listCertificatesByCA_pageSize</a> - The result page size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:caCertificateId:ListCertificatesByCA'</a>,
--   <a>listCertificatesByCA_caCertificateId</a> - The ID of the CA
--   certificate. This operation will list all registered device
--   certificate that were signed by this CA certificate.

-- | Lists the Device Defender audits that have been performed during a
--   given time period.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>ListAuditTasks</a> action.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoT.ListAuditTasks

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAuditTasks</a> smart constructor.
data ListAuditTasks
ListAuditTasks' :: Maybe AuditTaskType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe AuditTaskStatus -> POSIX -> POSIX -> ListAuditTasks

-- | A filter to limit the output to the specified type of audit: can be
--   one of "ON_DEMAND_AUDIT_TASK" or "SCHEDULED__AUDIT_TASK".
[$sel:taskType:ListAuditTasks'] :: ListAuditTasks -> Maybe AuditTaskType

-- | The token for the next set of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAuditTasks'] :: ListAuditTasks -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time. The default is
--   25.
[$sel:maxResults:ListAuditTasks'] :: ListAuditTasks -> Maybe Natural

-- | A filter to limit the output to audits with the specified completion
--   status: can be one of "IN_PROGRESS", "COMPLETED", "FAILED", or
--   "CANCELED".
[$sel:taskStatus:ListAuditTasks'] :: ListAuditTasks -> Maybe AuditTaskStatus

-- | The beginning of the time period. Audit information is retained for a
--   limited time (90 days). Requesting a start time prior to what is
--   retained results in an "InvalidRequestException".
[$sel:startTime:ListAuditTasks'] :: ListAuditTasks -> POSIX

-- | The end of the time period.
[$sel:endTime:ListAuditTasks'] :: ListAuditTasks -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAuditTasks</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskType:ListAuditTasks'</a>, <a>listAuditTasks_taskType</a> -
--   A filter to limit the output to the specified type of audit: can be
--   one of "ON_DEMAND_AUDIT_TASK" or "SCHEDULED__AUDIT_TASK".
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListAuditTasks'</a>, <a>listAuditTasks_nextToken</a>
--   - The token for the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListAuditTasks'</a>,
--   <a>listAuditTasks_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results to
--   return at one time. The default is 25.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStatus:ListAuditTasks'</a>,
--   <a>listAuditTasks_taskStatus</a> - A filter to limit the output to
--   audits with the specified completion status: can be one of
--   "IN_PROGRESS", "COMPLETED", "FAILED", or "CANCELED".
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:ListAuditTasks'</a>, <a>listAuditTasks_startTime</a>
--   - The beginning of the time period. Audit information is retained for
--   a limited time (90 days). Requesting a start time prior to what is
--   retained results in an "InvalidRequestException".
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:ListAuditTasks'</a>, <a>listAuditTasks_endTime</a> -
--   The end of the time period.
newListAuditTasks :: UTCTime -> UTCTime -> ListAuditTasks

-- | A filter to limit the output to the specified type of audit: can be
--   one of "ON_DEMAND_AUDIT_TASK" or "SCHEDULED__AUDIT_TASK".

-- | The token for the next set of results.
listAuditTasks_nextToken :: Lens' ListAuditTasks (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time. The default is
--   25.

--   "CANCELED".
listAuditTasks_taskStatus :: Lens' ListAuditTasks (Maybe AuditTaskStatus)

-- | The beginning of the time period. Audit information is retained for a
--   limited time (90 days). Requesting a start time prior to what is
--   retained results in an "InvalidRequestException".
listAuditTasks_startTime :: Lens' ListAuditTasks UTCTime

-- | The end of the time period.
listAuditTasks_endTime :: Lens' ListAuditTasks UTCTime

-- | Lists the findings (results) of a Device Defender audit or of the
--   audits performed during a specified time period. (Findings are
--   retained for 90 days.)
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>ListAuditFindings</a> action.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoT.ListAuditFindings

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAuditFindings</a> smart constructor.
data ListAuditFindings
ListAuditFindings' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe ResourceIdentifier -> ListAuditFindings

-- | A filter to limit results to those found after the specified time. You
--   must specify either the startTime and endTime or the taskId, but not
--   both.
[$sel:startTime:ListAuditFindings'] :: ListAuditFindings -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A filter to limit results to the audit with the specified ID. You must
--   specify either the taskId or the startTime and endTime, but not both.

-- | A filter to limit results to the findings for the specified audit
--   check.

-- | Boolean flag indicating whether only the suppressed findings or the
--   unsuppressed findings should be listed. If this parameter isn't
--   provided, the response will list both suppressed and unsuppressed
--   findings.
[$sel:listSuppressedFindings:ListAuditFindings'] :: ListAuditFindings -> Maybe Bool

-- | The token for the next set of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAuditFindings'] :: ListAuditFindings -> Maybe Text

--   not both.

--   25.

-- | Lists the policies attached to the specified thing group.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>ListAttachedPolicies</a> action.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoT.ListAttachedPolicies

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAttachedPolicies</a> smart constructor.
data ListAttachedPolicies

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results.
[$sel:marker:ListAttachedPolicies'] :: ListAttachedPolicies -> Maybe Text

-- | When true, recursively list attached policies.
[$sel:recursive:ListAttachedPolicies'] :: ListAttachedPolicies -> Maybe Bool

-- | The maximum number of results to be returned per request.
[$sel:pageSize:ListAttachedPolicies'] :: ListAttachedPolicies -> Maybe Natural

-- | The group or principal for which the policies will be listed. Valid
--   principals are CertificateArn
--   (arn:aws:iot:<i>region</i>:<i>accountId</i>:cert/<i>certificateId</i>),
--   thingGroupArn
--   (arn:aws:iot:<i>region</i>:<i>accountId</i>:thinggroup/<i>groupName</i>)
--   and CognitoId (<i>region</i>:<i>id</i>).

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   set of results.

--   attached policies.

-- | Lists the active violations for a given Device Defender security
--   profile.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>ListActiveViolations</a> action.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoT.ListActiveViolations

--   are listed.

-- | The name of the thing whose active violations are listed.
[$sel:thingName:ListActiveViolations'] :: ListActiveViolations -> Maybe Text

-- | The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).
[$sel:verificationState:ListActiveViolations'] :: ListActiveViolations -> Maybe VerificationState

-- | The maximum number of results to return at one time.

-- | Returns the count, average, sum, minimum, maximum, sum of squares,
--   variance, and standard deviation for the specified aggregated field.
--   If the aggregation field is of type <tt>String</tt>, only the count
--   statistic is returned.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>GetStatistics</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.GetStatistics

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data GetStatistics
GetStatistics' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> GetStatistics

-- | The version of the query used to search.
[$sel:queryVersion:GetStatistics'] :: GetStatistics -> Maybe Text

-- | The aggregation field name.
[$sel:aggregationField:GetStatistics'] :: GetStatistics -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the index to search. The default value is
--   <tt>AWS_Things</tt>.
[$sel:indexName:GetStatistics'] :: GetStatistics -> Maybe Text

-- | The query used to search. You can specify "*" for the query string to
--   get the count of all indexed things in your Amazon Web Services
--   account.
[$sel:queryString:GetStatistics'] :: GetStatistics -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   The name of the index to search. The default value is
--   <tt>AWS_Things</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queryString:GetStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>getStatistics_queryString</a> - The query used to search. You can
--   specify "*" for the query string to get the count of all indexed

--   <a>getPolicyVersionResponse_policyVersionId</a> - The policy version
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyArn:GetPolicyVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getPolicyVersionResponse_policyArn</a> - The policy ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:GetPolicyVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getPolicyVersionResponse_creationDate</a> - The date the policy was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:generationId:GetPolicyVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getPolicyVersionResponse_generationId</a> - The generation ID of
--   the policy version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDefaultVersion:GetPolicyVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getPolicyVersionResponse_isDefaultVersion</a> - Specifies whether
--   the policy version is the default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetPolicyVersionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getPolicyVersionResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetPolicyVersionResponse :: Int -> GetPolicyVersionResponse

-- | The date the policy was last modified.
getPolicyVersionResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' GetPolicyVersionResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The policy name.
getPolicyVersionResponse_policyName :: Lens' GetPolicyVersionResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The JSON document that describes the policy.
getPolicyVersionResponse_policyDocument :: Lens' GetPolicyVersionResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The policy version ID.
getPolicyVersionResponse_policyVersionId :: Lens' GetPolicyVersionResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The policy ARN.
getPolicyVersionResponse_policyArn :: Lens' GetPolicyVersionResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the policy was created.
getPolicyVersionResponse_creationDate :: Lens' GetPolicyVersionResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The generation ID of the policy version.
getPolicyVersionResponse_generationId :: Lens' GetPolicyVersionResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the policy version is the default.
getPolicyVersionResponse_isDefaultVersion :: Lens' GetPolicyVersionResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The response's http status code.
getPolicyVersionResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetPolicyVersionResponse Int

-- | Gets information about the specified policy with the policy document

-- | Groups the aggregated values that match the query into percentile
--   groupings. The default percentile groupings are: 1,5,25,50,75,95,99,
--   although you can specify your own when you call
--   <tt>GetPercentiles</tt>. This function returns a value for each
--   percentile group specified (or the default percentile groupings). The
--   percentile group "1" contains the aggregated field value that occurs
--   in approximately one percent of the values that match the query. The
--   percentile group "5" contains the aggregated field value that occurs
--   in approximately five percent of the values that match the query, and
--   so on. The result is an approximation, the more values that match the
--   query, the more accurate the percentile values.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>GetPercentiles</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetPercentiles</a> smart constructor.
data GetPercentiles
GetPercentiles' :: Maybe [Double] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> GetPercentiles

-- | The percentile groups returned.
[$sel:percents:GetPercentiles'] :: GetPercentiles -> Maybe [Double]

-- | The query version.
[$sel:queryVersion:GetPercentiles'] :: GetPercentiles -> Maybe Text

-- | The field to aggregate.
[$sel:aggregationField:GetPercentiles'] :: GetPercentiles -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the index to search.
[$sel:indexName:GetPercentiles'] :: GetPercentiles -> Maybe Text

-- | The search query string.
[$sel:queryString:GetPercentiles'] :: GetPercentiles -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetPercentiles</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:percents:GetPercentiles'</a>, <a>getPercentiles_percents</a> -
--   The percentile groups returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queryVersion:GetPercentiles'</a>,
--   <a>getPercentiles_queryVersion</a> - The query version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:aggregationField:GetPercentiles'</a>,
--   <a>getPercentiles_aggregationField</a> - The field to aggregate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexName:GetPercentiles'</a>, <a>getPercentiles_indexName</a>
--   - The name of the index to search.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queryString:GetPercentiles'</a>,
--   <a>getPercentiles_queryString</a> - The search query string.
newGetPercentiles :: Text -> GetPercentiles

-- | The percentile groups returned.
getPercentiles_percents :: Lens' GetPercentiles (Maybe [Double])

-- | The query version.
getPercentiles_queryVersion :: Lens' GetPercentiles (Maybe Text)

-- | The field to aggregate.
getPercentiles_aggregationField :: Lens' GetPercentiles (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the index to search.
getPercentiles_indexName :: Lens' GetPercentiles (Maybe Text)

-- | The search query string.
getPercentiles_queryString :: Lens' GetPercentiles Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetPercentilesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetPercentilesResponse
GetPercentilesResponse' :: Maybe [PercentPair] -> Int -> GetPercentilesResponse

-- | The percentile values of the aggregated fields.
[$sel:percentiles:GetPercentilesResponse'] :: GetPercentilesResponse -> Maybe [PercentPair]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetPercentilesResponse'] :: GetPercentilesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetPercentilesResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentiles:GetPercentilesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getPercentilesResponse_percentiles</a> - The percentile values of
--   the aggregated fields.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetPercentilesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getPercentilesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetPercentilesResponse :: Int -> GetPercentilesResponse

-- | The percentile values of the aggregated fields.
getPercentilesResponse_percentiles :: Lens' GetPercentilesResponse (Maybe [PercentPair])

-- | The response's http status code.
getPercentilesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetPercentilesResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentiles
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentiles
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentiles
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentiles
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentilesResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentilesResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentilesResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentilesResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentiles
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentilesResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentiles
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoT.GetPercentiles.GetPercentiles

-- | Gets a list of the policies that have an effect on the authorization
--   behavior of the specified device when it connects to the IoT device
--   gateway.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>GetEffectivePolicies</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.GetEffectivePolicies

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetEffectivePolicies</a> smart constructor.
data GetEffectivePolicies
GetEffectivePolicies' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> GetEffectivePolicies

-- | The principal. Valid principals are CertificateArn
--   (arn:aws:iot:<i>region</i>:<i>accountId</i>:cert/<i>certificateId</i>),
--   thingGroupArn
--   (arn:aws:iot:<i>region</i>:<i>accountId</i>:thinggroup/<i>groupName</i>)
--   and CognitoId (<i>region</i>:<i>id</i>).

-- | The Cognito identity pool ID.
[$sel:cognitoIdentityPoolId:GetEffectivePolicies'] :: GetEffectivePolicies -> Maybe Text

-- | The thing name.

--   particular fields.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>GetBucketsAggregation</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.GetBucketsAggregation

--   type to perform.

data GetBucketsAggregationResponse
GetBucketsAggregationResponse' :: Maybe [Bucket] -> Maybe Int -> Int -> GetBucketsAggregationResponse

-- | The main part of the response with a list of buckets. Each bucket
--   contains a <tt>keyValue</tt> and a <tt>count</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>keyValue</tt>: The aggregation field value counted for the
--   particular bucket.
--   
--   <tt>count</tt>: The number of documents that have that value.
[$sel:buckets:GetBucketsAggregationResponse'] :: GetBucketsAggregationResponse -> Maybe [Bucket]

-- | The total number of documents that fit the query string criteria and
--   contain a value for the Aggregation field targeted in the request.
[$sel:totalCount:GetBucketsAggregationResponse'] :: GetBucketsAggregationResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetBucketsAggregationResponse'] :: GetBucketsAggregationResponse -> Int

--   optional fields omitted.

--   response with a list of buckets. Each bucket contains a
--   <tt>keyValue</tt> and a <tt>count</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>keyValue</tt>: The aggregation field value counted for the
--   particular bucket.
--   
--   <tt>count</tt>: The number of documents that have that value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalCount:GetBucketsAggregationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketsAggregationResponse_totalCount</a> - The total number of
--   documents that fit the query string criteria and contain a value for
--   the Aggregation field targeted in the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetBucketsAggregationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketsAggregationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.

--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | Detaches the specified principal from the specified thing. A principal
--   can be X.509 certificates, IAM users, groups, and roles, Amazon
--   Cognito identities or federated identities.
--   
--   This call is asynchronous. It might take several seconds for the
--   detachment to propagate.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DetachThingPrincipal</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DetachThingPrincipal

-- | The input for the DetachThingPrincipal operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDetachThingPrincipal</a> smart constructor.
data DetachThingPrincipal
DetachThingPrincipal' :: Text -> Text -> DetachThingPrincipal

-- | The name of the thing.
[$sel:thingName:DetachThingPrincipal'] :: DetachThingPrincipal -> Text

-- | If the principal is a certificate, this value must be ARN of the
--   certificate. If the principal is an Amazon Cognito identity, this
--   value must be the ID of the Amazon Cognito identity.
[$sel:principal:DetachThingPrincipal'] :: DetachThingPrincipal -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DetachThingPrincipal</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:DetachThingPrincipal'</a>,
--   <a>detachThingPrincipal_thingName</a> - The name of the thing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:principal:DetachThingPrincipal'</a>,
--   <a>detachThingPrincipal_principal</a> - If the principal is a
--   certificate, this value must be ARN of the certificate. If the
--   principal is an Amazon Cognito identity, this value must be the ID of
--   the Amazon Cognito identity.
newDetachThingPrincipal :: Text -> Text -> DetachThingPrincipal

-- | The name of the thing.
detachThingPrincipal_thingName :: Lens' DetachThingPrincipal Text

-- | If the principal is a certificate, this value must be ARN of the
--   certificate. If the principal is an Amazon Cognito identity, this
--   value must be the ID of the Amazon Cognito identity.
detachThingPrincipal_principal :: Lens' DetachThingPrincipal Text

-- | The output from the DetachThingPrincipal operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDetachThingPrincipalResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DetachThingPrincipalResponse
DetachThingPrincipalResponse' :: Int -> DetachThingPrincipalResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DetachThingPrincipalResponse'] :: DetachThingPrincipalResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DetachThingPrincipalResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DetachThingPrincipalResponse'</a>,
--   <a>detachThingPrincipalResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDetachThingPrincipalResponse :: Int -> DetachThingPrincipalResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
detachThingPrincipalResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DetachThingPrincipalResponse Int

-- | Detaches a policy from the specified target.
--   
--   Because of the distributed nature of Amazon Web Services, it can take

--   deleted.
--

--   including description, and a list of searchable thing attribute names.

--   type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the
--   thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when it was deprecated.
[$sel:thingTypeMetadata:DescribeThingTypeResponse'] :: DescribeThingTypeResponse -> Maybe ThingTypeMetadata

[$sel:thingTypeArn:DescribeThingTypeResponse'] :: DescribeThingTypeResponse -> Maybe Text
