-- | Gets information about the specified thing.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DescribeThing</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DescribeThing

-- | The input for the DescribeThing operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeThing</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeThing
DescribeThing' :: Text -> DescribeThing

-- | The name of the thing.
[$sel:thingName:DescribeThing'] :: DescribeThing -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeThing</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:DescribeThing'</a>, <a>describeThing_thingName</a> -
--   The name of the thing.
newDescribeThing :: Text -> DescribeThing

-- | The name of the thing.
describeThing_thingName :: Lens' DescribeThing Text

-- | The output from the DescribeThing operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeThingResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeThingResponse
DescribeThingResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeThingResponse

-- | The default MQTT client ID. For a typical device, the thing name is
--   also used as the default MQTT client ID. Although we dont require a
--   mapping between a thing's registry name and its use of MQTT client
--   IDs, certificates, or shadow state, we recommend that you choose a
--   thing name and use it as the MQTT client ID for the registry and the
--   Device Shadow service.
--   
--   This lets you better organize your IoT fleet without removing the
--   flexibility of the underlying device certificate model or shadows.
[$sel:defaultClientId:DescribeThingResponse'] :: DescribeThingResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The thing type name.
[$sel:thingTypeName:DescribeThingResponse'] :: DescribeThingResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the thing to describe.
[$sel:thingArn:DescribeThingResponse'] :: DescribeThingResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The thing attributes.
[$sel:attributes:DescribeThingResponse'] :: DescribeThingResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The current version of the thing record in the registry.
--   
--   To avoid unintentional changes to the information in the registry, you
--   can pass the version information in the <tt>expectedVersion</tt>
--   parameter of the <tt>UpdateThing</tt> and <tt>DeleteThing</tt> calls.
[$sel:version:DescribeThingResponse'] :: DescribeThingResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the thing.
[$sel:thingName:DescribeThingResponse'] :: DescribeThingResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the billing group the thing belongs to.
[$sel:billingGroupName:DescribeThingResponse'] :: DescribeThingResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the thing to describe.
[$sel:thingId:DescribeThingResponse'] :: DescribeThingResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeThingResponse'] :: DescribeThingResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeThingResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultClientId:DescribeThingResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeThingResponse_defaultClientId</a> - The default MQTT client
--   ID. For a typical device, the thing name is also used as the default
--   MQTT client ID. Although we dont require a mapping between a thing's
--   registry name and its use of MQTT client IDs, certificates, or shadow
--   state, we recommend that you choose a thing name and use it as the
--   MQTT client ID for the registry and the Device Shadow service.
--   
--   This lets you better organize your IoT fleet without removing the
--   flexibility of the underlying device certificate model or shadows.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingTypeName:DescribeThingResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeThingResponse_thingTypeName</a> - The thing type name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingArn:DescribeThingResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeThingResponse_thingArn</a> - The ARN of the thing to
--   describe.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:DescribeThingResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeThingResponse_attributes</a> - The thing attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:DescribeThingResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeThingResponse_version</a> - The current version of the
--   thing record in the registry.
--   
--   To avoid unintentional changes to the information in the registry, you
--   can pass the version information in the <tt>expectedVersion</tt>
--   parameter of the <tt>UpdateThing</tt> and <tt>DeleteThing</tt> calls.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:DescribeThing'</a>,
--   <a>describeThingResponse_thingName</a> - The name of the thing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:billingGroupName:DescribeThingResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeThingResponse_billingGroupName</a> - The name of the
--   billing group the thing belongs to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingId:DescribeThingResponse'</a>,

--   describe.

--   code.
newDescribeThingResponse :: Int -> DescribeThingResponse

-- | The default MQTT client ID. For a typical device, the thing name is
--   also used as the default MQTT client ID. Although we dont require a

-- | Gets information about a Device Defender security profile.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DescribeSecurityProfile</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DescribeSecurityProfile

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeSecurityProfile</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeSecurityProfile
DescribeSecurityProfile' :: Text -> DescribeSecurityProfile

-- | The name of the security profile whose information you want to get.
[$sel:securityProfileName:DescribeSecurityProfile'] :: DescribeSecurityProfile -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeSecurityProfile</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileName:DescribeSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>describeSecurityProfile_securityProfileName</a> - The name of the
--   security profile whose information you want to get.
newDescribeSecurityProfile :: Text -> DescribeSecurityProfile

-- | The name of the security profile whose information you want to get.
describeSecurityProfile_securityProfileName :: Lens' DescribeSecurityProfile Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeSecurityProfileResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeSecurityProfileResponse
DescribeSecurityProfileResponse' :: Maybe (HashMap AlertTargetType AlertTarget) -> Maybe [MetricToRetain] -> Maybe [Behavior] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeSecurityProfileResponse

-- | Where the alerts are sent. (Alerts are always sent to the console.)
[$sel:alertTargets:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'] :: DescribeSecurityProfileResponse -> Maybe (HashMap AlertTargetType AlertTarget)

-- | A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the profile's behaviors, but it is
--   also retained for any metric specified here.
[$sel:additionalMetricsToRetainV2:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'] :: DescribeSecurityProfileResponse -> Maybe [MetricToRetain]

-- | Specifies the behaviors that, when violated by a device (thing), cause
--   an alert.
[$sel:behaviors:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'] :: DescribeSecurityProfileResponse -> Maybe [Behavior]

-- | The time the security profile was last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'] :: DescribeSecurityProfileResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The version of the security profile. A new version is generated
--   whenever the security profile is updated.
[$sel:version:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'] :: DescribeSecurityProfileResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the security profile.
[$sel:securityProfileName:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'] :: DescribeSecurityProfileResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The time the security profile was created.
[$sel:creationDate:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'] :: DescribeSecurityProfileResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | /Please use
--   DescribeSecurityProfileResponse$additionalMetricsToRetainV2 instead./
--   
--   A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the profile's <tt>behaviors</tt>, but
--   it is also retained for any metric specified here.
[$sel:additionalMetricsToRetain:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'] :: DescribeSecurityProfileResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The ARN of the security profile.
[$sel:securityProfileArn:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'] :: DescribeSecurityProfileResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the security profile (associated with the security
--   profile when it was created or updated).
[$sel:securityProfileDescription:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'] :: DescribeSecurityProfileResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'] :: DescribeSecurityProfileResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeSecurityProfileResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alertTargets:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeSecurityProfileResponse_alertTargets</a> - Where the alerts
--   are sent. (Alerts are always sent to the console.)
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalMetricsToRetainV2:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeSecurityProfileResponse_additionalMetricsToRetainV2</a> - A
--   list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the profile's behaviors, but it is
--   also retained for any metric specified here.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviors:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeSecurityProfileResponse_behaviors</a> - Specifies the
--   behaviors that, when violated by a device (thing), cause an alert.

--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeSecurityProfileResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The time the
--   security profile was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'</a>,

--   profile is updated.

--   of the security profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeSecurityProfileResponse_creationDate</a> - The time the
--   security profile was created.
--

--   /Please use
--   DescribeSecurityProfileResponse$additionalMetricsToRetainV2 instead./

--   A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is

--   it is also retained for any metric specified here.

--   <a>$sel:securityProfileArn:DescribeSecurityProfileResponse'</a>,

--   the security profile.
--

--   also retained for any metric specified here.
describeSecurityProfileResponse_additionalMetricsToRetainV2 :: Lens' DescribeSecurityProfileResponse (Maybe [MetricToRetain])

--   profile when it was created or updated).

-- | Gets information about a scheduled audit.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DescribeScheduledAudit</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DescribeScheduledAudit

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeScheduledAudit</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeScheduledAudit
DescribeScheduledAudit' :: Text -> DescribeScheduledAudit

-- | The name of the scheduled audit whose information you want to get.
[$sel:scheduledAuditName:DescribeScheduledAudit'] :: DescribeScheduledAudit -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeScheduledAudit</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditName:DescribeScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAudit_scheduledAuditName</a> - The name of the
--   scheduled audit whose information you want to get.
newDescribeScheduledAudit :: Text -> DescribeScheduledAudit

-- | The name of the scheduled audit whose information you want to get.
describeScheduledAudit_scheduledAuditName :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAudit Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeScheduledAuditResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeScheduledAuditResponse
DescribeScheduledAuditResponse' :: Maybe AuditFrequency -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe DayOfWeek -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeScheduledAuditResponse

-- | How often the scheduled audit takes place, either one of
--   <tt>DAILY</tt>, <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>, or
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start time of each audit is determined by the
--   system.
[$sel:frequency:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'] :: DescribeScheduledAuditResponse -> Maybe AuditFrequency

-- | The name of the scheduled audit.
[$sel:scheduledAuditName:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'] :: DescribeScheduledAuditResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit takes place. This is
--   will be <tt>1</tt> through <tt>31</tt> or <tt>LAST</tt>. If days
--   <tt>29</tt>-<tt>31</tt> are specified, and the month does not have
--   that many days, the audit takes place on the <tt>LAST</tt> day of the
--   month.
[$sel:dayOfMonth:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'] :: DescribeScheduledAuditResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Which checks are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be
--   enabled for your account. (Use
--   <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the list of all
--   checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
[$sel:targetCheckNames:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'] :: DescribeScheduledAuditResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The day of the week on which the scheduled audit takes place, either
--   one of <tt>SUN</tt>, <tt>MON</tt>, <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>,
--   <tt>THU</tt>, <tt>FRI</tt>, or <tt>SAT</tt>.
[$sel:dayOfWeek:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'] :: DescribeScheduledAuditResponse -> Maybe DayOfWeek

-- | The ARN of the scheduled audit.
[$sel:scheduledAuditArn:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'] :: DescribeScheduledAuditResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'] :: DescribeScheduledAuditResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeScheduledAuditResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:frequency:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_frequency</a> - How often the
--   scheduled audit takes place, either one of <tt>DAILY</tt>,
--   <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>, or <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start
--   time of each audit is determined by the system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditName:DescribeScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_scheduledAuditName</a> - The name of
--   the scheduled audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfMonth:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_dayOfMonth</a> - The day of the
--   month on which the scheduled audit takes place. This is will be
--   <tt>1</tt> through <tt>31</tt> or <tt>LAST</tt>. If days
--   <tt>29</tt>-<tt>31</tt> are specified, and the month does not have
--   that many days, the audit takes place on the <tt>LAST</tt> day of the
--   month.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetCheckNames:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_targetCheckNames</a> - Which checks
--   are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be enabled for
--   your account. (Use <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see
--   the list of all checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfWeek:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_dayOfWeek</a> - The day of the week
--   on which the scheduled audit takes place, either one of <tt>SUN</tt>,
--   <tt>MON</tt>, <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>, <tt>THU</tt>, <tt>FRI</tt>,
--   or <tt>SAT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditArn:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_scheduledAuditArn</a> - The ARN of
--   the scheduled audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeScheduledAuditResponse :: Int -> DescribeScheduledAuditResponse

-- | How often the scheduled audit takes place, either one of
--   <tt>DAILY</tt>, <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>, or
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start time of each audit is determined by the
--   system.
describeScheduledAuditResponse_frequency :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe AuditFrequency)

-- | The name of the scheduled audit.
describeScheduledAuditResponse_scheduledAuditName :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit takes place. This is
--   will be <tt>1</tt> through <tt>31</tt> or <tt>LAST</tt>. If days
--   <tt>29</tt>-<tt>31</tt> are specified, and the month does not have
--   that many days, the audit takes place on the <tt>LAST</tt> day of the
--   month.
describeScheduledAuditResponse_dayOfMonth :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Which checks are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be
--   enabled for your account. (Use
--   <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the list of all
--   checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
describeScheduledAuditResponse_targetCheckNames :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The day of the week on which the scheduled audit takes place, either
--   one of <tt>SUN</tt>, <tt>MON</tt>, <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>,
--   <tt>THU</tt>, <tt>FRI</tt>, or <tt>SAT</tt>.
describeScheduledAuditResponse_dayOfWeek :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe DayOfWeek)

-- | The ARN of the scheduled audit.
describeScheduledAuditResponse_scheduledAuditArn :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe Text)

describeScheduledAuditResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse Int

-- | Returns information about a fleet provisioning template version.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the
--   <a>DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion</a> action.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion
DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion' :: Text -> Int -> DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion

-- | The template name.
[$sel:templateName:DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion'] :: DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion -> Text

-- | The fleet provisioning template version ID.
[$sel:versionId:DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion'] :: DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion'</a>,
--   <a>describeProvisioningTemplateVersion_templateName</a> - The template
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion'</a>,
--   <a>describeProvisioningTemplateVersion_versionId</a> - The fleet
--   provisioning template version ID.
newDescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion :: Text -> Int -> DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion

-- | The template name.
describeProvisioningTemplateVersion_templateName :: Lens' DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion Text

-- | The fleet provisioning template version ID.
describeProvisioningTemplateVersion_versionId :: Lens' DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersion Int

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeProvisioningTemplateVersionResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersionResponse
DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersionResponse' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Int -> DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersionResponse

-- | The fleet provisioning template version ID.
[$sel:versionId:DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersionResponse'] :: DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersionResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The date when the fleet provisioning template version was created.
[$sel:creationDate:DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersionResponse'] :: DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersionResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The JSON formatted contents of the fleet provisioning template
--   version.
[$sel:templateBody:DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersionResponse'] :: DescribeProvisioningTemplateVersionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | True if the fleet provisioning template version is the default
--   version.

data DescribeJobExecution

--   specify a particular job execution on a particular device.
[$sel:executionNumber:DescribeJobExecution'] :: DescribeJobExecution -> Maybe Integer

data DescribeIndex

[$sel:indexName:DescribeIndex'] :: DescribeIndex -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeIndex</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeIndexResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeIndexResponse
DescribeIndexResponse' :: Maybe IndexStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeIndexResponse

-- | The index status.
[$sel:indexStatus:DescribeIndexResponse'] :: DescribeIndexResponse -> Maybe IndexStatus

-- | Contains a value that specifies the type of indexing performed. Valid
--   values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>REGISTRY  Your thing index contains only registry data.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW - Your thing index contains registry data and
--   shadow data.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_CONNECTIVITY_STATUS - Your thing index contains
--   registry data and thing connectivity status data.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW_AND_CONNECTIVITY_STATUS - Your thing index
--   contains registry data, shadow data, and thing connectivity status
--   data.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:schema:DescribeIndexResponse'] :: DescribeIndexResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The index name.
[$sel:indexName:DescribeIndexResponse'] :: DescribeIndexResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeIndexResponse'] :: DescribeIndexResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeIndexResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexStatus:DescribeIndexResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeIndexResponse_indexStatus</a> - The index status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schema:DescribeIndexResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeIndexResponse_schema</a> - Contains a value that specifies
--   the type of indexing performed. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>REGISTRY  Your thing index contains only registry data.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW - Your thing index contains registry data and
--   shadow data.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_CONNECTIVITY_STATUS - Your thing index contains
--   registry data and thing connectivity status data.</li>
--   <li>REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW_AND_CONNECTIVITY_STATUS - Your thing index
--   contains registry data, shadow data, and thing connectivity status
--   data.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexName:DescribeIndex'</a>,
--   <a>describeIndexResponse_indexName</a> - The index name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeIndexResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeIndexResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.

--   values are:

-- | Gets information about the specified fleet metric.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DescribeFleetMetric</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DescribeFleetMetric

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeFleetMetric</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeFleetMetric
DescribeFleetMetric' :: Text -> DescribeFleetMetric

-- | The name of the fleet metric to describe.
[$sel:metricName:DescribeFleetMetric'] :: DescribeFleetMetric -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeFleetMetric</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeFleetMetricResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeFleetMetricResponse
DescribeFleetMetricResponse' :: Maybe AggregationType -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe FleetMetricUnit -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeFleetMetricResponse

-- | The type of the aggregation query.
[$sel:aggregationType:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe AggregationType

-- | The date when the fleet metric is last modified.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time in seconds between fleet metric emissions. Range [60(1 min),
--   86400(1 day)] and must be multiple of 60.
[$sel:period:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe Natural

-- | The query version.
[$sel:queryVersion:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the fleet metric to describe.
[$sel:metricName:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The field to aggregate.
[$sel:aggregationField:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The search query string.
[$sel:queryString:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The version of the fleet metric.
[$sel:version:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date when the fleet metric is created.
[$sel:creationDate:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The fleet metric description.
[$sel:description:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Used to support unit transformation such as milliseconds to seconds.
--   The unit must be supported by <a>CW metric</a>.
[$sel:unit:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe FleetMetricUnit

-- | The name of the index to search.
[$sel:indexName:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the fleet metric to describe.
[$sel:metricArn:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeFleetMetricResponse'] :: DescribeFleetMetricResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeFleetMetricResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

-- | Returns a unique endpoint specific to the Amazon Web Services account
--   making the call.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DescribeEndpoint</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DescribeEndpoint

-- | The input for the DescribeEndpoint operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEndpoint
DescribeEndpoint' :: Maybe Text -> DescribeEndpoint

-- | The endpoint type. Valid endpoint types include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>iot:Data</tt> - Returns a VeriSign signed data endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:Data-ATS</tt> - Returns an ATS signed data endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:CredentialProvider</tt> - Returns an IoT credentials
--   provider API endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:Jobs</tt> - Returns an IoT device management Jobs API
--   endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend that customers use the newer
--   <tt>iot:Data-ATS</tt> endpoint type to avoid issues related to the
--   widespread distrust of Symantec certificate authorities.
[$sel:endpointType:DescribeEndpoint'] :: DescribeEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeEndpoint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointType:DescribeEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>describeEndpoint_endpointType</a> - The endpoint type. Valid
--   endpoint types include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>iot:Data</tt> - Returns a VeriSign signed data endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:Data-ATS</tt> - Returns an ATS signed data endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:CredentialProvider</tt> - Returns an IoT credentials
--   provider API endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:Jobs</tt> - Returns an IoT device management Jobs API
--   endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend that customers use the newer
--   <tt>iot:Data-ATS</tt> endpoint type to avoid issues related to the
--   widespread distrust of Symantec certificate authorities.
newDescribeEndpoint :: DescribeEndpoint

-- | The endpoint type. Valid endpoint types include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>iot:Data</tt> - Returns a VeriSign signed data endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:Data-ATS</tt> - Returns an ATS signed data endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:CredentialProvider</tt> - Returns an IoT credentials
--   provider API endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:Jobs</tt> - Returns an IoT device management Jobs API
--   endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend that customers use the newer
--   <tt>iot:Data-ATS</tt> endpoint type to avoid issues related to the
--   widespread distrust of Symantec certificate authorities.
describeEndpoint_endpointType :: Lens' DescribeEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The output from the DescribeEndpoint operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEndpointResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEndpointResponse
DescribeEndpointResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeEndpointResponse

-- | The endpoint. The format of the endpoint is as follows:
--   <i>identifier</i>.iot.<i>region</i>.amazonaws.com.
[$sel:endpointAddress:DescribeEndpointResponse'] :: DescribeEndpointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeEndpointResponse'] :: DescribeEndpointResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeEndpointResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointAddress:DescribeEndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEndpointResponse_endpointAddress</a> - The endpoint. The
--   format of the endpoint is as follows:
--   <i>identifier</i>.iot.<i>region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeEndpointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEndpointResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeEndpointResponse :: Int -> DescribeEndpointResponse

-- | The endpoint. The format of the endpoint is as follows:
--   <i>identifier</i>.iot.<i>region</i>.amazonaws.com.
describeEndpointResponse_endpointAddress :: Lens' DescribeEndpointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Gets information about a Device Defender detect custom metric.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DescribeCustomMetric</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DescribeCustomMetric

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeCustomMetric</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeCustomMetric
DescribeCustomMetric' :: Text -> DescribeCustomMetric

-- | The name of the custom metric.
[$sel:metricName:DescribeCustomMetric'] :: DescribeCustomMetric -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeCustomMetric</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:DescribeCustomMetric'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomMetric_metricName</a> - The name of the custom
--   metric.
newDescribeCustomMetric :: Text -> DescribeCustomMetric

-- | The name of the custom metric.
describeCustomMetric_metricName :: Lens' DescribeCustomMetric Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeCustomMetricResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeCustomMetricResponse
DescribeCustomMetricResponse' :: Maybe CustomMetricType -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeCustomMetricResponse

-- | The type of the custom metric. Types include <tt>string-list</tt>,
--   <tt>ip-address-list</tt>, <tt>number-list</tt>, and <tt>number</tt>.
[$sel:metricType:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'] :: DescribeCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe CustomMetricType

-- | The time the custom metric was last modified in milliseconds since
--   epoch.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'] :: DescribeCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the custom metric.
[$sel:metricName:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'] :: DescribeCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Field represents a friendly name in the console for the custom metric;
--   doesn't have to be unique. Don't use this name as the metric
--   identifier in the device metric report. Can be updated.
[$sel:displayName:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'] :: DescribeCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The creation date of the custom metric in milliseconds since epoch.
[$sel:creationDate:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'] :: DescribeCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the custom metric.
[$sel:metricArn:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'] :: DescribeCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'] :: DescribeCustomMetricResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeCustomMetricResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricType:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomMetricResponse_metricType</a> - The type of the
--   custom metric. Types include <tt>string-list</tt>,
--   <tt>ip-address-list</tt>, <tt>number-list</tt>, and <tt>number</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomMetricResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The time the
--   custom metric was last modified in milliseconds since epoch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:DescribeCustomMetric'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomMetricResponse_metricName</a> - The name of the
--   custom metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomMetricResponse_displayName</a> - Field represents a
--   friendly name in the console for the custom metric; doesn't have to be
--   unique. Don't use this name as the metric identifier in the device
--   metric report. Can be updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomMetricResponse_creationDate</a> - The creation date
--   of the custom metric in milliseconds since epoch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricArn:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomMetricResponse_metricArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Number (ARN) of the custom metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeCustomMetricResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCustomMetricResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeCustomMetricResponse :: Int -> DescribeCustomMetricResponse

-- | The type of the custom metric. Types include <tt>string-list</tt>,
--   <tt>ip-address-list</tt>, <tt>number-list</tt>, and <tt>number</tt>.

--   epoch.

--   identifier in the device metric report. Can be updated.

-- | The creation date of the custom metric in milliseconds since epoch.
describeCustomMetricResponse_creationDate :: Lens' DescribeCustomMetricResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the custom metric.
describeCustomMetricResponse_metricArn :: Lens' DescribeCustomMetricResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeCustomMetricResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeCustomMetricResponse Int

-- | The name of the authorizer to describe.

--   or "CANCELED".

-- | Gets information about an audit mitigation task that is used to apply
--   mitigation actions to a set of audit findings. Properties include the
--   actions being applied, the audit checks to which they're being
--   applied, the task status, and aggregated task statistics.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTask

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeAuditMitigationActionsTask</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTask

--   constructor.

-- | The date and time when the task was started.
[$sel:startTime:DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse'] :: DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Aggregate counts of the results when the mitigation tasks were applied
--   to the findings for this audit mitigation actions task.
[$sel:taskStatistics:DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse'] :: DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text TaskStatisticsForAuditCheck)

-- | Specifies the mitigation actions and their parameters that are applied
--   as part of this task.
[$sel:actionsDefinition:DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse'] :: DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse -> Maybe [MitigationAction]

-- | Specifies the mitigation actions that should be applied to specific
--   audit checks.
[$sel:auditCheckToActionsMapping:DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse'] :: DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The date and time when the task was completed or canceled.
[$sel:endTime:DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse'] :: DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Identifies the findings to which the mitigation actions are applied.
--   This can be by audit checks, by audit task, or a set of findings.
[$sel:target:DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse'] :: DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse -> Maybe AuditMitigationActionsTaskTarget

-- | The current status of the task.
[$sel:taskStatus:DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse'] :: DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse -> Maybe AuditMitigationActionsTaskStatus

[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse'] :: DescribeAuditMitigationActionsTaskResponse -> Int

-- | Gets information about a single audit finding. Properties include the
--   reason for noncompliance, the severity of the issue, and the start
--   time when the audit that returned the finding.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DescribeAuditFinding</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DescribeAuditFinding

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeAuditFinding</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeAuditFinding
DescribeAuditFinding' :: Text -> DescribeAuditFinding

-- | A unique identifier for a single audit finding. You can use this
--   identifier to apply mitigation actions to the finding.
[$sel:findingId:DescribeAuditFinding'] :: DescribeAuditFinding -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeAuditFinding</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingId:DescribeAuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>describeAuditFinding_findingId</a> - A unique identifier for a
--   single audit finding. You can use this identifier to apply mitigation
--   actions to the finding.
newDescribeAuditFinding :: Text -> DescribeAuditFinding

-- | A unique identifier for a single audit finding. You can use this

-- | Deprecates a thing type. You can not associate new things with
--   deprecated thing type.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DeprecateThingType</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DeprecateThingType

-- | The input for the DeprecateThingType operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeprecateThingType</a> smart constructor.
data DeprecateThingType
DeprecateThingType' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> DeprecateThingType

-- | Whether to undeprecate a deprecated thing type. If <b>true</b>, the
--   thing type will not be deprecated anymore and you can associate it
--   with things.
[$sel:undoDeprecate:DeprecateThingType'] :: DeprecateThingType -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the thing type to deprecate.
[$sel:thingTypeName:DeprecateThingType'] :: DeprecateThingType -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeprecateThingType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:undoDeprecate:DeprecateThingType'</a>,
--   <a>deprecateThingType_undoDeprecate</a> - Whether to undeprecate a
--   deprecated thing type. If <b>true</b>, the thing type will not be
--   deprecated anymore and you can associate it with things.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingTypeName:DeprecateThingType'</a>,
--   <a>deprecateThingType_thingTypeName</a> - The name of the thing type
--   to deprecate.
newDeprecateThingType :: Text -> DeprecateThingType

-- | Whether to undeprecate a deprecated thing type. If <b>true</b>, the
--   thing type will not be deprecated anymore and you can associate it
--   with things.
deprecateThingType_undoDeprecate :: Lens' DeprecateThingType (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the thing type to deprecate.
deprecateThingType_thingTypeName :: Lens' DeprecateThingType Text

-- | The output for the DeprecateThingType operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeprecateThingTypeResponse</a> smart constructor.

[$sel:httpStatus:DeprecateThingTypeResponse'] :: DeprecateThingTypeResponse -> Int

-- | Deletes the specified thing type. You cannot delete a thing type if it
--   has things associated with it. To delete a thing type, first mark it
--   as deprecated by calling DeprecateThingType, then remove any
--   associated things by calling UpdateThing to change the thing type on
--   any associated thing, and finally use DeleteThingType to delete the
--   thing type.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DeleteThingType</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteThingType

-- | The input for the DeleteThingType operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteThingType</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteThingType
DeleteThingType' :: Text -> DeleteThingType

-- | The name of the thing type.
[$sel:thingTypeName:DeleteThingType'] :: DeleteThingType -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteThingType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingTypeName:DeleteThingType'</a>,
--   <a>deleteThingType_thingTypeName</a> - The name of the thing type.
newDeleteThingType :: Text -> DeleteThingType

-- | The name of the thing type.
deleteThingType_thingTypeName :: Lens' DeleteThingType Text

-- | The output for the DeleteThingType operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteThingTypeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteThingTypeResponse
DeleteThingTypeResponse' :: Int -> DeleteThingTypeResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteThingTypeResponse'] :: DeleteThingTypeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteThingTypeResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteThingTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteThingTypeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDeleteThingTypeResponse :: Int -> DeleteThingTypeResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteThingTypeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteThingTypeResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteThingType.DeleteThingType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteThingType.DeleteThingType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteThingType.DeleteThingType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteThingType.DeleteThingType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteThingType.DeleteThingTypeResponse

-- | Deletes the specified thing. Returns successfully with no error if the
--   deletion is successful or you specify a thing that doesn't exist.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DeleteThing</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteThing

-- | The input for the DeleteThing operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteThing</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteThing
DeleteThing' :: Maybe Integer -> Text -> DeleteThing

-- | The expected version of the thing record in the registry. If the
--   version of the record in the registry does not match the expected
--   version specified in the request, the <tt>DeleteThing</tt> request is
--   rejected with a <tt>VersionConflictException</tt>.
[$sel:expectedVersion:DeleteThing'] :: DeleteThing -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the thing to delete.
[$sel:thingName:DeleteThing'] :: DeleteThing -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteThing</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedVersion:DeleteThing'</a>,
--   <a>deleteThing_expectedVersion</a> - The expected version of the thing
--   record in the registry. If the version of the record in the registry
--   does not match the expected version specified in the request, the
--   <tt>DeleteThing</tt> request is rejected with a
--   <tt>VersionConflictException</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:DeleteThing'</a>, <a>deleteThing_thingName</a> - The
--   name of the thing to delete.
newDeleteThing :: Text -> DeleteThing

-- | The expected version of the thing record in the registry. If the
--   version of the record in the registry does not match the expected
--   version specified in the request, the <tt>DeleteThing</tt> request is
--   rejected with a <tt>VersionConflictException</tt>.
deleteThing_expectedVersion :: Lens' DeleteThing (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the thing to delete.
deleteThing_thingName :: Lens' DeleteThing Text

-- | The output of the DeleteThing operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteThingResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteThingResponse

[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteThingResponse'] :: DeleteThingResponse -> Int

--   code.

-- | Deletes the specified policy.
--   
--   A policy cannot be deleted if it has non-default versions or it is
--   attached to any certificate.
--   
--   To delete a policy, use the DeletePolicyVersion action to delete all
--   non-default versions of the policy; use the DetachPolicy action to
--   detach the policy from any certificate; and then use the DeletePolicy
--   action to delete the policy.
--   
--   When a policy is deleted using DeletePolicy, its default version is
--   deleted with it.
--   
--   Because of the distributed nature of Amazon Web Services, it can take
--   up to five minutes after a policy is detached before it's ready to be
--   deleted.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DeletePolicy</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DeletePolicy

-- | The input for the DeletePolicy operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeletePolicy</a> smart constructor.
data DeletePolicy
DeletePolicy' :: Text -> DeletePolicy

-- | The name of the policy to delete.
[$sel:policyName:DeletePolicy'] :: DeletePolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeletePolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:DeletePolicy'</a>, <a>deletePolicy_policyName</a> -
--   The name of the policy to delete.
newDeletePolicy :: Text -> DeletePolicy

-- | The name of the policy to delete.
deletePolicy_policyName :: Lens' DeletePolicy Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeletePolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeletePolicyResponse
DeletePolicyResponse' :: DeletePolicyResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeletePolicyResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDeletePolicyResponse :: DeletePolicyResponse

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.DeletePolicy.DeletePolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.DeletePolicy.DeletePolicy
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.DeletePolicy.DeletePolicyResponse

--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DeleteOTAUpdate</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteOTAUpdate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteOTAUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteOTAUpdate
DeleteOTAUpdate' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> DeleteOTAUpdate

-- | When true, deletes the IoT job created by the OTAUpdate process even
--   if it is "IN_PROGRESS". Otherwise, if the job is not in a terminal
--   state ("COMPLETED" or "CANCELED") an exception will occur. The default
--   is false.
[$sel:forceDeleteAWSJob:DeleteOTAUpdate'] :: DeleteOTAUpdate -> Maybe Bool

-- | When true, the stream created by the OTAUpdate process is deleted when
--   the OTA update is deleted. Ignored if the stream specified in the
--   OTAUpdate is supplied by the user.
[$sel:deleteStream:DeleteOTAUpdate'] :: DeleteOTAUpdate -> Maybe Bool

--   job created by the OTAUpdate process even if it is "IN_PROGRESS".
--   Otherwise, if the job is not in a terminal state ("COMPLETED" or
--   "CANCELED") an exception will occur. The default is false.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteStream:DeleteOTAUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>deleteOTAUpdate_deleteStream</a> - When true, the stream created by
--   the OTAUpdate process is deleted when the OTA update is deleted.
--   Ignored if the stream specified in the OTAUpdate is supplied by the
--   user.

--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateId:DeleteOTAUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>deleteOTAUpdate_otaUpdateId</a> - The ID of the OTA update to
--   delete.

--   is false.

-- | Deletes a job execution.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DeleteJobExecution</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteJobExecution

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteJobExecution</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteJobExecution
DeleteJobExecution' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Integer -> DeleteJobExecution

-- | (Optional) When true, you can delete a job execution which is
--   "IN_PROGRESS". Otherwise, you can only delete a job execution which is
--   in a terminal state ("SUCCEEDED", "FAILED", "REJECTED", "REMOVED" or
--   "CANCELED") or an exception will occur. The default is false.
--   
--   Deleting a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause the device
--   to be unable to access job information or update the job execution
--   status. Use caution and ensure that the device is able to recover to a
--   valid state.
[$sel:force:DeleteJobExecution'] :: DeleteJobExecution -> Maybe Bool

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
[$sel:namespaceId:DeleteJobExecution'] :: DeleteJobExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the job whose execution on a particular device will be
--   deleted.
[$sel:jobId:DeleteJobExecution'] :: DeleteJobExecution -> Text

-- | The name of the thing whose job execution will be deleted.
[$sel:thingName:DeleteJobExecution'] :: DeleteJobExecution -> Text

-- | The ID of the job execution to be deleted. The
--   <tt>executionNumber</tt> refers to the execution of a particular job
--   on a particular device.
--   
--   Note that once a job execution is deleted, the
--   <tt>executionNumber</tt> may be reused by IoT, so be sure you get and
--   use the correct value here.
[$sel:executionNumber:DeleteJobExecution'] :: DeleteJobExecution -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteJobExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:force:DeleteJobExecution'</a>, <a>deleteJobExecution_force</a>
--   - (Optional) When true, you can delete a job execution which is
--   "IN_PROGRESS". Otherwise, you can only delete a job execution which is
--   in a terminal state ("SUCCEEDED", "FAILED", "REJECTED", "REMOVED" or
--   "CANCELED") or an exception will occur. The default is false.
--   
--   Deleting a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause the device
--   to be unable to access job information or update the job execution
--   status. Use caution and ensure that the device is able to recover to a
--   valid state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:DeleteJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>deleteJobExecution_namespaceId</a> - The namespace used to indicate
--   that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:DeleteJobExecution'</a>, <a>deleteJobExecution_jobId</a>
--   - The ID of the job whose execution on a particular device will be
--   deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:DeleteJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>deleteJobExecution_thingName</a> - The name of the thing whose job
--   execution will be deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionNumber:DeleteJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>deleteJobExecution_executionNumber</a> - The ID of the job
--   execution to be deleted. The <tt>executionNumber</tt> refers to the
--   execution of a particular job on a particular device.
--   
--   Note that once a job execution is deleted, the
--   <tt>executionNumber</tt> may be reused by IoT, so be sure you get and
--   use the correct value here.
newDeleteJobExecution :: Text -> Text -> Integer -> DeleteJobExecution

-- | (Optional) When true, you can delete a job execution which is
--   "IN_PROGRESS". Otherwise, you can only delete a job execution which is
--   in a terminal state ("SUCCEEDED", "FAILED", "REJECTED", "REMOVED" or
--   "CANCELED") or an exception will occur. The default is false.
--   
--   Deleting a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause the device
--   to be unable to access job information or update the job execution
--   status. Use caution and ensure that the device is able to recover to a
--   valid state.
deleteJobExecution_force :: Lens' DeleteJobExecution (Maybe Bool)

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
deleteJobExecution_namespaceId :: Lens' DeleteJobExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the job whose execution on a particular device will be
--   deleted.
deleteJobExecution_jobId :: Lens' DeleteJobExecution Text

-- | The name of the thing whose job execution will be deleted.
deleteJobExecution_thingName :: Lens' DeleteJobExecution Text

-- | The ID of the job execution to be deleted. The
--   <tt>executionNumber</tt> refers to the execution of a particular job
--   on a particular device.
--   
--   Note that once a job execution is deleted, the
--   <tt>executionNumber</tt> may be reused by IoT, so be sure you get and
--   use the correct value here.
deleteJobExecution_executionNumber :: Lens' DeleteJobExecution Integer

-- | Deletes a job and its related job executions.
--   
--   Deleting a job may take time, depending on the number of job
--   executions created for the job and various other factors. While the
--   job is being deleted, the status of the job will be shown as
--   "DELETION_IN_PROGRESS". Attempting to delete or cancel a job whose
--   status is already "DELETION_IN_PROGRESS" will result in an error.
--   
--   Only 10 jobs may have status "DELETION_IN_PROGRESS" at the same time,
--   or a LimitExceededException will occur.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DeleteJob</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteJob</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteJob
DeleteJob' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> DeleteJob

-- | (Optional) When true, you can delete a job which is "IN_PROGRESS".
--   Otherwise, you can only delete a job which is in a terminal state
--   ("COMPLETED" or "CANCELED") or an exception will occur. The default is
--   false.
--   
--   Deleting a job which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause a device which is
--   executing the job to be unable to access job information or update the
--   job execution status. Use caution and ensure that each device
--   executing a job which is deleted is able to recover to a valid state.
[$sel:force:DeleteJob'] :: DeleteJob -> Maybe Bool

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
[$sel:namespaceId:DeleteJob'] :: DeleteJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the job to be deleted.
--   
--   After a job deletion is completed, you may reuse this jobId when you
--   create a new job. However, this is not recommended, and you must
--   ensure that your devices are not using the jobId to refer to the
--   deleted job.
[$sel:jobId:DeleteJob'] :: DeleteJob -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:force:DeleteJob'</a>, <a>deleteJob_force</a> - (Optional) When
--   true, you can delete a job which is "IN_PROGRESS". Otherwise, you can
--   only delete a job which is in a terminal state ("COMPLETED" or
--   "CANCELED") or an exception will occur. The default is false.
--   
--   Deleting a job which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause a device which is
--   executing the job to be unable to access job information or update the
--   job execution status. Use caution and ensure that each device
--   executing a job which is deleted is able to recover to a valid state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:DeleteJob'</a>, <a>deleteJob_namespaceId</a> - The
--   namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:DeleteJob'</a>, <a>deleteJob_jobId</a> - The ID of the
--   job to be deleted.
--   
--   After a job deletion is completed, you may reuse this jobId when you
--   create a new job. However, this is not recommended, and you must
--   ensure that your devices are not using the jobId to refer to the
--   deleted job.
newDeleteJob :: Text -> DeleteJob

-- | (Optional) When true, you can delete a job which is "IN_PROGRESS".
--   Otherwise, you can only delete a job which is in a terminal state
--   ("COMPLETED" or "CANCELED") or an exception will occur. The default is
--   false.
--   
--   Deleting a job which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause a device which is
--   executing the job to be unable to access job information or update the
--   job execution status. Use caution and ensure that each device
--   executing a job which is deleted is able to recover to a valid state.
deleteJob_force :: Lens' DeleteJob (Maybe Bool)

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
deleteJob_namespaceId :: Lens' DeleteJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the job to be deleted.

--   After a job deletion is completed, you may reuse this jobId when you
--   create a new job. However, this is not recommended, and you must
--   ensure that your devices are not using the jobId to refer to the

-- | Deletes a Device Defender detect custom metric.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DeleteCustomMetric</a> action.
--   
--   Before you can delete a custom metric, you must first remove the
--   custom metric from all security profiles it's a part of. The security
--   profile associated with the custom metric can be found using the
--   <a>ListSecurityProfiles</a> API with <tt>metricName</tt> set to your
--   custom metric name.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteCustomMetric

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteCustomMetric</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteCustomMetric
DeleteCustomMetric' :: Text -> DeleteCustomMetric

-- | The name of the custom metric.
[$sel:metricName:DeleteCustomMetric'] :: DeleteCustomMetric -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteCustomMetric</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:DeleteCustomMetric'</a>,
--   <a>deleteCustomMetric_metricName</a> - The name of the custom metric.
newDeleteCustomMetric :: Text -> DeleteCustomMetric

-- | The name of the custom metric.
deleteCustomMetric_metricName :: Lens' DeleteCustomMetric Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteCustomMetricResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteCustomMetricResponse
DeleteCustomMetricResponse' :: Int -> DeleteCustomMetricResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteCustomMetricResponse'] :: DeleteCustomMetricResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteCustomMetricResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteCustomMetricResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteCustomMetricResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http

-- | Deletes the specified certificate.
--   
--   A certificate cannot be deleted if it has a policy or IoT thing
--   attached to it or if its status is set to ACTIVE. To delete a
--   certificate, first use the DetachPolicy action to detach all policies.
--   Next, use the UpdateCertificate action to set the certificate to the
--   INACTIVE status.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>DeleteCertificate</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteCertificate

-- | The input for the DeleteCertificate operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteCertificate
DeleteCertificate' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> DeleteCertificate

-- | Forces the deletion of a certificate if it is inactive and is not
--   attached to an IoT thing.
[$sel:forceDelete:DeleteCertificate'] :: DeleteCertificate -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
[$sel:certificateId:DeleteCertificate'] :: DeleteCertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteCertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceDelete:DeleteCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>deleteCertificate_forceDelete</a> - Forces the deletion of a
--   certificate if it is inactive and is not attached to an IoT thing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:DeleteCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>deleteCertificate_certificateId</a> - The ID of the certificate.
--   (The last part of the certificate ARN contains the certificate ID.)
newDeleteCertificate :: Text -> DeleteCertificate

-- | Forces the deletion of a certificate if it is inactive and is not
--   attached to an IoT thing.
deleteCertificate_forceDelete :: Lens' DeleteCertificate (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
deleteCertificate_certificateId :: Lens' DeleteCertificate Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteCertificateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteCertificateResponse
DeleteCertificateResponse' :: DeleteCertificateResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteCertificateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDeleteCertificateResponse :: DeleteCertificateResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteCertificate.DeleteCertificate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteCertificate.DeleteCertificate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteCertificate.DeleteCertificate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteCertificate.DeleteCertificate
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteCertificate.DeleteCertificateResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteCertificate.DeleteCertificateResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteCertificate.DeleteCertificateResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.IoT.DeleteCertificate.DeleteCertificate

-- | Creates a rule. Creating rules is an administrator-level action. Any
--   user who has permission to create rules will be able to access data
--   processed by the rule.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateTopicRule</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreateTopicRule

--

-- | Creates a thing record in the registry. If this call is made multiple
--   times using the same thing name and configuration, the call will
--   succeed. If this call is made with the same thing name but different
--   configuration a <tt>ResourceAlreadyExistsException</tt> is thrown.
--   
--   This is a control plane operation. See <a>Authorization</a> for
--   information about authorizing control plane actions.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateThing</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreateThing

-- | The input for the CreateThing operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateThing</a> smart constructor.
data CreateThing
CreateThing' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe AttributePayload -> Maybe Text -> Text -> CreateThing

-- | The name of the thing type associated with the new thing.
[$sel:thingTypeName:CreateThing'] :: CreateThing -> Maybe Text

-- | The attribute payload, which consists of up to three name/value pairs
--   in a JSON document. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"attributes\":{\"string1\":\"string2\"}}
--   </pre>
[$sel:attributePayload:CreateThing'] :: CreateThing -> Maybe AttributePayload

-- | The name of the billing group the thing will be added to.
[$sel:billingGroupName:CreateThing'] :: CreateThing -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the thing to create.
--   
--   You can't change a thing's name after you create it. To change a
--   thing's name, you must create a new thing, give it the new name, and
--   then delete the old thing.
[$sel:thingName:CreateThing'] :: CreateThing -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateThing</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   </pre>

-- | Creates a stream for delivering one or more large files in chunks over
--   MQTT. A stream transports data bytes in chunks or blocks packaged as
--   MQTT messages from a source like S3. You can have one or more files
--   associated with a stream.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateStream</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreateStream

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateStream</a> smart constructor.
data CreateStream
CreateStream' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> NonEmpty StreamFile -> Text -> CreateStream

-- | A description of the stream.
[$sel:description:CreateStream'] :: CreateStream -> Maybe Text

-- | Metadata which can be used to manage streams.
[$sel:tags:CreateStream'] :: CreateStream -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The stream ID.
[$sel:streamId:CreateStream'] :: CreateStream -> Text

-- | The files to stream.
[$sel:files:CreateStream'] :: CreateStream -> NonEmpty StreamFile

-- | An IAM role that allows the IoT service principal assumes to access
--   your S3 files.
[$sel:roleArn:CreateStream'] :: CreateStream -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateStream</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateStream'</a>, <a>createStream_description</a>
--   - A description of the stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateStream'</a>, <a>createStream_tags</a> - Metadata
--   which can be used to manage streams.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamId:CreateStream'</a>, <a>createStream_streamId</a> - The
--   stream ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:files:CreateStream'</a>, <a>createStream_files</a> - The files
--   to stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:CreateStream'</a>, <a>createStream_roleArn</a> - An
--   IAM role that allows the IoT service principal assumes to access your
--   S3 files.
newCreateStream :: Text -> NonEmpty StreamFile -> Text -> CreateStream

-- | A description of the stream.
createStream_description :: Lens' CreateStream (Maybe Text)

-- | Metadata which can be used to manage streams.
createStream_tags :: Lens' CreateStream (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The stream ID.
createStream_streamId :: Lens' CreateStream Text

-- | The files to stream.
createStream_files :: Lens' CreateStream (NonEmpty StreamFile)

-- | An IAM role that allows the IoT service principal assumes to access
--   your S3 files.
createStream_roleArn :: Lens' CreateStream Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateStreamResponse</a> smart constructor.

--

-- | Creates a Device Defender security profile.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateSecurityProfile</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreateSecurityProfile

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateSecurityProfile</a> smart constructor.
data CreateSecurityProfile
CreateSecurityProfile' :: Maybe (HashMap AlertTargetType AlertTarget) -> Maybe [MetricToRetain] -> Maybe [Behavior] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> CreateSecurityProfile

-- | Specifies the destinations to which alerts are sent. (Alerts are
--   always sent to the console.) Alerts are generated when a device
--   (thing) violates a behavior.
[$sel:alertTargets:CreateSecurityProfile'] :: CreateSecurityProfile -> Maybe (HashMap AlertTargetType AlertTarget)

-- | A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the profile's <tt>behaviors</tt>, but
--   it is also retained for any metric specified here. Can be used with
--   custom metrics; cannot be used with dimensions.
[$sel:additionalMetricsToRetainV2:CreateSecurityProfile'] :: CreateSecurityProfile -> Maybe [MetricToRetain]

-- | Specifies the behaviors that, when violated by a device (thing), cause
--   an alert.
[$sel:behaviors:CreateSecurityProfile'] :: CreateSecurityProfile -> Maybe [Behavior]

-- | /Please use CreateSecurityProfileRequest$additionalMetricsToRetainV2
--   instead./
--   
--   A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the profile's <tt>behaviors</tt>, but
--   it is also retained for any metric specified here. Can be used with
--   custom metrics; cannot be used with dimensions.
[$sel:additionalMetricsToRetain:CreateSecurityProfile'] :: CreateSecurityProfile -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A description of the security profile.
[$sel:securityProfileDescription:CreateSecurityProfile'] :: CreateSecurityProfile -> Maybe Text

[$sel:tags:CreateSecurityProfile'] :: CreateSecurityProfile -> Maybe [Tag]
