-- | Creates a scheduled audit that is run at a specified time interval.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateScheduledAudit</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreateScheduledAudit

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateScheduledAudit</a> smart constructor.
data CreateScheduledAudit
CreateScheduledAudit' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe DayOfWeek -> Maybe [Tag] -> AuditFrequency -> [Text] -> Text -> CreateScheduledAudit

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit takes place. This
--   can be "1" through "31" or "LAST". This field is required if the
--   "frequency" parameter is set to <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. If days 29 to 31 are
--   specified, and the month doesn't have that many days, the audit takes
--   place on the <tt>LAST</tt> day of the month.
[$sel:dayOfMonth:CreateScheduledAudit'] :: CreateScheduledAudit -> Maybe Text

-- | The day of the week on which the scheduled audit takes place, either
--   <tt>SUN</tt>, <tt>MON</tt>, <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>, <tt>THU</tt>,
--   <tt>FRI</tt>, or <tt>SAT</tt>. This field is required if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> parameter is set to <tt>WEEKLY</tt> or
--   <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>.
[$sel:dayOfWeek:CreateScheduledAudit'] :: CreateScheduledAudit -> Maybe DayOfWeek

-- | Metadata that can be used to manage the scheduled audit.
[$sel:tags:CreateScheduledAudit'] :: CreateScheduledAudit -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | How often the scheduled audit takes place, either <tt>DAILY</tt>,
--   <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt> or <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start time
--   of each audit is determined by the system.
[$sel:frequency:CreateScheduledAudit'] :: CreateScheduledAudit -> AuditFrequency

-- | Which checks are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be
--   enabled for your account. (Use
--   <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the list of all
--   checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
[$sel:targetCheckNames:CreateScheduledAudit'] :: CreateScheduledAudit -> [Text]

-- | The name you want to give to the scheduled audit. (Max. 128 chars)
[$sel:scheduledAuditName:CreateScheduledAudit'] :: CreateScheduledAudit -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateScheduledAudit</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfMonth:CreateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>createScheduledAudit_dayOfMonth</a> - The day of the month on which
--   the scheduled audit takes place. This can be "1" through "31" or
--   "LAST". This field is required if the "frequency" parameter is set to
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. If days 29 to 31 are specified, and the month
--   doesn't have that many days, the audit takes place on the
--   <tt>LAST</tt> day of the month.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfWeek:CreateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>createScheduledAudit_dayOfWeek</a> - The day of the week on which
--   the scheduled audit takes place, either <tt>SUN</tt>, <tt>MON</tt>,
--   <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>, <tt>THU</tt>, <tt>FRI</tt>, or
--   <tt>SAT</tt>. This field is required if the <tt>frequency</tt>
--   parameter is set to <tt>WEEKLY</tt> or <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>createScheduledAudit_tags</a> - Metadata that can be used to manage
--   the scheduled audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:frequency:CreateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>createScheduledAudit_frequency</a> - How often the scheduled audit
--   takes place, either <tt>DAILY</tt>, <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>
--   or <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start time of each audit is determined by the
--   system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetCheckNames:CreateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>createScheduledAudit_targetCheckNames</a> - Which checks are
--   performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be enabled for your
--   account. (Use <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the
--   list of all checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditName:CreateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>createScheduledAudit_scheduledAuditName</a> - The name you want to
--   give to the scheduled audit. (Max. 128 chars)
newCreateScheduledAudit :: AuditFrequency -> Text -> CreateScheduledAudit

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit takes place. This
--   can be "1" through "31" or "LAST". This field is required if the
--   "frequency" parameter is set to <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. If days 29 to 31 are
--   specified, and the month doesn't have that many days, the audit takes
--   place on the <tt>LAST</tt> day of the month.
createScheduledAudit_dayOfMonth :: Lens' CreateScheduledAudit (Maybe Text)

-- | The day of the week on which the scheduled audit takes place, either
--   <tt>SUN</tt>, <tt>MON</tt>, <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>, <tt>THU</tt>,
--   <tt>FRI</tt>, or <tt>SAT</tt>. This field is required if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> parameter is set to <tt>WEEKLY</tt> or
--   <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>.
createScheduledAudit_dayOfWeek :: Lens' CreateScheduledAudit (Maybe DayOfWeek)

-- | Metadata that can be used to manage the scheduled audit.
createScheduledAudit_tags :: Lens' CreateScheduledAudit (Maybe [Tag])

-- | How often the scheduled audit takes place, either <tt>DAILY</tt>,
--   <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt> or <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start time
--   of each audit is determined by the system.
createScheduledAudit_frequency :: Lens' CreateScheduledAudit AuditFrequency

-- | Which checks are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be
--   enabled for your account. (Use
--   <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the list of all
--   checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
createScheduledAudit_targetCheckNames :: Lens' CreateScheduledAudit [Text]

-- | The name you want to give to the scheduled audit. (Max. 128 chars)
createScheduledAudit_scheduledAuditName :: Lens' CreateScheduledAudit Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateScheduledAuditResponse</a> smart constructor.

CreateScheduledAuditResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> CreateScheduledAuditResponse

--   optional fields omitted.

-- | Creates a role alias.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateRoleAlias</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreateRoleAlias

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateRoleAlias</a> smart constructor.
data CreateRoleAlias
CreateRoleAlias' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CreateRoleAlias

-- | How long (in seconds) the credentials will be valid. The default value
--   is 3,600 seconds.
[$sel:credentialDurationSeconds:CreateRoleAlias'] :: CreateRoleAlias -> Maybe Natural

-- | Metadata which can be used to manage the role alias.
--   
--   For URI Request parameters use format:
--   ...key1=value1&amp;key2=value2...
--   
--   For the CLI command-line parameter use format: &amp;&amp;tags
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
--   
--   For the cli-input-json file use format: "tags":
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
[$sel:tags:CreateRoleAlias'] :: CreateRoleAlias -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The role alias that points to a role ARN. This allows you to change
--   the role without having to update the device.
[$sel:roleAlias:CreateRoleAlias'] :: CreateRoleAlias -> Text

-- | The role ARN.
[$sel:roleArn:CreateRoleAlias'] :: CreateRoleAlias -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateRoleAlias</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:credentialDurationSeconds:CreateRoleAlias'</a>,
--   <a>createRoleAlias_credentialDurationSeconds</a> - How long (in

--   Metadata which can be used to manage the role alias.

--   role ARN. This allows you to change the role without having to update
--   the device.

--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."

-- | Creates a new version of the specified IoT policy. To update a policy,
--   create a new policy version. A managed policy can have up to five
--   versions. If the policy has five versions, you must use
--   DeletePolicyVersion to delete an existing version before you create a
--   new one.
--   
--   Optionally, you can set the new version as the policy's default
--   version. The default version is the operative version (that is, the
--   version that is in effect for the certificates to which the policy is
--   attached).
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreatePolicyVersion</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreatePolicyVersion

-- | The input for the CreatePolicyVersion operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreatePolicyVersion</a> smart constructor.
data CreatePolicyVersion
CreatePolicyVersion' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> CreatePolicyVersion

-- | Specifies whether the policy version is set as the default. When this
--   parameter is true, the new policy version becomes the operative
--   version (that is, the version that is in effect for the certificates
--   to which the policy is attached).
[$sel:setAsDefault:CreatePolicyVersion'] :: CreatePolicyVersion -> Maybe Bool

-- | The policy name.
[$sel:policyName:CreatePolicyVersion'] :: CreatePolicyVersion -> Text

-- | The JSON document that describes the policy. Minimum length of 1.
--   Maximum length of 2048, excluding whitespace.
[$sel:policyDocument:CreatePolicyVersion'] :: CreatePolicyVersion -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreatePolicyVersion</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   <a>createPolicyVersion_policyDocument</a> - The JSON document that

-- | Creates an IoT policy.
--   
--   The created policy is the default version for the policy. This
--   operation creates a policy version with a version identifier of
--   <b>1</b> and sets <b>1</b> as the policy's default version.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreatePolicy</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreatePolicy

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreatePolicy</a> smart constructor.

--

--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."

-- | Creates an IoT OTA update on a target group of things or groups.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateOTAUpdate</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreateOTAUpdate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateOTAUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data CreateOTAUpdate
CreateOTAUpdate' :: Maybe AwsJobAbortConfig -> Maybe AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe (NonEmpty Protocol) -> Maybe AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe AwsJobTimeoutConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TargetSelection -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> NonEmpty OTAUpdateFile -> Text -> CreateOTAUpdate

-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
[$sel:awsJobAbortConfig:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> Maybe AwsJobAbortConfig

-- | Configuration for the rollout of OTA updates.
[$sel:awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> Maybe AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The protocol used to transfer the OTA update image. Valid values are
--   [HTTP], [MQTT], [HTTP, MQTT]. When both HTTP and MQTT are specified,
--   the target device can choose the protocol.
[$sel:protocols:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> Maybe (NonEmpty Protocol)

-- | Configuration information for pre-signed URLs.
[$sel:awsJobPresignedUrlConfig:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> Maybe AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig

-- | A list of additional OTA update parameters which are name-value pairs.
[$sel:additionalParameters:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
[$sel:awsJobTimeoutConfig:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> Maybe AwsJobTimeoutConfig

-- | The description of the OTA update.
[$sel:description:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or
--   will be complete after all the things specified as targets have
--   completed the update (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the update may also be
--   run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, an
--   update will run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group,
--   even after the update was completed by all things originally in the
--   group. Valid values: CONTINUOUS | SNAPSHOT.
[$sel:targetSelection:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> Maybe TargetSelection

-- | Metadata which can be used to manage updates.
[$sel:tags:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The ID of the OTA update to be created.
[$sel:otaUpdateId:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> Text

-- | The devices targeted to receive OTA updates.
[$sel:targets:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The files to be streamed by the OTA update.
[$sel:files:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> NonEmpty OTAUpdateFile

-- | The IAM role that grants Amazon Web Services IoT Core access to the
--   Amazon S3, IoT jobs and Amazon Web Services Code Signing resources to
--   create an OTA update job.
[$sel:roleArn:CreateOTAUpdate'] :: CreateOTAUpdate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateOTAUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

-- | Defines an action that can be applied to audit findings by using
--   StartAuditMitigationActionsTask. Only certain types of mitigation
--   actions can be applied to specific check names. For more information,
--   see <a>Mitigation actions</a>. Each mitigation action can apply only
--   one type of change.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateMitigationAction</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreateMitigationAction

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateMitigationAction</a> smart constructor.

-- | Creates a 2048-bit RSA key pair and issues an X.509 certificate using
--   the issued public key. You can also call
--   <tt>CreateKeysAndCertificate</tt> over MQTT from a device, for more
--   information, see <a>Provisioning MQTT API</a>.
--   
--   <b>Note</b> This is the only time IoT issues the private key for this
--   certificate, so it is important to keep it in a secure location.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateKeysAndCertificate</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreateKeysAndCertificate

-- | The input for the CreateKeysAndCertificate operation.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the
--   <a>CreateKeysAndCertificateRequest</a> action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateKeysAndCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data CreateKeysAndCertificate

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>createKeysAndCertificate_setAsActive</a> - Specifies whether the
--   certificate is active.

-- | The ID of the certificate. IoT issues a default subject name for the
--   certificate (for example, IoT Certificate).
[$sel:certificateId:CreateKeysAndCertificateResponse'] :: CreateKeysAndCertificateResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.

--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateJobTemplate</a> action.

data CreateJobTemplate
CreateJobTemplate' :: Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AbortConfig -> Maybe PresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TimeoutConfig -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CreateJobTemplate
[$sel:jobExecutionsRolloutConfig:CreateJobTemplate'] :: CreateJobTemplate -> Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The ARN of the job to use as the basis for the job template.
[$sel:jobArn:CreateJobTemplate'] :: CreateJobTemplate -> Maybe Text

-- | An S3 link to the job document to use in the template. Required if you
--   don't specify a value for <tt>document</tt>.
--   
--   If the job document resides in an S3 bucket, you must use a
--   placeholder link when specifying the document.
--   
--   The placeholder link is of the following form:
--   
--   <pre>
--   ${aws:iot:s3-presigned-url:https://s3.amazonaws.com/bucket/key}
--   </pre>
--   
--   where <i>bucket</i> is your bucket name and <i>key</i> is the object
--   in the bucket to which you are linking.
[$sel:documentSource:CreateJobTemplate'] :: CreateJobTemplate -> Maybe Text
[$sel:abortConfig:CreateJobTemplate'] :: CreateJobTemplate -> Maybe AbortConfig
[$sel:presignedUrlConfig:CreateJobTemplate'] :: CreateJobTemplate -> Maybe PresignedUrlConfig

[$sel:jobTemplateId:CreateJobTemplate'] :: CreateJobTemplate -> Text

-- | Creates a job.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateJob</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreateJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateJob</a> smart constructor.
data CreateJob
CreateJob' :: Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AbortConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TargetSelection -> Maybe TimeoutConfig -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CreateJob

-- | Allows you to create a staged rollout of the job.
[$sel:jobExecutionsRolloutConfig:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | An S3 link to the job document. Required if you don't specify a value
--   for <tt>document</tt>.
--   
--   If the job document resides in an S3 bucket, you must use a
--   placeholder link when specifying the document.
--   
--   The placeholder link is of the following form:
--   
--   <pre>
--   ${aws:iot:s3-presigned-url:https://s3.amazonaws.com/bucket/key}
--   </pre>
--   
--   where <i>bucket</i> is your bucket name and <i>key</i> is the object
--   in the bucket to which you are linking.
[$sel:documentSource:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Allows you to create criteria to abort a job.
[$sel:abortConfig:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Maybe AbortConfig

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
[$sel:namespaceId:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Configuration information for pre-signed S3 URLs.
[$sel:presignedUrlConfig:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Maybe PresignedUrlConfig

-- | The job document. Required if you don't specify a value for
--   <tt>documentSource</tt>.
[$sel:document:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the job template used to create the job.
[$sel:jobTemplateArn:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A short text description of the job.
[$sel:description:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job
--   was completed by all things originally in the group.
[$sel:targetSelection:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Maybe TargetSelection

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. The timer is started when the job execution status is set
--   to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the time expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
[$sel:timeoutConfig:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Maybe TimeoutConfig

-- | Metadata which can be used to manage the job.
[$sel:tags:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | A job identifier which must be unique for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. We recommend using a UUID. Alpha-numeric characters, "-" and
--   "_" are valid for use here.
[$sel:jobId:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> Text

-- | A list of things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
[$sel:targets:CreateJob'] :: CreateJob -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExecutionsRolloutConfig:CreateJob'</a>,
--   <a>createJob_jobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> - Allows you to create a
--   staged rollout of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentSource:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_documentSource</a>
--   - An S3 link to the job document. Required if you don't specify a
--   value for <tt>document</tt>.
--   
--   If the job document resides in an S3 bucket, you must use a
--   placeholder link when specifying the document.
--   
--   The placeholder link is of the following form:
--   
--   <pre>
--   ${aws:iot:s3-presigned-url:https://s3.amazonaws.com/bucket/key}
--   </pre>
--   
--   where <i>bucket</i> is your bucket name and <i>key</i> is the object
--   in the bucket to which you are linking.
--   
--   <a>$sel:abortConfig:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_abortConfig</a> -
--   Allows you to create criteria to abort a job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_namespaceId</a> - The
--   namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:presignedUrlConfig:CreateJob'</a>,
--   <a>createJob_presignedUrlConfig</a> - Configuration information for
--   pre-signed S3 URLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:document:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_document</a> - The job
--   document. Required if you don't specify a value for
--   <tt>documentSource</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobTemplateArn:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_jobTemplateArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the job template used to create the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_description</a> - A
--   short text description of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:CreateJob'</a>,
--   <a>createJob_targetSelection</a> - Specifies whether the job will
--   continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those
--   things specified as targets have completed the job (SNAPSHOT). If
--   continuous, the job may also be run on a thing when a change is
--   detected in a target. For example, a job will run on a thing when the
--   thing is added to a target group, even after the job was completed by
--   all things originally in the group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutConfig:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_timeoutConfig</a> -
--   Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. The timer is started when the job execution status is set
--   to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the time expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_tags</a> - Metadata which
--   can be used to manage the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_jobId</a> - A job
--   identifier which must be unique for your Amazon Web Services account.
--   We recommend using a UUID. Alpha-numeric characters, "-" and "_" are
--   valid for use here.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_targets</a> - A list of
--   things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
newCreateJob :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CreateJob

-- | Allows you to create a staged rollout of the job.
createJob_jobExecutionsRolloutConfig :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig)

-- | An S3 link to the job document. Required if you don't specify a value
--   for <tt>document</tt>.
--   
--   If the job document resides in an S3 bucket, you must use a
--   placeholder link when specifying the document.
--   
--   The placeholder link is of the following form:
--   
--   <pre>
--   ${aws:iot:s3-presigned-url:https://s3.amazonaws.com/bucket/key}
--   </pre>
--   
--   where <i>bucket</i> is your bucket name and <i>key</i> is the object
--   in the bucket to which you are linking.
createJob_documentSource :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Allows you to create criteria to abort a job.
createJob_abortConfig :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe AbortConfig)

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
createJob_namespaceId :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Configuration information for pre-signed S3 URLs.
createJob_presignedUrlConfig :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe PresignedUrlConfig)

-- | The job document. Required if you don't specify a value for
--   <tt>documentSource</tt>.
createJob_document :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the job template used to create the job.
createJob_jobTemplateArn :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A short text description of the job.
createJob_description :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job
--   was completed by all things originally in the group.
createJob_targetSelection :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe TargetSelection)

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. The timer is started when the job execution status is set
--   to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the time expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
createJob_timeoutConfig :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe TimeoutConfig)

-- | Metadata which can be used to manage the job.
createJob_tags :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe [Tag])

-- | A job identifier which must be unique for your Amazon Web Services
--   account. We recommend using a UUID. Alpha-numeric characters, "-" and
--   "_" are valid for use here.
createJob_jobId :: Lens' CreateJob Text

-- | A list of things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
createJob_targets :: Lens' CreateJob (NonEmpty Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateJobResponse
CreateJobResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> CreateJobResponse

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job.
[$sel:jobId:CreateJobResponse'] :: CreateJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The job ARN.
[$sel:jobArn:CreateJobResponse'] :: CreateJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The job description.
[$sel:description:CreateJobResponse'] :: CreateJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateJobResponse'] :: CreateJobResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateJobResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJobResponse_jobId</a> - The
--   unique identifier you assigned to this job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:CreateJobResponse'</a>, <a>createJobResponse_jobArn</a>
--   - The job ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateJob'</a>,
--   <a>createJobResponse_description</a> - The job description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createJobResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
newCreateJobResponse :: Int -> CreateJobResponse

--   used in a security profile for IoT Device Defender. For example, using

--   in the dimension.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateDimension</a> action.

--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER.</tt>

-- | Specifies the value or list of values for the dimension. For
--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimensions, this is a pattern used to match the
--   MQTT topic (for example, "admin/#").
[$sel:stringValues:CreateDimension'] :: CreateDimension -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Each dimension must have a unique client request token. If you try to
--   create a new dimension with the same token as a dimension that already
--   exists, an exception occurs. If you omit this value, Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs will automatically generate a unique client request.

-- | Creates an X.509 certificate using the specified certificate signing
--   request.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> The CSR must include a public key that is either an RSA
--   key with a length of at least 2048 bits or an ECC key from NIST P-256
--   or NIST P-384 curves.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> Reusing the same certificate signing request (CSR)
--   results in a distinct certificate.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CreateCertificateFromCsr</a>
--   action.
--   
--   You can create multiple certificates in a batch by creating a
--   directory, copying multiple .csr files into that directory, and then
--   specifying that directory on the command line. The following commands
--   show how to create a batch of certificates given a batch of CSRs.
--   
--   Assuming a set of CSRs are located inside of the directory
--   my-csr-directory:
--   
--   On Linux and OS X, the command is:
--   
--   $ ls my-csr-directory/ | xargs -I {} aws iot
--   create-certificate-from-csr --certificate-signing-request
--   file://my-csr-directory/{}
--   
--   This command lists all of the CSRs in my-csr-directory and pipes each
--   CSR file name to the aws iot create-certificate-from-csr Amazon Web
--   Services CLI command to create a certificate for the corresponding
--   CSR.
--   
--   The aws iot create-certificate-from-csr part of the command can also
--   be run in parallel to speed up the certificate creation process:
--   
--   $ ls my-csr-directory/ | xargs -P 10 -I {} aws iot
--   create-certificate-from-csr --certificate-signing-request
--   file://my-csr-directory/{}
--   
--   On Windows PowerShell, the command to create certificates for all CSRs
--   in my-csr-directory is:
--   
--   <pre>
--   ls -Name my-csr-directory | %{aws iot create-certificate-from-csr
--   </pre>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>-certificate-signing-request file://my-csr-directory/$_}</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   On a Windows command prompt, the command to create certificates for
--   all CSRs in my-csr-directory is:
--   
--   <pre>
--   forfiles \/p my-csr-directory \/c \"cmd \/c aws iot
--   </pre>
--   
--   create-certificate-from-csr --certificate-signing-request
--   file://@path"
module Network.AWS.IoT.CreateCertificateFromCsr

-- | The input for the CreateCertificateFromCsr operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateCertificateFromCsr</a> smart constructor.

-- | Confirms a topic rule destination. When you create a rule requiring a
--   destination, IoT sends a confirmation message to the endpoint or base
--   address you specify. The message includes a token which you pass back
--   when calling <tt>ConfirmTopicRuleDestination</tt> to confirm that you
--   own or have access to the endpoint.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>ConfirmTopicRuleDestination</a>
--   action.

-- | Cancels the execution of a job for a given thing.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CancelJobExecution</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CancelJobExecution

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelJobExecution</a> smart constructor.
data CancelJobExecution
CancelJobExecution' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> Text -> CancelJobExecution

-- | (Optional) If <tt>true</tt> the job execution will be canceled if it
--   has status IN_PROGRESS or QUEUED, otherwise the job execution will be
--   canceled only if it has status QUEUED. If you attempt to cancel a job
--   execution that is IN_PROGRESS, and you do not set <tt>force</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt>, then an <tt>InvalidStateTransitionException</tt> will
--   be thrown. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Canceling a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause the
--   device to be unable to update the job execution status. Use caution
--   and ensure that the device is able to recover to a valid state.
[$sel:force:CancelJobExecution'] :: CancelJobExecution -> Maybe Bool

-- | A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job
--   execution. If not specified, the statusDetails are unchanged. You can
--   specify at most 10 name/value pairs.
[$sel:statusDetails:CancelJobExecution'] :: CancelJobExecution -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | (Optional) The expected current version of the job execution. Each
--   time you update the job execution, its version is incremented. If the
--   version of the job execution stored in Jobs does not match, the update
--   is rejected with a VersionMismatch error, and an ErrorResponse that
--   contains the current job execution status data is returned. (This
--   makes it unnecessary to perform a separate DescribeJobExecution
--   request in order to obtain the job execution status data.)
[$sel:expectedVersion:CancelJobExecution'] :: CancelJobExecution -> Maybe Integer

-- | The ID of the job to be canceled.
[$sel:jobId:CancelJobExecution'] :: CancelJobExecution -> Text

-- | The name of the thing whose execution of the job will be canceled.
[$sel:thingName:CancelJobExecution'] :: CancelJobExecution -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelJobExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:force:CancelJobExecution'</a>, <a>cancelJobExecution_force</a>
--   - (Optional) If <tt>true</tt> the job execution will be canceled if it
--   has status IN_PROGRESS or QUEUED, otherwise the job execution will be
--   canceled only if it has status QUEUED. If you attempt to cancel a job
--   execution that is IN_PROGRESS, and you do not set <tt>force</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt>, then an <tt>InvalidStateTransitionException</tt> will
--   be thrown. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Canceling a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause the
--   device to be unable to update the job execution status. Use caution
--   and ensure that the device is able to recover to a valid state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusDetails:CancelJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>cancelJobExecution_statusDetails</a> - A collection of name/value
--   pairs that describe the status of the job execution. If not specified,
--   the statusDetails are unchanged. You can specify at most 10 name/value
--   pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedVersion:CancelJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>cancelJobExecution_expectedVersion</a> - (Optional) The expected
--   current version of the job execution. Each time you update the job
--   execution, its version is incremented. If the version of the job
--   execution stored in Jobs does not match, the update is rejected with a
--   VersionMismatch error, and an ErrorResponse that contains the current
--   job execution status data is returned. (This makes it unnecessary to
--   perform a separate DescribeJobExecution request in order to obtain the
--   job execution status data.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:CancelJobExecution'</a>, <a>cancelJobExecution_jobId</a>
--   - The ID of the job to be canceled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:CancelJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>cancelJobExecution_thingName</a> - The name of the thing whose
--   execution of the job will be canceled.
newCancelJobExecution :: Text -> Text -> CancelJobExecution

-- | (Optional) If <tt>true</tt> the job execution will be canceled if it
--   has status IN_PROGRESS or QUEUED, otherwise the job execution will be
--   canceled only if it has status QUEUED. If you attempt to cancel a job
--   execution that is IN_PROGRESS, and you do not set <tt>force</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt>, then an <tt>InvalidStateTransitionException</tt> will
--   be thrown. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Canceling a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause the
--   device to be unable to update the job execution status. Use caution
--   and ensure that the device is able to recover to a valid state.
cancelJobExecution_force :: Lens' CancelJobExecution (Maybe Bool)

-- | A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job
--   execution. If not specified, the statusDetails are unchanged. You can
--   specify at most 10 name/value pairs.
cancelJobExecution_statusDetails :: Lens' CancelJobExecution (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | (Optional) The expected current version of the job execution. Each
--   time you update the job execution, its version is incremented. If the
--   version of the job execution stored in Jobs does not match, the update
--   is rejected with a VersionMismatch error, and an ErrorResponse that
--   contains the current job execution status data is returned. (This
--   makes it unnecessary to perform a separate DescribeJobExecution
--   request in order to obtain the job execution status data.)
cancelJobExecution_expectedVersion :: Lens' CancelJobExecution (Maybe Integer)

-- | The ID of the job to be canceled.
cancelJobExecution_jobId :: Lens' CancelJobExecution Text

-- | The name of the thing whose execution of the job will be canceled.
cancelJobExecution_thingName :: Lens' CancelJobExecution Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelJobExecutionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CancelJobExecutionResponse
CancelJobExecutionResponse' :: CancelJobExecutionResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelJobExecutionResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newCancelJobExecutionResponse :: CancelJobExecutionResponse

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.CancelJobExecution.CancelJobExecution
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.CancelJobExecution.CancelJobExecution

-- | Cancels a job.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CancelJob</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CancelJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelJob</a> smart constructor.
data CancelJob
CancelJob' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> CancelJob

-- | (Optional) If <tt>true</tt> job executions with status "IN_PROGRESS"
--   and "QUEUED" are canceled, otherwise only job executions with status
--   "QUEUED" are canceled. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Canceling a job which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause a device which is
--   executing the job to be unable to update the job execution status. Use
--   caution and ensure that each device executing a job which is canceled
--   is able to recover to a valid state.
[$sel:force:CancelJob'] :: CancelJob -> Maybe Bool

-- | (Optional)A reason code string that explains why the job was canceled.
[$sel:reasonCode:CancelJob'] :: CancelJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An optional comment string describing why the job was canceled.
[$sel:comment:CancelJob'] :: CancelJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
[$sel:jobId:CancelJob'] :: CancelJob -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:force:CancelJob'</a>, <a>cancelJob_force</a> - (Optional) If
--   <tt>true</tt> job executions with status "IN_PROGRESS" and "QUEUED"
--   are canceled, otherwise only job executions with status "QUEUED" are
--   canceled. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Canceling a job which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause a device which is
--   executing the job to be unable to update the job execution status. Use
--   caution and ensure that each device executing a job which is canceled
--   is able to recover to a valid state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonCode:CancelJob'</a>, <a>cancelJob_reasonCode</a> -
--   (Optional)A reason code string that explains why the job was canceled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comment:CancelJob'</a>, <a>cancelJob_comment</a> - An optional
--   comment string describing why the job was canceled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:CancelJob'</a>, <a>cancelJob_jobId</a> - The unique
--   identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
newCancelJob :: Text -> CancelJob

-- | (Optional) If <tt>true</tt> job executions with status "IN_PROGRESS"
--   and "QUEUED" are canceled, otherwise only job executions with status
--   "QUEUED" are canceled. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Canceling a job which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause a device which is
--   executing the job to be unable to update the job execution status. Use
--   caution and ensure that each device executing a job which is canceled
--   is able to recover to a valid state.
cancelJob_force :: Lens' CancelJob (Maybe Bool)

-- | (Optional)A reason code string that explains why the job was canceled.
cancelJob_reasonCode :: Lens' CancelJob (Maybe Text)

-- | An optional comment string describing why the job was canceled.
cancelJob_comment :: Lens' CancelJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
cancelJob_jobId :: Lens' CancelJob Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CancelJobResponse
CancelJobResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> CancelJobResponse

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
[$sel:jobId:CancelJobResponse'] :: CancelJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The job ARN.
[$sel:jobArn:CancelJobResponse'] :: CancelJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A short text description of the job.
[$sel:description:CancelJobResponse'] :: CancelJobResponse -> Maybe Text

[$sel:httpStatus:CancelJobResponse'] :: CancelJobResponse -> Int

--   omitted.

--

-- | Cancels a pending transfer for the specified certificate.
--   
--   <b>Note</b> Only the transfer source account can use this operation to
--   cancel a transfer. (Transfer destinations can use
--   RejectCertificateTransfer instead.) After transfer, IoT returns the
--   certificate to the source account in the INACTIVE state. After the
--   destination account has accepted the transfer, the transfer cannot be
--   cancelled.
--   
--   After a certificate transfer is cancelled, the status of the
--   certificate changes from PENDING_TRANSFER to INACTIVE.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CancelCertificateTransfer</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.CancelCertificateTransfer

-- | The input for the CancelCertificateTransfer operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelCertificateTransfer</a> smart constructor.
data CancelCertificateTransfer
CancelCertificateTransfer' :: Text -> CancelCertificateTransfer

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
[$sel:certificateId:CancelCertificateTransfer'] :: CancelCertificateTransfer -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelCertificateTransfer</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:CancelCertificateTransfer'</a>,
--   <a>cancelCertificateTransfer_certificateId</a> - The ID of the
--   certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN contains the
--   certificate ID.)
newCancelCertificateTransfer :: Text -> CancelCertificateTransfer

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
cancelCertificateTransfer_certificateId :: Lens' CancelCertificateTransfer Text

--   constructor.

CancelCertificateTransferResponse' :: CancelCertificateTransferResponse

--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newCancelCertificateTransferResponse :: CancelCertificateTransferResponse

-- | Cancels an audit that is in progress. The audit can be either
--   scheduled or on demand. If the audit isn't in progress, an
--   "InvalidRequestException" occurs.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>CancelAuditTask</a> action.

--   that is "IN_PROGRESS".

-- | Attaches the specified principal to the specified thing. A principal
--   can be X.509 certificates, IAM users, groups, and roles, Amazon
--   Cognito identities or federated identities.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>AttachThingPrincipal</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.AttachThingPrincipal

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachThingPrincipal</a> smart constructor.

[$sel:thingName:AttachThingPrincipal'] :: AttachThingPrincipal -> Text

--   CreateCertificate operation) or an Amazon Cognito ID.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>attachThingPrincipal_thingName</a> - The name of the thing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:principal:AttachThingPrincipal'</a>,
--   <a>attachThingPrincipal_principal</a> - The principal, which can be a
--   certificate ARN (as returned from the CreateCertificate operation) or
--   an Amazon Cognito ID.

-- | Associates a group with a continuous job. The following criteria must
--   be met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The job must have been created with the <tt>targetSelection</tt>
--   field set to "CONTINUOUS".</li>
--   <li>The job status must currently be "IN_PROGRESS".</li>
--   <li>The total number of targets associated with a job must not exceed
--   100.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>AssociateTargetsWithJob</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.AssociateTargetsWithJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateTargetsWithJob</a> smart constructor.
data AssociateTargetsWithJob
AssociateTargetsWithJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NonEmpty Text -> Text -> AssociateTargetsWithJob

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
[$sel:namespaceId:AssociateTargetsWithJob'] :: AssociateTargetsWithJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An optional comment string describing why the job was associated with
--   the targets.
[$sel:comment:AssociateTargetsWithJob'] :: AssociateTargetsWithJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of thing group ARNs that define the targets of the job.
[$sel:targets:AssociateTargetsWithJob'] :: AssociateTargetsWithJob -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
[$sel:jobId:AssociateTargetsWithJob'] :: AssociateTargetsWithJob -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateTargetsWithJob</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:AssociateTargetsWithJob'</a>,
--   <a>associateTargetsWithJob_namespaceId</a> - The namespace used to
--   indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comment:AssociateTargetsWithJob'</a>,
--   <a>associateTargetsWithJob_comment</a> - An optional comment string
--   describing why the job was associated with the targets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:AssociateTargetsWithJob'</a>,
--   <a>associateTargetsWithJob_targets</a> - A list of thing group ARNs
--   that define the targets of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:AssociateTargetsWithJob'</a>,
--   <a>associateTargetsWithJob_jobId</a> - The unique identifier you
--   assigned to this job when it was created.
newAssociateTargetsWithJob :: NonEmpty Text -> Text -> AssociateTargetsWithJob

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
associateTargetsWithJob_namespaceId :: Lens' AssociateTargetsWithJob (Maybe Text)

-- | An optional comment string describing why the job was associated with
--   the targets.
associateTargetsWithJob_comment :: Lens' AssociateTargetsWithJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of thing group ARNs that define the targets of the job.
associateTargetsWithJob_targets :: Lens' AssociateTargetsWithJob (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
associateTargetsWithJob_jobId :: Lens' AssociateTargetsWithJob Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateTargetsWithJobResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AssociateTargetsWithJobResponse
AssociateTargetsWithJobResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> AssociateTargetsWithJobResponse

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
[$sel:jobId:AssociateTargetsWithJobResponse'] :: AssociateTargetsWithJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An ARN identifying the job.

-- | Adds a thing to a thing group.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>AddThingToThingGroup</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.AddThingToThingGroup

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAddThingToThingGroup</a> smart constructor.
data AddThingToThingGroup
AddThingToThingGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> AddThingToThingGroup

-- | The ARN of the group to which you are adding a thing.
[$sel:thingGroupArn:AddThingToThingGroup'] :: AddThingToThingGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the thing to add to a group.
[$sel:thingArn:AddThingToThingGroup'] :: AddThingToThingGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the group to which you are adding a thing.
[$sel:thingGroupName:AddThingToThingGroup'] :: AddThingToThingGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Override dynamic thing groups with static thing groups when 10-group
--   limit is reached. If a thing belongs to 10 thing groups, and one or
--   more of those groups are dynamic thing groups, adding a thing to a
--   static group removes the thing from the last dynamic group.
[$sel:overrideDynamicGroups:AddThingToThingGroup'] :: AddThingToThingGroup -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the thing to add to a group.
[$sel:thingName:AddThingToThingGroup'] :: AddThingToThingGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AddThingToThingGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupArn:AddThingToThingGroup'</a>,
--   <a>addThingToThingGroup_thingGroupArn</a> - The ARN of the group to
--   which you are adding a thing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingArn:AddThingToThingGroup'</a>,
--   <a>addThingToThingGroup_thingArn</a> - The ARN of the thing to add to
--   a group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupName:AddThingToThingGroup'</a>,
--   <a>addThingToThingGroup_thingGroupName</a> - The name of the group to
--   which you are adding a thing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:overrideDynamicGroups:AddThingToThingGroup'</a>,
--   <a>addThingToThingGroup_overrideDynamicGroups</a> - Override dynamic
--   thing groups with static thing groups when 10-group limit is reached.
--   If a thing belongs to 10 thing groups, and one or more of those groups
--   are dynamic thing groups, adding a thing to a static group removes the
--   thing from the last dynamic group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:AddThingToThingGroup'</a>,
--   <a>addThingToThingGroup_thingName</a> - The name of the thing to add
--   to a group.
newAddThingToThingGroup :: AddThingToThingGroup

-- | The ARN of the group to which you are adding a thing.
addThingToThingGroup_thingGroupArn :: Lens' AddThingToThingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the thing to add to a group.
addThingToThingGroup_thingArn :: Lens' AddThingToThingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the group to which you are adding a thing.
addThingToThingGroup_thingGroupName :: Lens' AddThingToThingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Override dynamic thing groups with static thing groups when 10-group
--   limit is reached. If a thing belongs to 10 thing groups, and one or
--   more of those groups are dynamic thing groups, adding a thing to a
--   static group removes the thing from the last dynamic group.
addThingToThingGroup_overrideDynamicGroups :: Lens' AddThingToThingGroup (Maybe Bool)

addThingToThingGroup_thingName :: Lens' AddThingToThingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | Accepts a pending certificate transfer. The default state of the
--   certificate is INACTIVE.
--   
--   To check for pending certificate transfers, call ListCertificates to
--   enumerate your certificates.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>AcceptCertificateTransfer</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.AcceptCertificateTransfer

-- | The input for the AcceptCertificateTransfer operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAcceptCertificateTransfer</a> smart constructor.
data AcceptCertificateTransfer
AcceptCertificateTransfer' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> AcceptCertificateTransfer

-- | Specifies whether the certificate is active.
[$sel:setAsActive:AcceptCertificateTransfer'] :: AcceptCertificateTransfer -> Maybe Bool

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
[$sel:certificateId:AcceptCertificateTransfer'] :: AcceptCertificateTransfer -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AcceptCertificateTransfer</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:setAsActive:AcceptCertificateTransfer'</a>,
--   <a>acceptCertificateTransfer_setAsActive</a> - Specifies whether the
--   certificate is active.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:AcceptCertificateTransfer'</a>,
--   <a>acceptCertificateTransfer_certificateId</a> - The ID of the
--   certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN contains the
--   certificate ID.)
newAcceptCertificateTransfer :: Text -> AcceptCertificateTransfer

-- | Specifies whether the certificate is active.
acceptCertificateTransfer_setAsActive :: Lens' AcceptCertificateTransfer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)

--   constructor.

--   omitted.

--

--   list of the keys of the tags to be removed from the resource.

-- | Configures or reconfigures the Device Defender audit settings for this
--   account. Settings include how audit notifications are sent and which
--   audit checks are enabled or disabled.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the
--   <a>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration
UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration' :: Maybe (HashMap Text AuditCheckConfiguration) -> Maybe (HashMap AuditNotificationType AuditNotificationTarget) -> Maybe Text -> UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration

-- | Specifies which audit checks are enabled and disabled for this
--   account. Use <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the
--   list of all checks, including those that are currently enabled.
--   
--   Some data collection might start immediately when certain checks are
--   enabled. When a check is disabled, any data collected so far in
--   relation to the check is deleted.
--   
--   You cannot disable a check if it's used by any scheduled audit. You
--   must first delete the check from the scheduled audit or delete the
--   scheduled audit itself.
--   
--   On the first call to <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt>, this
--   parameter is required and must specify at least one enabled check.
[$sel:auditCheckConfigurations:UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration'] :: UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text AuditCheckConfiguration)

-- | Information about the targets to which audit notifications are sent.
[$sel:auditNotificationTargetConfigurations:UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration'] :: UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap AuditNotificationType AuditNotificationTarget)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that grants permission to
--   IoT to access information about your devices, policies, certificates,
--   and other items as required when performing an audit.
[$sel:roleArn:UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration'] :: UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:auditCheckConfigurations:UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountAuditConfiguration_auditCheckConfigurations</a> -
--   Specifies which audit checks are enabled and disabled for this
--   account. Use <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the
--   list of all checks, including those that are currently enabled.
--   
--   Some data collection might start immediately when certain checks are
--   enabled. When a check is disabled, any data collected so far in
--   relation to the check is deleted.
--   
--   You cannot disable a check if it's used by any scheduled audit. You
--   must first delete the check from the scheduled audit or delete the
--   scheduled audit itself.
--   
--   On the first call to <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt>, this
--   parameter is required and must specify at least one enabled check.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:auditNotificationTargetConfigurations:UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountAuditConfiguration_auditNotificationTargetConfigurations</a>
--   - Information about the targets to which audit notifications are sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountAuditConfiguration_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the role that grants permission to IoT to access
--   information about your devices, policies, certificates, and other
--   items as required when performing an audit.
newUpdateAccountAuditConfiguration :: UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration

-- | Specifies which audit checks are enabled and disabled for this
--   account. Use <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the
--   list of all checks, including those that are currently enabled.
--   
--   Some data collection might start immediately when certain checks are
--   enabled. When a check is disabled, any data collected so far in
--   relation to the check is deleted.
--   
--   You cannot disable a check if it's used by any scheduled audit. You
--   must first delete the check from the scheduled audit or delete the
--   scheduled audit itself.
--   
--   On the first call to <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt>, this
--   parameter is required and must specify at least one enabled check.
updateAccountAuditConfiguration_auditCheckConfigurations :: Lens' UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration (Maybe (HashMap Text AuditCheckConfiguration))

-- | Information about the targets to which audit notifications are sent.
updateAccountAuditConfiguration_auditNotificationTargetConfigurations :: Lens' UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration (Maybe (HashMap AuditNotificationType AuditNotificationTarget))

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that grants permission to
--   IoT to access information about your devices, policies, certificates,
--   and other items as required when performing an audit.
updateAccountAuditConfiguration_roleArn :: Lens' UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse
UpdateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse' :: Int -> UpdateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse'] :: UpdateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newUpdateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse :: Int -> UpdateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
updateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateAccountAuditConfigurationResponse Int

--   billing group does not match the expected version specified in the
--   request, the <tt>UpdateBillingGroup</tt> request is rejected with a
--   <tt>VersionConflictException</tt>.

-- | Updates a registered CA certificate.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateCACertificate</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateCACertificate

-- | The input to the UpdateCACertificate operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateCACertificate</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateCACertificate
UpdateCACertificate' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe CACertificateStatus -> Maybe RegistrationConfig -> Maybe AutoRegistrationStatus -> Text -> UpdateCACertificate

-- | If true, removes auto registration.
[$sel:removeAutoRegistration:UpdateCACertificate'] :: UpdateCACertificate -> Maybe Bool

-- | The updated status of the CA certificate.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and
--   should not be used.
[$sel:newStatus':UpdateCACertificate'] :: UpdateCACertificate -> Maybe CACertificateStatus

-- | Information about the registration configuration.
[$sel:registrationConfig:UpdateCACertificate'] :: UpdateCACertificate -> Maybe RegistrationConfig

-- | The new value for the auto registration status. Valid values are:
--   "ENABLE" or "DISABLE".
[$sel:newAutoRegistrationStatus':UpdateCACertificate'] :: UpdateCACertificate -> Maybe AutoRegistrationStatus

-- | The CA certificate identifier.
[$sel:certificateId:UpdateCACertificate'] :: UpdateCACertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateCACertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   auto registration.

--   <a>updateCACertificate_newStatus</a> - The updated status of the CA
--   certificate.

--   should not be used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registrationConfig:UpdateCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>updateCACertificate_registrationConfig</a> - Information about the
--   registration configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:newAutoRegistrationStatus':UpdateCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>updateCACertificate_newAutoRegistrationStatus</a> - The new value
--   for the auto registration status. Valid values are: "ENABLE" or
--   "DISABLE".

--   <a>updateCACertificate_certificateId</a> - The CA certificate
--   identifier.

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateCACertificate.UpdateCACertificate


-- | Updates the status of the specified certificate. This operation is
--   idempotent.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateCertificate</a> action.
--   
--   Certificates must be in the ACTIVE state to authenticate devices that
--   use a certificate to connect to IoT.
--   
--   Within a few minutes of updating a certificate from the ACTIVE state
--   to any other state, IoT disconnects all devices that used that
--   certificate to connect. Devices cannot use a certificate that is not
--   in the ACTIVE state to reconnect.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateCertificate

-- | The input for the UpdateCertificate operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateCertificate
UpdateCertificate' :: Text -> CertificateStatus -> UpdateCertificate

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
[$sel:certificateId:UpdateCertificate'] :: UpdateCertificate -> Text

-- | The new status.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> Setting the status to PENDING_TRANSFER or
--   PENDING_ACTIVATION will result in an exception being thrown.
--   PENDING_TRANSFER and PENDING_ACTIVATION are statuses used internally
--   by IoT. They are not intended for developer use.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and
--   should not be used.
[$sel:newStatus':UpdateCertificate'] :: UpdateCertificate -> CertificateStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateCertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:UpdateCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>updateCertificate_certificateId</a> - The ID of the certificate.
--   (The last part of the certificate ARN contains the certificate ID.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:newStatus':UpdateCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>updateCertificate_newStatus</a> - The new status.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> Setting the status to PENDING_TRANSFER or
--   PENDING_ACTIVATION will result in an exception being thrown.
--   PENDING_TRANSFER and PENDING_ACTIVATION are statuses used internally
--   by IoT. They are not intended for developer use.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and
--   should not be used.
newUpdateCertificate :: Text -> CertificateStatus -> UpdateCertificate

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
updateCertificate_certificateId :: Lens' UpdateCertificate Text

-- | The new status.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> Setting the status to PENDING_TRANSFER or
--   PENDING_ACTIVATION will result in an exception being thrown.
--   PENDING_TRANSFER and PENDING_ACTIVATION are statuses used internally
--   by IoT. They are not intended for developer use.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and
--   should not be used.
updateCertificate_newStatus :: Lens' UpdateCertificate CertificateStatus

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateCertificateResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateCertificateResponse
UpdateCertificateResponse' :: UpdateCertificateResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateCertificateResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newUpdateCertificateResponse :: UpdateCertificateResponse

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateCertificate.UpdateCertificate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateCertificate.UpdateCertificate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateCertificate.UpdateCertificate

-- | Updates a Device Defender detect custom metric.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateCustomMetric</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateCustomMetric

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateCustomMetric</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateCustomMetric
UpdateCustomMetric' :: Text -> Text -> UpdateCustomMetric

-- | The name of the custom metric. Cannot be updated.
[$sel:metricName:UpdateCustomMetric'] :: UpdateCustomMetric -> Text

-- | Field represents a friendly name in the console for the custom metric,
--   it doesn't have to be unique. Don't use this name as the metric
--   identifier in the device metric report. Can be updated.
[$sel:displayName:UpdateCustomMetric'] :: UpdateCustomMetric -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateCustomMetric</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:UpdateCustomMetric'</a>,
--   <a>updateCustomMetric_metricName</a> - The name of the custom metric.
--   Cannot be updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:UpdateCustomMetric'</a>,
--   <a>updateCustomMetric_displayName</a> - Field represents a friendly
--   name in the console for the custom metric, it doesn't have to be
--   unique. Don't use this name as the metric identifier in the device
--   metric report. Can be updated.
newUpdateCustomMetric :: Text -> Text -> UpdateCustomMetric

-- | The name of the custom metric. Cannot be updated.
updateCustomMetric_metricName :: Lens' UpdateCustomMetric Text

-- | Field represents a friendly name in the console for the custom metric,
--   it doesn't have to be unique. Don't use this name as the metric
--   identifier in the device metric report. Can be updated.
updateCustomMetric_displayName :: Lens' UpdateCustomMetric Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateCustomMetricResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateCustomMetricResponse
UpdateCustomMetricResponse' :: Maybe CustomMetricType -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Int -> UpdateCustomMetricResponse

-- | The type of the custom metric. Types include <tt>string-list</tt>,
--   <tt>ip-address-list</tt>, <tt>number-list</tt>, and <tt>number</tt>.
[$sel:metricType:UpdateCustomMetricResponse'] :: UpdateCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe CustomMetricType

-- | The time the custom metric was last modified in milliseconds since
--   epoch.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:UpdateCustomMetricResponse'] :: UpdateCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the custom metric.
[$sel:metricName:UpdateCustomMetricResponse'] :: UpdateCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A friendly name in the console for the custom metric
[$sel:displayName:UpdateCustomMetricResponse'] :: UpdateCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The creation date of the custom metric in milliseconds since epoch.
[$sel:creationDate:UpdateCustomMetricResponse'] :: UpdateCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the custom metric.
[$sel:metricArn:UpdateCustomMetricResponse'] :: UpdateCustomMetricResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateCustomMetricResponse'] :: UpdateCustomMetricResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateCustomMetricResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>updateCustomMetricResponse_metricType</a> - The type of the custom
--   metric. Types include <tt>string-list</tt>, <tt>ip-address-list</tt>,
--   <tt>number-list</tt>, and <tt>number</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:UpdateCustomMetricResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateCustomMetricResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The time the
--   custom metric was last modified in milliseconds since epoch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:UpdateCustomMetric'</a>,
--   <a>updateCustomMetricResponse_metricName</a> - The name of the custom
--   metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:UpdateCustomMetric'</a>,
--   <a>updateCustomMetricResponse_displayName</a> - A friendly name in the
--   console for the custom metric
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:UpdateCustomMetricResponse'</a>,

--   the custom metric in milliseconds since epoch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricArn:UpdateCustomMetricResponse'</a>,

--   Number (ARN) of the custom metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateCustomMetricResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateCustomMetricResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newUpdateCustomMetricResponse :: Int -> UpdateCustomMetricResponse

-- | Updates the definition for a dimension. You cannot change the type of
--   a dimension after it is created (you can delete it and recreate it).
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateDimension</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateDimension

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateDimension</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateDimension
UpdateDimension' :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> UpdateDimension

-- | A unique identifier for the dimension. Choose something that describes
--   the type and value to make it easy to remember what it does.
[$sel:name:UpdateDimension'] :: UpdateDimension -> Text

-- | Specifies the value or list of values for the dimension. For
--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimensions, this is a pattern used to match the
--   MQTT topic (for example, "admin/#").
[$sel:stringValues:UpdateDimension'] :: UpdateDimension -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateDimension'</a>, <a>updateDimension_name</a> - A
--   unique identifier for the dimension. Choose something that describes
--   the type and value to make it easy to remember what it does.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stringValues:UpdateDimension'</a>,
--   <a>updateDimension_stringValues</a> - Specifies the value or list of
--   values for the dimension. For <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimensions, this
--   is a pattern used to match the MQTT topic (for example, "admin/#").
newUpdateDimension :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> UpdateDimension

-- | A unique identifier for the dimension. Choose something that describes
--   the type and value to make it easy to remember what it does.
updateDimension_name :: Lens' UpdateDimension Text

-- | Specifies the value or list of values for the dimension. For
--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimensions, this is a pattern used to match the
--   MQTT topic (for example, "admin/#").
updateDimension_stringValues :: Lens' UpdateDimension (NonEmpty Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateDimensionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateDimensionResponse
UpdateDimensionResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe DimensionType -> Int -> UpdateDimensionResponse

-- | The date and time, in milliseconds since epoch, when the dimension was
--   most recently updated.
[$sel:lastModifiedDate:UpdateDimensionResponse'] :: UpdateDimensionResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)of the created dimension.
[$sel:arn:UpdateDimensionResponse'] :: UpdateDimensionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The value or list of values used to scope the dimension. For example,
--   for topic filters, this is the pattern used to match the MQTT topic
--   name.
[$sel:stringValues:UpdateDimensionResponse'] :: UpdateDimensionResponse -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A unique identifier for the dimension.
[$sel:name:UpdateDimensionResponse'] :: UpdateDimensionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in milliseconds since epoch, when the dimension was
--   initially created.
[$sel:creationDate:UpdateDimensionResponse'] :: UpdateDimensionResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The type of the dimension.
[$sel:type':UpdateDimensionResponse'] :: UpdateDimensionResponse -> Maybe DimensionType

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateDimensionResponse'] :: UpdateDimensionResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateDimensionResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:UpdateDimensionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateDimensionResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time,
--   in milliseconds since epoch, when the dimension was most recently
--   updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UpdateDimensionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateDimensionResponse_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)of
--   the created dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stringValues:UpdateDimension'</a>,
--   <a>updateDimensionResponse_stringValues</a> - The value or list of
--   values used to scope the dimension. For example, for topic filters,
--   this is the pattern used to match the MQTT topic name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateDimension'</a>, <a>updateDimensionResponse_name</a>
--   - A unique identifier for the dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:UpdateDimensionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateDimensionResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time, in
--   milliseconds since epoch, when the dimension was initially created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':UpdateDimensionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateDimensionResponse_type</a> - The type of the dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateDimensionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateDimensionResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUpdateDimensionResponse :: Int -> UpdateDimensionResponse

-- | The date and time, in milliseconds since epoch, when the dimension was
--   most recently updated.
updateDimensionResponse_lastModifiedDate :: Lens' UpdateDimensionResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)of the created dimension.
updateDimensionResponse_arn :: Lens' UpdateDimensionResponse (Maybe Text)

--   for topic filters, this is the pattern used to match the MQTT topic
--   name.
