updateDimensionResponse_name :: Lens' UpdateDimensionResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in milliseconds since epoch, when the dimension was
--   initially created.
updateDimensionResponse_creationDate :: Lens' UpdateDimensionResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The type of the dimension.
updateDimensionResponse_type :: Lens' UpdateDimensionResponse (Maybe DimensionType)

updateDimensionResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateDimensionResponse Int

-- | Updates values stored in the domain configuration. Domain
--   configurations for default endpoints can't be updated.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateDomainConfiguration</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateDomainConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateDomainConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateDomainConfiguration
UpdateDomainConfiguration' :: Maybe AuthorizerConfig -> Maybe DomainConfigurationStatus -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> UpdateDomainConfiguration

-- | An object that specifies the authorization service for a domain.
[$sel:authorizerConfig:UpdateDomainConfiguration'] :: UpdateDomainConfiguration -> Maybe AuthorizerConfig

-- | The status to which the domain configuration should be updated.
[$sel:domainConfigurationStatus:UpdateDomainConfiguration'] :: UpdateDomainConfiguration -> Maybe DomainConfigurationStatus

-- | Removes the authorization configuration from a domain.
[$sel:removeAuthorizerConfig:UpdateDomainConfiguration'] :: UpdateDomainConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

--   status to which the domain configuration should be updated.

-- | Updates a dynamic thing group.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateDynamicThingGroup</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateDynamicThingGroup

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateDynamicThingGroup</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateDynamicThingGroup
UpdateDynamicThingGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ThingGroupProperties -> UpdateDynamicThingGroup

-- | The dynamic thing group query version to update.
--   
--   Currently one query version is supported: "2017-09-30". If not
--   specified, the query version defaults to this value.
[$sel:queryVersion:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'] :: UpdateDynamicThingGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The expected version of the dynamic thing group to update.
[$sel:expectedVersion:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'] :: UpdateDynamicThingGroup -> Maybe Integer

-- | The dynamic thing group search query string to update.
[$sel:queryString:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'] :: UpdateDynamicThingGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The dynamic thing group index to update.
--   
--   Currently one index is supported: <tt>AWS_Things</tt>.
[$sel:indexName:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'] :: UpdateDynamicThingGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the dynamic thing group to update.
[$sel:thingGroupName:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'] :: UpdateDynamicThingGroup -> Text

-- | The dynamic thing group properties to update.
[$sel:thingGroupProperties:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'] :: UpdateDynamicThingGroup -> ThingGroupProperties

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateDynamicThingGroup</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:queryVersion:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'</a>,
--   <a>updateDynamicThingGroup_queryVersion</a> - The dynamic thing group
--   query version to update.
--   
--   Currently one query version is supported: "2017-09-30". If not
--   specified, the query version defaults to this value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedVersion:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'</a>,
--   <a>updateDynamicThingGroup_expectedVersion</a> - The expected version
--   of the dynamic thing group to update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queryString:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'</a>,
--   <a>updateDynamicThingGroup_queryString</a> - The dynamic thing group
--   search query string to update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexName:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'</a>,
--   <a>updateDynamicThingGroup_indexName</a> - The dynamic thing group
--   index to update.
--   
--   Currently one index is supported: <tt>AWS_Things</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupName:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'</a>,
--   <a>updateDynamicThingGroup_thingGroupName</a> - The name of the
--   dynamic thing group to update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupProperties:UpdateDynamicThingGroup'</a>,
--   <a>updateDynamicThingGroup_thingGroupProperties</a> - The dynamic
--   thing group properties to update.
newUpdateDynamicThingGroup :: Text -> ThingGroupProperties -> UpdateDynamicThingGroup

-- | The dynamic thing group query version to update.
--   
--   Currently one query version is supported: "2017-09-30". If not
--   specified, the query version defaults to this value.
updateDynamicThingGroup_queryVersion :: Lens' UpdateDynamicThingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The expected version of the dynamic thing group to update.
updateDynamicThingGroup_expectedVersion :: Lens' UpdateDynamicThingGroup (Maybe Integer)

-- | The dynamic thing group search query string to update.
updateDynamicThingGroup_queryString :: Lens' UpdateDynamicThingGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The dynamic thing group index to update.

-- | Updates the data for a fleet metric.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateFleetMetric</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateFleetMetric

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateFleetMetric</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateFleetMetric
UpdateFleetMetric' :: Maybe AggregationType -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe FleetMetricUnit -> Text -> Text -> UpdateFleetMetric

-- | The type of the aggregation query.
[$sel:aggregationType:UpdateFleetMetric'] :: UpdateFleetMetric -> Maybe AggregationType

-- | The time in seconds between fleet metric emissions. Range [60(1 min),
--   86400(1 day)] and must be multiple of 60.
[$sel:period:UpdateFleetMetric'] :: UpdateFleetMetric -> Maybe Natural

-- | The version of the query.
[$sel:queryVersion:UpdateFleetMetric'] :: UpdateFleetMetric -> Maybe Text

-- | The field to aggregate.
[$sel:aggregationField:UpdateFleetMetric'] :: UpdateFleetMetric -> Maybe Text

-- | The expected version of the fleet metric record in the registry.
[$sel:expectedVersion:UpdateFleetMetric'] :: UpdateFleetMetric -> Maybe Integer

-- | The search query string.
[$sel:queryString:UpdateFleetMetric'] :: UpdateFleetMetric -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the fleet metric.
[$sel:description:UpdateFleetMetric'] :: UpdateFleetMetric -> Maybe Text

-- | Used to support unit transformation such as milliseconds to seconds.
--   The unit must be supported by <a>CW metric</a>.
[$sel:unit:UpdateFleetMetric'] :: UpdateFleetMetric -> Maybe FleetMetricUnit

-- | The name of the fleet metric to update.
[$sel:metricName:UpdateFleetMetric'] :: UpdateFleetMetric -> Text

-- | The name of the index to search.
[$sel:indexName:UpdateFleetMetric'] :: UpdateFleetMetric -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateFleetMetric</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--

--   query.
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:UpdateFleetMetric'</a>, <a>updateFleetMetric_period</a>
--   - The time in seconds between fleet metric emissions. Range [60(1
--   min), 86400(1 day)] and must be multiple of 60.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queryVersion:UpdateFleetMetric'</a>,
--   <a>updateFleetMetric_queryVersion</a> - The version of the query.

--   metric.

-- | Updates supported fields of the specified job.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateJob</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateJob</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateJob
UpdateJob' :: Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe AbortConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TimeoutConfig -> Text -> UpdateJob

-- | Allows you to create a staged rollout of the job.
[$sel:jobExecutionsRolloutConfig:UpdateJob'] :: UpdateJob -> Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | Allows you to create criteria to abort a job.
[$sel:abortConfig:UpdateJob'] :: UpdateJob -> Maybe AbortConfig

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
[$sel:namespaceId:UpdateJob'] :: UpdateJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Configuration information for pre-signed S3 URLs.
[$sel:presignedUrlConfig:UpdateJob'] :: UpdateJob -> Maybe PresignedUrlConfig

-- | A short text description of the job.
[$sel:description:UpdateJob'] :: UpdateJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. The timer is started when the job execution status is set
--   to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the time expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
[$sel:timeoutConfig:UpdateJob'] :: UpdateJob -> Maybe TimeoutConfig

-- | The ID of the job to be updated.
[$sel:jobId:UpdateJob'] :: UpdateJob -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExecutionsRolloutConfig:UpdateJob'</a>,
--   <a>updateJob_jobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> - Allows you to create a
--   staged rollout of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:abortConfig:UpdateJob'</a>, <a>updateJob_abortConfig</a> -
--   Allows you to create criteria to abort a job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:UpdateJob'</a>, <a>updateJob_namespaceId</a> - The
--   namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:presignedUrlConfig:UpdateJob'</a>,
--   <a>updateJob_presignedUrlConfig</a> - Configuration information for
--   pre-signed S3 URLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateJob'</a>, <a>updateJob_description</a> - A
--   short text description of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutConfig:UpdateJob'</a>, <a>updateJob_timeoutConfig</a> -
--   Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. The timer is started when the job execution status is set
--   to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the time expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:UpdateJob'</a>, <a>updateJob_jobId</a> - The ID of the
--   job to be updated.
newUpdateJob :: Text -> UpdateJob

-- | Allows you to create a staged rollout of the job.
updateJob_jobExecutionsRolloutConfig :: Lens' UpdateJob (Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig)

-- | Allows you to create criteria to abort a job.
updateJob_abortConfig :: Lens' UpdateJob (Maybe AbortConfig)

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
updateJob_namespaceId :: Lens' UpdateJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Configuration information for pre-signed S3 URLs.
updateJob_presignedUrlConfig :: Lens' UpdateJob (Maybe PresignedUrlConfig)

-- | A short text description of the job.
updateJob_description :: Lens' UpdateJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. The timer is started when the job execution status is set
--   to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the time expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
updateJob_timeoutConfig :: Lens' UpdateJob (Maybe TimeoutConfig)

-- | The ID of the job to be updated.
updateJob_jobId :: Lens' UpdateJob Text

-- | Updates the definition for the specified mitigation action.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateMitigationAction</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateMitigationAction

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateMitigationAction</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateMitigationAction
UpdateMitigationAction' :: Maybe MitigationActionParams -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateMitigationAction

-- | Defines the type of action and the parameters for that action.
[$sel:actionParams:UpdateMitigationAction'] :: UpdateMitigationAction -> Maybe MitigationActionParams

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that is used to apply the mitigation action.
[$sel:roleArn:UpdateMitigationAction'] :: UpdateMitigationAction -> Maybe Text

-- | The friendly name for the mitigation action. You cannot change the
--   name by using <tt>UpdateMitigationAction</tt>. Instead, you must
--   delete and recreate the mitigation action with the new name.
[$sel:actionName:UpdateMitigationAction'] :: UpdateMitigationAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateMitigationAction</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionParams:UpdateMitigationAction'</a>,
--   <a>updateMitigationAction_actionParams</a> - Defines the type of
--   action and the parameters for that action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:UpdateMitigationAction'</a>,
--   <a>updateMitigationAction_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the IAM role that
--   is used to apply the mitigation action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionName:UpdateMitigationAction'</a>,
--   <a>updateMitigationAction_actionName</a> - The friendly name for the
--   mitigation action. You cannot change the name by using
--   <tt>UpdateMitigationAction</tt>. Instead, you must delete and recreate
--   the mitigation action with the new name.
newUpdateMitigationAction :: Text -> UpdateMitigationAction

-- | Defines the type of action and the parameters for that action.
updateMitigationAction_actionParams :: Lens' UpdateMitigationAction (Maybe MitigationActionParams)

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that is used to apply the mitigation action.
updateMitigationAction_roleArn :: Lens' UpdateMitigationAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name for the mitigation action. You cannot change the
--   name by using <tt>UpdateMitigationAction</tt>. Instead, you must
--   delete and recreate the mitigation action with the new name.
updateMitigationAction_actionName :: Lens' UpdateMitigationAction Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateMitigationActionResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Updates a scheduled audit, including which checks are performed and
--   how often the audit takes place.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateScheduledAudit</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateScheduledAudit

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateScheduledAudit</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateScheduledAudit
UpdateScheduledAudit' :: Maybe AuditFrequency -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe DayOfWeek -> Text -> UpdateScheduledAudit

-- | How often the scheduled audit takes place, either <tt>DAILY</tt>,
--   <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>, or <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start
--   time of each audit is determined by the system.
[$sel:frequency:UpdateScheduledAudit'] :: UpdateScheduledAudit -> Maybe AuditFrequency

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit takes place. This
--   can be <tt>1</tt> through <tt>31</tt> or <tt>LAST</tt>. This field is
--   required if the <tt>frequency</tt> parameter is set to
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. If days 29-31 are specified, and the month does not
--   have that many days, the audit takes place on the "LAST" day of the
--   month.
[$sel:dayOfMonth:UpdateScheduledAudit'] :: UpdateScheduledAudit -> Maybe Text

-- | Which checks are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be
--   enabled for your account. (Use
--   <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the list of all
--   checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
[$sel:targetCheckNames:UpdateScheduledAudit'] :: UpdateScheduledAudit -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The day of the week on which the scheduled audit takes place. This can
--   be one of <tt>SUN</tt>, <tt>MON</tt>, <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>,
--   <tt>THU</tt>, <tt>FRI</tt>, or <tt>SAT</tt>. This field is required if
--   the "frequency" parameter is set to <tt>WEEKLY</tt> or
--   <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>.
[$sel:dayOfWeek:UpdateScheduledAudit'] :: UpdateScheduledAudit -> Maybe DayOfWeek

-- | The name of the scheduled audit. (Max. 128 chars)
[$sel:scheduledAuditName:UpdateScheduledAudit'] :: UpdateScheduledAudit -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateScheduledAudit</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:frequency:UpdateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>updateScheduledAudit_frequency</a> - How often the scheduled audit
--   takes place, either <tt>DAILY</tt>, <tt>WEEKLY</tt>,
--   <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>, or <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start time of each audit
--   is determined by the system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfMonth:UpdateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>updateScheduledAudit_dayOfMonth</a> - The day of the month on which
--   the scheduled audit takes place. This can be <tt>1</tt> through
--   <tt>31</tt> or <tt>LAST</tt>. This field is required if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> parameter is set to <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. If days 29-31
--   are specified, and the month does not have that many days, the audit
--   takes place on the "LAST" day of the month.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetCheckNames:UpdateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>updateScheduledAudit_targetCheckNames</a> - Which checks are
--   performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be enabled for your
--   account. (Use <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the
--   list of all checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfWeek:UpdateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>updateScheduledAudit_dayOfWeek</a> - The day of the week on which
--   the scheduled audit takes place. This can be one of <tt>SUN</tt>,
--   <tt>MON</tt>, <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>, <tt>THU</tt>, <tt>FRI</tt>,
--   or <tt>SAT</tt>. This field is required if the "frequency" parameter
--   is set to <tt>WEEKLY</tt> or <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditName:UpdateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>updateScheduledAudit_scheduledAuditName</a> - The name of the
--   scheduled audit. (Max. 128 chars)
newUpdateScheduledAudit :: Text -> UpdateScheduledAudit

-- | How often the scheduled audit takes place, either <tt>DAILY</tt>,
--   <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>, or <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start
--   time of each audit is determined by the system.
updateScheduledAudit_frequency :: Lens' UpdateScheduledAudit (Maybe AuditFrequency)

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit takes place. This
--   can be <tt>1</tt> through <tt>31</tt> or <tt>LAST</tt>. This field is
--   required if the <tt>frequency</tt> parameter is set to
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. If days 29-31 are specified, and the month does not

-- | Updates a Device Defender security profile.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateSecurityProfile</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateSecurityProfile

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateSecurityProfile</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateSecurityProfile
UpdateSecurityProfile' :: Maybe (HashMap AlertTargetType AlertTarget) -> Maybe [MetricToRetain] -> Maybe [Behavior] -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> UpdateSecurityProfile

-- | Where the alerts are sent. (Alerts are always sent to the console.)
[$sel:alertTargets:UpdateSecurityProfile'] :: UpdateSecurityProfile -> Maybe (HashMap AlertTargetType AlertTarget)

-- | A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the profile's behaviors, but it is
--   also retained for any metric specified here. Can be used with custom
--   metrics; cannot be used with dimensions.
[$sel:additionalMetricsToRetainV2:UpdateSecurityProfile'] :: UpdateSecurityProfile -> Maybe [MetricToRetain]

-- | Specifies the behaviors that, when violated by a device (thing), cause
--   an alert.
[$sel:behaviors:UpdateSecurityProfile'] :: UpdateSecurityProfile -> Maybe [Behavior]

-- | The expected version of the security profile. A new version is
--   generated whenever the security profile is updated. If you specify a
--   value that is different from the actual version, a
--   <tt>VersionConflictException</tt> is thrown.
[$sel:expectedVersion:UpdateSecurityProfile'] :: UpdateSecurityProfile -> Maybe Integer

-- | If true, delete all <tt>alertTargets</tt> defined for this security
--   profile. If any <tt>alertTargets</tt> are defined in the current
--   invocation, an exception occurs.
[$sel:deleteAlertTargets:UpdateSecurityProfile'] :: UpdateSecurityProfile -> Maybe Bool

-- | /Please use UpdateSecurityProfileRequest$additionalMetricsToRetainV2
--   instead./
--   
--   A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the profile's <tt>behaviors</tt>, but
--   it is also retained for any metric specified here. Can be used with
--   custom metrics; cannot be used with dimensions.
[$sel:additionalMetricsToRetain:UpdateSecurityProfile'] :: UpdateSecurityProfile -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A description of the security profile.
[$sel:securityProfileDescription:UpdateSecurityProfile'] :: UpdateSecurityProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | If true, delete all <tt>behaviors</tt> defined for this security
--   profile. If any <tt>behaviors</tt> are defined in the current
--   invocation, an exception occurs.
[$sel:deleteBehaviors:UpdateSecurityProfile'] :: UpdateSecurityProfile -> Maybe Bool

-- | If true, delete all <tt>additionalMetricsToRetain</tt> defined for
--   this security profile. If any <tt>additionalMetricsToRetain</tt> are
--   defined in the current invocation, an exception occurs.
[$sel:deleteAdditionalMetricsToRetain:UpdateSecurityProfile'] :: UpdateSecurityProfile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the security profile you want to update.
[$sel:securityProfileName:UpdateSecurityProfile'] :: UpdateSecurityProfile -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateSecurityProfile</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   metrics; cannot be used with dimensions.

--   an alert.

data UpdateSecurityProfileResponse

--   instead./

-- | Updates an existing stream. The stream version will be incremented by
--   one.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateStream</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateStream

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateStream</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateStream
UpdateStream' :: Maybe (NonEmpty StreamFile) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateStream

-- | The files associated with the stream.
[$sel:files:UpdateStream'] :: UpdateStream -> Maybe (NonEmpty StreamFile)

-- | The description of the stream.
[$sel:description:UpdateStream'] :: UpdateStream -> Maybe Text

-- | An IAM role that allows the IoT service principal assumes to access
--   your S3 files.
[$sel:roleArn:UpdateStream'] :: UpdateStream -> Maybe Text

-- | The stream ID.
[$sel:streamId:UpdateStream'] :: UpdateStream -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateStream</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:files:UpdateStream'</a>, <a>updateStream_files</a> - The files
--   associated with the stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateStream'</a>, <a>updateStream_description</a>
--   - The description of the stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:UpdateStream'</a>, <a>updateStream_roleArn</a> - An
--   IAM role that allows the IoT service principal assumes to access your
--   S3 files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamId:UpdateStream'</a>, <a>updateStream_streamId</a> - The
--   stream ID.
newUpdateStream :: Text -> UpdateStream

-- | The files associated with the stream.
updateStream_files :: Lens' UpdateStream (Maybe (NonEmpty StreamFile))

-- | The description of the stream.
updateStream_description :: Lens' UpdateStream (Maybe Text)

-- | An IAM role that allows the IoT service principal assumes to access
--   your S3 files.
updateStream_roleArn :: Lens' UpdateStream (Maybe Text)

-- | The stream ID.
updateStream_streamId :: Lens' UpdateStream Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateStreamResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateStreamResponse
UpdateStreamResponse' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> UpdateStreamResponse

-- | The stream version.
[$sel:streamVersion:UpdateStreamResponse'] :: UpdateStreamResponse -> Maybe Natural

-- | The stream ARN.
[$sel:streamArn:UpdateStreamResponse'] :: UpdateStreamResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the stream.
[$sel:description:UpdateStreamResponse'] :: UpdateStreamResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The stream ID.
[$sel:streamId:UpdateStreamResponse'] :: UpdateStreamResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateStreamResponse'] :: UpdateStreamResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateStreamResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamVersion:UpdateStreamResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateStreamResponse_streamVersion</a> - The stream version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamArn:UpdateStreamResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateStreamResponse_streamArn</a> - The stream ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateStream'</a>,
--   <a>updateStreamResponse_description</a> - A description of the stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:streamId:UpdateStream'</a>,
--   <a>updateStreamResponse_streamId</a> - The stream ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateStreamResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateStreamResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUpdateStreamResponse :: Int -> UpdateStreamResponse

-- | The stream version.
updateStreamResponse_streamVersion :: Lens' UpdateStreamResponse (Maybe Natural)

-- | The stream ARN.
updateStreamResponse_streamArn :: Lens' UpdateStreamResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the stream.
updateStreamResponse_description :: Lens' UpdateStreamResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The stream ID.
updateStreamResponse_streamId :: Lens' UpdateStreamResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateStreamResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateStreamResponse Int

-- | Updates the data for a thing.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateThing</a> action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateThing

-- | The input for the UpdateThing operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateThing</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateThing
UpdateThing' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe AttributePayload -> Text -> UpdateThing

-- | Remove a thing type association. If <b>true</b>, the association is
--   removed.
[$sel:removeThingType:UpdateThing'] :: UpdateThing -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the thing type.
[$sel:thingTypeName:UpdateThing'] :: UpdateThing -> Maybe Text

-- | The expected version of the thing record in the registry. If the
--   version of the record in the registry does not match the expected
--   version specified in the request, the <tt>UpdateThing</tt> request is
--   rejected with a <tt>VersionConflictException</tt>.
[$sel:expectedVersion:UpdateThing'] :: UpdateThing -> Maybe Integer

-- | A list of thing attributes, a JSON string containing name-value pairs.
--   For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"attributes\":{\"name1\":\"value2\"}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   This data is used to add new attributes or update existing attributes.
[$sel:attributePayload:UpdateThing'] :: UpdateThing -> Maybe AttributePayload

-- | The name of the thing to update.
--   
--   You can't change a thing's name. To change a thing's name, you must
--   create a new thing, give it the new name, and then delete the old
--   thing.
[$sel:thingName:UpdateThing'] :: UpdateThing -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateThing</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:removeThingType:UpdateThing'</a>,
--   <a>updateThing_removeThingType</a> - Remove a thing type association.
--   If <b>true</b>, the association is removed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingTypeName:UpdateThing'</a>,
--   <a>updateThing_thingTypeName</a> - The name of the thing type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedVersion:UpdateThing'</a>,
--   <a>updateThing_expectedVersion</a> - The expected version of the thing
--   record in the registry. If the version of the record in the registry
--   does not match the expected version specified in the request, the
--   <tt>UpdateThing</tt> request is rejected with a
--   <tt>VersionConflictException</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributePayload:UpdateThing'</a>,
--   <a>updateThing_attributePayload</a> - A list of thing attributes, a
--   JSON string containing name-value pairs. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"attributes\":{\"name1\":\"value2\"}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   This data is used to add new attributes or update existing attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:UpdateThing'</a>, <a>updateThing_thingName</a> - The
--   name of the thing to update.
--   
--   You can't change a thing's name. To change a thing's name, you must
--   create a new thing, give it the new name, and then delete the old
--   thing.
newUpdateThing :: Text -> UpdateThing

-- | Remove a thing type association. If <b>true</b>, the association is
--   removed.
updateThing_removeThingType :: Lens' UpdateThing (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the thing type.
updateThing_thingTypeName :: Lens' UpdateThing (Maybe Text)

-- | The expected version of the thing record in the registry. If the
--   version of the record in the registry does not match the expected
--   version specified in the request, the <tt>UpdateThing</tt> request is
--   rejected with a <tt>VersionConflictException</tt>.
updateThing_expectedVersion :: Lens' UpdateThing (Maybe Integer)

-- | A list of thing attributes, a JSON string containing name-value pairs.
--   For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"attributes\":{\"name1\":\"value2\"}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   This data is used to add new attributes or update existing attributes.
updateThing_attributePayload :: Lens' UpdateThing (Maybe AttributePayload)

-- | The name of the thing to update.
--   
--   You can't change a thing's name. To change a thing's name, you must
--   create a new thing, give it the new name, and then delete the old
--   thing.
updateThing_thingName :: Lens' UpdateThing Text

-- | The output from the UpdateThing operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateThingResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateThingResponse
UpdateThingResponse' :: Int -> UpdateThingResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateThingResponse'] :: UpdateThingResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateThingResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateThingResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateThingResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUpdateThingResponse :: Int -> UpdateThingResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
updateThingResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateThingResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateThing.UpdateThing
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateThing.UpdateThing
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateThing.UpdateThing
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateThing.UpdateThing

-- | Updates the groups to which the thing belongs.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateThingGroupsForThing</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateThingGroupsForThing

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateThingGroupsForThing</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateThingGroupsForThing
UpdateThingGroupsForThing' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> UpdateThingGroupsForThing

-- | The groups to which the thing will be added.
[$sel:thingGroupsToAdd:UpdateThingGroupsForThing'] :: UpdateThingGroupsForThing -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The groups from which the thing will be removed.
[$sel:thingGroupsToRemove:UpdateThingGroupsForThing'] :: UpdateThingGroupsForThing -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Override dynamic thing groups with static thing groups when 10-group
--   limit is reached. If a thing belongs to 10 thing groups, and one or
--   more of those groups are dynamic thing groups, adding a thing to a
--   static group removes the thing from the last dynamic group.
[$sel:overrideDynamicGroups:UpdateThingGroupsForThing'] :: UpdateThingGroupsForThing -> Maybe Bool

-- | The thing whose group memberships will be updated.
[$sel:thingName:UpdateThingGroupsForThing'] :: UpdateThingGroupsForThing -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateThingGroupsForThing</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupsToAdd:UpdateThingGroupsForThing'</a>,
--   <a>updateThingGroupsForThing_thingGroupsToAdd</a> - The groups to
--   which the thing will be added.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupsToRemove:UpdateThingGroupsForThing'</a>,
--   <a>updateThingGroupsForThing_thingGroupsToRemove</a> - The groups from
--   which the thing will be removed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:overrideDynamicGroups:UpdateThingGroupsForThing'</a>,
--   <a>updateThingGroupsForThing_overrideDynamicGroups</a> - Override
--   dynamic thing groups with static thing groups when 10-group limit is
--   reached. If a thing belongs to 10 thing groups, and one or more of
--   those groups are dynamic thing groups, adding a thing to a static
--   group removes the thing from the last dynamic group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:UpdateThingGroupsForThing'</a>,
--   <a>updateThingGroupsForThing_thingName</a> - The thing whose group
--   memberships will be updated.
newUpdateThingGroupsForThing :: UpdateThingGroupsForThing

-- | The groups to which the thing will be added.
updateThingGroupsForThing_thingGroupsToAdd :: Lens' UpdateThingGroupsForThing (Maybe [Text])

-- | The groups from which the thing will be removed.
updateThingGroupsForThing_thingGroupsToRemove :: Lens' UpdateThingGroupsForThing (Maybe [Text])

-- | Override dynamic thing groups with static thing groups when 10-group
--   limit is reached. If a thing belongs to 10 thing groups, and one or
--   more of those groups are dynamic thing groups, adding a thing to a
--   static group removes the thing from the last dynamic group.
updateThingGroupsForThing_overrideDynamicGroups :: Lens' UpdateThingGroupsForThing (Maybe Bool)

-- | The thing whose group memberships will be updated.
updateThingGroupsForThing_thingName :: Lens' UpdateThingGroupsForThing (Maybe Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateThingGroupsForThingResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateThingGroupsForThingResponse
UpdateThingGroupsForThingResponse' :: Int -> UpdateThingGroupsForThingResponse

[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateThingGroupsForThingResponse'] :: UpdateThingGroupsForThingResponse -> Int

--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateThingGroupsForThingResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateThingGroupsForThingResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newUpdateThingGroupsForThingResponse :: Int -> UpdateThingGroupsForThingResponse

updateThingGroupsForThingResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateThingGroupsForThingResponse Int

-- | Updates a topic rule destination. You use this to change the status,
--   endpoint URL, or confirmation URL of the destination.
--   
--   Requires permission to access the <a>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</a>
--   action.
module Network.AWS.IoT.UpdateTopicRuleDestination

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateTopicRuleDestination</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateTopicRuleDestination
UpdateTopicRuleDestination' :: Text -> TopicRuleDestinationStatus -> UpdateTopicRuleDestination

-- | The ARN of the topic rule destination.
[$sel:arn:UpdateTopicRuleDestination'] :: UpdateTopicRuleDestination -> Text

-- | The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>ERROR</i> Confirmation could not be completed, for example if
--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can
--   set <tt>status</tt> to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>. Calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:UpdateTopicRuleDestination'] :: UpdateTopicRuleDestination -> TopicRuleDestinationStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UpdateTopicRuleDestination'</a>,
--   <a>updateTopicRuleDestination_arn</a> - The ARN of the topic rule
--   destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:UpdateTopicRuleDestination'</a>,
--   <a>updateTopicRuleDestination_status</a> - The status of the topic
--   rule destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>ERROR</i> Confirmation could not be completed, for example if
--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can
--   set <tt>status</tt> to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>. Calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
newUpdateTopicRuleDestination :: Text -> TopicRuleDestinationStatus -> UpdateTopicRuleDestination

-- | The ARN of the topic rule destination.
updateTopicRuleDestination_arn :: Lens' UpdateTopicRuleDestination Text

-- | The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>

--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>

--   the confirmation timed out. You can call

module Network.AWS.IoT.Lens

-- | The query version.
getCardinality_queryVersion :: Lens' GetCardinality (Maybe Text)

-- | The field to aggregate.
getCardinality_aggregationField :: Lens' GetCardinality (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the index to search.
getCardinality_indexName :: Lens' GetCardinality (Maybe Text)

-- | The search query string.
getCardinality_queryString :: Lens' GetCardinality Text

-- | The approximate count of unique values that match the query.
getCardinalityResponse_cardinality :: Lens' GetCardinalityResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | The response's http status code.
getCardinalityResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetCardinalityResponse Int

-- | An object that specifies the authorization service for a domain.
createDomainConfiguration_authorizerConfig :: Lens' CreateDomainConfiguration (Maybe AuthorizerConfig)

-- | The ARNs of the certificates that IoT passes to the device during the
--   TLS handshake. Currently you can specify only one certificate ARN.
--   This value is not required for Amazon Web Services-managed domains.
createDomainConfiguration_serverCertificateArns :: Lens' CreateDomainConfiguration (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the domain.

--   service type.

--   certificate authority. This value is not required for Amazon Web
--   Services-managed domains.
createDomainConfiguration_validationCertificateArn :: Lens' CreateDomainConfiguration (Maybe Text)

--   For URI Request parameters use format:

--   
--   For the CLI command-line parameter use format: &amp;&amp;tags
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
--   
--   For the cli-input-json file use format: "tags":
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."

-- | (Optional) When true, you can delete a job execution which is
--   "IN_PROGRESS". Otherwise, you can only delete a job execution which is
--   in a terminal state ("SUCCEEDED", "FAILED", "REJECTED", "REMOVED" or
--   "CANCELED") or an exception will occur. The default is false.
--   
--   Deleting a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause the device
--   to be unable to access job information or update the job execution
--   status. Use caution and ensure that the device is able to recover to a
--   valid state.
deleteJobExecution_force :: Lens' DeleteJobExecution (Maybe Bool)

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
deleteJobExecution_namespaceId :: Lens' DeleteJobExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the job whose execution on a particular device will be
--   deleted.
deleteJobExecution_jobId :: Lens' DeleteJobExecution Text

-- | The name of the thing whose job execution will be deleted.
deleteJobExecution_thingName :: Lens' DeleteJobExecution Text

-- | The ID of the job execution to be deleted. The
--   <tt>executionNumber</tt> refers to the execution of a particular job
--   on a particular device.
--   
--   Note that once a job execution is deleted, the
--   <tt>executionNumber</tt> may be reused by IoT, so be sure you get and
--   use the correct value here.
deleteJobExecution_executionNumber :: Lens' DeleteJobExecution Integer

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
createOTAUpdate_awsJobTimeoutConfig :: Lens' CreateOTAUpdate (Maybe AwsJobTimeoutConfig)

-- | The description of the OTA update.
createOTAUpdate_description :: Lens' CreateOTAUpdate (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or
--   will be complete after all the things specified as targets have
--   completed the update (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the update may also be
--   run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, an
--   update will run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group,
--   even after the update was completed by all things originally in the
--   group. Valid values: CONTINUOUS | SNAPSHOT.
createOTAUpdate_targetSelection :: Lens' CreateOTAUpdate (Maybe TargetSelection)

--   time of each audit is determined by the system.

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit takes place. This
--   can be <tt>1</tt> through <tt>31</tt> or <tt>LAST</tt>. This field is
--   required if the <tt>frequency</tt> parameter is set to
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. If days 29-31 are specified, and the month does not
--   have that many days, the audit takes place on the "LAST" day of the
--   month.

--   <tt>THU</tt>, <tt>FRI</tt>, or <tt>SAT</tt>. This field is required if

-- | Specifies which audit checks are enabled and disabled for this
--   account. Use <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the
--   list of all checks, including those that are currently enabled.
--   
--   Some data collection might start immediately when certain checks are
--   enabled. When a check is disabled, any data collected so far in
--   relation to the check is deleted.
--   
--   You cannot disable a check if it's used by any scheduled audit. You
--   must first delete the check from the scheduled audit or delete the
--   scheduled audit itself.
--   
--   On the first call to <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt>, this
--   parameter is required and must specify at least one enabled check.

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit takes place. This
--   can be "1" through "31" or "LAST". This field is required if the
--   "frequency" parameter is set to <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. If days 29 to 31 are
--   specified, and the month doesn't have that many days, the audit takes
--   place on the <tt>LAST</tt> day of the month.
createScheduledAudit_dayOfMonth :: Lens' CreateScheduledAudit (Maybe Text)

-- | The day of the week on which the scheduled audit takes place, either
--   <tt>SUN</tt>, <tt>MON</tt>, <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>, <tt>THU</tt>,
--   <tt>FRI</tt>, or <tt>SAT</tt>. This field is required if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> parameter is set to <tt>WEEKLY</tt> or
--   <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>.
createScheduledAudit_dayOfWeek :: Lens' CreateScheduledAudit (Maybe DayOfWeek)

-- | Metadata that can be used to manage the scheduled audit.
createScheduledAudit_tags :: Lens' CreateScheduledAudit (Maybe [Tag])

-- | How often the scheduled audit takes place, either <tt>DAILY</tt>,
--   <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt> or <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start time
--   of each audit is determined by the system.
createScheduledAudit_frequency :: Lens' CreateScheduledAudit AuditFrequency

-- | Which checks are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be
--   enabled for your account. (Use
--   <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the list of all
--   checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)

--   placeholder link when specifying the document.
--   
--   The placeholder link is of the following form:
--   
--   <pre>
--   ${aws:iot:s3-presigned-url:https://s3.amazonaws.com/bucket/key}
--   </pre>
--   
--   where <i>bucket</i> is your bucket name and <i>key</i> is the object

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job
--   was completed by all things originally in the group.
createJob_targetSelection :: Lens' CreateJob (Maybe TargetSelection)

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. The timer is started when the job execution status is set
--   to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the time expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.

--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on

--   was completed by all things originally in the group.

-- | (Optional) When true, you can delete a job which is "IN_PROGRESS".
--   Otherwise, you can only delete a job which is in a terminal state
--   ("COMPLETED" or "CANCELED") or an exception will occur. The default is
--   false.
--   
--   Deleting a job which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause a device which is
--   executing the job to be unable to access job information or update the
--   job execution status. Use caution and ensure that each device
--   executing a job which is deleted is able to recover to a valid state.
deleteJob_force :: Lens' DeleteJob (Maybe Bool)

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
deleteJob_namespaceId :: Lens' DeleteJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the job to be deleted.
--   
--   After a job deletion is completed, you may reuse this jobId when you
--   create a new job. However, this is not recommended, and you must
--   ensure that your devices are not using the jobId to refer to the
--   deleted job.
deleteJob_jobId :: Lens' DeleteJob Text

-- | How often the scheduled audit takes place, either one of
--   <tt>DAILY</tt>, <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>, or
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start time of each audit is determined by the
--   system.
describeScheduledAuditResponse_frequency :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe AuditFrequency)

-- | The name of the scheduled audit.
describeScheduledAuditResponse_scheduledAuditName :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The day of the month on which the scheduled audit takes place. This is
--   will be <tt>1</tt> through <tt>31</tt> or <tt>LAST</tt>. If days
--   <tt>29</tt>-<tt>31</tt> are specified, and the month does not have
--   that many days, the audit takes place on the <tt>LAST</tt> day of the
--   month.
describeScheduledAuditResponse_dayOfMonth :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Which checks are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be
--   enabled for your account. (Use
--   <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the list of all
--   checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
describeScheduledAuditResponse_targetCheckNames :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The day of the week on which the scheduled audit takes place, either
--   one of <tt>SUN</tt>, <tt>MON</tt>, <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>,
--   <tt>THU</tt>, <tt>FRI</tt>, or <tt>SAT</tt>.
describeScheduledAuditResponse_dayOfWeek :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe DayOfWeek)

-- | The ARN of the scheduled audit.
describeScheduledAuditResponse_scheduledAuditArn :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeScheduledAuditResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeScheduledAuditResponse Int

--   contains the certificate ID.)

-- | The new status.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> Setting the status to PENDING_TRANSFER or
--   PENDING_ACTIVATION will result in an exception being thrown.
--   PENDING_TRANSFER and PENDING_ACTIVATION are statuses used internally
--   by IoT. They are not intended for developer use.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and
--   should not be used.

--   exists, an exception occurs. If you omit this value, Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs will automatically generate a unique client request.

-- | The ARN of the topic rule destination.
updateTopicRuleDestination_arn :: Lens' UpdateTopicRuleDestination Text

-- | The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>ERROR</i> Confirmation could not be completed, for example if
--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can
--   set <tt>status</tt> to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>. Calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
updateTopicRuleDestination_status :: Lens' UpdateTopicRuleDestination TopicRuleDestinationStatus

updateTopicRuleDestinationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateTopicRuleDestinationResponse Int

-- | When true, deletes the IoT job created by the OTAUpdate process even
--   if it is "IN_PROGRESS". Otherwise, if the job is not in a terminal
--   state ("COMPLETED" or "CANCELED") an exception will occur. The default
--   is false.

-- | Undocumented member.
createAuditSuppression_resourceIdentifier :: Lens' CreateAuditSuppression ResourceIdentifier

-- | Each audit supression must have a unique client request token. If you
--   try to create a new audit suppression with the same token as one that
--   already exists, an exception occurs. If you omit this value, Amazon
--   Web Services SDKs will automatically generate a unique client request.

-- | An S3 link to the job document to use in the template. Required if you
--   don't specify a value for <tt>document</tt>.
--   
--   If the job document resides in an S3 bucket, you must use a
--   placeholder link when specifying the document.
--   
--   The placeholder link is of the following form:
--   
--   <pre>
--   ${aws:iot:s3-presigned-url:https://s3.amazonaws.com/bucket/key}
--   </pre>
--   
--   where <i>bucket</i> is your bucket name and <i>key</i> is the object
--   in the bucket to which you are linking.

-- | (Optional) If <tt>true</tt> the job execution will be canceled if it
--   has status IN_PROGRESS or QUEUED, otherwise the job execution will be
--   canceled only if it has status QUEUED. If you attempt to cancel a job
--   execution that is IN_PROGRESS, and you do not set <tt>force</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt>, then an <tt>InvalidStateTransitionException</tt> will
--   be thrown. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Canceling a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause the
--   device to be unable to update the job execution status. Use caution
--   and ensure that the device is able to recover to a valid state.
cancelJobExecution_force :: Lens' CancelJobExecution (Maybe Bool)

-- | A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job
--   execution. If not specified, the statusDetails are unchanged. You can
--   specify at most 10 name/value pairs.

-- | (Optional) The expected current version of the job execution. Each
--   time you update the job execution, its version is incremented. If the
--   version of the job execution stored in Jobs does not match, the update
--   is rejected with a VersionMismatch error, and an ErrorResponse that
--   contains the current job execution status data is returned. (This
--   makes it unnecessary to perform a separate DescribeJobExecution
--   request in order to obtain the job execution status data.)
cancelJobExecution_expectedVersion :: Lens' CancelJobExecution (Maybe Integer)

-- | The endpoint type. Valid endpoint types include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>iot:Data</tt> - Returns a VeriSign signed data endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:Data-ATS</tt> - Returns an ATS signed data endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:CredentialProvider</tt> - Returns an IoT credentials
--   provider API endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:Jobs</tt> - Returns an IoT device management Jobs API
--   endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend that customers use the newer
--   <tt>iot:Data-ATS</tt> endpoint type to avoid issues related to the
--   widespread distrust of Symantec certificate authorities.

--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."

-- | A token that can be used to retrieve the next set of results, or
--   <tt>null</tt> if there are no additional results.
listDimensionsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListDimensionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the names of the defined dimensions. Use
--   <tt>DescribeDimension</tt> to get details for a dimension.
listDimensionsResponse_dimensionNames :: Lens' ListDimensionsResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The response's http status code.
listDimensionsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListDimensionsResponse Int

-- | Disables all logs.
getV2LoggingOptionsResponse_disableAllLogs :: Lens' GetV2LoggingOptionsResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default log level.
getV2LoggingOptionsResponse_defaultLogLevel :: Lens' GetV2LoggingOptionsResponse (Maybe LogLevel)

-- | The IAM role ARN IoT uses to write to your CloudWatch logs.
getV2LoggingOptionsResponse_roleArn :: Lens' GetV2LoggingOptionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getV2LoggingOptionsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetV2LoggingOptionsResponse Int

listThingRegistrationTasks_status :: Lens' ListThingRegistrationTasks (Maybe TaskStatus)

-- | To retrieve the next set of results, the <tt>nextToken</tt> value from
--   a previous response; otherwise <b>null</b> to receive the first set of
--   results.

listThingRegistrationTasksResponse_taskIds :: Lens' ListThingRegistrationTasksResponse (Maybe [Text])

listThingRegistrationTasksResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListThingRegistrationTasksResponse Int

rejectCertificateTransfer_rejectReason :: Lens' RejectCertificateTransfer (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the certificate. (The last part of the certificate ARN
--   contains the certificate ID.)
rejectCertificateTransfer_certificateId :: Lens' RejectCertificateTransfer Text

-- | Specifies the destinations to which alerts are sent. (Alerts are
--   always sent to the console.) Alerts are generated when a device
--   (thing) violates a behavior.
createSecurityProfile_alertTargets :: Lens' CreateSecurityProfile (Maybe (HashMap AlertTargetType AlertTarget))

-- | A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the profile's <tt>behaviors</tt>, but
--   it is also retained for any metric specified here. Can be used with
--   custom metrics; cannot be used with dimensions.
createSecurityProfile_additionalMetricsToRetainV2 :: Lens' CreateSecurityProfile (Maybe [MetricToRetain])

--   an alert.
createSecurityProfile_behaviors :: Lens' CreateSecurityProfile (Maybe [Behavior])

-- | /Please use CreateSecurityProfileRequest$additionalMetricsToRetainV2
--   instead./
--   
--   A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the profile's <tt>behaviors</tt>, but
--   it is also retained for any metric specified here. Can be used with
--   custom metrics; cannot be used with dimensions.
createSecurityProfile_additionalMetricsToRetain :: Lens' CreateSecurityProfile (Maybe [Text])

-- | If the principal is a certificate, this value must be ARN of the
--   certificate. If the principal is an Amazon Cognito identity, this
--   value must be the ID of the Amazon Cognito identity.
detachThingPrincipal_principal :: Lens' DetachThingPrincipal Text

detachThingPrincipalResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DetachThingPrincipalResponse Int

-- | (Optional) If <tt>true</tt> job executions with status "IN_PROGRESS"
--   and "QUEUED" are canceled, otherwise only job executions with status
--   "QUEUED" are canceled. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Canceling a job which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause a device which is
--   executing the job to be unable to update the job execution status. Use
--   caution and ensure that each device executing a job which is canceled
--   is able to recover to a valid state.
cancelJob_force :: Lens' CancelJob (Maybe Bool)

-- | (Optional)A reason code string that explains why the job was canceled.
cancelJob_reasonCode :: Lens' CancelJob (Maybe Text)

-- | An optional comment string describing why the job was canceled.
cancelJob_comment :: Lens' CancelJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
cancelJob_jobId :: Lens' CancelJob Text

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
cancelJobResponse_jobId :: Lens' CancelJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The job ARN.
cancelJobResponse_jobArn :: Lens' CancelJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A short text description of the job.
cancelJobResponse_description :: Lens' CancelJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
cancelJobResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CancelJobResponse Int

-- | Whether to undeprecate a deprecated thing type. If <b>true</b>, the
--   thing type will not be deprecated anymore and you can associate it
--   with things.
deprecateThingType_undoDeprecate :: Lens' DeprecateThingType (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the thing type to deprecate.
deprecateThingType_thingTypeName :: Lens' DeprecateThingType Text

-- | The response's http status code.
deprecateThingTypeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeprecateThingTypeResponse Int

-- | The list of criteria that determine when and how to abort the job.
abortConfig_criteriaList :: Lens' AbortConfig (NonEmpty AbortCriteria)

-- | The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.
abortCriteria_failureType :: Lens' AbortCriteria JobExecutionFailureType

-- | The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
abortCriteria_action :: Lens' AbortCriteria AbortAction

-- | The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
abortCriteria_thresholdPercentage :: Lens' AbortCriteria Double

-- | The minimum number of things which must receive job execution
--   notifications before the job can be aborted.
abortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings :: Lens' AbortCriteria Natural

action_cloudwatchMetric :: Lens' Action (Maybe CloudwatchMetricAction)

-- | Send data to CloudWatch Logs.
action_cloudwatchLogs :: Lens' Action (Maybe CloudwatchLogsAction)

-- | Write to a DynamoDB table. This is a new version of the DynamoDB
--   action. It allows you to write each attribute in an MQTT message
--   payload into a separate DynamoDB column.
action_dynamoDBv2 :: Lens' Action (Maybe DynamoDBv2Action)

-- | Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.
action_stepFunctions :: Lens' Action (Maybe StepFunctionsAction)

-- | Change the state of a CloudWatch alarm.
action_cloudwatchAlarm :: Lens' Action (Maybe CloudwatchAlarmAction)

action_sns :: Lens' Action (Maybe SnsAction)

action_dynamoDB :: Lens' Action (Maybe DynamoDBAction)

-- | Write to an Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
action_firehose :: Lens' Action (Maybe FirehoseAction)

-- | The Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT
--   message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the
--   <a>Timestream</a> topic rule action documentation.
action_timestream :: Lens' Action (Maybe TimestreamAction)

-- | Sends data from the MQTT message that triggered the rule to IoT
--   SiteWise asset properties.
action_iotSiteWise :: Lens' Action (Maybe IotSiteWiseAction)

action_iotAnalytics :: Lens' Action (Maybe IotAnalyticsAction)

action_lambda :: Lens' Action (Maybe LambdaAction)

action_openSearch :: Lens' Action (Maybe OpenSearchAction)

action_iotEvents :: Lens' Action (Maybe IotEventsAction)

-- | Send a message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.
action_salesforce :: Lens' Action (Maybe SalesforceAction)

-- | Write data to an Amazon Kinesis stream.
action_kinesis :: Lens' Action (Maybe KinesisAction)

-- | Write to an Amazon S3 bucket.
action_s3 :: Lens' Action (Maybe S3Action)

-- | Send data to an HTTPS endpoint.
action_http :: Lens' Action (Maybe HttpAction)

-- | Write data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
--   
--   The <tt>Elasticsearch</tt> action can only be used by existing rule
--   actions. To create a new rule action or to update an existing rule
--   action, use the <tt>OpenSearch</tt> rule action instead. For more
--   information, see <a>OpenSearchAction</a>.
action_elasticsearch :: Lens' Action (Maybe ElasticsearchAction)

--   MSK) or self-managed Apache Kafka cluster.
action_kafka :: Lens' Action (Maybe KafkaAction)

action_republish :: Lens' Action (Maybe RepublishAction)

action_sqs :: Lens' Action (Maybe SqsAction)

--   {\"attributes\":{\"string1\":\"string2\"}}
--   </pre>
attributePayload_attributes :: Lens' AttributePayload (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Specifies whether the list of attributes provided in the
--   <tt>AttributePayload</tt> is merged with the attributes stored in the
--   registry, instead of overwriting them.
--   
--   To remove an attribute, call <tt>UpdateThing</tt> with an empty
--   attribute value.
--   
--   The <tt>merge</tt> attribute is only valid when calling
--   <tt>UpdateThing</tt> or <tt>UpdateThingGroup</tt>.

awsJobAbortConfig_abortCriteriaList :: Lens' AwsJobAbortConfig (NonEmpty AwsJobAbortCriteria)

-- | The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.
awsJobAbortCriteria_failureType :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria AwsJobAbortCriteriaFailureType

-- | The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
awsJobAbortCriteria_action :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria AwsJobAbortCriteriaAbortAction

-- | The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
awsJobAbortCriteria_thresholdPercentage :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria Double

-- | The minimum number of things which must receive job execution
--   notifications before the job can be aborted.
awsJobAbortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings :: Lens' AwsJobAbortCriteria Natural

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define an exponential rate increase for a job rollout.
awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig_exponentialRate :: Lens' AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig (Maybe AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate)

-- | The maximum number of OTA update job executions started per minute.
awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig_maximumPerMinute :: Lens' AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute, at the start of the job rollout. This is the initial rate
--   of the rollout.
awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_baseRatePerMinute :: Lens' AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate Natural

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. The number of things notified
--   is multiplied by this factor.
awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_incrementFactor :: Lens' AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate Double

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_rateIncreaseCriteria :: Lens' AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

-- | How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 -
--   3600, the default value is 1800 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated
--   when a request for the job document is received.
awsJobPresignedUrlConfig_expiresInSec :: Lens' AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig (Maybe Integer)

-- | When this number of things have been notified, it will initiate an
--   increase in the rollout rate.
awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfNotifiedThings :: Lens' AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria (Maybe Natural)

-- | When this number of things have succeeded in their job execution, it
--   will initiate an increase in the rollout rate.
awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfSucceededThings :: Lens' AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish
--   execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1
--   minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be
--   updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a
--   job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this
--   interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal
--   <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt> status.
awsJobTimeoutConfig_inProgressTimeoutInMinutes :: Lens' AwsJobTimeoutConfig (Maybe Integer)

-- | Suppresses alerts.
behavior_suppressAlerts :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe Bool)

-- | The dimension for a metric in your behavior. For example, using a
--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimension, you can narrow down the scope of the
--   metric to only MQTT topics where the name matches the pattern
--   specified in the dimension. This can't be used with custom metrics.
behavior_metricDimension :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe MetricDimension)

-- | What is measured by the behavior.
behavior_metric :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe Text)

-- | The criteria that determine if a device is behaving normally in regard
--   to the <tt>metric</tt>.
behavior_criteria :: Lens' Behavior (Maybe BehaviorCriteria)

-- | The name you've given to the behavior.
behavior_name :: Lens' Behavior Text

-- | The configuration of an ML Detect
behaviorCriteria_mlDetectionConfig :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe MachineLearningDetectionConfig)

-- | The value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
behaviorCriteria_value :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe MetricValue)

-- | If a device is in violation of the behavior for the specified number
--   of consecutive datapoints, an alarm occurs. If not specified, the
--   default is 1.
behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe Natural)

-- | The operator that relates the thing measured (<tt>metric</tt>) to the
--   criteria (containing a <tt>value</tt> or
--   <tt>statisticalThreshold</tt>). Valid operators include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>string-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>ip-address-list</tt>: <tt>in-cidr-set</tt> and
--   <tt>not-in-cidr-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number</tt>: <tt>less-than</tt>, <tt>less-than-equals</tt>,
--   <tt>greater-than</tt>, and <tt>greater-than-equals</tt></li>
--   </ul>
behaviorCriteria_comparisonOperator :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe ComparisonOperator)

-- | A statistical ranking (percentile)that indicates a threshold value by
--   which a behavior is determined to be in compliance or in violation of
--   the behavior.
behaviorCriteria_statisticalThreshold :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe StatisticalThreshold)

-- | Use this to specify the time duration over which the behavior is
--   evaluated, for those criteria that have a time dimension (for example,
--   <tt>NUM_MESSAGES_SENT</tt>). For a <tt>statisticalThreshhold</tt>
--   metric comparison, measurements from all devices are accumulated over
--   this time duration before being used to calculate percentiles, and
--   later, measurements from an individual device are also accumulated
--   over this time duration before being given a percentile rank. Cannot
--   be used with list-based metric datatypes.
behaviorCriteria_durationSeconds :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe Int)

-- | If an alarm has occurred and the offending device is no longer in
--   violation of the behavior for the specified number of consecutive
--   datapoints, the alarm is cleared. If not specified, the default is 1.
behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToClear :: Lens' BehaviorCriteria (Maybe Natural)

-- | The date the model was last refreshed.
behaviorModelTrainingSummary_lastModelRefreshDate :: Lens' BehaviorModelTrainingSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the behavior.
behaviorModelTrainingSummary_behaviorName :: Lens' BehaviorModelTrainingSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of datapoints collected.
behaviorModelTrainingSummary_datapointsCollectionPercentage :: Lens' BehaviorModelTrainingSummary (Maybe Double)

-- | The name of the security profile.

-- | The date a training model started collecting data.
behaviorModelTrainingSummary_trainingDataCollectionStartDate :: Lens' BehaviorModelTrainingSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

behaviorModelTrainingSummary_modelStatus :: Lens' BehaviorModelTrainingSummary (Maybe ModelStatus)

billingGroupMetadata_creationDate :: Lens' BillingGroupMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

billingGroupProperties_billingGroupDescription :: Lens' BillingGroupProperties (Maybe Text)

bucket_keyValue :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

--   and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to
--   Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.

-- | Whether to deliver the Kinesis Data Firehose stream as a batch by
--   using <a>PutRecordBatch</a> . The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule's SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element forms one record in the
--   <a>PutRecordBatch</a> request. The resulting array can't have more
--   than 500 records.
firehoseAction_batchMode :: Lens' FirehoseAction (Maybe Bool)

-- | A character separator that will be used to separate records written to
--   the Firehose stream. Valid values are: '\n' (newline), '\t' (tab),
--   '\r\n' (Windows newline), ',' (comma).

-- | The URL to which IoT sends a confirmation message. The value of the
--   confirmation URL must be a prefix of the endpoint URL. If you do not
--   specify a confirmation URL IoT uses the endpoint URL as the
--   confirmation URL. If you use substitution templates in the
--   confirmationUrl, you must create and enable topic rule destinations
--   that match each possible value of the substitution template before
--   traffic is allowed to your endpoint URL.
httpAction_confirmationUrl :: Lens' HttpAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The authentication method to use when sending data to an HTTPS
--   endpoint.
httpAction_auth :: Lens' HttpAction (Maybe HttpAuthorization)

-- | The HTTP headers to send with the message data.
httpAction_headers :: Lens' HttpAction (Maybe [HttpActionHeader])

-- | The endpoint URL. If substitution templates are used in the URL, you
--   must also specify a <tt>confirmationUrl</tt>. If this is a new
--   destination, a new <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt> is created if
--   possible.
httpAction_url :: Lens' HttpAction Text

httpActionHeader_key :: Lens' HttpActionHeader Text

-- | The HTTP header value. Substitution templates are supported.

--   Version 4 Signing Process</a>.
