--   destination URL.
httpUrlDestinationSummary_confirmationUrl :: Lens' HttpUrlDestinationSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Policies that don't contain a matching allow or deny statement for the
--   specified action on the specified resource.
implicitDeny_policies :: Lens' ImplicitDeny (Maybe [Policy])

-- | Whether to process the action as a batch. The default value is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is delivered as a separate
--   message when passed by <a>BatchPutMessage</a> to the IoT Analytics
--   channel. The resulting array can't have more than 100 messages.
iotAnalyticsAction_batchMode :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Bool)

-- | (deprecated) The ARN of the IoT Analytics channel to which message
--   data will be sent.
iotAnalyticsAction_channelArn :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the IoT Analytics channel to which message data will be
--   sent.
iotAnalyticsAction_channelName :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the role which has a policy that grants IoT Analytics
--   permission to send message data via IoT Analytics
--   (iotanalytics:BatchPutMessage).
iotAnalyticsAction_roleArn :: Lens' IotAnalyticsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether to process the event actions as a batch. The default value is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is treated as a separate
--   message when it's sent to IoT Events by calling <a>BatchPutMessage</a>
--   . The resulting array can't have more than 10 messages.
iotEventsAction_batchMode :: Lens' IotEventsAction (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ID of the message. The default <tt>messageId</tt> is a new UUID
--   value.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>--a new UUID value will be assigned.
--   
--   Assign a value to this property to ensure that only one input
--   (message) with a given <tt>messageId</tt> will be processed by an IoT
--   Events detector.
iotEventsAction_messageId :: Lens' IotEventsAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the IoT Events input.
iotEventsAction_inputName :: Lens' IotEventsAction Text

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an input to an
--   IoT Events detector. ("Action":"iotevents:BatchPutMessage").
iotEventsAction_roleArn :: Lens' IotEventsAction Text

-- | A list of asset property value entries.
iotSiteWiseAction_putAssetPropertyValueEntries :: Lens' IotSiteWiseAction (NonEmpty PutAssetPropertyValueEntry)

-- | The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an asset
--   property value to IoT SiteWise. (<tt>"Action":
--   "iotsitewise:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue"</tt>). The trust policy can
--   restrict access to specific asset hierarchy paths.
iotSiteWiseAction_roleArn :: Lens' IotSiteWiseAction Text

-- | The status of the job, one of <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>DELETION_IN_PROGRESS</tt> or <tt>COMPLETED</tt>.
job_status :: Lens' Job (Maybe JobStatus)

-- | Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.
job_jobExecutionsRolloutConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig)

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
job_jobId :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
job_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' Job (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An ARN identifying the job with format
--   "arn:aws:iot:region:account:job/jobId".
job_jobArn :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
job_createdAt :: Lens' Job (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Configuration for criteria to abort the job.
job_abortConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe AbortConfig)

-- | Details about the job process.
job_jobProcessDetails :: Lens' Job (Maybe JobProcessDetails)

-- | The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
job_namespaceId :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | If the job was updated, provides the reason code for the update.
job_reasonCode :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.
job_presignedUrlConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe PresignedUrlConfig)

-- | Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job was canceled with the optional
--   <tt>force</tt> parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
job_forceCanceled :: Lens' Job (Maybe Bool)

-- | The ARN of the job template used to create the job.
job_jobTemplateArn :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of IoT things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
job_targets :: Lens' Job (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was completed.
job_completedAt :: Lens' Job (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If the job was updated, describes the reason for the update.
job_comment :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | A short text description of the job.
job_description :: Lens' Job (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a device when the thing representing the device is added to a target
--   group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in
--   the group.
job_targetSelection :: Lens' Job (Maybe TargetSelection)

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
job_timeoutConfig :: Lens' Job (Maybe TimeoutConfig)

-- | The status of the job execution (IN_PROGRESS, QUEUED, FAILED,
--   SUCCEEDED, TIMED_OUT, CANCELED, or REJECTED).
jobExecution_status :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe JobExecutionStatus)

-- | The unique identifier you assigned to the job when it was created.
jobExecution_jobId :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last
--   updated.
jobExecution_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The estimated number of seconds that remain before the job execution
--   status will be changed to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>. The timeout interval can
--   be anywhere between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The
--   actual job execution timeout can occur up to 60 seconds later than the
--   estimated duration. This value will not be included if the job
--   execution has reached a terminal status.
jobExecution_approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was
--   queued.
jobExecution_queuedAt :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job
--   execution.
jobExecution_statusDetails :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe JobExecutionStatusDetails)

-- | The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.
jobExecution_thingArn :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies
--   this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be
--   used in commands which return or update job execution information.
jobExecution_executionNumber :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Integer)

-- | The version of the job execution. Job execution versions are
--   incremented each time they are updated by a device.
jobExecution_versionNumber :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
jobExecution_startedAt :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job execution was canceled with the
--   optional <tt>force</tt> parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
jobExecution_forceCanceled :: Lens' JobExecution (Maybe Bool)

-- | The job execution status.
jobExecutionStatusDetails_detailsMap :: Lens' JobExecutionStatusDetails (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The status of the job execution.
jobExecutionSummary_status :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe JobExecutionStatus)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last
--   updated.
jobExecutionSummary_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was
--   queued.
jobExecutionSummary_queuedAt :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies
--   this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be
--   used later in commands which return or update job execution
--   information.
jobExecutionSummary_executionNumber :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe Integer)

-- | The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
jobExecutionSummary_startedAt :: Lens' JobExecutionSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Contains a subset of information about a job execution.
jobExecutionSummaryForJob_jobExecutionSummary :: Lens' JobExecutionSummaryForJob (Maybe JobExecutionSummary)

-- | The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.
jobExecutionSummaryForJob_thingArn :: Lens' JobExecutionSummaryForJob (Maybe Text)

jobExecutionSummaryForThing_jobExecutionSummary :: Lens' JobExecutionSummaryForThing (Maybe JobExecutionSummary)

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define an exponential rate for a job rollout.
jobExecutionsRolloutConfig_exponentialRate :: Lens' JobExecutionsRolloutConfig (Maybe ExponentialRolloutRate)

-- | The maximum number of things that will be notified of a pending job,
--   per minute. This parameter allows you to create a staged rollout.
jobExecutionsRolloutConfig_maximumPerMinute :: Lens' JobExecutionsRolloutConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of things that are no longer scheduled to execute the job
--   because they have been deleted or have been removed from the group
--   that was a target of the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfRemovedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that are awaiting execution of the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfQueuedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that failed executing the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfFailedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things which successfully completed the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfSucceededThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things currently executing the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfInProgressThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that cancelled the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfCanceledThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things whose job execution status is <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfTimedOutThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of things that rejected the job.
jobProcessDetails_numberOfRejectedThings :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe Int)

--   This value will be null after the job execution has finished rolling
--   out to all the target devices.
jobProcessDetails_processingTargets :: Lens' JobProcessDetails (Maybe [Text])

-- | Defines how the <tt>dimensionValues</tt> of a dimension are
--   interpreted. For example, for dimension type TOPIC_FILTER, the
--   <tt>IN</tt> operator, a message will be counted only if its topic
--   matches one of the topic filters. With <tt>NOT_IN</tt> operator, a
--   message will be counted only if it doesn't match any of the topic
--   filters. The operator is optional: if it's not provided (is
--   <tt>null</tt>), it will be interpreted as <tt>IN</tt>.
metricDimension_operator :: Lens' MetricDimension (Maybe DimensionValueOperator)

-- | A unique identifier for the dimension.
metricDimension_dimensionName :: Lens' MetricDimension Text

--   to specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
metricValue_cidrs :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe [Text])

--   to specify that numeric value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
metricValue_count :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe Natural)

--   to specify that set to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.

mqttContext_username :: Lens' MqttContext (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the <tt>password</tt> key in an MQTT authorization
--   request.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes
--   and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to
--   Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
mqttContext_password :: Lens' MqttContext (Maybe ByteString)

-- | Optional. A unique identifier for this entry that you can define to
--   better track which message caused an error in case of failure. Accepts
--   substitution templates. Defaults to a new UUID.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_entryId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the property alias associated with your asset property.
--   You must specify either a <tt>propertyAlias</tt> or both an
--   <tt>aliasId</tt> and a <tt>propertyId</tt>. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyAlias :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentile that resolves to a threshold value by which compliance
--   with a behavior is determined. Metrics are collected over the
--   specified period (<tt>durationSeconds</tt>) from all reporting devices
--   in your account and statistical ranks are calculated. Then, the
--   measurements from a device are collected over the same period. If the
--   accumulated measurements from the device fall above or below
--   (<tt>comparisonOperator</tt>) the value associated with the percentile
--   specified, then the device is considered to be in compliance with the
--   behavior, otherwise a violation occurs.
statisticalThreshold_statistic :: Lens' StatisticalThreshold (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish
--   execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1
--   minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be
--   updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a
--   job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this
--   interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal
--   <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt> status.
timeoutConfig_inProgressTimeoutInMinutes :: Lens' TimeoutConfig (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies an application-defined value to replace the default value
--   assigned to the Timestream record's timestamp in the <tt>time</tt>
--   column.
--   
--   You can use this property to specify the value and the precision of
--   the Timestream record's timestamp. You can specify a value from the
--   message payload or a value computed by a substitution template.
--   
--   If omitted, the topic rule action assigns the timestamp, in
--   milliseconds, at the time it processed the rule.
timestreamAction_timestamp :: Lens' TimestreamAction (Maybe TimestreamTimestamp)

-- | The ARN of the role that grants permission to write to the Amazon
--   Timestream database table.

--   measure record.

-- | The metadata dimension name. This is the name of the column in the
--   Amazon Timestream database table record.
--   
--   Dimensions cannot be named: <tt>measure_name</tt>,
--   <tt>measure_value</tt>, or <tt>time</tt>. These names are reserved.
--   Dimension names cannot start with <tt>ts_</tt> or
--   <tt>measure_value</tt> and they cannot contain the colon (<tt>:</tt>)
--   character.
timestreamDimension_name :: Lens' TimestreamDimension Text

-- | The value to write in this column of the database record.
timestreamDimension_value :: Lens' TimestreamDimension Text

-- | An expression that returns a long epoch time value.
timestreamTimestamp_value :: Lens' TimestreamTimestamp Text

-- | The precision of the timestamp value that results from the expression
--   described in <tt>value</tt>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>SECONDS</tt> | <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt> |
--   <tt>MICROSECONDS</tt> | <tt>NANOSECONDS</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>MILLISECONDS</tt>.
timestreamTimestamp_unit :: Lens' TimestreamTimestamp Text

-- | Properties of the virtual private cloud (VPC) connection.
topicRuleDestination_vpcProperties :: Lens' TopicRuleDestination (Maybe VpcDestinationProperties)

-- | The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>ERROR</i> Confirmation could not be completed, for example if
--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can
--   set <tt>status</tt> to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>. Calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
topicRuleDestination_status :: Lens' TopicRuleDestination (Maybe TopicRuleDestinationStatus)

-- | The date and time when the topic rule destination was last updated.
topicRuleDestination_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' TopicRuleDestination (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the topic rule destination was created.

--   current status.

-- | Configuration of the HTTP URL.
topicRuleDestinationConfiguration_httpUrlConfiguration :: Lens' TopicRuleDestinationConfiguration (Maybe HttpUrlDestinationConfiguration)

-- | The status of the topic rule destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>ERROR</i> Confirmation could not be completed, for example if
--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can
--   set <tt>status</tt> to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>. Calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
topicRuleDestinationSummary_status :: Lens' TopicRuleDestinationSummary (Maybe TopicRuleDestinationStatus)

-- | Information about the HTTP URL.
topicRuleDestinationSummary_httpUrlSummary :: Lens' TopicRuleDestinationSummary (Maybe HttpUrlDestinationSummary)

-- | The date and time when the topic rule destination was last updated.
topicRuleDestinationSummary_lastUpdatedAt :: Lens' TopicRuleDestinationSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The topic rule destination ARN.
topicRuleDestinationSummary_arn :: Lens' TopicRuleDestinationSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the topic rule destination was created.
topicRuleDestinationSummary_createdAt :: Lens' TopicRuleDestinationSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Information about the virtual private cloud (VPC) connection.
topicRuleDestinationSummary_vpcDestinationSummary :: Lens' TopicRuleDestinationSummary (Maybe VpcDestinationSummary)

-- | The reason the topic rule destination is in the current status.
topicRuleDestinationSummary_statusReason :: Lens' TopicRuleDestinationSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time the rule was created.
topicRuleListItem_createdAt :: Lens' TopicRuleListItem (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
topicRuleListItem_ruleDisabled :: Lens' TopicRuleListItem (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the rule.
topicRuleListItem_ruleName :: Lens' TopicRuleListItem (Maybe Text)

-- | The rule ARN.
topicRuleListItem_ruleArn :: Lens' TopicRuleListItem (Maybe Text)

-- | The pattern for the topic names that apply.
topicRuleListItem_topicPattern :: Lens' TopicRuleListItem (Maybe Text)

-- | The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.
topicRulePayload_awsIotSqlVersion :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to take when an error occurs.
topicRulePayload_errorAction :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Action)

-- | Specifies whether the rule is disabled.
topicRulePayload_ruleDisabled :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Bool)

-- | The description of the rule.
topicRulePayload_description :: Lens' TopicRulePayload (Maybe Text)

-- | The SQL statement used to query the topic. For more information, see
--   <a>IoT SQL Reference</a> in the <i>IoT Developer Guide</i>.
topicRulePayload_sql :: Lens' TopicRulePayload Text

-- | The actions associated with the rule.
topicRulePayload_actions :: Lens' TopicRulePayload [Action]

-- | The date the transfer took place.
transferData_transferDate :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date the transfer was accepted.
transferData_acceptDate :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The transfer message.
transferData_transferMessage :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the transfer was rejected.
transferData_rejectDate :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The reason why the transfer was rejected.
transferData_rejectReason :: Lens' TransferData (Maybe Text)

-- | The action that you want to apply to the CA certificate. The only
--   supported value is <tt>DEACTIVATE</tt>.
updateCACertificateParams_action :: Lens' UpdateCACertificateParams CACertificateUpdateAction

-- | The action that you want to apply to the device certificate. The only
--   supported value is <tt>DEACTIVATE</tt>.
updateDeviceCertificateParams_action :: Lens' UpdateDeviceCertificateParams DeviceCertificateUpdateAction

-- | The description of an error found in the behaviors.
validationError_errorMessage :: Lens' ValidationError (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of violation event.
violationEvent_violationEventType :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe ViolationEventType)

-- | The description of the verification state of the violation.
violationEvent_verificationStateDescription :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the violation event.
violationEvent_violationId :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The behavior that was violated.
violationEvent_behavior :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe Behavior)

-- | The value of the metric (the measurement).
violationEvent_metricValue :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe MetricValue)

-- | The name of the security profile whose behavior was violated.
violationEvent_securityProfileName :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The details of a violation event.
violationEvent_violationEventAdditionalInfo :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo)

-- | The time the violation event occurred.
violationEvent_violationEventTime :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the thing responsible for the violation event.
violationEvent_thingName :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The verification state of the violation (detect alarm).
violationEvent_verificationState :: Lens' ViolationEvent (Maybe VerificationState)

-- | The sensitivity of anomalous behavior evaluation. Can be <tt>Low</tt>,
--   <tt>Medium</tt>, or <tt>High</tt>.
violationEventAdditionalInfo_confidenceLevel :: Lens' ViolationEventAdditionalInfo (Maybe ConfidenceLevel)

-- | The start date and time of a time period in which violation events
--   occurred.
violationEventOccurrenceRange_startTime :: Lens' ViolationEventOccurrenceRange UTCTime

-- | The end date and time of a time period in which violation events
--   occurred.
violationEventOccurrenceRange_endTime :: Lens' ViolationEventOccurrenceRange UTCTime

-- | The security groups of the VPC destination.
vpcDestinationConfiguration_securityGroups :: Lens' VpcDestinationConfiguration (Maybe [Text])

-- | The subnet IDs of the VPC destination.
vpcDestinationConfiguration_subnetIds :: Lens' VpcDestinationConfiguration [Text]

-- | The ID of the VPC.
vpcDestinationConfiguration_vpcId :: Lens' VpcDestinationConfiguration Text

-- | The ARN of a role that has permission to create and attach to elastic
--   network interfaces (ENIs).
vpcDestinationConfiguration_roleArn :: Lens' VpcDestinationConfiguration Text

-- | The security groups of the VPC destination.
vpcDestinationProperties_securityGroups :: Lens' VpcDestinationProperties (Maybe [Text])

-- | The subnet IDs of the VPC destination.
vpcDestinationProperties_subnetIds :: Lens' VpcDestinationProperties (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ID of the VPC.
vpcDestinationProperties_vpcId :: Lens' VpcDestinationProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of a role that has permission to create and attach to elastic
--   network interfaces (ENIs).
vpcDestinationProperties_roleArn :: Lens' VpcDestinationProperties (Maybe Text)

-- | The security groups of the VPC destination.
vpcDestinationSummary_securityGroups :: Lens' VpcDestinationSummary (Maybe [Text])

-- | The subnet IDs of the VPC destination.
vpcDestinationSummary_subnetIds :: Lens' VpcDestinationSummary (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ID of the VPC.
vpcDestinationSummary_vpcId :: Lens' VpcDestinationSummary (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.IoT.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2015-05-28</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   IoT
--   
--   IoT provides secure, bi-directional communication between
--   Internet-connected devices (such as sensors, actuators, embedded
--   devices, or smart appliances) and the Amazon Web Services cloud. You
--   can discover your custom IoT-Data endpoint to communicate with,
--   configure rules for data processing and integration with other
--   services, organize resources associated with each device (Registry),
--   configure logging, and create and manage policies and credentials to
--   authenticate devices.
--   
--   The service endpoints that expose this API are listed in <a>Amazon Web
--   Services IoT Core Endpoints and Quotas</a>. You must use the endpoint
--   for the region that has the resources you want to access.
--   
--   The service name used by <a>Amazon Web Services Signature Version
--   4</a> to sign the request is: <i>execute-api</i>.
--   
--   For more information about how IoT works, see the <a>Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   For information about how to use the credentials provider for IoT, see
--   <a>Authorizing Direct Calls to Amazon Web Services Services</a>.
module Network.AWS.IoT

-- | API version <tt>2015-05-28</tt> of the Amazon IoT SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | This exception occurs if you attempt to start a task with the same
--   task-id as an existing task but with a different clientRequestToken.
_TaskAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Unable to verify the CA certificate used to sign the device
--   certificate you are attempting to register. This is happens when you
--   have registered more than one CA certificate that has the same subject
--   field and public key.
_CertificateConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The Rule-SQL expression can't be parsed correctly.
_SqlParseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The index is not ready.
_IndexNotReadyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request is not valid.
_InvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't transfer the certificate because authorization policies are
--   still attached.
_TransferConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The certificate operation is not allowed.
_CertificateStateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The response is invalid.
_InvalidResponseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The registration code is invalid.
_RegistrationCodeValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The policy documentation is not valid.
_MalformedPolicyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't delete the resource because it is attached to one or more
--   resources.
_DeleteConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource already exists.
_ResourceAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource is not configured.
_NotConfiguredException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The certificate is invalid.
_CertificateValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource with the same name already exists.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource registration failed.
_ResourceRegistrationFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The query is invalid.
_InvalidQueryException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't revert the certificate transfer because the transfer is
--   already complete.
_TransferAlreadyCompletedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The rate exceeds the limit.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The aggregation is invalid.
_InvalidAggregationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A conflicting resource update exception. This exception is thrown when
--   two pending updates cause a conflict.
_ConflictingResourceUpdateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An unexpected error has occurred.
_InternalFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The number of policy versions exceeds the limit.
_VersionsLimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The service is temporarily unavailable.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An unexpected error has occurred.
_InternalException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An exception thrown when the version of an entity specified with the
--   <tt>expectedVersion</tt> parameter does not match the latest version
--   in the system.
_VersionConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You are not authorized to perform this operation.
_UnauthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An attempt was made to change to an invalid state, for example by
--   deleting a job or a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS" without
--   setting the <tt>force</tt> parameter.
_InvalidStateTransitionException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource does not exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A limit has been exceeded.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

data UpdateSecurityProfile
UpdateSecurityProfile' :: Maybe (HashMap AlertTargetType AlertTarget) -> Maybe [MetricToRetain] -> Maybe [Behavior] -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> UpdateSecurityProfile

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateSecurityProfile</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alertTargets:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfile_alertTargets</a> - Where the alerts are sent.
--   (Alerts are always sent to the console.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalMetricsToRetainV2:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfile_additionalMetricsToRetainV2</a> - A list of
--   metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is retained
--   for any metric used in the profile's behaviors, but it is also
--   retained for any metric specified here. Can be used with custom
--   metrics; cannot be used with dimensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviors:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfile_behaviors</a> - Specifies the behaviors that,
--   when violated by a device (thing), cause an alert.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedVersion:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfile_expectedVersion</a> - The expected version of
--   the security profile. A new version is generated whenever the security
--   profile is updated. If you specify a value that is different from the
--   actual version, a <tt>VersionConflictException</tt> is thrown.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteAlertTargets:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfile_deleteAlertTargets</a> - If true, delete all
--   <tt>alertTargets</tt> defined for this security profile. If any
--   <tt>alertTargets</tt> are defined in the current invocation, an
--   exception occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalMetricsToRetain:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfile_additionalMetricsToRetain</a> - /Please use
--   UpdateSecurityProfileRequest$additionalMetricsToRetainV2 instead./
--   
--   A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the profile's <tt>behaviors</tt>, but
--   it is also retained for any metric specified here. Can be used with
--   custom metrics; cannot be used with dimensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileDescription:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfile_securityProfileDescription</a> - A
--   description of the security profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteBehaviors:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfile_deleteBehaviors</a> - If true, delete all
--   <tt>behaviors</tt> defined for this security profile. If any
--   <tt>behaviors</tt> are defined in the current invocation, an exception
--   occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteAdditionalMetricsToRetain:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfile_deleteAdditionalMetricsToRetain</a> - If
--   true, delete all <tt>additionalMetricsToRetain</tt> defined for this
--   security profile. If any <tt>additionalMetricsToRetain</tt> are
--   defined in the current invocation, an exception occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileName:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfile_securityProfileName</a> - The name of the
--   security profile you want to update.
newUpdateSecurityProfile :: Text -> UpdateSecurityProfile

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateSecurityProfileResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateSecurityProfileResponse
UpdateSecurityProfileResponse' :: Maybe (HashMap AlertTargetType AlertTarget) -> Maybe [MetricToRetain] -> Maybe [Behavior] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> UpdateSecurityProfileResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateSecurityProfileResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alertTargets:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfileResponse_alertTargets</a> - Where the alerts
--   are sent. (Alerts are always sent to the console.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalMetricsToRetainV2:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfileResponse_additionalMetricsToRetainV2</a> - A
--   list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the profile's behaviors, but it is
--   also retained for any metric specified here. Can be used with custom
--   metrics; cannot be used with dimensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviors:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfileResponse_behaviors</a> - Specifies the
--   behaviors that, when violated by a device (thing), cause an alert.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:UpdateSecurityProfileResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfileResponse_lastModifiedDate</a> - The time the
--   security profile was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:UpdateSecurityProfileResponse'</a>,

--   the security profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileName:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfileResponse_securityProfileName</a> - The name of
--   the security profile that was updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:UpdateSecurityProfileResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfileResponse_creationDate</a> - The time the
--   security profile was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalMetricsToRetain:UpdateSecurityProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateSecurityProfileResponse_additionalMetricsToRetain</a> -
--   /Please use UpdateSecurityProfileResponse$additionalMetricsToRetainV2
--   instead./
--   
--   A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is
--   retained for any metric used in the security profile's
--   <tt>behaviors</tt>, but it is also retained for any metric specified
--   here.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileArn:UpdateSecurityProfileResponse'</a>,

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteJobExecution</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteJobExecution
DeleteJobExecution' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Integer -> DeleteJobExecution

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteJobExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:force:DeleteJobExecution'</a>, <a>deleteJobExecution_force</a>
--   - (Optional) When true, you can delete a job execution which is
--   "IN_PROGRESS". Otherwise, you can only delete a job execution which is
--   in a terminal state ("SUCCEEDED", "FAILED", "REJECTED", "REMOVED" or
--   "CANCELED") or an exception will occur. The default is false.
--   
--   Deleting a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause the device
--   to be unable to access job information or update the job execution
--   status. Use caution and ensure that the device is able to recover to a
--   valid state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:DeleteJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>deleteJobExecution_namespaceId</a> - The namespace used to indicate
--   that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:DeleteJobExecution'</a>, <a>deleteJobExecution_jobId</a>
--   - The ID of the job whose execution on a particular device will be
--   deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:DeleteJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>deleteJobExecution_thingName</a> - The name of the thing whose job
--   execution will be deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionNumber:DeleteJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>deleteJobExecution_executionNumber</a> - The ID of the job
--   execution to be deleted. The <tt>executionNumber</tt> refers to the
--   execution of a particular job on a particular device.
--   
--   Note that once a job execution is deleted, the
--   <tt>executionNumber</tt> may be reused by IoT, so be sure you get and
--   use the correct value here.
newDeleteJobExecution :: Text -> Text -> Integer -> DeleteJobExecution

data CreateOTAUpdate
CreateOTAUpdate' :: Maybe AwsJobAbortConfig -> Maybe AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe (NonEmpty Protocol) -> Maybe AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe AwsJobTimeoutConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TargetSelection -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> NonEmpty OTAUpdateFile -> Text -> CreateOTAUpdate

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateOTAUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsJobAbortConfig:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>createOTAUpdate_awsJobAbortConfig</a> - The criteria that determine
--   when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>createOTAUpdate_awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> - Configuration
--   for the rollout of OTA updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocols:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>createOTAUpdate_protocols</a> - The protocol used to transfer the
--   OTA update image. Valid values are [HTTP], [MQTT], [HTTP, MQTT]. When
--   both HTTP and MQTT are specified, the target device can choose the
--   protocol.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsJobPresignedUrlConfig:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>createOTAUpdate_awsJobPresignedUrlConfig</a> - Configuration
--   information for pre-signed URLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalParameters:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>createOTAUpdate_additionalParameters</a> - A list of additional OTA
--   update parameters which are name-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsJobTimeoutConfig:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>createOTAUpdate_awsJobTimeoutConfig</a> - Specifies the amount of
--   time each device has to finish its execution of the job. A timer is
--   started when the job execution status is set to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>.
--   If the job execution status is not set to another terminal state
--   before the timer expires, it will be automatically set to
--   <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>createOTAUpdate_description</a> - The description of the OTA
--   update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>createOTAUpdate_targetSelection</a> - Specifies whether the update
--   will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all the
--   things specified as targets have completed the update (SNAPSHOT). If
--   continuous, the update may also be run on a thing when a change is
--   detected in a target. For example, an update will run on a thing when
--   the thing is added to a target group, even after the update was
--   completed by all things originally in the group. Valid values:
--   CONTINUOUS | SNAPSHOT.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>, <a>createOTAUpdate_tags</a> -
--   Metadata which can be used to manage updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateId:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>createOTAUpdate_otaUpdateId</a> - The ID of the OTA update to be
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>, <a>createOTAUpdate_targets</a> -
--   The devices targeted to receive OTA updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:files:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>, <a>createOTAUpdate_files</a> - The
--   files to be streamed by the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:CreateOTAUpdate'</a>, <a>createOTAUpdate_roleArn</a> -
--   The IAM role that grants Amazon Web Services IoT Core access to the
--   Amazon S3, IoT jobs and Amazon Web Services Code Signing resources to
--   create an OTA update job.
newCreateOTAUpdate :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> NonEmpty OTAUpdateFile -> Text -> CreateOTAUpdate

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateScheduledAudit</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   <a>updateScheduledAudit_frequency</a> - How often the scheduled audit
--   takes place, either <tt>DAILY</tt>, <tt>WEEKLY</tt>,
--   <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>, or <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start time of each audit
--   is determined by the system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfMonth:UpdateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>updateScheduledAudit_dayOfMonth</a> - The day of the month on which
--   the scheduled audit takes place. This can be <tt>1</tt> through
--   <tt>31</tt> or <tt>LAST</tt>. This field is required if the
--   <tt>frequency</tt> parameter is set to <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. If days 29-31
--   are specified, and the month does not have that many days, the audit
--   takes place on the "LAST" day of the month.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetCheckNames:UpdateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>updateScheduledAudit_targetCheckNames</a> - Which checks are
--   performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be enabled for your
--   account. (Use <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the
--   list of all checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfWeek:UpdateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>updateScheduledAudit_dayOfWeek</a> - The day of the week on which
--   the scheduled audit takes place. This can be one of <tt>SUN</tt>,
--   <tt>MON</tt>, <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>, <tt>THU</tt>, <tt>FRI</tt>,
--   or <tt>SAT</tt>. This field is required if the "frequency" parameter
--   is set to <tt>WEEKLY</tt> or <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditName:UpdateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>updateScheduledAudit_scheduledAuditName</a> - The name of the
--   scheduled audit. (Max. 128 chars)

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   
--   <a>$sel:auditCheckConfigurations:UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountAuditConfiguration_auditCheckConfigurations</a> -
--   Specifies which audit checks are enabled and disabled for this
--   account. Use <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the
--   list of all checks, including those that are currently enabled.
--   
--   Some data collection might start immediately when certain checks are
--   enabled. When a check is disabled, any data collected so far in
--   relation to the check is deleted.
--   
--   You cannot disable a check if it's used by any scheduled audit. You
--   must first delete the check from the scheduled audit or delete the
--   scheduled audit itself.
--   
--   On the first call to <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt>, this
--   parameter is required and must specify at least one enabled check.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:auditNotificationTargetConfigurations:UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountAuditConfiguration_auditNotificationTargetConfigurations</a>
--   - Information about the targets to which audit notifications are sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountAuditConfiguration_roleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the role that grants permission to IoT to access
--   information about your devices, policies, certificates, and other
--   items as required when performing an audit.
newUpdateAccountAuditConfiguration :: UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration

--   for the role associated with the fleet provisioning template. This IoT

--   "LAST". This field is required if the "frequency" parameter is set to
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. If days 29 to 31 are specified, and the month

--   <tt>LAST</tt> day of the month.

--   the scheduled audit.
--

--   <a>createScheduledAudit_frequency</a> - How often the scheduled audit
--   takes place, either <tt>DAILY</tt>, <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>
--   or <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start time of each audit is determined by the
--   system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetCheckNames:CreateScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>createScheduledAudit_targetCheckNames</a> - Which checks are
--   performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be enabled for your
--   account. (Use <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see the
--   list of all checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
--

--   <a>createScheduledAudit_scheduledAuditName</a> - The name you want to
--   give to the scheduled audit. (Max. 128 chars)

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateCustomMetric</a> with all optional fields

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:CreateCustomMetric'</a>,
--   <a>createCustomMetric_displayName</a> - Field represents a friendly
--   name in the console for the custom metric; it doesn't have to be
--   unique. Don't use this name as the metric identifier in the device
--   metric report. Can be updated once defined.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateCustomMetric'</a>, <a>createCustomMetric_tags</a> -

--

--   <a>createCustomMetric_metricName</a> - The name of the custom metric.
--   This will be used in the metric report submitted from the
--   device/thing. Shouldn't begin with <tt>aws:</tt>. Cannot be updated
--   once defined.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricType:CreateCustomMetric'</a>,
--   <a>createCustomMetric_metricType</a> - The type of the custom metric.
--   Types include <tt>string-list</tt>, <tt>ip-address-list</tt>,
--   <tt>number-list</tt>, and <tt>number</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientRequestToken:CreateCustomMetric'</a>,
--   <a>createCustomMetric_clientRequestToken</a> - Each custom metric must
--   have a unique client request token. If you try to create a new custom
--   metric that already exists with a different token, an exception
--   occurs. If you omit this value, Amazon Web Services SDKs will
--   automatically generate a unique client request.
newCreateCustomMetric :: Text -> CustomMetricType -> Text -> CreateCustomMetric

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--

--   staged rollout of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:documentSource:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_documentSource</a>
--   - An S3 link to the job document. Required if you don't specify a
--   value for <tt>document</tt>.
--   
--   If the job document resides in an S3 bucket, you must use a
--   placeholder link when specifying the document.
--   
--   The placeholder link is of the following form:
--   
--   <pre>
--   ${aws:iot:s3-presigned-url:https://s3.amazonaws.com/bucket/key}
--   </pre>
--   
--   where <i>bucket</i> is your bucket name and <i>key</i> is the object
--   in the bucket to which you are linking.
--   
--   <a>$sel:abortConfig:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_abortConfig</a> -
--   Allows you to create criteria to abort a job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_namespaceId</a> - The
--   namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:presignedUrlConfig:CreateJob'</a>,
--   <a>createJob_presignedUrlConfig</a> - Configuration information for
--   pre-signed S3 URLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:document:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_document</a> - The job
--   document. Required if you don't specify a value for
--   <tt>documentSource</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobTemplateArn:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_jobTemplateArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the job template used to create the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_description</a> - A
--   short text description of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:CreateJob'</a>,
--   <a>createJob_targetSelection</a> - Specifies whether the job will
--   continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those
--   things specified as targets have completed the job (SNAPSHOT). If
--   continuous, the job may also be run on a thing when a change is
--   detected in a target. For example, a job will run on a thing when the
--   thing is added to a target group, even after the job was completed by
--   all things originally in the group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutConfig:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_timeoutConfig</a> -
--   Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. The timer is started when the job execution status is set
--   to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the time expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_tags</a> - Metadata which
--   can be used to manage the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_jobId</a> - A job
--   identifier which must be unique for your Amazon Web Services account.
--   We recommend using a UUID. Alpha-numeric characters, "-" and "_" are
--   valid for use here.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:CreateJob'</a>, <a>createJob_targets</a> - A list of
--   things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
newCreateJob :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CreateJob

--   describing why the job was associated with the targets.

--   that define the targets of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:AssociateTargetsWithJob'</a>,
--   <a>associateTargetsWithJob_jobId</a> - The unique identifier you
--   assigned to this job when it was created.
newAssociateTargetsWithJob :: NonEmpty Text -> Text -> AssociateTargetsWithJob

--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job
--   was completed by all things originally in the group.

data DeleteJob

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:force:DeleteJob'</a>, <a>deleteJob_force</a> - (Optional) When
--   true, you can delete a job which is "IN_PROGRESS". Otherwise, you can
--   only delete a job which is in a terminal state ("COMPLETED" or
--   "CANCELED") or an exception will occur. The default is false.
--   
--   Deleting a job which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause a device which is
--   executing the job to be unable to access job information or update the
--   job execution status. Use caution and ensure that each device
--   executing a job which is deleted is able to recover to a valid state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:DeleteJob'</a>, <a>deleteJob_namespaceId</a> - The
--   namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:DeleteJob'</a>, <a>deleteJob_jobId</a> - The ID of the
--   job to be deleted.
--   
--   After a job deletion is completed, you may reuse this jobId when you
--   create a new job. However, this is not recommended, and you must
--   ensure that your devices are not using the jobId to refer to the
--   deleted job.
newDeleteJob :: Text -> DeleteJob

--   ID. For a typical device, the thing name is also used as the default
--   MQTT client ID. Although we dont require a mapping between a thing's
--   registry name and its use of MQTT client IDs, certificates, or shadow
--   state, we recommend that you choose a thing name and use it as the
--   MQTT client ID for the registry and the Device Shadow service.
--

--   <a>describeScheduledAudit_scheduledAuditName</a> - The name of the
--   scheduled audit whose information you want to get.
newDescribeScheduledAudit :: Text -> DescribeScheduledAudit

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeScheduledAuditResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeScheduledAuditResponse
DescribeScheduledAuditResponse' :: Maybe AuditFrequency -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe DayOfWeek -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeScheduledAuditResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeScheduledAuditResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:frequency:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_frequency</a> - How often the
--   scheduled audit takes place, either one of <tt>DAILY</tt>,
--   <tt>WEEKLY</tt>, <tt>BIWEEKLY</tt>, or <tt>MONTHLY</tt>. The start
--   time of each audit is determined by the system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditName:DescribeScheduledAudit'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_scheduledAuditName</a> - The name of
--   the scheduled audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfMonth:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_dayOfMonth</a> - The day of the
--   month on which the scheduled audit takes place. This is will be
--   <tt>1</tt> through <tt>31</tt> or <tt>LAST</tt>. If days
--   <tt>29</tt>-<tt>31</tt> are specified, and the month does not have
--   that many days, the audit takes place on the <tt>LAST</tt> day of the
--   month.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetCheckNames:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_targetCheckNames</a> - Which checks
--   are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be enabled for
--   your account. (Use <tt>DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to see
--   the list of all checks, including those that are enabled or use
--   <tt>UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration</tt> to select which checks are
--   enabled.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:dayOfWeek:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_dayOfWeek</a> - The day of the week
--   on which the scheduled audit takes place, either one of <tt>SUN</tt>,
--   <tt>MON</tt>, <tt>TUE</tt>, <tt>WED</tt>, <tt>THU</tt>, <tt>FRI</tt>,
--   or <tt>SAT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledAuditArn:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_scheduledAuditArn</a> - The ARN of
--   the scheduled audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeScheduledAuditResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeScheduledAuditResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeScheduledAuditResponse :: Int -> DescribeScheduledAuditResponse

--   by IoT. They are not intended for developer use.

--   should not be used.

data UpdateTopicRuleDestination
UpdateTopicRuleDestination' :: Text -> TopicRuleDestinationStatus -> UpdateTopicRuleDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UpdateTopicRuleDestination'</a>,
--   <a>updateTopicRuleDestination_arn</a> - The ARN of the topic rule
--   destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:UpdateTopicRuleDestination'</a>,
--   <a>updateTopicRuleDestination_status</a> - The status of the topic
--   rule destination. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>IN_PROGRESS</i> A topic rule destination was created but has
--   not been confirmed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.
--   Calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   <li><i>ENABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>DISABLED</i> Confirmation was completed, and traffic to this
--   destination is not allowed. You can set <tt>status</tt> to
--   <tt>ENABLED</tt> by calling <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>.</li>
--   <li><i>ERROR</i> Confirmation could not be completed, for example if
--   the confirmation timed out. You can call
--   <tt>GetTopicRuleDestination</tt> for details about the error. You can
--   set <tt>status</tt> to <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> by calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt>. Calling
--   <tt>UpdateTopicRuleDestination</tt> causes a new confirmation
--   challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
newUpdateTopicRuleDestination :: Text -> TopicRuleDestinationStatus -> UpdateTopicRuleDestination

--   user.

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachThingPrincipal</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:AttachThingPrincipal'</a>,
--   <a>attachThingPrincipal_thingName</a> - The name of the thing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:principal:AttachThingPrincipal'</a>,

--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CreateAuthorizer'</a>, <a>createAuthorizer_status</a> -
--   The status of the create authorizer request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingDisabled:CreateAuthorizer'</a>,
--   <a>createAuthorizer_signingDisabled</a> - Specifies whether IoT
--   validates the token signature in an authorization request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenSigningPublicKeys:CreateAuthorizer'</a>,
--   <a>createAuthorizer_tokenSigningPublicKeys</a> - The public keys used
--   to verify the digital signature returned by your custom authentication
--   service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenKeyName:CreateAuthorizer'</a>,
--   <a>createAuthorizer_tokenKeyName</a> - The name of the token key used
--   to extract the token from the HTTP headers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateAuthorizer'</a>, <a>createAuthorizer_tags</a> -
--   Metadata which can be used to manage the custom authorizer.
--   
--   For URI Request parameters use format:
--   ...key1=value1&amp;key2=value2...
--   
--   For the CLI command-line parameter use format: &amp;&amp;tags
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
--   
--   For the cli-input-json file use format: "tags":
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
--   
--   <a>$sel:authorizerName:CreateAuthorizer'</a>,
--   <a>createAuthorizer_authorizerName</a> - The authorizer name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authorizerFunctionArn:CreateAuthorizer'</a>,
--   <a>createAuthorizer_authorizerFunctionArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   authorizer's Lambda function.
newCreateAuthorizer :: Text -> Text -> CreateAuthorizer

--   document to use in the template. Required if you don't specify a value
--   for <tt>document</tt>.
--   
--   If the job document resides in an S3 bucket, you must use a
--   placeholder link when specifying the document.
--   
--   The placeholder link is of the following form:
--   
--   <pre>
--   ${aws:iot:s3-presigned-url:https://s3.amazonaws.com/bucket/key}
--   </pre>
--   
--   where <i>bucket</i> is your bucket name and <i>key</i> is the object
--   in the bucket to which you are linking.
--

--   <a>$sel:presignedUrlConfig:CreateJobTemplate'</a>,

--

--   don't specify a value for <tt>documentSource</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutConfig:CreateJobTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createJobTemplate_timeoutConfig</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateJobTemplate'</a>, <a>createJobTemplate_tags</a> -
--   Metadata that can be used to manage the job template.
--

--   <a>createJobTemplate_jobTemplateId</a> - A unique identifier for the
--   job template. We recommend using a UUID. Alpha-numeric characters,
--   "-", and "_" are valid for use here.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelJobExecution</a> smart constructor.
data CancelJobExecution
CancelJobExecution' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> Text -> CancelJobExecution

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelJobExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:force:CancelJobExecution'</a>, <a>cancelJobExecution_force</a>
--   - (Optional) If <tt>true</tt> the job execution will be canceled if it
--   has status IN_PROGRESS or QUEUED, otherwise the job execution will be
--   canceled only if it has status QUEUED. If you attempt to cancel a job
--   execution that is IN_PROGRESS, and you do not set <tt>force</tt> to
--   <tt>true</tt>, then an <tt>InvalidStateTransitionException</tt> will
--   be thrown. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Canceling a job execution which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause the
--   device to be unable to update the job execution status. Use caution
--   and ensure that the device is able to recover to a valid state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusDetails:CancelJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>cancelJobExecution_statusDetails</a> - A collection of name/value
--   pairs that describe the status of the job execution. If not specified,
--   the statusDetails are unchanged. You can specify at most 10 name/value
--   pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedVersion:CancelJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>cancelJobExecution_expectedVersion</a> - (Optional) The expected
--   current version of the job execution. Each time you update the job
--   execution, its version is incremented. If the version of the job
--   execution stored in Jobs does not match, the update is rejected with a
--   VersionMismatch error, and an ErrorResponse that contains the current
--   job execution status data is returned. (This makes it unnecessary to
--   perform a separate DescribeJobExecution request in order to obtain the
--   job execution status data.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:CancelJobExecution'</a>, <a>cancelJobExecution_jobId</a>
--   - The ID of the job to be canceled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:CancelJobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>cancelJobExecution_thingName</a> - The name of the thing whose
--   execution of the job will be canceled.
newCancelJobExecution :: Text -> Text -> CancelJobExecution

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelJobExecutionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CancelJobExecutionResponse
CancelJobExecutionResponse' :: CancelJobExecutionResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelJobExecutionResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newCancelJobExecutionResponse :: CancelJobExecutionResponse

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEndpoint
DescribeEndpoint' :: Maybe Text -> DescribeEndpoint

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeEndpoint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpointType:DescribeEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>describeEndpoint_endpointType</a> - The endpoint type. Valid
--   endpoint types include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>iot:Data</tt> - Returns a VeriSign signed data endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:Data-ATS</tt> - Returns an ATS signed data endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:CredentialProvider</tt> - Returns an IoT credentials
--   provider API endpoint.</li>
--   <li><tt>iot:Jobs</tt> - Returns an IoT device management Jobs API
--   endpoint.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   We strongly recommend that customers use the newer
--   <tt>iot:Data-ATS</tt> endpoint type to avoid issues related to the
--   widespread distrust of Symantec certificate authorities.
newDescribeEndpoint :: DescribeEndpoint

data RegisterCACertificate

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterCACertificate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:setAsActive:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_setAsActive</a> - A boolean value that
--   specifies if the CA certificate is set to active.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowAutoRegistration:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_allowAutoRegistration</a> - Allows this CA
--   certificate to be used for auto registration of device certificates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registrationConfig:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_registrationConfig</a> - Information about
--   the registration configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_tags</a> - Metadata which can be used to
--   manage the CA certificate.
--   
--   For URI Request parameters use format:
--   ...key1=value1&amp;key2=value2...
--   
--   For the CLI command-line parameter use format: &amp;&amp;tags
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
--   
--   For the cli-input-json file use format: "tags":
--   "key1=value1&amp;key2=value2..."
--   
--   <a>$sel:caCertificate:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_caCertificate</a> - The CA certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationCertificate:RegisterCACertificate'</a>,
--   <a>registerCACertificate_verificationCertificate</a> - The private key
--   verification certificate.
newRegisterCACertificate :: Text -> Text -> RegisterCACertificate

--   custom metrics; cannot be used with dimensions.

--   description of the security profile.

data CancelJob
CancelJob' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> CancelJob

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:force:CancelJob'</a>, <a>cancelJob_force</a> - (Optional) If
--   <tt>true</tt> job executions with status "IN_PROGRESS" and "QUEUED"
--   are canceled, otherwise only job executions with status "QUEUED" are
--   canceled. The default is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Canceling a job which is "IN_PROGRESS", will cause a device which is
--   executing the job to be unable to update the job execution status. Use
--   caution and ensure that each device executing a job which is canceled
--   is able to recover to a valid state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonCode:CancelJob'</a>, <a>cancelJob_reasonCode</a> -
--   (Optional)A reason code string that explains why the job was canceled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comment:CancelJob'</a>, <a>cancelJob_comment</a> - An optional
--   comment string describing why the job was canceled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:CancelJob'</a>, <a>cancelJob_jobId</a> - The unique
--   identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
newCancelJob :: Text -> CancelJob
