-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAbortConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AbortConfig
AbortConfig' :: NonEmpty AbortCriteria -> AbortConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>AbortConfig</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:criteriaList:AbortConfig'</a>, <a>abortConfig_criteriaList</a>
--   - The list of criteria that determine when and how to abort the job.
newAbortConfig :: NonEmpty AbortCriteria -> AbortConfig

-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAbortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data AbortCriteria
AbortCriteria' :: JobExecutionFailureType -> AbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AbortCriteria

-- | Create a value of <a>AbortCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureType:AbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>abortCriteria_failureType</a> - The type of job execution failures
--   that can initiate a job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:AbortCriteria'</a>, <a>abortCriteria_action</a> - The
--   type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thresholdPercentage:AbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>abortCriteria_thresholdPercentage</a> - The minimum percentage of
--   job execution failures that must occur to initiate the job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
--   
--   <a>$sel:minNumberOfExecutedThings:AbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>abortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings</a> - The minimum number of
--   things which must receive job execution notifications before the job
--   can be aborted.
newAbortCriteria :: JobExecutionFailureType -> AbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AbortCriteria

-- | Describes the actions associated with a rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAction</a> smart constructor.
data Action
Action' :: Maybe CloudwatchMetricAction -> Maybe CloudwatchLogsAction -> Maybe DynamoDBv2Action -> Maybe StepFunctionsAction -> Maybe CloudwatchAlarmAction -> Maybe SnsAction -> Maybe DynamoDBAction -> Maybe FirehoseAction -> Maybe TimestreamAction -> Maybe IotSiteWiseAction -> Maybe IotAnalyticsAction -> Maybe LambdaAction -> Maybe OpenSearchAction -> Maybe IotEventsAction -> Maybe SalesforceAction -> Maybe KinesisAction -> Maybe S3Action -> Maybe HttpAction -> Maybe ElasticsearchAction -> Maybe KafkaAction -> Maybe RepublishAction -> Maybe SqsAction -> Action

-- | Create a value of <a>Action</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudwatchMetric:Action'</a>, <a>action_cloudwatchMetric</a> -
--   Capture a CloudWatch metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudwatchLogs:Action'</a>, <a>action_cloudwatchLogs</a> -
--   Send data to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamoDBv2:Action'</a>, <a>action_dynamoDBv2</a> - Write to a
--   DynamoDB table. This is a new version of the DynamoDB action. It
--   allows you to write each attribute in an MQTT message payload into a
--   separate DynamoDB column.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stepFunctions:Action'</a>, <a>action_stepFunctions</a> -
--   Starts execution of a Step Functions state machine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudwatchAlarm:Action'</a>, <a>action_cloudwatchAlarm</a> -
--   Change the state of a CloudWatch alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sns:Action'</a>, <a>action_sns</a> - Publish to an Amazon SNS
--   topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dynamoDB:Action'</a>, <a>action_dynamoDB</a> - Write to a
--   DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firehose:Action'</a>, <a>action_firehose</a> - Write to an
--   Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestream:Action'</a>, <a>action_timestream</a> - The
--   Timestream rule action writes attributes (measures) from an MQTT
--   message into an Amazon Timestream table. For more information, see the
--   <a>Timestream</a> topic rule action documentation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iotSiteWise:Action'</a>, <a>action_iotSiteWise</a> - Sends
--   data from the MQTT message that triggered the rule to IoT SiteWise
--   asset properties.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iotAnalytics:Action'</a>, <a>action_iotAnalytics</a> - Sends
--   message data to an IoT Analytics channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambda:Action'</a>, <a>action_lambda</a> - Invoke a Lambda
--   function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openSearch:Action'</a>, <a>action_openSearch</a> - Write data
--   to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iotEvents:Action'</a>, <a>action_iotEvents</a> - Sends an
--   input to an IoT Events detector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:salesforce:Action'</a>, <a>action_salesforce</a> - Send a
--   message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesis:Action'</a>, <a>action_kinesis</a> - Write data to an
--   Amazon Kinesis stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3:Action'</a>, <a>action_s3</a> - Write to an Amazon S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:http:Action'</a>, <a>action_http</a> - Send data to an HTTPS
--   endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticsearch:Action'</a>, <a>action_elasticsearch</a> - Write
--   data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.
--   
--   The <tt>Elasticsearch</tt> action can only be used by existing rule
--   actions. To create a new rule action or to update an existing rule
--   action, use the <tt>OpenSearch</tt> rule action instead. For more
--   information, see <a>OpenSearchAction</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kafka:Action'</a>, <a>action_kafka</a> - Send messages to an
--   Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK) or self-managed
--   Apache Kafka cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:republish:Action'</a>, <a>action_republish</a> - Publish to
--   another MQTT topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sqs:Action'</a>, <a>action_sqs</a> - Publish to an Amazon SQS
--   queue.
newAction :: Action

-- | Information about an active Device Defender security profile behavior
--   violation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActiveViolation</a> smart constructor.
data ActiveViolation
ActiveViolation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe MetricValue -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Behavior -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ViolationEventAdditionalInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VerificationState -> ActiveViolation

-- | Create a value of <a>ActiveViolation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationStateDescription:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_verificationStateDescription</a> - The description
--   of the verification state of the violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastViolationValue:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_lastViolationValue</a> - The value of the metric
--   (the measurement) that caused the most recent violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastViolationTime:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_lastViolationTime</a> - The time the most recent
--   violation occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationStartTime:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_violationStartTime</a> - The time the violation
--   started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationId:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_violationId</a> - The ID of the active violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:behavior:ActiveViolation'</a>, <a>activeViolation_behavior</a>
--   - The behavior that is being violated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileName:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_securityProfileName</a> - The security profile with
--   the behavior is in violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:violationEventAdditionalInfo:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_violationEventAdditionalInfo</a> - The details of a
--   violation event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingName:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_thingName</a> - The name of the thing responsible
--   for the active violation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verificationState:ActiveViolation'</a>,
--   <a>activeViolation_verificationState</a> - The verification state of
--   the violation (detect alarm).
newActiveViolation :: ActiveViolation

-- | Parameters used when defining a mitigation action that move a set of
--   things to a thing group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddThingsToThingGroupParams</a> smart constructor.
data AddThingsToThingGroupParams
AddThingsToThingGroupParams' :: Maybe Bool -> NonEmpty Text -> AddThingsToThingGroupParams

-- | Create a value of <a>AddThingsToThingGroupParams</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:overrideDynamicGroups:AddThingsToThingGroupParams'</a>,
--   <a>addThingsToThingGroupParams_overrideDynamicGroups</a> - Specifies
--   if this mitigation action can move the things that triggered the
--   mitigation action even if they are part of one or more dynamic thing
--   groups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupNames:AddThingsToThingGroupParams'</a>,
--   <a>addThingsToThingGroupParams_thingGroupNames</a> - The list of
--   groups to which you want to add the things that triggered the
--   mitigation action. You can add a thing to a maximum of 10 groups, but
--   you can't add a thing to more than one group in the same hierarchy.
newAddThingsToThingGroupParams :: NonEmpty Text -> AddThingsToThingGroupParams

data AggregationType

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   list of the values of aggregation types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AggregationType'</a>, <a>aggregationType_name</a> - The
--   name of the aggregation type.
newAggregationType :: AggregationTypeName -> AggregationType

-- | A structure containing the alert target ARN and the role ARN.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAlertTarget</a> smart constructor.
data AlertTarget
AlertTarget' :: Text -> Text -> AlertTarget

-- | Create a value of <a>AlertTarget</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alertTargetArn:AlertTarget'</a>,
--   <a>alertTarget_alertTargetArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the notification target to which alerts are sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:AlertTarget'</a>, <a>alertTarget_roleArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the role that grants permission to send alerts to the notification
--   target.
newAlertTarget :: Text -> Text -> AlertTarget

-- | Contains information that allowed the authorization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAllowed</a> smart constructor.
data Allowed
Allowed' :: Maybe [Policy] -> Allowed

-- | Create a value of <a>Allowed</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policies:Allowed'</a>, <a>allowed_policies</a> - A list of
--   policies that allowed the authentication.
newAllowed :: Allowed

-- | An asset property timestamp entry containing the following
--   information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetPropertyTimestamp</a> smart constructor.
data AssetPropertyTimestamp
AssetPropertyTimestamp' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> AssetPropertyTimestamp

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetPropertyTimestamp</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   contains the nanosecond time offset. Accepts substitution templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeInSeconds:AssetPropertyTimestamp'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyTimestamp_timeInSeconds</a> - A string that contains
--   the time in seconds since epoch. Accepts substitution templates.
newAssetPropertyTimestamp :: Text -> AssetPropertyTimestamp

-- | An asset property value entry containing the following information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetPropertyValue</a> smart constructor.
data AssetPropertyValue

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetPropertyValue</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:quality:AssetPropertyValue'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyValue_quality</a> - Optional. A string that describes
--   the quality of the value. Accepts substitution templates. Must be
--   <tt>GOOD</tt>, <tt>BAD</tt>, or <tt>UNCERTAIN</tt>.

--   <a>assetPropertyValue_timestamp</a> - The asset property value
--   timestamp.
newAssetPropertyValue :: AssetPropertyVariant -> AssetPropertyTimestamp -> AssetPropertyValue

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetPropertyVariant</a> smart constructor.
data AssetPropertyVariant

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:integerValue:AssetPropertyVariant'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyVariant_integerValue</a> - Optional. A string that
--   contains the integer value of the value entry. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:doubleValue:AssetPropertyVariant'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyVariant_doubleValue</a> - Optional. A string that
--   contains the double value of the value entry. Accepts substitution
--   templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stringValue:AssetPropertyVariant'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyVariant_stringValue</a> - Optional. The string value
--   of the value entry. Accepts substitution templates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:booleanValue:AssetPropertyVariant'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyVariant_booleanValue</a> - Optional. A string that
--   contains the boolean value (<tt>true</tt> or <tt>false</tt>) of the
--   value entry. Accepts substitution templates.
newAssetPropertyVariant :: AssetPropertyVariant

-- | The attribute payload.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttributePayload</a> smart constructor.
data AttributePayload
AttributePayload' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Bool -> AttributePayload

-- | Create a value of <a>AttributePayload</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:AttributePayload'</a>,
--   <a>attributePayload_attributes</a> - A JSON string containing up to
--   three key-value pair in JSON format. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {\"attributes\":{\"string1\":\"string2\"}}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:merge:AttributePayload'</a>, <a>attributePayload_merge</a> -
--   Specifies whether the list of attributes provided in the
--   <tt>AttributePayload</tt> is merged with the attributes stored in the
--   registry, instead of overwriting them.
--   
--   To remove an attribute, call <tt>UpdateThing</tt> with an empty
--   attribute value.
--   
--   The <tt>merge</tt> attribute is only valid when calling
--   <tt>UpdateThing</tt> or <tt>UpdateThingGroup</tt>.
newAttributePayload :: AttributePayload

-- | Information about the audit check.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditCheckDetails</a> smart constructor.
data AuditCheckDetails
AuditCheckDetails' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuditCheckRunStatus -> AuditCheckDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditCheckDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressedNonCompliantResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_suppressedNonCompliantResourcesCount</a> -
--   Describes how many of the non-compliant resources created during the
--   evaluation of an audit check were marked as suppressed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_totalResourcesCount</a> - The number of resources
--   on which the check was performed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkCompliant:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_checkCompliant</a> - True if the check is
--   complete and found all resources compliant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nonCompliantResourcesCount:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_nonCompliantResourcesCount</a> - The number of
--   resources that were found noncompliant during the check.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_errorCode</a> - The code of any error encountered
--   when this check is performed during this audit. One of
--   "INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS" or "AUDIT_CHECK_DISABLED".
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_message</a> - The message associated with any
--   error encountered when this check is performed during this audit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkRunStatus:AuditCheckDetails'</a>,
--   <a>auditCheckDetails_checkRunStatus</a> - The completion status of
--   this check. One of "IN_PROGRESS", "WAITING_FOR_DATA_COLLECTION",
--   "CANCELED", "COMPLETED_COMPLIANT", "COMPLETED_NON_COMPLIANT", or
--   "FAILED".
newAuditCheckDetails :: AuditCheckDetails

-- | The findings (results) of the audit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuditFinding</a> smart constructor.
data AuditFinding
AuditFinding' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AuditFindingSeverity -> Maybe [RelatedResource] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe NonCompliantResource -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AuditFinding

-- | Create a value of <a>AuditFinding</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isSuppressed:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_isSuppressed</a> - Indicates whether the audit finding
--   was suppressed or not during reporting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskId:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_taskId</a> - The ID
--   of the audit that generated this result (finding).
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingTime:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_findingTime</a>
--   - The time the result (finding) was discovered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStartTime:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_taskStartTime</a> - The time the audit started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonForNonComplianceCode:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_reasonForNonComplianceCode</a> - A code that indicates
--   the reason that the resource was noncompliant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_severity</a> - The
--   severity of the result (finding).
--   
--   <a>$sel:relatedResources:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_relatedResources</a> - The list of related resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checkName:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_checkName</a> -
--   The audit check that generated this result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nonCompliantResource:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_nonCompliantResource</a> - The resource that was found
--   to be noncompliant with the audit check.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonForNonCompliance:AuditFinding'</a>,
--   <a>auditFinding_reasonForNonCompliance</a> - The reason the resource
--   was noncompliant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingId:AuditFinding'</a>, <a>auditFinding_findingId</a> - A
--   unique identifier for this set of audit findings. This identifier is
--   used to apply mitigation tasks to one or more sets of findings.
newAuditFinding :: AuditFinding

-- | Returned by ListAuditMitigationActionsTask, this object contains

--   status of the task being executed.

--   <a>auditMitigationActionExecutionMetadata_startTime</a> - The date and
--   time when the task was started.

--   identifier for the task that applies the mitigation action.

--   still running.

--   occurred, the code that indicates which type of error occurred.

-- | A collection of authorization information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthInfo</a> smart constructor.
data AuthInfo

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   resources for which the principal is being authorized to perform the
--   specified action.

-- | The authorizer result.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthResult</a> smart constructor.
data AuthResult
AuthResult' :: Maybe Denied -> Maybe AuthDecision -> Maybe Allowed -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe AuthInfo -> AuthResult

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthResult</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:denied:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_denied</a> - The
--   policies and statements that denied the specified action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authDecision:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_authDecision</a> -
--   The final authorization decision of this scenario. Multiple statements
--   are taken into account when determining the authorization decision. An
--   explicit deny statement can override multiple allow statements.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowed:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_allowed</a> - The
--   policies and statements that allowed the specified action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingContextValues:AuthResult'</a>,
--   <a>authResult_missingContextValues</a> - Contains any missing context
--   values found while evaluating policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authInfo:AuthResult'</a>, <a>authResult_authInfo</a> -
--   Authorization information.
newAuthResult :: AuthResult

--   be overridden.

--   <a>authorizerConfig_defaultAuthorizerName</a> - The name of the
--   authorization service for a domain configuration.
newAuthorizerConfig :: AuthorizerConfig

-- | The authorizer description.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAuthorizerDescription</a> smart constructor.
data AuthorizerDescription
AuthorizerDescription' :: Maybe AuthorizerStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> AuthorizerDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>AuthorizerDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_status</a> - The status of the authorizer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_lastModifiedDate</a> - The UNIX timestamp of
--   when the authorizer was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingDisabled:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_signingDisabled</a> - Specifies whether IoT
--   validates the token signature in an authorization request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authorizerName:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_authorizerName</a> - The authorizer name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authorizerFunctionArn:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_authorizerFunctionArn</a> - The authorizer's
--   Lambda function ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:authorizerArn:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_authorizerArn</a> - The authorizer ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_creationDate</a> - The UNIX timestamp of when
--   the authorizer was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenSigningPublicKeys:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_tokenSigningPublicKeys</a> - The public keys
--   used to validate the token signature returned by your custom
--   authentication service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokenKeyName:AuthorizerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>authorizerDescription_tokenKeyName</a> - The key used to extract
--   the token from the HTTP headers.
newAuthorizerDescription :: AuthorizerDescription

-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobAbortConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobAbortConfig
AwsJobAbortConfig' :: NonEmpty AwsJobAbortCriteria -> AwsJobAbortConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobAbortConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:abortCriteriaList:AwsJobAbortConfig'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortConfig_abortCriteriaList</a> - The list of criteria that
--   determine when and how to abort the job.
newAwsJobAbortConfig :: NonEmpty AwsJobAbortCriteria -> AwsJobAbortConfig

-- | The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobAbortCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobAbortCriteria
AwsJobAbortCriteria' :: AwsJobAbortCriteriaFailureType -> AwsJobAbortCriteriaAbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AwsJobAbortCriteria

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobAbortCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureType:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_failureType</a> - The type of job execution
--   failures that can initiate a job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_action</a> - The type of job action to take to
--   initiate the job abort.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thresholdPercentage:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_thresholdPercentage</a> - The minimum
--   percentage of job execution failures that must occur to initiate the
--   job abort.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to two digits after the
--   decimal (for example, 10.9 and 10.99, but not 10.999).
--   
--   <a>$sel:minNumberOfExecutedThings:AwsJobAbortCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobAbortCriteria_minNumberOfExecutedThings</a> - The minimum
--   number of things which must receive job execution notifications before
--   the job can be aborted.
newAwsJobAbortCriteria :: AwsJobAbortCriteriaFailureType -> AwsJobAbortCriteriaAbortAction -> Double -> Natural -> AwsJobAbortCriteria

data AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig

--   optional fields omitted.

--   increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to define an
--   exponential rate increase for a job rollout.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumPerMinute:AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig_maximumPerMinute</a> - The maximum
--   number of OTA update job executions started per minute.
newAwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig :: AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to
--   define an exponential rate increase for a job rollout.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobExponentialRolloutRate</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate
AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate' :: Natural -> Double -> AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria -> AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseRatePerMinute:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_baseRatePerMinute</a> - The minimum
--   number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute,
--   at the start of the job rollout. This is the initial rate of the
--   rollout.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incrementFactor:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_incrementFactor</a> - The rate of
--   increase for a job rollout. The number of things notified is
--   multiplied by this factor.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateIncreaseCriteria:AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobExponentialRolloutRate_rateIncreaseCriteria</a> - The
--   criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
newAwsJobExponentialRolloutRate :: Natural -> Double -> AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria -> AwsJobExponentialRolloutRate

--   for the job document is received.
newAwsJobPresignedUrlConfig :: AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig

-- | The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria
AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfNotifiedThings:AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfNotifiedThings</a> - When this
--   number of things have been notified, it will initiate an increase in
--   the rollout rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobRateIncreaseCriteria_numberOfSucceededThings</a> - When this
--   number of things have succeeded in their job execution, it will
--   initiate an increase in the rollout rate.
newAwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria :: AwsJobRateIncreaseCriteria

-- | Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution
--   of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAwsJobTimeoutConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AwsJobTimeoutConfig
AwsJobTimeoutConfig' :: Maybe Integer -> AwsJobTimeoutConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>AwsJobTimeoutConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inProgressTimeoutInMinutes:AwsJobTimeoutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>awsJobTimeoutConfig_inProgressTimeoutInMinutes</a> - Specifies the
--   amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish execution of
--   this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1 minute and 7
--   days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be updated and
--   will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a job execution
--   remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this interval, the
--   job execution will fail and switch to the terminal <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>
--   status.
newAwsJobTimeoutConfig :: AwsJobTimeoutConfig

-- | A Device Defender security profile behavior.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBehavior</a> smart constructor.
data Behavior
Behavior' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe MetricDimension -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BehaviorCriteria -> Text -> Behavior

-- | Create a value of <a>Behavior</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressAlerts:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_suppressAlerts</a> -
--   Suppresses alerts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricDimension:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_metricDimension</a>
--   - The dimension for a metric in your behavior. For example, using a
--   <tt>TOPIC_FILTER</tt> dimension, you can narrow down the scope of the
--   metric to only MQTT topics where the name matches the pattern
--   specified in the dimension. This can't be used with custom metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_metric</a> - What is
--   measured by the behavior.
--   
--   <a>$sel:criteria:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_criteria</a> - The
--   criteria that determine if a device is behaving normally in regard to
--   the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Behavior'</a>, <a>behavior_name</a> - The name you've
--   given to the behavior.
newBehavior :: Text -> Behavior

-- | The criteria by which the behavior is determined to be normal.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBehaviorCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data BehaviorCriteria
BehaviorCriteria' :: Maybe MachineLearningDetectionConfig -> Maybe MetricValue -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe ComparisonOperator -> Maybe StatisticalThreshold -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Natural -> BehaviorCriteria

-- | Create a value of <a>BehaviorCriteria</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mlDetectionConfig:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_mlDetectionConfig</a> - The configuration of an ML
--   Detect
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:BehaviorCriteria'</a>, <a>behaviorCriteria_value</a> -
--   The value to be compared with the <tt>metric</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToAlarm</a> - If a device is
--   in violation of the behavior for the specified number of consecutive
--   datapoints, an alarm occurs. If not specified, the default is 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_comparisonOperator</a> - The operator that relates
--   the thing measured (<tt>metric</tt>) to the criteria (containing a
--   <tt>value</tt> or <tt>statisticalThreshold</tt>). Valid operators
--   include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>string-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number-list</tt>: <tt>in-set</tt> and <tt>not-in-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>ip-address-list</tt>: <tt>in-cidr-set</tt> and
--   <tt>not-in-cidr-set</tt></li>
--   <li><tt>number</tt>: <tt>less-than</tt>, <tt>less-than-equals</tt>,
--   <tt>greater-than</tt>, and <tt>greater-than-equals</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statisticalThreshold:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_statisticalThreshold</a> - A statistical ranking
--   (percentile)that indicates a threshold value by which a behavior is
--   determined to be in compliance or in violation of the behavior.
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationSeconds:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_durationSeconds</a> - Use this to specify the time
--   duration over which the behavior is evaluated, for those criteria that
--   have a time dimension (for example, <tt>NUM_MESSAGES_SENT</tt>). For a
--   <tt>statisticalThreshhold</tt> metric comparison, measurements from
--   all devices are accumulated over this time duration before being used
--   to calculate percentiles, and later, measurements from an individual
--   device are also accumulated over this time duration before being given
--   a percentile rank. Cannot be used with list-based metric datatypes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:consecutiveDatapointsToClear:BehaviorCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>behaviorCriteria_consecutiveDatapointsToClear</a> - If an alarm has
--   occurred and the offending device is no longer in violation of the
--   behavior for the specified number of consecutive datapoints, the alarm
--   is cleared. If not specified, the default is 1.
newBehaviorCriteria :: BehaviorCriteria

--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date and time the
--   certificate was last modified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:caCertificateId:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_caCertificateId</a> - The certificate ID of
--   the CA certificate used to sign this certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:previousOwnedBy:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_previousOwnedBy</a> - The ID of the Amazon
--   Web Services account of the previous owner of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificatePem:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_certificatePem</a> - The certificate data,
--   in PEM format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_certificateArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_certificateId</a> - The ID of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateMode:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_certificateMode</a> - The mode of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validity:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_validity</a> - When the certificate is
--   valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_creationDate</a> - The date and time the
--   certificate was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:generationId:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_generationId</a> - The generation ID of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferData:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_transferData</a> - The transfer data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customerVersion:CertificateDescription'</a>,
--   <a>certificateDescription_customerVersion</a> - The customer version
--   of the certificate.
newCertificateDescription :: CertificateDescription

-- | Describes an action to write to a DynamoDB table.
--   
--   The <tt>tableName</tt>, <tt>hashKeyField</tt>, and
--   <tt>rangeKeyField</tt> values must match the values used when you
--   created the table.
--   
--   The <tt>hashKeyValue</tt> and <tt>rangeKeyvalue</tt> fields use a
--   substitution template syntax. These templates provide data at runtime.
--   The syntax is as follows: ${<i>sql-expression</i>}.
--   
--   You can specify any valid expression in a WHERE or SELECT clause,
--   including JSON properties, comparisons, calculations, and functions.
--   For example, the following field uses the third level of the topic:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "hashKeyValue": "${topic(3)}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   The following field uses the timestamp:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "rangeKeyValue": "${timestamp()}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDynamoDBAction</a> smart constructor.
data DynamoDBAction
DynamoDBAction' :: Maybe DynamoKeyType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DynamoKeyType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DynamoDBAction

-- | Create a value of <a>DynamoDBAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hashKeyType:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_hashKeyType</a> - The hash key type. Valid values
--   are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
--   
--   <a>$sel:operation:DynamoDBAction'</a>, <a>dynamoDBAction_operation</a>
--   - The type of operation to be performed. This follows the substitution
--   template, so it can be <tt>${operation}</tt>, but the substitution
--   must result in one of the following: <tt>INSERT</tt>, <tt>UPDATE</tt>,
--   or <tt>DELETE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeKeyType:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyType</a> - The range key type. Valid values
--   are "STRING" or "NUMBER"
--   
--   <a>$sel:payloadField:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_payloadField</a> - The action payload. This name can
--   be customized.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeKeyField:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyField</a> - The range key name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeKeyValue:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_rangeKeyValue</a> - The range key value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tableName:DynamoDBAction'</a>, <a>dynamoDBAction_tableName</a>
--   - The name of the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:DynamoDBAction'</a>, <a>dynamoDBAction_roleArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hashKeyField:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_hashKeyField</a> - The hash key name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hashKeyValue:DynamoDBAction'</a>,
--   <a>dynamoDBAction_hashKeyValue</a> - The hash key value.
newDynamoDBAction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DynamoDBAction

-- | Describes an action to write to a DynamoDB table.
--   
--   This DynamoDB action writes each attribute in the message payload into
--   it's own column in the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDynamoDBv2Action</a> smart constructor.
data DynamoDBv2Action
DynamoDBv2Action' :: Text -> PutItemInput -> DynamoDBv2Action

-- | Create a value of <a>DynamoDBv2Action</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:DynamoDBv2Action'</a>, <a>dynamoDBv2Action_roleArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:putItem:DynamoDBv2Action'</a>, <a>dynamoDBv2Action_putItem</a>
--   - Specifies the DynamoDB table to which the message data will be
--   written. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "dynamoDBv2": { "roleArn": "aws:iam:12341251:my-role" "putItem": { "tableName": "my-table" } } }
--   </pre>
--   
--   Each attribute in the message payload will be written to a separate
--   column in the DynamoDB database.
newDynamoDBv2Action :: Text -> PutItemInput -> DynamoDBv2Action

-- | The policy that has the effect on the authorization results.
--

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>effectivePolicy_policyName</a> - The policy name.

--   <a>$sel:policyDocument:EffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>effectivePolicy_policyDocument</a> - The IAM policy document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyArn:EffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>effectivePolicy_policyArn</a> - The policy ARN.
newEffectivePolicy :: EffectivePolicy

-- | Describes an action that writes data to an Amazon OpenSearch Service
--   domain.
--   
--   The <tt>Elasticsearch</tt> action can only be used by existing rule
--   actions. To create a new rule action or to update an existing rule
--   action, use the <tt>OpenSearch</tt> rule action instead. For more
--   information, see <a>OpenSearchAction</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticsearchAction</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticsearchAction
ElasticsearchAction' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchAction

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticsearchAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:ElasticsearchAction'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchAction_roleArn</a> - The IAM role ARN that has access
--   to OpenSearch.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endpoint:ElasticsearchAction'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchAction_endpoint</a> - The endpoint of your OpenSearch
--   domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:index:ElasticsearchAction'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchAction_index</a> - The index where you want to store
--   your data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ElasticsearchAction'</a>,
--   <a>elasticsearchAction_type</a> - The type of document you are
--   storing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ElasticsearchAction'</a>, <a>elasticsearchAction_id</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the document you are storing.
newElasticsearchAction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ElasticsearchAction

-- | Allows you to create an exponential rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExponentialRolloutRate</a> smart constructor.
data ExponentialRolloutRate
ExponentialRolloutRate' :: Natural -> Double -> RateIncreaseCriteria -> ExponentialRolloutRate

-- | Create a value of <a>ExponentialRolloutRate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:baseRatePerMinute:ExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>exponentialRolloutRate_baseRatePerMinute</a> - The minimum number
--   of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute at the
--   start of job rollout. This parameter allows you to define the initial
--   rate of rollout.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incrementFactor:ExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>exponentialRolloutRate_incrementFactor</a> - The exponential factor
--   to increase the rate of rollout for a job.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services IoT Core supports up to one digit after the
--   decimal (for example, 1.5, but not 1.55).
--   
--   <a>$sel:rateIncreaseCriteria:ExponentialRolloutRate'</a>,
--   <a>exponentialRolloutRate_rateIncreaseCriteria</a> - The criteria to
--   initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.
newExponentialRolloutRate :: Natural -> Double -> RateIncreaseCriteria -> ExponentialRolloutRate

-- | Describes an action that writes data to an Amazon Kinesis Firehose
--   stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFirehoseAction</a> smart constructor.
data FirehoseAction
FirehoseAction' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> FirehoseAction

-- | Create a value of <a>FirehoseAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchMode:FirehoseAction'</a>, <a>firehoseAction_batchMode</a>
--   - Whether to deliver the Kinesis Data Firehose stream as a batch by
--   using <a>PutRecordBatch</a> . The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule's SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element forms one record in the
--   <a>PutRecordBatch</a> request. The resulting array can't have more
--   than 500 records.
--   
--   <a>$sel:separator:FirehoseAction'</a>, <a>firehoseAction_separator</a>
--   - A character separator that will be used to separate records written
--   to the Firehose stream. Valid values are: '\n' (newline), '\t' (tab),
--   '\r\n' (Windows newline), ',' (comma).
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:FirehoseAction'</a>, <a>firehoseAction_roleArn</a> -
--   The IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamName:FirehoseAction'</a>,
--   <a>firehoseAction_deliveryStreamName</a> - The delivery stream name.
newFirehoseAction :: Text -> Text -> FirehoseAction

-- | Send data to an HTTPS endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpAction</a> smart constructor.
data HttpAction
HttpAction' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HttpAuthorization -> Maybe [HttpActionHeader] -> Text -> HttpAction

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpAction</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:confirmationUrl:HttpAction'</a>,
--   <a>httpAction_confirmationUrl</a> - The URL to which IoT sends a
--   confirmation message. The value of the confirmation URL must be a
--   prefix of the endpoint URL. If you do not specify a confirmation URL
--   IoT uses the endpoint URL as the confirmation URL. If you use
--   substitution templates in the confirmationUrl, you must create and
--   enable topic rule destinations that match each possible value of the
--   substitution template before traffic is allowed to your endpoint URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:auth:HttpAction'</a>, <a>httpAction_auth</a> - The
--   authentication method to use when sending data to an HTTPS endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:headers:HttpAction'</a>, <a>httpAction_headers</a> - The HTTP
--   headers to send with the message data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:HttpAction'</a>, <a>httpAction_url</a> - The endpoint URL.
--   If substitution templates are used in the URL, you must also specify a
--   <tt>confirmationUrl</tt>. If this is a new destination, a new
--   <tt>TopicRuleDestination</tt> is created if possible.
newHttpAction :: Text -> HttpAction

-- | The HTTP action header.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHttpActionHeader</a> smart constructor.
data HttpActionHeader
HttpActionHeader' :: Text -> Text -> HttpActionHeader

-- | Create a value of <a>HttpActionHeader</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:HttpActionHeader'</a>, <a>httpActionHeader_key</a> - The
--   HTTP header key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:HttpActionHeader'</a>, <a>httpActionHeader_value</a> -
--   The HTTP header value. Substitution templates are supported.
newHttpActionHeader :: Text -> Text -> HttpActionHeader

--

data HttpAuthorization

newHttpAuthorization :: HttpAuthorization

data HttpContext

-- | Information that implicitly denies authorization. When policy doesn't
--   explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is considered an
--   implicit deny.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImplicitDeny</a> smart constructor.
data ImplicitDeny
ImplicitDeny' :: Maybe [Policy] -> ImplicitDeny

-- | Create a value of <a>ImplicitDeny</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policies:ImplicitDeny'</a>, <a>implicitDeny_policies</a> -
--   Policies that don't contain a matching allow or deny statement for the
--   specified action on the specified resource.
newImplicitDeny :: ImplicitDeny

-- | Sends message data to an IoT Analytics channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIotAnalyticsAction</a> smart constructor.
data IotAnalyticsAction
IotAnalyticsAction' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> IotAnalyticsAction

-- | Create a value of <a>IotAnalyticsAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchMode:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_batchMode</a> - Whether to process the action as
--   a batch. The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is delivered as a separate
--   message when passed by <a>BatchPutMessage</a> to the IoT Analytics
--   channel. The resulting array can't have more than 100 messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelArn:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_channelArn</a> - (deprecated) The ARN of the IoT
--   Analytics channel to which message data will be sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelName:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_channelName</a> - The name of the IoT Analytics
--   channel to which message data will be sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:IotAnalyticsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotAnalyticsAction_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the role which has a
--   policy that grants IoT Analytics permission to send message data via
--   IoT Analytics (iotanalytics:BatchPutMessage).
newIotAnalyticsAction :: IotAnalyticsAction

-- | Sends an input to an IoT Events detector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIotEventsAction</a> smart constructor.
data IotEventsAction
IotEventsAction' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> IotEventsAction

-- | Create a value of <a>IotEventsAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchMode:IotEventsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotEventsAction_batchMode</a> - Whether to process the event
--   actions as a batch. The default value is <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt> and the rule SQL statement
--   evaluates to an Array, each Array element is treated as a separate
--   message when it's sent to IoT Events by calling <a>BatchPutMessage</a>
--   . The resulting array can't have more than 10 messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:IotEventsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotEventsAction_messageId</a> - The ID of the message. The default
--   <tt>messageId</tt> is a new UUID value.
--   
--   When <tt>batchMode</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, you can't specify a
--   <tt>messageId</tt>--a new UUID value will be assigned.
--   
--   Assign a value to this property to ensure that only one input
--   (message) with a given <tt>messageId</tt> will be processed by an IoT
--   Events detector.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputName:IotEventsAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotEventsAction_inputName</a> - The name of the IoT Events input.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:IotEventsAction'</a>, <a>iotEventsAction_roleArn</a> -
--   The ARN of the role that grants IoT permission to send an input to an
--   IoT Events detector. ("Action":"iotevents:BatchPutMessage").
newIotEventsAction :: Text -> Text -> IotEventsAction

-- | Describes an action to send data from an MQTT message that triggered
--   the rule to IoT SiteWise asset properties.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIotSiteWiseAction</a> smart constructor.
data IotSiteWiseAction
IotSiteWiseAction' :: NonEmpty PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Text -> IotSiteWiseAction

-- | Create a value of <a>IotSiteWiseAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:putAssetPropertyValueEntries:IotSiteWiseAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotSiteWiseAction_putAssetPropertyValueEntries</a> - A list of
--   asset property value entries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:IotSiteWiseAction'</a>,
--   <a>iotSiteWiseAction_roleArn</a> - The ARN of the role that grants IoT
--   permission to send an asset property value to IoT SiteWise.
--   (<tt>"Action": "iotsitewise:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue"</tt>). The
--   trust policy can restrict access to specific asset hierarchy paths.
newIotSiteWiseAction :: NonEmpty PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Text -> IotSiteWiseAction

-- | The <tt>Job</tt> object contains details about a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJob</a> smart constructor.
data Job
Job' :: Maybe JobStatus -> Maybe JobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AbortConfig -> Maybe JobProcessDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TargetSelection -> Maybe TimeoutConfig -> Job

-- | Create a value of <a>Job</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Job'</a>, <a>job_status</a> - The status of the job,
--   one of <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, <tt>CANCELED</tt>,
--   <tt>DELETION_IN_PROGRESS</tt> or <tt>COMPLETED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobExecutionsRolloutConfig:Job'</a>,
--   <a>job_jobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> - Allows you to create a staged
--   rollout of a job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobId</a> - The unique identifier you
--   assigned to this job when it was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:Job'</a>, <a>job_lastUpdatedAt</a> - The time,
--   in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobArn</a> - An ARN identifying the
--   job with format "arn:aws:iot:region:account:job/jobId".
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Job'</a>, <a>job_createdAt</a> - The time, in
--   seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:abortConfig:Job'</a>, <a>job_abortConfig</a> - Configuration
--   for criteria to abort the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobProcessDetails:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobProcessDetails</a> -
--   Details about the job process.
--   
--   <a>$sel:namespaceId:Job'</a>, <a>job_namespaceId</a> - The namespace
--   used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.
--   
--   When you specify a value for this parameter, Amazon Web Services IoT
--   Core sends jobs notifications to MQTT topics that contain the value in
--   the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   $aws/things/THING_NAME/jobs/JOB_ID/notify-namespace-NAMESPACE_ID/
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>namespaceId</tt> feature is in public preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonCode:Job'</a>, <a>job_reasonCode</a> - If the job was
--   updated, provides the reason code for the update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:presignedUrlConfig:Job'</a>, <a>job_presignedUrlConfig</a> -
--   Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceCanceled:Job'</a>, <a>job_forceCanceled</a> - Will be
--   <tt>true</tt> if the job was canceled with the optional <tt>force</tt>
--   parameter set to <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobTemplateArn:Job'</a>, <a>job_jobTemplateArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the job template used to create the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:Job'</a>, <a>job_targets</a> - A list of IoT things
--   and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedAt:Job'</a>, <a>job_completedAt</a> - The time, in
--   seconds since the epoch, when the job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comment:Job'</a>, <a>job_comment</a> - If the job was updated,
--   describes the reason for the update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Job'</a>, <a>job_description</a> - A short text
--   description of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:Job'</a>, <a>job_targetSelection</a> -
--   Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will
--   be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed
--   the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on
--   a device when the thing representing the device is added to a target
--   group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in
--   the group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutConfig:Job'</a>, <a>job_timeoutConfig</a> - Specifies
--   the amount of time each device has to finish its execution of the job.
--   A timer is started when the job execution status is set to
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>. If the job execution status is not set to
--   another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be
--   automatically set to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
newJob :: Job

-- | The job execution object represents the execution of a job on a
--   particular device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecution</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecution
JobExecution' :: Maybe JobExecutionStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe JobExecutionStatusDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> JobExecution

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_status</a> - The
--   status of the job execution (IN_PROGRESS, QUEUED, FAILED, SUCCEEDED,
--   TIMED_OUT, CANCELED, or REJECTED).
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_jobId</a> - The
--   unique identifier you assigned to the job when it was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_lastUpdatedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since the
--   epoch, when the job execution was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_approximateSecondsBeforeTimedOut</a> - The estimated
--   number of seconds that remain before the job execution status will be
--   changed to <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>. The timeout interval can be anywhere
--   between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The actual job
--   execution timeout can occur up to 60 seconds later than the estimated
--   duration. This value will not be included if the job execution has
--   reached a terminal status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queuedAt:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_queuedAt</a> - The
--   time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution was queued.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusDetails:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_statusDetails</a> - A collection of name/value pairs
--   that describe the status of the job execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingArn:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_thingArn</a> - The
--   ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionNumber:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_executionNumber</a> - A string (consisting of the
--   digits "0" through "9") which identifies this particular job execution
--   on this particular device. It can be used in commands which return or
--   update job execution information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionNumber:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_versionNumber</a> - The version of the job execution.
--   Job execution versions are incremented each time they are updated by a
--   device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startedAt:JobExecution'</a>, <a>jobExecution_startedAt</a> -
--   The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceCanceled:JobExecution'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecution_forceCanceled</a> - Will be <tt>true</tt> if the job
--   execution was canceled with the optional <tt>force</tt> parameter set
--   to <tt>true</tt>.
newJobExecution :: JobExecution

-- | Details of the job execution status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecutionStatusDetails</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecutionStatusDetails
JobExecutionStatusDetails' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> JobExecutionStatusDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecutionStatusDetails</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:detailsMap:JobExecutionStatusDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionStatusDetails_detailsMap</a> - The job execution
--   status.
newJobExecutionStatusDetails :: JobExecutionStatusDetails

-- | The job execution summary.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecutionSummary</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecutionSummary
JobExecutionSummary' :: Maybe JobExecutionStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> JobExecutionSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecutionSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:status:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_status</a> - The status of the job execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_lastUpdatedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since
--   the epoch, when the job execution was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queuedAt:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_queuedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since the
--   epoch, when the job execution was queued.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionNumber:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_executionNumber</a> - A string (consisting of
--   the digits "0" through "9") which identifies this particular job
--   execution on this particular device. It can be used later in commands
--   which return or update job execution information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startedAt:JobExecutionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionSummary_startedAt</a> - The time, in seconds since the
--   epoch, when the job execution started.
newJobExecutionSummary :: JobExecutionSummary

newJobExecutionSummaryForJob :: JobExecutionSummaryForJob

-- | Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> smart constructor.
data JobExecutionsRolloutConfig
JobExecutionsRolloutConfig' :: Maybe ExponentialRolloutRate -> Maybe Natural -> JobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>JobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:exponentialRate:JobExecutionsRolloutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionsRolloutConfig_exponentialRate</a> - The rate of
--   increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to define an
--   exponential rate for a job rollout.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumPerMinute:JobExecutionsRolloutConfig'</a>,
--   <a>jobExecutionsRolloutConfig_maximumPerMinute</a> - The maximum
--   number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute.
--   This parameter allows you to create a staged rollout.
newJobExecutionsRolloutConfig :: JobExecutionsRolloutConfig

-- | The job process details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobProcessDetails</a> smart constructor.
data JobProcessDetails
JobProcessDetails' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> JobProcessDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>JobProcessDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRemovedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfRemovedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that are no longer scheduled to execute the job because they have been
--   deleted or have been removed from the group that was a target of the
--   job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfQueuedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfQueuedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that are awaiting execution of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfFailedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfFailedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that failed executing the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfSucceededThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfSucceededThings</a> - The number of
--   things which successfully completed the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfInProgressThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfInProgressThings</a> - The number of
--   things currently executing the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfCanceledThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfCanceledThings</a> - The number of things
--   that cancelled the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfTimedOutThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfTimedOutThings</a> - The number of things
--   whose job execution status is <tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRejectedThings:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_numberOfRejectedThings</a> - The number of things
--   that rejected the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingTargets:JobProcessDetails'</a>,
--   <a>jobProcessDetails_processingTargets</a> - The target devices to
--   which the job execution is being rolled out. This value will be null
--   after the job execution has finished rolling out to all the target
--   devices.
newJobProcessDetails :: JobProcessDetails

-- | The job summary.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobSummary</a> smart constructor.
data JobSummary
JobSummary' :: Maybe JobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe TargetSelection -> JobSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>JobSummary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_status</a> - The job
--   summary status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobId</a> - The unique
--   identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedAt:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_lastUpdatedAt</a>
--   - The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobArn:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_jobArn</a> - The job
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_createdAt</a> - The
--   time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thingGroupId:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_thingGroupId</a> -
--   The ID of the thing group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedAt:JobSummary'</a>, <a>jobSummary_completedAt</a> -
--   The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:JobSummary'</a>,
--   <a>jobSummary_targetSelection</a> - Specifies whether the job will
--   continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those
--   things specified as targets have completed the job (SNAPSHOT). If
--   continuous, the job may also be run on a thing when a change is
--   detected in a target. For example, a job will run on a thing when the
--   thing is added to a target group, even after the job was completed by
--   all things originally in the group.
newJobSummary :: JobSummary

-- | The configuration of an ML Detect Security Profile.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMachineLearningDetectionConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data MachineLearningDetectionConfig

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   sensitivity of anomalous behavior evaluation. Can be <tt>Low</tt>,

newMachineLearningDetectionConfig :: ConfidenceLevel -> MachineLearningDetectionConfig

-- | The dimension of a metric.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricDimension</a> smart constructor.
data MetricDimension
MetricDimension' :: Maybe DimensionValueOperator -> Text -> MetricDimension

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricDimension</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:operator:MetricDimension'</a>, <a>metricDimension_operator</a>
--   - Defines how the <tt>dimensionValues</tt> of a dimension are
--   interpreted. For example, for dimension type TOPIC_FILTER, the
--   <tt>IN</tt> operator, a message will be counted only if its topic
--   matches one of the topic filters. With <tt>NOT_IN</tt> operator, a
--   message will be counted only if it doesn't match any of the topic
--   filters. The operator is optional: if it's not provided (is
--   <tt>null</tt>), it will be interpreted as <tt>IN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:MetricDimension'</a>,
--   <a>metricDimension_dimensionName</a> - A unique identifier for the
--   dimension.
newMetricDimension :: Text -> MetricDimension

--   This can't be used with custom metrics.

newMetricToRetain :: Text -> MetricToRetain

-- | The set of parameters for this mitigation action. You can specify only
--   one type of parameter (in other words, you can apply only one action
--   for each defined mitigation action).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMitigationActionParams</a> smart constructor.
data MitigationActionParams
MitigationActionParams' :: Maybe EnableIoTLoggingParams -> Maybe AddThingsToThingGroupParams -> Maybe UpdateCACertificateParams -> Maybe UpdateDeviceCertificateParams -> Maybe ReplaceDefaultPolicyVersionParams -> Maybe PublishFindingToSnsParams -> MitigationActionParams

--   fields omitted.

--   define a mitigation action that enables Amazon Web Services IoT Core
--   logging at a specified level of detail.
--

--   <a>mitigationActionParams_addThingsToThingGroupParams</a> - Parameters
--   to define a mitigation action that moves devices associated with a
--   certificate to one or more specified thing groups, typically for
--   quarantine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateCACertificateParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,
--   <a>mitigationActionParams_updateCACertificateParams</a> - Parameters
--   to define a mitigation action that changes the state of the CA
--   certificate to inactive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateDeviceCertificateParams:MitigationActionParams'</a>,

--   device certificate to inactive.

--   to define a mitigation action that publishes findings to Amazon Simple
--   Notification Service (Amazon SNS. You can implement your own custom
--   actions in response to the Amazon SNS messages.
newMitigationActionParams :: MitigationActionParams

-- | Information about an OTA update.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOTAUpdateInfo</a> smart constructor.
data OTAUpdateInfo
OTAUpdateInfo' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe AwsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty Protocol) -> Maybe AwsJobPresignedUrlConfig -> Maybe (NonEmpty OTAUpdateFile) -> Maybe OTAUpdateStatus -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ErrorInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TargetSelection -> OTAUpdateInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>OTAUpdateInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedDate:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_lastModifiedDate</a> - The date when the OTA update
--   was last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_awsJobExecutionsRolloutConfig</a> - Configuration for
--   the rollout of OTA updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsIotJobId:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_awsIotJobId</a> - The IoT job ID associated with the
--   OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocols:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>, <a>oTAUpdateInfo_protocols</a> -
--   The protocol used to transfer the OTA update image. Valid values are
--   [HTTP], [MQTT], [HTTP, MQTT]. When both HTTP and MQTT are specified,
--   the target device can choose the protocol.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsJobPresignedUrlConfig:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_awsJobPresignedUrlConfig</a> - Configuration
--   information for pre-signed URLs. Valid when <tt>protocols</tt>
--   contains HTTP.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateFiles:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateFiles</a> - A list of files associated with
--   the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateStatus:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateStatus</a> - The status of the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>, <a>oTAUpdateInfo_targets</a> - The
--   targets of the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsIotJobArn:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_awsIotJobArn</a> - The IoT job ARN associated with
--   the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_creationDate</a> - The date when the OTA update was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalParameters:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_additionalParameters</a> - A collection of name/value
--   pairs
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateId:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateId</a> - The OTA update ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorInfo:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>, <a>oTAUpdateInfo_errorInfo</a> -
--   Error information associated with the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otaUpdateArn:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_otaUpdateArn</a> - The OTA update ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_description</a> - A description of the OTA update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetSelection:OTAUpdateInfo'</a>,
--   <a>oTAUpdateInfo_targetSelection</a> - Specifies whether the OTA
--   update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after
--   all those things specified as targets have completed the OTA update
--   (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the OTA update may also be run on a thing
--   when a change is detected in a target. For example, an OTA update will
--   run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after
--   the OTA update was completed by all things originally in the group.
newOTAUpdateInfo :: OTAUpdateInfo
